Bug Summary

File:spell.c
Location:line 6089, column 17
Description:Access to field 'sb_next' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from variable 'bl')

Annotated Source Code

1// VIM - Vi IMproved by Bram Moolenaar
2//
3// Do ":help uganda" in Vim to read copying and usage conditions.
4// Do ":help credits" in Vim to see a list of people who contributed.
5// See README.txt for an overview of the Vim source code.
6
7// spell.c: code for spell checking
8//
9// The spell checking mechanism uses a tree (aka trie). Each node in the tree
10// has a list of bytes that can appear (siblings). For each byte there is a
11// pointer to the node with the byte that follows in the word (child).
12//
13// A NUL byte is used where the word may end. The bytes are sorted, so that
14// binary searching can be used and the NUL bytes are at the start. The
15// number of possible bytes is stored before the list of bytes.
16//
17// The tree uses two arrays: "byts" stores the characters, "idxs" stores
18// either the next index or flags. The tree starts at index 0. For example,
19// to lookup "vi" this sequence is followed:
20// i = 0
21// len = byts[i]
22// n = where "v" appears in byts[i + 1] to byts[i + len]
23// i = idxs[n]
24// len = byts[i]
25// n = where "i" appears in byts[i + 1] to byts[i + len]
26// i = idxs[n]
27// len = byts[i]
28// find that byts[i + 1] is 0, idxs[i + 1] has flags for "vi".
29//
30// There are two word trees: one with case-folded words and one with words in
31// original case. The second one is only used for keep-case words and is
32// usually small.
33//
34// There is one additional tree for when not all prefixes are applied when
35// generating the .spl file. This tree stores all the possible prefixes, as
36// if they were words. At each word (prefix) end the prefix nr is stored, the
37// following word must support this prefix nr. And the condition nr is
38// stored, used to lookup the condition that the word must match with.
39//
40// Thanks to Olaf Seibert for providing an example implementation of this tree
41// and the compression mechanism.
42// LZ trie ideas:
43// http://www.irb.hr/hr/home/ristov/papers/RistovLZtrieRevision1.pdf
44// More papers: http://www-igm.univ-mlv.fr/~laporte/publi_en.html
45//
46// Matching involves checking the caps type: Onecap ALLCAP KeepCap.
47//
48// Why doesn't Vim use aspell/ispell/myspell/etc.?
49// See ":help develop-spell".
50
51// Use SPELL_PRINTTREE for debugging: dump the word tree after adding a word.
52// Only use it for small word lists!
53
54// Use DEBUG_TRIEWALK to print the changes made in suggest_trie_walk() for a
55// specific word.
56
57// Use this to adjust the score after finding suggestions, based on the
58// suggested word sounding like the bad word. This is much faster than doing
59// it for every possible suggestion.
60// Disadvantage: When "the" is typed as "hte" it sounds quite different ("@"
61// vs "ht") and goes down in the list.
62// Used when 'spellsuggest' is set to "best".
63#define RESCORE(word_score, sound_score)((3 * word_score + sound_score) / 4) ((3 * word_score + sound_score) / 4)
64
65// Do the opposite: based on a maximum end score and a known sound score,
66// compute the maximum word score that can be used.
67#define MAXSCORE(word_score, sound_score)((4 * word_score - sound_score) / 3) ((4 * word_score - sound_score) / 3)
68
69// Vim spell file format: <HEADER>
70// <SECTIONS>
71// <LWORDTREE>
72// <KWORDTREE>
73// <PREFIXTREE>
74//
75// <HEADER>: <fileID> <versionnr>
76//
77// <fileID> 8 bytes "VIMspell"
78// <versionnr> 1 byte VIMSPELLVERSION
79//
80//
81// Sections make it possible to add information to the .spl file without
82// making it incompatible with previous versions. There are two kinds of
83// sections:
84// 1. Not essential for correct spell checking. E.g. for making suggestions.
85// These are skipped when not supported.
86// 2. Optional information, but essential for spell checking when present.
87// E.g. conditions for affixes. When this section is present but not
88// supported an error message is given.
89//
90// <SECTIONS>: <section> ... <sectionend>
91//
92// <section>: <sectionID> <sectionflags> <sectionlen> (section contents)
93//
94// <sectionID> 1 byte number from 0 to 254 identifying the section
95//
96// <sectionflags> 1 byte SNF_REQUIRED: this section is required for correct
97// spell checking
98//
99// <sectionlen> 4 bytes length of section contents, MSB first
100//
101// <sectionend> 1 byte SN_END
102//
103//
104// sectionID == SN_INFO: <infotext>
105// <infotext> N bytes free format text with spell file info (version,
106// website, etc)
107//
108// sectionID == SN_REGION: <regionname> ...
109// <regionname> 2 bytes Up to 8 region names: ca, au, etc. Lower case.
110// First <regionname> is region 1.
111//
112// sectionID == SN_CHARFLAGS: <charflagslen> <charflags>
113// <folcharslen> <folchars>
114// <charflagslen> 1 byte Number of bytes in <charflags> (should be 128).
115// <charflags> N bytes List of flags (first one is for character 128):
116// 0x01 word character CF_WORD
117// 0x02 upper-case character CF_UPPER
118// <folcharslen> 2 bytes Number of bytes in <folchars>.
119// <folchars> N bytes Folded characters, first one is for character 128.
120//
121// sectionID == SN_MIDWORD: <midword>
122// <midword> N bytes Characters that are word characters only when used
123// in the middle of a word.
124//
125// sectionID == SN_PREFCOND: <prefcondcnt> <prefcond> ...
126// <prefcondcnt> 2 bytes Number of <prefcond> items following.
127// <prefcond> : <condlen> <condstr>
128// <condlen> 1 byte Length of <condstr>.
129// <condstr> N bytes Condition for the prefix.
130//
131// sectionID == SN_REP: <repcount> <rep> ...
132// <repcount> 2 bytes number of <rep> items, MSB first.
133// <rep> : <repfromlen> <repfrom> <reptolen> <repto>
134// <repfromlen> 1 byte length of <repfrom>
135// <repfrom> N bytes "from" part of replacement
136// <reptolen> 1 byte length of <repto>
137// <repto> N bytes "to" part of replacement
138//
139// sectionID == SN_REPSAL: <repcount> <rep> ...
140// just like SN_REP but for soundfolded words
141//
142// sectionID == SN_SAL: <salflags> <salcount> <sal> ...
143// <salflags> 1 byte flags for soundsalike conversion:
144// SAL_F0LLOWUP
145// SAL_COLLAPSE
146// SAL_REM_ACCENTS
147// <salcount> 2 bytes number of <sal> items following
148// <sal> : <salfromlen> <salfrom> <saltolen> <salto>
149// <salfromlen> 1 byte length of <salfrom>
150// <salfrom> N bytes "from" part of soundsalike
151// <saltolen> 1 byte length of <salto>
152// <salto> N bytes "to" part of soundsalike
153//
154// sectionID == SN_SOFO: <sofofromlen> <sofofrom> <sofotolen> <sofoto>
155// <sofofromlen> 2 bytes length of <sofofrom>
156// <sofofrom> N bytes "from" part of soundfold
157// <sofotolen> 2 bytes length of <sofoto>
158// <sofoto> N bytes "to" part of soundfold
159//
160// sectionID == SN_SUGFILE: <timestamp>
161// <timestamp> 8 bytes time in seconds that must match with .sug file
162//
163// sectionID == SN_NOSPLITSUGS: nothing
164//
165// sectionID == SN_WORDS: <word> ...
166// <word> N bytes NUL terminated common word
167//
168// sectionID == SN_MAP: <mapstr>
169// <mapstr> N bytes String with sequences of similar characters,
170// separated by slashes.
171//
172// sectionID == SN_COMPOUND: <compmax> <compminlen> <compsylmax> <compoptions>
173// <comppatcount> <comppattern> ... <compflags>
174// <compmax> 1 byte Maximum nr of words in compound word.
175// <compminlen> 1 byte Minimal word length for compounding.
176// <compsylmax> 1 byte Maximum nr of syllables in compound word.
177// <compoptions> 2 bytes COMP_ flags.
178// <comppatcount> 2 bytes number of <comppattern> following
179// <compflags> N bytes Flags from COMPOUNDRULE items, separated by
180// slashes.
181//
182// <comppattern>: <comppatlen> <comppattext>
183// <comppatlen> 1 byte length of <comppattext>
184// <comppattext> N bytes end or begin chars from CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN
185//
186// sectionID == SN_NOBREAK: (empty, its presence is what matters)
187//
188// sectionID == SN_SYLLABLE: <syllable>
189// <syllable> N bytes String from SYLLABLE item.
190//
191// <LWORDTREE>: <wordtree>
192//
193// <KWORDTREE>: <wordtree>
194//
195// <PREFIXTREE>: <wordtree>
196//
197//
198// <wordtree>: <nodecount> <nodedata> ...
199//
200// <nodecount> 4 bytes Number of nodes following. MSB first.
201//
202// <nodedata>: <siblingcount> <sibling> ...
203//
204// <siblingcount> 1 byte Number of siblings in this node. The siblings
205// follow in sorted order.
206//
207// <sibling>: <byte> [ <nodeidx> <xbyte>
208// | <flags> [<flags2>] [<region>] [<affixID>]
209// | [<pflags>] <affixID> <prefcondnr> ]
210//
211// <byte> 1 byte Byte value of the sibling. Special cases:
212// BY_NOFLAGS: End of word without flags and for all
213// regions.
214// For PREFIXTREE <affixID> and
215// <prefcondnr> follow.
216// BY_FLAGS: End of word, <flags> follow.
217// For PREFIXTREE <pflags>, <affixID>
218// and <prefcondnr> follow.
219// BY_FLAGS2: End of word, <flags> and <flags2>
220// follow. Not used in PREFIXTREE.
221// BY_INDEX: Child of sibling is shared, <nodeidx>
222// and <xbyte> follow.
223//
224// <nodeidx> 3 bytes Index of child for this sibling, MSB first.
225//
226// <xbyte> 1 byte Byte value of the sibling.
227//
228// <flags> 1 byte Bitmask of:
229// WF_ALLCAP word must have only capitals
230// WF_ONECAP first char of word must be capital
231// WF_KEEPCAP keep-case word
232// WF_FIXCAP keep-case word, all caps not allowed
233// WF_RARE rare word
234// WF_BANNED bad word
235// WF_REGION <region> follows
236// WF_AFX <affixID> follows
237//
238// <flags2> 1 byte Bitmask of:
239// WF_HAS_AFF >> 8 word includes affix
240// WF_NEEDCOMP >> 8 word only valid in compound
241// WF_NOSUGGEST >> 8 word not used for suggestions
242// WF_COMPROOT >> 8 word already a compound
243// WF_NOCOMPBEF >> 8 no compounding before this word
244// WF_NOCOMPAFT >> 8 no compounding after this word
245//
246// <pflags> 1 byte Bitmask of:
247// WFP_RARE rare prefix
248// WFP_NC non-combining prefix
249// WFP_UP letter after prefix made upper case
250//
251// <region> 1 byte Bitmask for regions in which word is valid. When
252// omitted it's valid in all regions.
253// Lowest bit is for region 1.
254//
255// <affixID> 1 byte ID of affix that can be used with this word. In
256// PREFIXTREE used for the required prefix ID.
257//
258// <prefcondnr> 2 bytes Prefix condition number, index in <prefcond> list
259// from HEADER.
260//
261// All text characters are in 'encoding', but stored as single bytes.
262
263// Vim .sug file format: <SUGHEADER>
264// <SUGWORDTREE>
265// <SUGTABLE>
266//
267// <SUGHEADER>: <fileID> <versionnr> <timestamp>
268//
269// <fileID> 6 bytes "VIMsug"
270// <versionnr> 1 byte VIMSUGVERSION
271// <timestamp> 8 bytes timestamp that must match with .spl file
272//
273//
274// <SUGWORDTREE>: <wordtree> (see above, no flags or region used)
275//
276//
277// <SUGTABLE>: <sugwcount> <sugline> ...
278//
279// <sugwcount> 4 bytes number of <sugline> following
280//
281// <sugline>: <sugnr> ... NUL
282//
283// <sugnr>: X bytes word number that results in this soundfolded word,
284// stored as an offset to the previous number in as
285// few bytes as possible, see offset2bytes())
286

288#include <inttypes.h>
289#include <stdbool.h>
290#include <string.h>
291#include <stdlib.h>
292#include <wctype.h>

320#include "nvim/screen.h"
321#include "nvim/search.h"
322#include "nvim/strings.h"
323#include "nvim/syntax.h"
324#include "nvim/term.h"
325#include "nvim/tempfile.h"
326#include "nvim/ui.h"
327#include "nvim/undo.h"
328#include "nvim/os/os.h"

330#ifndef UNIX // it's in os_unix_defs.h for Unix
331# include <time.h> // for time_t
332#endif
333
334#define MAXWLEN250 250 // Assume max. word len is this many bytes.
335 // Some places assume a word length fits in a
336 // byte, thus it can't be above 255.
337
338// Type used for indexes in the word tree need to be at least 4 bytes. If int
339// is 8 bytes we could use something smaller, but what?
340typedef int idx_T;
341
342# define SPL_FNAME_TMPL"%s.%s.spl" "%s.%s.spl"
343# define SPL_FNAME_ADD".add." ".add."
344# define SPL_FNAME_ASCII".ascii." ".ascii."
345
346// Flags used for a word. Only the lowest byte can be used, the region byte
347// comes above it.
348#define WF_REGION0x01 0x01 // region byte follows
349#define WF_ONECAP0x02 0x02 // word with one capital (or all capitals)
350#define WF_ALLCAP0x04 0x04 // word must be all capitals
351#define WF_RARE0x08 0x08 // rare word
352#define WF_BANNED0x10 0x10 // bad word
353#define WF_AFX0x20 0x20 // affix ID follows
354#define WF_FIXCAP0x40 0x40 // keep-case word, allcap not allowed
355#define WF_KEEPCAP0x80 0x80 // keep-case word
356
357// for <flags2>, shifted up one byte to be used in wn_flags
358#define WF_HAS_AFF0x0100 0x0100 // word includes affix
359#define WF_NEEDCOMP0x0200 0x0200 // word only valid in compound
360#define WF_NOSUGGEST0x0400 0x0400 // word not to be suggested
361#define WF_COMPROOT0x0800 0x0800 // already compounded word, COMPOUNDROOT
362#define WF_NOCOMPBEF0x1000 0x1000 // no compounding before this word
363#define WF_NOCOMPAFT0x2000 0x2000 // no compounding after this word
364
365// only used for su_badflags
366#define WF_MIXCAP0x20 0x20 // mix of upper and lower case: macaRONI
367
368#define WF_CAPMASK(0x02 | 0x04 | 0x80 | 0x40) (WF_ONECAP0x02 | WF_ALLCAP0x04 | WF_KEEPCAP0x80 | WF_FIXCAP0x40)
369
370// flags for <pflags>
371#define WFP_RARE0x01 0x01 // rare prefix
372#define WFP_NC0x02 0x02 // prefix is not combining
373#define WFP_UP0x04 0x04 // to-upper prefix
374#define WFP_COMPPERMIT0x08 0x08 // prefix with COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG
375#define WFP_COMPFORBID0x10 0x10 // prefix with COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG
376
377// Flags for postponed prefixes in "sl_pidxs". Must be above affixID (one
378// byte) and prefcondnr (two bytes).
379#define WF_RAREPFX(0x01 << 24) (WFP_RARE0x01 << 24) // rare postponed prefix
380#define WF_PFX_NC(0x02 << 24) (WFP_NC0x02 << 24) // non-combining postponed prefix
381#define WF_PFX_UP(0x04 << 24) (WFP_UP0x04 << 24) // to-upper postponed prefix
382#define WF_PFX_COMPPERMIT(0x08 << 24) (WFP_COMPPERMIT0x08 << 24) // postponed prefix with
383 // COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG
384#define WF_PFX_COMPFORBID(0x10 << 24) (WFP_COMPFORBID0x10 << 24) // postponed prefix with
385 // COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG
386
387
388// flags for <compoptions>
389#define COMP_CHECKDUP1 1 // CHECKCOMPOUNDDUP
390#define COMP_CHECKREP2 2 // CHECKCOMPOUNDREP
391#define COMP_CHECKCASE4 4 // CHECKCOMPOUNDCASE
392#define COMP_CHECKTRIPLE8 8 // CHECKCOMPOUNDTRIPLE
393
394// Special byte values for <byte>. Some are only used in the tree for
395// postponed prefixes, some only in the other trees. This is a bit messy...
396#define BY_NOFLAGS0 0 // end of word without flags or region; for
397 // postponed prefix: no <pflags>
398#define BY_INDEX1 1 // child is shared, index follows
399#define BY_FLAGS2 2 // end of word, <flags> byte follows; for
400 // postponed prefix: <pflags> follows
401#define BY_FLAGS23 3 // end of word, <flags> and <flags2> bytes
402 // follow; never used in prefix tree
403#define BY_SPECIAL3 BY_FLAGS23 // highest special byte value
404
405// Info from "REP", "REPSAL" and "SAL" entries in ".aff" file used in si_rep,
406// si_repsal, sl_rep, and si_sal. Not for sl_sal!
407// One replacement: from "ft_from" to "ft_to".
408typedef struct fromto_S {
409 char_u *ft_from;
410 char_u *ft_to;
411} fromto_T;
412
413// Info from "SAL" entries in ".aff" file used in sl_sal.
414// The info is split for quick processing by spell_soundfold().
415// Note that "sm_oneof" and "sm_rules" point into sm_lead.
416typedef struct salitem_S {
417 char_u *sm_lead; // leading letters
418 int sm_leadlen; // length of "sm_lead"
419 char_u *sm_oneof; // letters from () or NULL
420 char_u *sm_rules; // rules like ^, $, priority
421 char_u *sm_to; // replacement.
422 int *sm_lead_w; // wide character copy of "sm_lead"
423 int *sm_oneof_w; // wide character copy of "sm_oneof"
424 int *sm_to_w; // wide character copy of "sm_to"
425} salitem_T;
426
427typedef int salfirst_T;
428
429// Values for SP_*ERROR are negative, positive values are used by
430// read_cnt_string().
431#define SP_TRUNCERROR-1 -1 // spell file truncated error
432#define SP_FORMERROR-2 -2 // format error in spell file
433#define SP_OTHERERROR-3 -3 // other error while reading spell file
434
435// Structure used to store words and other info for one language, loaded from
436// a .spl file.
437// The main access is through the tree in "sl_fbyts/sl_fidxs", storing the
438// case-folded words. "sl_kbyts/sl_kidxs" is for keep-case words.
439//
440// The "byts" array stores the possible bytes in each tree node, preceded by
441// the number of possible bytes, sorted on byte value:
442// <len> <byte1> <byte2> ...
443// The "idxs" array stores the index of the child node corresponding to the
444// byte in "byts".
445// Exception: when the byte is zero, the word may end here and "idxs" holds
446// the flags, region mask and affixID for the word. There may be several
447// zeros in sequence for alternative flag/region/affixID combinations.
448typedef struct slang_S slang_T;
449
450struct slang_S {
451 slang_T *sl_next; // next language
452 char_u *sl_name; // language name "en", "en.rare", "nl", etc.
453 char_u *sl_fname; // name of .spl file
454 bool_Bool sl_add; // true if it's a .add file.
455
456 char_u *sl_fbyts; // case-folded word bytes
457 idx_T *sl_fidxs; // case-folded word indexes
458 char_u *sl_kbyts; // keep-case word bytes
459 idx_T *sl_kidxs; // keep-case word indexes
460 char_u *sl_pbyts; // prefix tree word bytes
461 idx_T *sl_pidxs; // prefix tree word indexes
462
463 char_u *sl_info; // infotext string or NULL
464
465 char_u sl_regions[17]; // table with up to 8 region names plus NUL
466
467 char_u *sl_midword; // MIDWORD string or NULL
468
469 hashtab_T sl_wordcount; // hashtable with word count, wordcount_T
470
471 int sl_compmax; // COMPOUNDWORDMAX (default: MAXWLEN)
472 int sl_compminlen; // COMPOUNDMIN (default: 0)
473 int sl_compsylmax; // COMPOUNDSYLMAX (default: MAXWLEN)
474 int sl_compoptions; // COMP_* flags
475 garray_T sl_comppat; // CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN items
476 regprog_T *sl_compprog; // COMPOUNDRULE turned into a regexp progrm
477 // (NULL when no compounding)
478 char_u *sl_comprules; // all COMPOUNDRULE concatenated (or NULL)
479 char_u *sl_compstartflags; // flags for first compound word
480 char_u *sl_compallflags; // all flags for compound words
481 bool_Bool sl_nobreak; // When true: no spaces between words
482 char_u *sl_syllable; // SYLLABLE repeatable chars or NULL
483 garray_T sl_syl_items; // syllable items
484
485 int sl_prefixcnt; // number of items in "sl_prefprog"
486 regprog_T **sl_prefprog; // table with regprogs for prefixes
487
488 garray_T sl_rep; // list of fromto_T entries from REP lines
489 short sl_rep_first[256]; // indexes where byte first appears, -1 if
490 // there is none
491 garray_T sl_sal; // list of salitem_T entries from SAL lines
492 salfirst_T sl_sal_first[256]; // indexes where byte first appears, -1 if
493 // there is none
494 bool_Bool sl_followup; // SAL followup
495 bool_Bool sl_collapse; // SAL collapse_result
496 bool_Bool sl_rem_accents; // SAL remove_accents
497 bool_Bool sl_sofo; // SOFOFROM and SOFOTO instead of SAL items:
498 // "sl_sal_first" maps chars, when has_mbyte
499 // "sl_sal" is a list of wide char lists.
500 garray_T sl_repsal; // list of fromto_T entries from REPSAL lines
501 short sl_repsal_first[256]; // sl_rep_first for REPSAL lines
502 bool_Bool sl_nosplitsugs; // don't suggest splitting a word
503
504 // Info from the .sug file. Loaded on demand.
505 time_t sl_sugtime; // timestamp for .sug file
506 char_u *sl_sbyts; // soundfolded word bytes
507 idx_T *sl_sidxs; // soundfolded word indexes
508 buf_T *sl_sugbuf; // buffer with word number table
509 bool_Bool sl_sugloaded; // true when .sug file was loaded or failed to
510 // load
511
512 bool_Bool sl_has_map; // true, if there is a MAP line
513 hashtab_T sl_map_hash; // MAP for multi-byte chars
514 int sl_map_array[256]; // MAP for first 256 chars
515 hashtab_T sl_sounddone; // table with soundfolded words that have
516 // handled, see add_sound_suggest()
517};
518
519// First language that is loaded, start of the linked list of loaded
520// languages.
521static slang_T *first_lang = NULL((void*)0);
522
523// Flags used in .spl file for soundsalike flags.
524#define SAL_F0LLOWUP1 1
525#define SAL_COLLAPSE2 2
526#define SAL_REM_ACCENTS4 4
527
528// Structure used in "b_langp", filled from 'spelllang'.
529typedef struct langp_S {
530 slang_T *lp_slang; // info for this language
531 slang_T *lp_sallang; // language used for sound folding or NULL
532 slang_T *lp_replang; // language used for REP items or NULL
533 int lp_region; // bitmask for region or REGION_ALL
534} langp_T;
535
536#define LANGP_ENTRY(ga, i)(((langp_T *)(ga).ga_data) + (i)) (((langp_T *)(ga).ga_data) + (i))
537
538#define REGION_ALL0xff 0xff // word valid in all regions
539
540#define VIMSPELLMAGIC"VIMspell" "VIMspell" // string at start of Vim spell file
541#define VIMSPELLMAGICL8 8
542#define VIMSPELLVERSION50 50
543
544#define VIMSUGMAGIC"VIMsug" "VIMsug" // string at start of Vim .sug file
545#define VIMSUGMAGICL6 6
546#define VIMSUGVERSION1 1
547
548// Section IDs. Only renumber them when VIMSPELLVERSION changes!
549#define SN_REGION0 0 // <regionname> section
550#define SN_CHARFLAGS1 1 // charflags section
551#define SN_MIDWORD2 2 // <midword> section
552#define SN_PREFCOND3 3 // <prefcond> section
553#define SN_REP4 4 // REP items section
554#define SN_SAL5 5 // SAL items section
555#define SN_SOFO6 6 // soundfolding section
556#define SN_MAP7 7 // MAP items section
557#define SN_COMPOUND8 8 // compound words section
558#define SN_SYLLABLE9 9 // syllable section
559#define SN_NOBREAK10 10 // NOBREAK section
560#define SN_SUGFILE11 11 // timestamp for .sug file
561#define SN_REPSAL12 12 // REPSAL items section
562#define SN_WORDS13 13 // common words
563#define SN_NOSPLITSUGS14 14 // don't split word for suggestions
564#define SN_INFO15 15 // info section
565#define SN_END255 255 // end of sections
566
567#define SNF_REQUIRED1 1 // <sectionflags>: required section
568
569// Result values. Lower number is accepted over higher one.
570#define SP_BANNED-1 -1
571#define SP_OK0 0
572#define SP_RARE1 1
573#define SP_LOCAL2 2
574#define SP_BAD3 3
575
576// file used for "zG" and "zW"
577static char_u *int_wordlist = NULL((void*)0);
578
579typedef struct wordcount_S {
580 uint16_t wc_count; // nr of times word was seen
581 char_u wc_word[1]; // word, actually longer
582} wordcount_T;
583
584static wordcount_T dumwc;
585#define WC_KEY_OFF(unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word - (char_u *)&dumwc) (unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word - (char_u *)&dumwc)
586#define HI2WC(hi)((wordcount_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word -
(char_u *)&dumwc))) ((wordcount_T *)((hi)->hi_key - WC_KEY_OFF(unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word - (char_u *)&dumwc)))
587#define MAXWORDCOUNT0xffff 0xffff
588
589// Information used when looking for suggestions.
590typedef struct suginfo_S {
591 garray_T su_ga; // suggestions, contains "suggest_T"
592 int su_maxcount; // max. number of suggestions displayed
593 int su_maxscore; // maximum score for adding to su_ga
594 int su_sfmaxscore; // idem, for when doing soundfold words
595 garray_T su_sga; // like su_ga, sound-folded scoring
596 char_u *su_badptr; // start of bad word in line
597 int su_badlen; // length of detected bad word in line
598 int su_badflags; // caps flags for bad word
599 char_u su_badword[MAXWLEN250]; // bad word truncated at su_badlen
600 char_u su_fbadword[MAXWLEN250]; // su_badword case-folded
601 char_u su_sal_badword[MAXWLEN250]; // su_badword soundfolded
602 hashtab_T su_banned; // table with banned words
603 slang_T *su_sallang; // default language for sound folding
604} suginfo_T;
605
606// One word suggestion. Used in "si_ga".
607typedef struct {
608 char_u *st_word; // suggested word, allocated string
609 int st_wordlen; // STRLEN(st_word)
610 int st_orglen; // length of replaced text
611 int st_score; // lower is better
612 int st_altscore; // used when st_score compares equal
613 bool_Bool st_salscore; // st_score is for soundalike
614 bool_Bool st_had_bonus; // bonus already included in score
615 slang_T *st_slang; // language used for sound folding
616} suggest_T;
617
618#define SUG(ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(ga).ga_data)[i]) (((suggest_T *)(ga).ga_data)[i])
619
620// True if a word appears in the list of banned words.
621#define WAS_BANNED(su, word)(!((hash_find(&su->su_banned, word))->hi_key == ((void
*)0) || (hash_find(&su->su_banned, word))->hi_key ==
&hash_removed)) (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hash_find(&su->su_banned, word))((hash_find(&su->su_banned, word))->hi_key == ((void
*)0) || (hash_find(&su->su_banned, word))->hi_key ==
&hash_removed))
622
623// Number of suggestions kept when cleaning up. We need to keep more than
624// what is displayed, because when rescore_suggestions() is called the score
625// may change and wrong suggestions may be removed later.
626#define SUG_CLEAN_COUNT(su)((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20) ((su)->su_maxcount < \
627 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount + 20)
628
629// Threshold for sorting and cleaning up suggestions. Don't want to keep lots
630// of suggestions that are not going to be displayed.
631#define SUG_MAX_COUNT(su)(((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20) + 50) (SUG_CLEAN_COUNT(su)((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20) + 50)
632
633// score for various changes
634#define SCORE_SPLIT149 149 // split bad word
635#define SCORE_SPLIT_NO249 249 // split bad word with NOSPLITSUGS
636#define SCORE_ICASE52 52 // slightly different case
637#define SCORE_REGION200 200 // word is for different region
638#define SCORE_RARE180 180 // rare word
639#define SCORE_SWAP75 75 // swap two characters
640#define SCORE_SWAP3110 110 // swap two characters in three
641#define SCORE_REP65 65 // REP replacement
642#define SCORE_SUBST93 93 // substitute a character
643#define SCORE_SIMILAR33 33 // substitute a similar character
644#define SCORE_SUBCOMP33 33 // substitute a composing character
645#define SCORE_DEL94 94 // delete a character
646#define SCORE_DELDUP66 66 // delete a duplicated character
647#define SCORE_DELCOMP28 28 // delete a composing character
648#define SCORE_INS96 96 // insert a character
649#define SCORE_INSDUP67 67 // insert a duplicate character
650#define SCORE_INSCOMP30 30 // insert a composing character
651#define SCORE_NONWORD103 103 // change non-word to word char
652
653#define SCORE_FILE30 30 // suggestion from a file
654#define SCORE_MAXINIT350 350 // Initial maximum score: higher == slower.
655 // 350 allows for about three changes.
656
657#define SCORE_COMMON130 30 // subtracted for words seen before
658#define SCORE_COMMON240 40 // subtracted for words often seen
659#define SCORE_COMMON350 50 // subtracted for words very often seen
660#define SCORE_THRES210 10 // word count threshold for COMMON2
661#define SCORE_THRES3100 100 // word count threshold for COMMON3
662
663// When trying changed soundfold words it becomes slow when trying more than
664// two changes. With less then two changes it's slightly faster but we miss a
665// few good suggestions. In rare cases we need to try three of four changes.
666#define SCORE_SFMAX1200 200 // maximum score for first try
667#define SCORE_SFMAX2300 300 // maximum score for second try
668#define SCORE_SFMAX3400 400 // maximum score for third try
669
670#define SCORE_BIG96 * 3 SCORE_INS96 * 3 // big difference
671#define SCORE_MAXMAX999999 999999 // accept any score
672#define SCORE_LIMITMAX350 350 // for spell_edit_score_limit()
673
674// for spell_edit_score_limit() we need to know the minimum value of
675// SCORE_ICASE, SCORE_SWAP, SCORE_DEL, SCORE_SIMILAR and SCORE_INS
676#define SCORE_EDIT_MIN33 SCORE_SIMILAR33
677
678// Structure to store info for word matching.
679typedef struct matchinf_S {
680 langp_T *mi_lp; // info for language and region
681
682 // pointers to original text to be checked
683 char_u *mi_word; // start of word being checked
684 char_u *mi_end; // end of matching word so far
685 char_u *mi_fend; // next char to be added to mi_fword
686 char_u *mi_cend; // char after what was used for
687 // mi_capflags
688
689 // case-folded text
690 char_u mi_fword[MAXWLEN250 + 1]; // mi_word case-folded
691 int mi_fwordlen; // nr of valid bytes in mi_fword
692
693 // for when checking word after a prefix
694 int mi_prefarridx; // index in sl_pidxs with list of
695 // affixID/condition
696 int mi_prefcnt; // number of entries at mi_prefarridx
697 int mi_prefixlen; // byte length of prefix
698 int mi_cprefixlen; // byte length of prefix in original
699 // case
700
701 // for when checking a compound word
702 int mi_compoff; // start of following word offset
703 char_u mi_compflags[MAXWLEN250]; // flags for compound words used
704 int mi_complen; // nr of compound words used
705 int mi_compextra; // nr of COMPOUNDROOT words
706
707 // others
708 int mi_result; // result so far: SP_BAD, SP_OK, etc.
709 int mi_capflags; // WF_ONECAP WF_ALLCAP WF_KEEPCAP
710 win_T *mi_win; // buffer being checked
711
712 // for NOBREAK
713 int mi_result2; // "mi_resul" without following word
714 char_u *mi_end2; // "mi_end" without following word
715} matchinf_T;
716
717// The tables used for recognizing word characters according to spelling.
718// These are only used for the first 256 characters of 'encoding'.
719typedef struct {
720 bool_Bool st_isw[256]; // flags: is word char
721 bool_Bool st_isu[256]; // flags: is uppercase char
722 char_u st_fold[256]; // chars: folded case
723 char_u st_upper[256]; // chars: upper case
724} spelltab_T;
725
726// For finding suggestions: At each node in the tree these states are tried:
727typedef enum {
728 STATE_START = 0, // At start of node check for NUL bytes (goodword
729 // ends); if badword ends there is a match, otherwise
730 // try splitting word.
731 STATE_NOPREFIX, // try without prefix
732 STATE_SPLITUNDO, // Undo splitting.
733 STATE_ENDNUL, // Past NUL bytes at start of the node.
734 STATE_PLAIN, // Use each byte of the node.
735 STATE_DEL, // Delete a byte from the bad word.
736 STATE_INS_PREP, // Prepare for inserting bytes.
737 STATE_INS, // Insert a byte in the bad word.
738 STATE_SWAP, // Swap two bytes.
739 STATE_UNSWAP, // Undo swap two characters.
740 STATE_SWAP3, // Swap two characters over three.
741 STATE_UNSWAP3, // Undo Swap two characters over three.
742 STATE_UNROT3L, // Undo rotate three characters left
743 STATE_UNROT3R, // Undo rotate three characters right
744 STATE_REP_INI, // Prepare for using REP items.
745 STATE_REP, // Use matching REP items from the .aff file.
746 STATE_REP_UNDO, // Undo a REP item replacement.
747 STATE_FINAL // End of this node.
748} state_T;
749
750// Struct to keep the state at each level in suggest_try_change().
751typedef struct trystate_S {
752 state_T ts_state; // state at this level, STATE_
753 int ts_score; // score
754 idx_T ts_arridx; // index in tree array, start of node
755 short ts_curi; // index in list of child nodes
756 char_u ts_fidx; // index in fword[], case-folded bad word
757 char_u ts_fidxtry; // ts_fidx at which bytes may be changed
758 char_u ts_twordlen; // valid length of tword[]
759 char_u ts_prefixdepth; // stack depth for end of prefix or
760 // PFD_PREFIXTREE or PFD_NOPREFIX
761 char_u ts_flags; // TSF_ flags
762 char_u ts_tcharlen; // number of bytes in tword character
763 char_u ts_tcharidx; // current byte index in tword character
764 char_u ts_isdiff; // DIFF_ values
765 char_u ts_fcharstart; // index in fword where badword char started
766 char_u ts_prewordlen; // length of word in "preword[]"
767 char_u ts_splitoff; // index in "tword" after last split
768 char_u ts_splitfidx; // "ts_fidx" at word split
769 char_u ts_complen; // nr of compound words used
770 char_u ts_compsplit; // index for "compflags" where word was spit
771 char_u ts_save_badflags; // su_badflags saved here
772 char_u ts_delidx; // index in fword for char that was deleted,
773 // valid when "ts_flags" has TSF_DIDDEL
774} trystate_T;
775
776// Structure used for the cookie argument of do_in_runtimepath().
777typedef struct spelload_S {
778 char_u sl_lang[MAXWLEN250 + 1]; // language name
779 slang_T *sl_slang; // resulting slang_T struct
780 int sl_nobreak; // NOBREAK language found
781} spelload_T;
782
783#define SY_MAXLEN30 30
784typedef struct syl_item_S {
785 char_u sy_chars[SY_MAXLEN30]; // the sequence of chars
786 int sy_len;
787} syl_item_T;
788
789#define MAXLINELEN500 500 // Maximum length in bytes of a line in a .aff
790 // and .dic file.
791// Main structure to store the contents of a ".aff" file.
792typedef struct afffile_S {
793 char_u *af_enc; // "SET", normalized, alloc'ed string or NULL
794 int af_flagtype; // AFT_CHAR, AFT_LONG, AFT_NUM or AFT_CAPLONG
795 unsigned af_rare; // RARE ID for rare word
796 unsigned af_keepcase; // KEEPCASE ID for keep-case word
797 unsigned af_bad; // BAD ID for banned word
798 unsigned af_needaffix; // NEEDAFFIX ID
799 unsigned af_circumfix; // CIRCUMFIX ID
800 unsigned af_needcomp; // NEEDCOMPOUND ID
801 unsigned af_comproot; // COMPOUNDROOT ID
802 unsigned af_compforbid; // COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG ID
803 unsigned af_comppermit; // COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG ID
804 unsigned af_nosuggest; // NOSUGGEST ID
805 int af_pfxpostpone; // postpone prefixes without chop string and
806 // without flags
807 hashtab_T af_pref; // hashtable for prefixes, affheader_T
808 hashtab_T af_suff; // hashtable for suffixes, affheader_T
809 hashtab_T af_comp; // hashtable for compound flags, compitem_T
810} afffile_T;
811
812#define AFT_CHAR0 0 // flags are one character
813#define AFT_LONG1 1 // flags are two characters
814#define AFT_CAPLONG2 2 // flags are one or two characters
815#define AFT_NUM3 3 // flags are numbers, comma separated
816
817typedef struct affentry_S affentry_T;
818// Affix entry from ".aff" file. Used for prefixes and suffixes.
819struct affentry_S {
820 affentry_T *ae_next; // next affix with same name/number
821 char_u *ae_chop; // text to chop off basic word (can be NULL)
822 char_u *ae_add; // text to add to basic word (can be NULL)
823 char_u *ae_flags; // flags on the affix (can be NULL)
824 char_u *ae_cond; // condition (NULL for ".")
825 regprog_T *ae_prog; // regexp program for ae_cond or NULL
826 char ae_compforbid; // COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG found
827 char ae_comppermit; // COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG found
828};
829
830# define AH_KEY_LEN17 17 // 2 x 8 bytes + NUL
831
832// Affix header from ".aff" file. Used for af_pref and af_suff.
833typedef struct affheader_S {
834 char_u ah_key[AH_KEY_LEN17]; // key for hashtab == name of affix
835 unsigned ah_flag; // affix name as number, uses "af_flagtype"
836 int ah_newID; // prefix ID after renumbering; 0 if not used
837 int ah_combine; // suffix may combine with prefix
838 int ah_follows; // another affix block should be following
839 affentry_T *ah_first; // first affix entry
840} affheader_T;
841
842#define HI2AH(hi)((affheader_T *)(hi)->hi_key) ((affheader_T *)(hi)->hi_key)
843
844// Flag used in compound items.
845typedef struct compitem_S {
846 char_u ci_key[AH_KEY_LEN17]; // key for hashtab == name of compound
847 unsigned ci_flag; // affix name as number, uses "af_flagtype"
848 int ci_newID; // affix ID after renumbering.
849} compitem_T;
850
851#define HI2CI(hi)((compitem_T *)(hi)->hi_key) ((compitem_T *)(hi)->hi_key)
852
853// Structure that is used to store the items in the word tree. This avoids
854// the need to keep track of each allocated thing, everything is freed all at
855// once after ":mkspell" is done.
856// Note: "sb_next" must be just before "sb_data" to make sure the alignment of
857// "sb_data" is correct for systems where pointers must be aligned on
858// pointer-size boundaries and sizeof(pointer) > sizeof(int) (e.g., Sparc).
859#define SBLOCKSIZE16000 16000 // size of sb_data
860typedef struct sblock_S sblock_T;
861struct sblock_S {
862 int sb_used; // nr of bytes already in use
863 sblock_T *sb_next; // next block in list
864 char_u sb_data[1]; // data, actually longer
865};
866
867// A node in the tree.
868typedef struct wordnode_S wordnode_T;
869struct wordnode_S {
870 union // shared to save space
871 {
872 char_u hashkey[6]; // the hash key, only used while compressing
873 int index; // index in written nodes (valid after first
874 // round)
875 } wn_u1;
876 union // shared to save space
877 {
878 wordnode_T *next; // next node with same hash key
879 wordnode_T *wnode; // parent node that will write this node
880 } wn_u2;
881 wordnode_T *wn_child; // child (next byte in word)
882 wordnode_T *wn_sibling; // next sibling (alternate byte in word,
883 // always sorted)
884 int wn_refs; // Nr. of references to this node. Only
885 // relevant for first node in a list of
886 // siblings, in following siblings it is
887 // always one.
888 char_u wn_byte; // Byte for this node. NUL for word end
889
890 // Info for when "wn_byte" is NUL.
891 // In PREFIXTREE "wn_region" is used for the prefcondnr.
892 // In the soundfolded word tree "wn_flags" has the MSW of the wordnr and
893 // "wn_region" the LSW of the wordnr.
894 char_u wn_affixID; // supported/required prefix ID or 0
895 uint16_t wn_flags; // WF_ flags
896 short wn_region; // region mask
897
898#ifdef SPELL_PRINTTREE
899 int wn_nr; // sequence nr for printing
900#endif
901};
902
903#define WN_MASK0xffff 0xffff // mask relevant bits of "wn_flags"
904
905#define HI2WN(hi)(wordnode_T *)((hi)->hi_key) (wordnode_T *)((hi)->hi_key)
906
907// Info used while reading the spell files.
908typedef struct spellinfo_S {
909 wordnode_T *si_foldroot; // tree with case-folded words
910 long si_foldwcount; // nr of words in si_foldroot
911
912 wordnode_T *si_keeproot; // tree with keep-case words
913 long si_keepwcount; // nr of words in si_keeproot
914
915 wordnode_T *si_prefroot; // tree with postponed prefixes
916
917 long si_sugtree; // creating the soundfolding trie
918
919 sblock_T *si_blocks; // memory blocks used
920 long si_blocks_cnt; // memory blocks allocated
921 int si_did_emsg; // TRUE when ran out of memory
922
923 long si_compress_cnt; // words to add before lowering
924 // compression limit
925 wordnode_T *si_first_free; // List of nodes that have been freed during
926 // compression, linked by "wn_child" field.
927 long si_free_count; // number of nodes in si_first_free
928#ifdef SPELL_PRINTTREE
929 int si_wordnode_nr; // sequence nr for nodes
930#endif
931 buf_T *si_spellbuf; // buffer used to store soundfold word table
932
933 int si_ascii; // handling only ASCII words
934 int si_add; // addition file
935 int si_clear_chartab; // when TRUE clear char tables
936 int si_region; // region mask
937 vimconv_T si_conv; // for conversion to 'encoding'
938 int si_memtot; // runtime memory used
939 int si_verbose; // verbose messages
940 int si_msg_count; // number of words added since last message
941 char_u *si_info; // info text chars or NULL
942 int si_region_count; // number of regions supported (1 when there
943 // are no regions)
944 char_u si_region_name[17]; // region names; used only if
945 // si_region_count > 1)
946
947 garray_T si_rep; // list of fromto_T entries from REP lines
948 garray_T si_repsal; // list of fromto_T entries from REPSAL lines
949 garray_T si_sal; // list of fromto_T entries from SAL lines
950 char_u *si_sofofr; // SOFOFROM text
951 char_u *si_sofoto; // SOFOTO text
952 int si_nosugfile; // NOSUGFILE item found
953 int si_nosplitsugs; // NOSPLITSUGS item found
954 int si_followup; // soundsalike: ?
955 int si_collapse; // soundsalike: ?
956 hashtab_T si_commonwords; // hashtable for common words
957 time_t si_sugtime; // timestamp for .sug file
958 int si_rem_accents; // soundsalike: remove accents
959 garray_T si_map; // MAP info concatenated
960 char_u *si_midword; // MIDWORD chars or NULL
961 int si_compmax; // max nr of words for compounding
962 int si_compminlen; // minimal length for compounding
963 int si_compsylmax; // max nr of syllables for compounding
964 int si_compoptions; // COMP_ flags
965 garray_T si_comppat; // CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN items, each stored as
966 // a string
967 char_u *si_compflags; // flags used for compounding
968 char_u si_nobreak; // NOBREAK
969 char_u *si_syllable; // syllable string
970 garray_T si_prefcond; // table with conditions for postponed
971 // prefixes, each stored as a string
972 int si_newprefID; // current value for ah_newID
973 int si_newcompID; // current value for compound ID
974} spellinfo_T;
975
976static spelltab_T spelltab;
977static int did_set_spelltab;
978
979#define CF_WORD0x01 0x01
980#define CF_UPPER0x02 0x02
981
982// structure used to store soundfolded words that add_sound_suggest() has
983// handled already.
984typedef struct {
985 short sft_score; // lowest score used
986 char_u sft_word[1]; // soundfolded word, actually longer
987} sftword_T;
988
989typedef struct {
990 int badi;
991 int goodi;
992 int score;
993} limitscore_T;
994
995
996#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
997# include "spell.c.generated.h"
998#endif
999
1000// values for ts_isdiff
1001#define DIFF_NONE0 0 // no different byte (yet)
1002#define DIFF_YES1 1 // different byte found
1003#define DIFF_INSERT2 2 // inserting character
1004
1005// values for ts_flags
1006#define TSF_PREFIXOK1 1 // already checked that prefix is OK
1007#define TSF_DIDSPLIT2 2 // tried split at this point
1008#define TSF_DIDDEL4 4 // did a delete, "ts_delidx" has index
1009
1010// special values ts_prefixdepth
1011#define PFD_NOPREFIX0xff 0xff // not using prefixes
1012#define PFD_PREFIXTREE0xfe 0xfe // walking through the prefix tree
1013#define PFD_NOTSPECIAL0xfd 0xfd // highest value that's not special
1014
1015// mode values for find_word
1016#define FIND_FOLDWORD0 0 // find word case-folded
1017#define FIND_KEEPWORD1 1 // find keep-case word
1018#define FIND_PREFIX2 2 // find word after prefix
1019#define FIND_COMPOUND3 3 // find case-folded compound word
1020#define FIND_KEEPCOMPOUND4 4 // find keep-case compound word
1021
1022
1023// Use our own character-case definitions, because the current locale may
1024// differ from what the .spl file uses.
1025// These must not be called with negative number!
1026#include <wchar.h> // for towupper() and towlower()
1027// Multi-byte implementation. For Unicode we can call utf_*(), but don't do
1028// that for ASCII, because we don't want to use 'casemap' here. Otherwise use
1029// the "w" library function for characters above 255.
1030#define SPELL_TOFOLD(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_fold(c) : (c) < 256
? (int)spelltab.st_fold[c] : (int)towlower(c)) (enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_fold(c) \
1031 : (c) < \
1032 256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[c] : (int)towlower(c))
1033
1034#define SPELL_TOUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_toupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_upper[c] : (int)towupper(c)) (enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_toupper(c) \
1035 : (c) < \
1036 256 ? (int)spelltab.st_upper[c] : (int)towupper(c))
1037
1038#define SPELL_ISUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c)) (enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) \
1039 : (c) < 256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c))
1040
1041
1042static char *e_format = N_("E759: Format error in spell file")"E759: Format error in spell file";
1043static char *e_spell_trunc = N_("E758: Truncated spell file")"E758: Truncated spell file";
1044static char *e_afftrailing = N_("Trailing text in %s line %d: %s")"Trailing text in %s line %d: %s";
1045static char *e_affname = N_("Affix name too long in %s line %d: %s")"Affix name too long in %s line %d: %s";
1046static char *e_affform = N_("E761: Format error in affix file FOL, LOW or UPP")"E761: Format error in affix file FOL, LOW or UPP";
1047static char *e_affrange = N_("E762: Character in FOL, LOW or UPP is out of range"
1048 "E762: Character in FOL, LOW or UPP is out of range")"E762: Character in FOL, LOW or UPP is out of range";
1049static char *msg_compressing = N_("Compressing word tree...")"Compressing word tree...";
1050
1051// Remember what "z?" replaced.
1052static char_u *repl_from = NULL((void*)0);
1053static char_u *repl_to = NULL((void*)0);
1054
1055// Main spell-checking function.
1056// "ptr" points to a character that could be the start of a word.
1057// "*attrp" is set to the highlight index for a badly spelled word. For a
1058// non-word or when it's OK it remains unchanged.
1059// This must only be called when 'spelllang' is not empty.
1060//
1061// "capcol" is used to check for a Capitalised word after the end of a
1062// sentence. If it's zero then perform the check. Return the column where to
1063// check next, or -1 when no sentence end was found. If it's NULL then don't
1064// worry.
1065//
1066// Returns the length of the word in bytes, also when it's OK, so that the
1067// caller can skip over the word.
1068int
1069spell_check (
1070 win_T *wp, // current window
1071 char_u *ptr,
1072 hlf_T *attrp,
1073 int *capcol, // column to check for Capital
1074 bool_Bool docount // count good words
1075)
1076{
1077 matchinf_T mi; // Most things are put in "mi" so that it can
1078 // be passed to functions quickly.
1079 int nrlen = 0; // found a number first
1080 int c;
1081 int wrongcaplen = 0;
1082 int lpi;
1083 bool_Bool count_word = docount;
1084
1085 // A word never starts at a space or a control character. Return quickly
1086 // then, skipping over the character.
1087 if (*ptr <= ' ')
1088 return 1;
1089
1090 // Return here when loading language files failed.
1091 if (GA_EMPTY(&wp->w_s->b_langp)((&wp->w_s->b_langp)->ga_len <= 0))
1092 return 1;
1093
1094 memset(&mi, 0, sizeof(matchinf_T));
1095
1096 // A number is always OK. Also skip hexadecimal numbers 0xFF99 and
1097 // 0X99FF. But always do check spelling to find "3GPP" and "11
1098 // julifeest".
1099 if (*ptr >= '0' && *ptr <= '9') {
1100 if (*ptr == '0' && (ptr[1] == 'x' || ptr[1] == 'X'))
1101 mi.mi_end = skiphex(ptr + 2);
1102 else
1103 mi.mi_end = skipdigits(ptr);
1104 nrlen = (int)(mi.mi_end - ptr);
1105 }
1106
1107 // Find the normal end of the word (until the next non-word character).
1108 mi.mi_word = ptr;
1109 mi.mi_fend = ptr;
1110 if (spell_iswordp(mi.mi_fend, wp)) {
1111 do {
1112 mb_ptr_adv(mi.mi_fend)mi.mi_fend += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(mi.mi_fend) : 1;
1113 } while (*mi.mi_fend != NUL'\000' && spell_iswordp(mi.mi_fend, wp));
1114
1115 if (capcol != NULL((void*)0) && *capcol == 0 && wp->w_s->b_cap_prog != NULL((void*)0)) {
1116 // Check word starting with capital letter.
1117 c = PTR2CHAR(ptr)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(ptr) : (int)*(ptr));
1118 if (!SPELL_ISUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c)))
1119 wrongcaplen = (int)(mi.mi_fend - ptr);
1120 }
1121 }
1122 if (capcol != NULL((void*)0))
1123 *capcol = -1;
1124
1125 // We always use the characters up to the next non-word character,
1126 // also for bad words.
1127 mi.mi_end = mi.mi_fend;
1128
1129 // Check caps type later.
1130 mi.mi_capflags = 0;
1131 mi.mi_cend = NULL((void*)0);
1132 mi.mi_win = wp;
1133
1134 // case-fold the word with one non-word character, so that we can check
1135 // for the word end.
1136 if (*mi.mi_fend != NUL'\000')
1137 mb_ptr_adv(mi.mi_fend)mi.mi_fend += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(mi.mi_fend) : 1;
1138
1139 (void)spell_casefold(ptr, (int)(mi.mi_fend - ptr), mi.mi_fword,
1140 MAXWLEN250 + 1);
1141 mi.mi_fwordlen = (int)STRLEN(mi.mi_fword)strlen((char *)(mi.mi_fword));
1142
1143 // The word is bad unless we recognize it.
1144 mi.mi_result = SP_BAD3;
1145 mi.mi_result2 = SP_BAD3;
1146
1147 // Loop over the languages specified in 'spelllang'.
1148 // We check them all, because a word may be matched longer in another
1149 // language.
1150 for (lpi = 0; lpi < wp->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
1151 mi.mi_lp = LANGP_ENTRY(wp->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(wp->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
1152
1153 // If reloading fails the language is still in the list but everything
1154 // has been cleared.
1155 if (mi.mi_lp->lp_slang->sl_fidxs == NULL((void*)0))
1156 continue;
1157
1158 // Check for a matching word in case-folded words.
1159 find_word(&mi, FIND_FOLDWORD0);
1160
1161 // Check for a matching word in keep-case words.
1162 find_word(&mi, FIND_KEEPWORD1);
1163
1164 // Check for matching prefixes.
1165 find_prefix(&mi, FIND_FOLDWORD0);
1166
1167 // For a NOBREAK language, may want to use a word without a following
1168 // word as a backup.
1169 if (mi.mi_lp->lp_slang->sl_nobreak && mi.mi_result == SP_BAD3
1170 && mi.mi_result2 != SP_BAD3) {
1171 mi.mi_result = mi.mi_result2;
1172 mi.mi_end = mi.mi_end2;
1173 }
1174
1175 // Count the word in the first language where it's found to be OK.
1176 if (count_word && mi.mi_result == SP_OK0) {
1177 count_common_word(mi.mi_lp->lp_slang, ptr,
1178 (int)(mi.mi_end - ptr), 1);
1179 count_word = false0;
1180 }
1181 }
1182
1183 if (mi.mi_result != SP_OK0) {
1184 // If we found a number skip over it. Allows for "42nd". Do flag
1185 // rare and local words, e.g., "3GPP".
1186 if (nrlen > 0) {
1187 if (mi.mi_result == SP_BAD3 || mi.mi_result == SP_BANNED-1)
1188 return nrlen;
1189 }
1190 // When we are at a non-word character there is no error, just
1191 // skip over the character (try looking for a word after it).
1192 else if (!spell_iswordp_nmw(ptr, wp)) {
1193 if (capcol != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_s->b_cap_prog != NULL((void*)0)) {
1194 regmatch_T regmatch;
1195
1196 // Check for end of sentence.
1197 regmatch.regprog = wp->w_s->b_cap_prog;
1198 regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE0;
1199 if (vim_regexec(&regmatch, ptr, 0))
1200 *capcol = (int)(regmatch.endp[0] - ptr);
1201 }
1202
1203 if (has_mbyte) {
1204 return (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
1205 }
1206 return 1;
1207 } else if (mi.mi_end == ptr)
1208 // Always include at least one character. Required for when there
1209 // is a mixup in "midword".
1210 mb_ptr_adv(mi.mi_end)mi.mi_end += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(mi.mi_end) : 1;
1211 else if (mi.mi_result == SP_BAD3
1212 && LANGP_ENTRY(wp->w_s->b_langp, 0)(((langp_T *)(wp->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (0))->lp_slang->sl_nobreak) {
1213 char_u *p, *fp;
1214 int save_result = mi.mi_result;
1215
1216 // First language in 'spelllang' is NOBREAK. Find first position
1217 // at which any word would be valid.
1218 mi.mi_lp = LANGP_ENTRY(wp->w_s->b_langp, 0)(((langp_T *)(wp->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (0));
1219 if (mi.mi_lp->lp_slang->sl_fidxs != NULL((void*)0)) {
1220 p = mi.mi_word;
1221 fp = mi.mi_fword;
1222 for (;; ) {
1223 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
1224 mb_ptr_adv(fp)fp += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(fp) : 1;
1225 if (p >= mi.mi_end)
1226 break;
1227 mi.mi_compoff = (int)(fp - mi.mi_fword);
1228 find_word(&mi, FIND_COMPOUND3);
1229 if (mi.mi_result != SP_BAD3) {
1230 mi.mi_end = p;
1231 break;
1232 }
1233 }
1234 mi.mi_result = save_result;
1235 }
1236 }
1237
1238 if (mi.mi_result == SP_BAD3 || mi.mi_result == SP_BANNED-1)
1239 *attrp = HLF_SPB;
1240 else if (mi.mi_result == SP_RARE1)
1241 *attrp = HLF_SPR;
1242 else
1243 *attrp = HLF_SPL;
1244 }
1245
1246 if (wrongcaplen > 0 && (mi.mi_result == SP_OK0 || mi.mi_result == SP_RARE1)) {
1247 // Report SpellCap only when the word isn't badly spelled.
1248 *attrp = HLF_SPC;
1249 return wrongcaplen;
1250 }
1251
1252 return (int)(mi.mi_end - ptr);
1253}
1254
1255// Check if the word at "mip->mi_word" is in the tree.
1256// When "mode" is FIND_FOLDWORD check in fold-case word tree.
1257// When "mode" is FIND_KEEPWORD check in keep-case word tree.
1258// When "mode" is FIND_PREFIX check for word after prefix in fold-case word
1259// tree.
1260//
1261// For a match mip->mi_result is updated.
1262static void find_word(matchinf_T *mip, int mode)
1263{
1264 int wlen = 0;
1265 int flen;
1266 char_u *ptr;
1267 slang_T *slang = mip->mi_lp->lp_slang;
1268 char_u *byts;
1269 idx_T *idxs;
1270
1271 if (mode == FIND_KEEPWORD1 || mode == FIND_KEEPCOMPOUND4) {
1272 // Check for word with matching case in keep-case tree.
1273 ptr = mip->mi_word;
1274 flen = 9999; // no case folding, always enough bytes
1275 byts = slang->sl_kbyts;
1276 idxs = slang->sl_kidxs;
1277
1278 if (mode == FIND_KEEPCOMPOUND4)
1279 // Skip over the previously found word(s).
1280 wlen += mip->mi_compoff;
1281 } else {
1282 // Check for case-folded in case-folded tree.
1283 ptr = mip->mi_fword;
1284 flen = mip->mi_fwordlen; // available case-folded bytes
1285 byts = slang->sl_fbyts;
1286 idxs = slang->sl_fidxs;
1287
1288 if (mode == FIND_PREFIX2) {
1289 // Skip over the prefix.
1290 wlen = mip->mi_prefixlen;
1291 flen -= mip->mi_prefixlen;
1292 } else if (mode == FIND_COMPOUND3) {
1293 // Skip over the previously found word(s).
1294 wlen = mip->mi_compoff;
1295 flen -= mip->mi_compoff;
1296 }
1297
1298 }
1299
1300 if (byts == NULL((void*)0))
1301 return; // array is empty
1302
1303 idx_T arridx = 0;
1304 int endlen[MAXWLEN250]; // length at possible word endings
1305 idx_T endidx[MAXWLEN250]; // possible word endings
1306 int endidxcnt = 0;
1307 int len;
1308 int c;
1309
1310 // Repeat advancing in the tree until:
1311 // - there is a byte that doesn't match,
1312 // - we reach the end of the tree,
1313 // - or we reach the end of the line.
1314 for (;; ) {
1315 if (flen <= 0 && *mip->mi_fend != NUL'\000')
1316 flen = fold_more(mip);
1317
1318 len = byts[arridx++];
1319
1320 // If the first possible byte is a zero the word could end here.
1321 // Remember this index, we first check for the longest word.
1322 if (byts[arridx] == 0) {
1323 if (endidxcnt == MAXWLEN250) {
1324 // Must be a corrupted spell file.
1325 EMSG(_(e_format))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_format))));
1326 return;
1327 }
1328 endlen[endidxcnt] = wlen;
1329 endidx[endidxcnt++] = arridx++;
1330 --len;
1331
1332 // Skip over the zeros, there can be several flag/region
1333 // combinations.
1334 while (len > 0 && byts[arridx] == 0) {
1335 ++arridx;
1336 --len;
1337 }
1338 if (len == 0)
1339 break; // no children, word must end here
1340 }
1341
1342 // Stop looking at end of the line.
1343 if (ptr[wlen] == NUL'\000')
1344 break;
1345
1346 // Perform a binary search in the list of accepted bytes.
1347 c = ptr[wlen];
1348 if (c == TAB'\011') // <Tab> is handled like <Space>
1349 c = ' ';
1350 idx_T lo = arridx;
1351 idx_T hi = arridx + len - 1;
1352 while (lo < hi) {
1353 idx_T m = (lo + hi) / 2;
1354 if (byts[m] > c)
1355 hi = m - 1;
1356 else if (byts[m] < c)
1357 lo = m + 1;
1358 else {
1359 lo = hi = m;
1360 break;
1361 }
1362 }
1363
1364 // Stop if there is no matching byte.
1365 if (hi < lo || byts[lo] != c)
1366 break;
1367
1368 // Continue at the child (if there is one).
1369 arridx = idxs[lo];
1370 ++wlen;
1371 --flen;
1372
1373 // One space in the good word may stand for several spaces in the
1374 // checked word.
1375 if (c == ' ') {
1376 for (;; ) {
1377 if (flen <= 0 && *mip->mi_fend != NUL'\000')
1378 flen = fold_more(mip);
1379 if (ptr[wlen] != ' ' && ptr[wlen] != TAB'\011')
1380 break;
1381 ++wlen;
1382 --flen;
1383 }
1384 }
1385 }
1386
1387 char_u *p;
1388 bool_Bool word_ends;
1389
1390 // Verify that one of the possible endings is valid. Try the longest
1391 // first.
1392 while (endidxcnt > 0) {
1393 --endidxcnt;
1394 arridx = endidx[endidxcnt];
1395 wlen = endlen[endidxcnt];
1396
1397 if ((*mb_head_off)(ptr, ptr + wlen) > 0)
1398 continue; // not at first byte of character
1399 if (spell_iswordp(ptr + wlen, mip->mi_win)) {
1400 if (slang->sl_compprog == NULL((void*)0) && !slang->sl_nobreak)
1401 continue; // next char is a word character
1402 word_ends = false0;
1403 } else
1404 word_ends = true1;
1405 // The prefix flag is before compound flags. Once a valid prefix flag
1406 // has been found we try compound flags.
1407 bool_Bool prefix_found = false0;
1408
1409 if (mode != FIND_KEEPWORD1 && has_mbyte) {
1410 // Compute byte length in original word, length may change
1411 // when folding case. This can be slow, take a shortcut when the
1412 // case-folded word is equal to the keep-case word.
1413 p = mip->mi_word;
1414 if (STRNCMP(ptr, p, wlen)strncmp((char *)(ptr), (char *)(p), (size_t)(wlen)) != 0) {
1415 for (char_u *s = ptr; s < ptr + wlen; mb_ptr_adv(s)s += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s) : 1)
1416 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
1417 wlen = (int)(p - mip->mi_word);
1418 }
1419 }
1420
1421 // Check flags and region. For FIND_PREFIX check the condition and
1422 // prefix ID.
1423 // Repeat this if there are more flags/region alternatives until there
1424 // is a match.
1425 for (len = byts[arridx - 1]; len > 0 && byts[arridx] == 0;
1426 --len, ++arridx) {
1427 uint32_t flags = idxs[arridx];
1428
1429 // For the fold-case tree check that the case of the checked word
1430 // matches with what the word in the tree requires.
1431 // For keep-case tree the case is always right. For prefixes we
1432 // don't bother to check.
1433 if (mode == FIND_FOLDWORD0) {
1434 if (mip->mi_cend != mip->mi_word + wlen) {
1435 // mi_capflags was set for a different word length, need
1436 // to do it again.
1437 mip->mi_cend = mip->mi_word + wlen;
1438 mip->mi_capflags = captype(mip->mi_word, mip->mi_cend);
1439 }
1440
1441 if (mip->mi_capflags == WF_KEEPCAP0x80
1442 || !spell_valid_case(mip->mi_capflags, flags))
1443 continue;
1444 }
1445 // When mode is FIND_PREFIX the word must support the prefix:
1446 // check the prefix ID and the condition. Do that for the list at
1447 // mip->mi_prefarridx that find_prefix() filled.
1448 else if (mode == FIND_PREFIX2 && !prefix_found) {
1449 c = valid_word_prefix(mip->mi_prefcnt, mip->mi_prefarridx,
1450 flags,
1451 mip->mi_word + mip->mi_cprefixlen, slang,
1452 false0);
1453 if (c == 0)
1454 continue;
1455
1456 // Use the WF_RARE flag for a rare prefix.
1457 if (c & WF_RAREPFX(0x01 << 24))
1458 flags |= WF_RARE0x08;
1459 prefix_found = true1;
1460 }
1461
1462 if (slang->sl_nobreak) {
1463 if ((mode == FIND_COMPOUND3 || mode == FIND_KEEPCOMPOUND4)
1464 && (flags & WF_BANNED0x10) == 0) {
1465 // NOBREAK: found a valid following word. That's all we
1466 // need to know, so return.
1467 mip->mi_result = SP_OK0;
1468 break;
1469 }
1470 } else if ((mode == FIND_COMPOUND3 || mode == FIND_KEEPCOMPOUND4
1471 || !word_ends)) {
1472 // If there is no compound flag or the word is shorter than
1473 // COMPOUNDMIN reject it quickly.
1474 // Makes you wonder why someone puts a compound flag on a word
1475 // that's too short... Myspell compatibility requires this
1476 // anyway.
1477 if (((unsigned)flags >> 24) == 0
1478 || wlen - mip->mi_compoff < slang->sl_compminlen)
1479 continue;
1480 // For multi-byte chars check character length against
1481 // COMPOUNDMIN.
1482 if (has_mbyte
1483 && slang->sl_compminlen > 0
1484 && mb_charlen_len(mip->mi_word + mip->mi_compoff,
1485 wlen - mip->mi_compoff) < slang->sl_compminlen)
1486 continue;
1487
1488 // Limit the number of compound words to COMPOUNDWORDMAX if no
1489 // maximum for syllables is specified.
1490 if (!word_ends && mip->mi_complen + mip->mi_compextra + 2
1491 > slang->sl_compmax
1492 && slang->sl_compsylmax == MAXWLEN250)
1493 continue;
1494
1495 // Don't allow compounding on a side where an affix was added,
1496 // unless COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG was used.
1497 if (mip->mi_complen > 0 && (flags & WF_NOCOMPBEF0x1000))
1498 continue;
1499 if (!word_ends && (flags & WF_NOCOMPAFT0x2000))
1500 continue;
1501
1502 // Quickly check if compounding is possible with this flag.
1503 if (!byte_in_str(mip->mi_complen == 0
1504 ? slang->sl_compstartflags
1505 : slang->sl_compallflags,
1506 ((unsigned)flags >> 24)))
1507 continue;
1508
1509 // If there is a match with a CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN rule
1510 // discard the compound word.
1511 if (match_checkcompoundpattern(ptr, wlen, &slang->sl_comppat))
1512 continue;
1513
1514 if (mode == FIND_COMPOUND3) {
1515 int capflags;
1516
1517 // Need to check the caps type of the appended compound
1518 // word.
1519 if (has_mbyte && STRNCMP(ptr, mip->mi_word,strncmp((char *)(ptr), (char *)(mip->mi_word), (size_t)(mip
->mi_compoff))
1520 mip->mi_compoff)strncmp((char *)(ptr), (char *)(mip->mi_word), (size_t)(mip
->mi_compoff)) != 0) {
1521 // case folding may have changed the length
1522 p = mip->mi_word;
1523 for (char_u *s = ptr; s < ptr + mip->mi_compoff; mb_ptr_adv(s)s += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s) : 1)
1524 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
1525 } else
1526 p = mip->mi_word + mip->mi_compoff;
1527 capflags = captype(p, mip->mi_word + wlen);
1528 if (capflags == WF_KEEPCAP0x80 || (capflags == WF_ALLCAP0x04
1529 && (flags & WF_FIXCAP0x40) != 0))
1530 continue;
1531
1532 if (capflags != WF_ALLCAP0x04) {
1533 // When the character before the word is a word
1534 // character we do not accept a Onecap word. We do
1535 // accept a no-caps word, even when the dictionary
1536 // word specifies ONECAP.
1537 mb_ptr_back(mip->mi_word, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(mip->mi_word, p - 1) + 1)
: 1;
1538 if (spell_iswordp_nmw(p, mip->mi_win)
1539 ? capflags == WF_ONECAP0x02
1540 : (flags & WF_ONECAP0x02) != 0
1541 && capflags != WF_ONECAP0x02)
1542 continue;
1543 }
1544 }
1545
1546 // If the word ends the sequence of compound flags of the
1547 // words must match with one of the COMPOUNDRULE items and
1548 // the number of syllables must not be too large.
1549 mip->mi_compflags[mip->mi_complen] = ((unsigned)flags >> 24);
1550 mip->mi_compflags[mip->mi_complen + 1] = NUL'\000';
1551 if (word_ends) {
1552 char_u fword[MAXWLEN250];
1553
1554 if (slang->sl_compsylmax < MAXWLEN250) {
1555 // "fword" is only needed for checking syllables.
1556 if (ptr == mip->mi_word)
1557 (void)spell_casefold(ptr, wlen, fword, MAXWLEN250);
1558 else
1559 STRLCPY(fword, ptr, endlen[endidxcnt] + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(fword), (char *)(ptr), (size_t)(endlen[endidxcnt
] + 1));
1560 }
1561 if (!can_compound(slang, fword, mip->mi_compflags))
1562 continue;
1563 } else if (slang->sl_comprules != NULL((void*)0)
1564 && !match_compoundrule(slang, mip->mi_compflags))
1565 // The compound flags collected so far do not match any
1566 // COMPOUNDRULE, discard the compounded word.
1567 continue;
1568 }
1569 // Check NEEDCOMPOUND: can't use word without compounding.
1570 else if (flags & WF_NEEDCOMP0x0200)
1571 continue;
1572
1573 int nobreak_result = SP_OK0;
1574
1575 if (!word_ends) {
1576 int save_result = mip->mi_result;
1577 char_u *save_end = mip->mi_end;
1578 langp_T *save_lp = mip->mi_lp;
1579
1580 // Check that a valid word follows. If there is one and we
1581 // are compounding, it will set "mi_result", thus we are
1582 // always finished here. For NOBREAK we only check that a
1583 // valid word follows.
1584 // Recursive!
1585 if (slang->sl_nobreak)
1586 mip->mi_result = SP_BAD3;
1587
1588 // Find following word in case-folded tree.
1589 mip->mi_compoff = endlen[endidxcnt];
1590 if (has_mbyte && mode == FIND_KEEPWORD1) {
1591 // Compute byte length in case-folded word from "wlen":
1592 // byte length in keep-case word. Length may change when
1593 // folding case. This can be slow, take a shortcut when
1594 // the case-folded word is equal to the keep-case word.
1595 p = mip->mi_fword;
1596 if (STRNCMP(ptr, p, wlen)strncmp((char *)(ptr), (char *)(p), (size_t)(wlen)) != 0) {
1597 for (char_u *s = ptr; s < ptr + wlen; mb_ptr_adv(s)s += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s) : 1)
1598 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
1599 mip->mi_compoff = (int)(p - mip->mi_fword);
1600 }
1601 }
1602 c = mip->mi_compoff;
1603 ++mip->mi_complen;
1604 if (flags & WF_COMPROOT0x0800)
1605 ++mip->mi_compextra;
1606
1607 // For NOBREAK we need to try all NOBREAK languages, at least
1608 // to find the ".add" file(s).
1609 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < mip->mi_win->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
1610 if (slang->sl_nobreak) {
1611 mip->mi_lp = LANGP_ENTRY(mip->mi_win->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(mip->mi_win->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (
lpi));
1612 if (mip->mi_lp->lp_slang->sl_fidxs == NULL((void*)0)
1613 || !mip->mi_lp->lp_slang->sl_nobreak)
1614 continue;
1615 }
1616
1617 find_word(mip, FIND_COMPOUND3);
1618
1619 // When NOBREAK any word that matches is OK. Otherwise we
1620 // need to find the longest match, thus try with keep-case
1621 // and prefix too.
1622 if (!slang->sl_nobreak || mip->mi_result == SP_BAD3) {
1623 // Find following word in keep-case tree.
1624 mip->mi_compoff = wlen;
1625 find_word(mip, FIND_KEEPCOMPOUND4);
1626
1627#if 0 // Disabled, a prefix must not appear halfway a compound word,
1628 // unless the COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG is used and then it can't be a
1629 // postponed prefix.
1630 if (!slang->sl_nobreak || mip->mi_result == SP_BAD3) {
1631 // Check for following word with prefix.
1632 mip->mi_compoff = c;
1633 find_prefix(mip, FIND_COMPOUND3);
1634 }
1635#endif
1636 }
1637
1638 if (!slang->sl_nobreak)
1639 break;
1640 }
1641 --mip->mi_complen;
1642 if (flags & WF_COMPROOT0x0800)
1643 --mip->mi_compextra;
1644 mip->mi_lp = save_lp;
1645
1646 if (slang->sl_nobreak) {
1647 nobreak_result = mip->mi_result;
1648 mip->mi_result = save_result;
1649 mip->mi_end = save_end;
1650 } else {
1651 if (mip->mi_result == SP_OK0)
1652 break;
1653 continue;
1654 }
1655 }
1656
1657 int res = SP_BAD3;
1658 if (flags & WF_BANNED0x10)
1659 res = SP_BANNED-1;
1660 else if (flags & WF_REGION0x01) {
1661 // Check region.
1662 if ((mip->mi_lp->lp_region & (flags >> 16)) != 0)
1663 res = SP_OK0;
1664 else
1665 res = SP_LOCAL2;
1666 } else if (flags & WF_RARE0x08)
1667 res = SP_RARE1;
1668 else
1669 res = SP_OK0;
1670
1671 // Always use the longest match and the best result. For NOBREAK
1672 // we separately keep the longest match without a following good
1673 // word as a fall-back.
1674 if (nobreak_result == SP_BAD3) {
1675 if (mip->mi_result2 > res) {
1676 mip->mi_result2 = res;
1677 mip->mi_end2 = mip->mi_word + wlen;
1678 } else if (mip->mi_result2 == res
1679 && mip->mi_end2 < mip->mi_word + wlen)
1680 mip->mi_end2 = mip->mi_word + wlen;
1681 } else if (mip->mi_result > res) {
1682 mip->mi_result = res;
1683 mip->mi_end = mip->mi_word + wlen;
1684 } else if (mip->mi_result == res && mip->mi_end < mip->mi_word + wlen)
1685 mip->mi_end = mip->mi_word + wlen;
1686
1687 if (mip->mi_result == SP_OK0)
1688 break;
1689 }
1690
1691 if (mip->mi_result == SP_OK0)
1692 break;
1693 }
1694}
1695
1696// Returns true if there is a match between the word ptr[wlen] and
1697// CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN rules, assuming that we will concatenate with another
1698// word.
1699// A match means that the first part of CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN matches at the
1700// end of ptr[wlen] and the second part matches after it.
1701static bool_Bool
1702match_checkcompoundpattern (
1703 char_u *ptr,
1704 int wlen,
1705 garray_T *gap // &sl_comppat
1706)
1707{
1708 char_u *p;
1709 int len;
1710
1711 for (int i = 0; i + 1 < gap->ga_len; i += 2) {
1712 p = ((char_u **)gap->ga_data)[i + 1];
1713 if (STRNCMP(ptr + wlen, p, STRLEN(p))strncmp((char *)(ptr + wlen), (char *)(p), (size_t)(strlen((char
*)(p)))) == 0) {
1714 // Second part matches at start of following compound word, now
1715 // check if first part matches at end of previous word.
1716 p = ((char_u **)gap->ga_data)[i];
1717 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
1718 if (len <= wlen && STRNCMP(ptr + wlen - len, p, len)strncmp((char *)(ptr + wlen - len), (char *)(p), (size_t)(len
)) == 0)
1719 return true1;
1720 }
1721 }
1722 return false0;
1723}
1724
1725// Returns true if "flags" is a valid sequence of compound flags and "word"
1726// does not have too many syllables.
1727static bool_Bool can_compound(slang_T *slang, char_u *word, char_u *flags)
1728{
1729 regmatch_T regmatch;
1730 char_u uflags[MAXWLEN250 * 2];
1731 int i;
1732 char_u *p;
1733
1734 if (slang->sl_compprog == NULL((void*)0))
1735 return false0;
1736 if (enc_utf8) {
1737 // Need to convert the single byte flags to utf8 characters.
1738 p = uflags;
1739 for (i = 0; flags[i] != NUL'\000'; ++i)
1740 p += mb_char2bytes(flags[i], p);
1741 *p = NUL'\000';
1742 p = uflags;
1743 } else
1744 p = flags;
1745 regmatch.regprog = slang->sl_compprog;
1746 regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE0;
1747 if (!vim_regexec(&regmatch, p, 0))
1748 return false0;
1749
1750 // Count the number of syllables. This may be slow, do it last. If there
1751 // are too many syllables AND the number of compound words is above
1752 // COMPOUNDWORDMAX then compounding is not allowed.
1753 if (slang->sl_compsylmax < MAXWLEN250
1754 && count_syllables(slang, word) > slang->sl_compsylmax)
1755 return (int)STRLEN(flags)strlen((char *)(flags)) < slang->sl_compmax;
1756 return true1;
1757}
1758
1759// Returns true when the sequence of flags in "compflags" plus "flag" can
1760// possibly form a valid compounded word. This also checks the COMPOUNDRULE
1761// lines if they don't contain wildcards.
1762static bool_Bool can_be_compound(trystate_T *sp, slang_T *slang, char_u *compflags, int flag)
1763{
1764 // If the flag doesn't appear in sl_compstartflags or sl_compallflags
1765 // then it can't possibly compound.
1766 if (!byte_in_str(sp->ts_complen == sp->ts_compsplit
1767 ? slang->sl_compstartflags : slang->sl_compallflags, flag))
1768 return false0;
1769
1770 // If there are no wildcards, we can check if the flags collected so far
1771 // possibly can form a match with COMPOUNDRULE patterns. This only
1772 // makes sense when we have two or more words.
1773 if (slang->sl_comprules != NULL((void*)0) && sp->ts_complen > sp->ts_compsplit) {
1774 compflags[sp->ts_complen] = flag;
1775 compflags[sp->ts_complen + 1] = NUL'\000';
1776 bool_Bool v = match_compoundrule(slang, compflags + sp->ts_compsplit);
1777 compflags[sp->ts_complen] = NUL'\000';
1778 return v;
1779 }
1780
1781 return true1;
1782}
1783
1784// Returns true if the compound flags in compflags[] match the start of any
1785// compound rule. This is used to stop trying a compound if the flags
1786// collected so far can't possibly match any compound rule.
1787// Caller must check that slang->sl_comprules is not NULL.
1788static bool_Bool match_compoundrule(slang_T *slang, char_u *compflags)
1789{
1790 char_u *p;
1791 int i;
1792 int c;
1793
1794 // loop over all the COMPOUNDRULE entries
1795 for (p = slang->sl_comprules; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p) {
1796 // loop over the flags in the compound word we have made, match
1797 // them against the current rule entry
1798 for (i = 0;; ++i) {
1799 c = compflags[i];
1800 if (c == NUL'\000')
1801 // found a rule that matches for the flags we have so far
1802 return true1;
1803 if (*p == '/' || *p == NUL'\000')
1804 break; // end of rule, it's too short
1805 if (*p == '[') {
1806 bool_Bool match = false0;
1807
1808 // compare against all the flags in []
1809 ++p;
1810 while (*p != ']' && *p != NUL'\000')
1811 if (*p++ == c)
1812 match = true1;
1813 if (!match)
1814 break; // none matches
1815 } else if (*p != c)
1816 break; // flag of word doesn't match flag in pattern
1817 ++p;
1818 }
1819
1820 // Skip to the next "/", where the next pattern starts.
1821 p = vim_strchr(p, '/');
1822 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
1823 break;
1824 }
1825
1826 // Checked all the rules and none of them match the flags, so there
1827 // can't possibly be a compound starting with these flags.
1828 return false0;
1829}
1830
1831// Return non-zero if the prefix indicated by "arridx" matches with the prefix
1832// ID in "flags" for the word "word".
1833// The WF_RAREPFX flag is included in the return value for a rare prefix.
1834static int
1835valid_word_prefix (
1836 int totprefcnt, // nr of prefix IDs
1837 int arridx, // idx in sl_pidxs[]
1838 int flags,
1839 char_u *word,
1840 slang_T *slang,
1841 bool_Bool cond_req // only use prefixes with a condition
1842)
1843{
1844 int prefcnt;
1845 int pidx;
1846 regprog_T *rp;
1847 regmatch_T regmatch;
1848 int prefid;
1849
1850 prefid = (unsigned)flags >> 24;
1851 for (prefcnt = totprefcnt - 1; prefcnt >= 0; --prefcnt) {
1852 pidx = slang->sl_pidxs[arridx + prefcnt];
1853
1854 // Check the prefix ID.
1855 if (prefid != (pidx & 0xff))
1856 continue;
1857
1858 // Check if the prefix doesn't combine and the word already has a
1859 // suffix.
1860 if ((flags & WF_HAS_AFF0x0100) && (pidx & WF_PFX_NC(0x02 << 24)))
1861 continue;
1862
1863 // Check the condition, if there is one. The condition index is
1864 // stored in the two bytes above the prefix ID byte.
1865 rp = slang->sl_prefprog[((unsigned)pidx >> 8) & 0xffff];
1866 if (rp != NULL((void*)0)) {
1867 regmatch.regprog = rp;
1868 regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE0;
1869 if (!vim_regexec(&regmatch, word, 0))
1870 continue;
1871 } else if (cond_req)
1872 continue;
1873
1874 // It's a match! Return the WF_ flags.
1875 return pidx;
1876 }
1877 return 0;
1878}
1879
1880// Check if the word at "mip->mi_word" has a matching prefix.
1881// If it does, then check the following word.
1882//
1883// If "mode" is "FIND_COMPOUND" then do the same after another word, find a
1884// prefix in a compound word.
1885//
1886// For a match mip->mi_result is updated.
1887static void find_prefix(matchinf_T *mip, int mode)
1888{
1889 idx_T arridx = 0;
1890 int len;
1891 int wlen = 0;
1892 int flen;
1893 int c;
1894 char_u *ptr;
1895 idx_T lo, hi, m;
1896 slang_T *slang = mip->mi_lp->lp_slang;
1897 char_u *byts;
1898 idx_T *idxs;
1899
1900 byts = slang->sl_pbyts;
1901 if (byts == NULL((void*)0))
1902 return; // array is empty
1903
1904 // We use the case-folded word here, since prefixes are always
1905 // case-folded.
1906 ptr = mip->mi_fword;
1907 flen = mip->mi_fwordlen; // available case-folded bytes
1908 if (mode == FIND_COMPOUND3) {
1909 // Skip over the previously found word(s).
1910 ptr += mip->mi_compoff;
1911 flen -= mip->mi_compoff;
1912 }
1913 idxs = slang->sl_pidxs;
1914
1915 // Repeat advancing in the tree until:
1916 // - there is a byte that doesn't match,
1917 // - we reach the end of the tree,
1918 // - or we reach the end of the line.
1919 for (;; ) {
1920 if (flen == 0 && *mip->mi_fend != NUL'\000')
1921 flen = fold_more(mip);
1922
1923 len = byts[arridx++];
1924
1925 // If the first possible byte is a zero the prefix could end here.
1926 // Check if the following word matches and supports the prefix.
1927 if (byts[arridx] == 0) {
1928 // There can be several prefixes with different conditions. We
1929 // try them all, since we don't know which one will give the
1930 // longest match. The word is the same each time, pass the list
1931 // of possible prefixes to find_word().
1932 mip->mi_prefarridx = arridx;
1933 mip->mi_prefcnt = len;
1934 while (len > 0 && byts[arridx] == 0) {
1935 ++arridx;
1936 --len;
1937 }
1938 mip->mi_prefcnt -= len;
1939
1940 // Find the word that comes after the prefix.
1941 mip->mi_prefixlen = wlen;
1942 if (mode == FIND_COMPOUND3)
1943 // Skip over the previously found word(s).
1944 mip->mi_prefixlen += mip->mi_compoff;
1945
1946 if (has_mbyte) {
1947 // Case-folded length may differ from original length.
1948 mip->mi_cprefixlen = nofold_len(mip->mi_fword,
1949 mip->mi_prefixlen, mip->mi_word);
1950 } else
1951 mip->mi_cprefixlen = mip->mi_prefixlen;
1952 find_word(mip, FIND_PREFIX2);
1953
1954
1955 if (len == 0)
1956 break; // no children, word must end here
1957 }
1958
1959 // Stop looking at end of the line.
1960 if (ptr[wlen] == NUL'\000')
1961 break;
1962
1963 // Perform a binary search in the list of accepted bytes.
1964 c = ptr[wlen];
1965 lo = arridx;
1966 hi = arridx + len - 1;
1967 while (lo < hi) {
1968 m = (lo + hi) / 2;
1969 if (byts[m] > c)
1970 hi = m - 1;
1971 else if (byts[m] < c)
1972 lo = m + 1;
1973 else {
1974 lo = hi = m;
1975 break;
1976 }
1977 }
1978
1979 // Stop if there is no matching byte.
1980 if (hi < lo || byts[lo] != c)
1981 break;
1982
1983 // Continue at the child (if there is one).
1984 arridx = idxs[lo];
1985 ++wlen;
1986 --flen;
1987 }
1988}
1989
1990// Need to fold at least one more character. Do until next non-word character
1991// for efficiency. Include the non-word character too.
1992// Return the length of the folded chars in bytes.
1993static int fold_more(matchinf_T *mip)
1994{
1995 int flen;
1996 char_u *p;
1997
1998 p = mip->mi_fend;
1999 do {
2000 mb_ptr_adv(mip->mi_fend)mip->mi_fend += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(mip->mi_fend)
: 1;
2001 } while (*mip->mi_fend != NUL'\000' && spell_iswordp(mip->mi_fend, mip->mi_win));
2002
2003 // Include the non-word character so that we can check for the word end.
2004 if (*mip->mi_fend != NUL'\000')
2005 mb_ptr_adv(mip->mi_fend)mip->mi_fend += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(mip->mi_fend)
: 1;
2006
2007 (void)spell_casefold(p, (int)(mip->mi_fend - p),
2008 mip->mi_fword + mip->mi_fwordlen,
2009 MAXWLEN250 - mip->mi_fwordlen);
2010 flen = (int)STRLEN(mip->mi_fword + mip->mi_fwordlen)strlen((char *)(mip->mi_fword + mip->mi_fwordlen));
2011 mip->mi_fwordlen += flen;
2012 return flen;
2013}
2014
2015/// Checks case flags for a word. Returns true, if the word has the requested
2016/// case.
2017///
2018/// @param wordflags Flags for the checked word.
2019/// @param treeflags Flags for the word in the spell tree.
2020static bool_Bool spell_valid_case(int wordflags, int treeflags)
2021{
2022 return (wordflags == WF_ALLCAP0x04 && (treeflags & WF_FIXCAP0x40) == 0)
2023 || ((treeflags & (WF_ALLCAP0x04 | WF_KEEPCAP0x80)) == 0
2024 && ((treeflags & WF_ONECAP0x02) == 0
2025 || (wordflags & WF_ONECAP0x02) != 0));
2026}
2027
2028// Returns true if spell checking is not enabled.
2029static bool_Bool no_spell_checking(win_T *wp)
2030{
2031 if (!wp->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell || *wp->w_s->b_p_spl == NUL'\000'
2032 || GA_EMPTY(&wp->w_s->b_langp)((&wp->w_s->b_langp)->ga_len <= 0)) {
2033 EMSG(_("E756: Spell checking is not enabled"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E756: Spell checking is not enabled"
))));
2034 return true1;
2035 }
2036 return false0;
2037}
2038
2039// Moves to the next spell error.
2040// "curline" is false for "[s", "]s", "[S" and "]S".
2041// "curline" is true to find word under/after cursor in the same line.
2042// For Insert mode completion "dir" is BACKWARD and "curline" is true: move
2043// to after badly spelled word before the cursor.
2044// Return 0 if not found, length of the badly spelled word otherwise.
2045int
2046spell_move_to (
2047 win_T *wp,
2048 int dir, // FORWARD or BACKWARD
2049 bool_Bool allwords, // true for "[s"/"]s", false for "[S"/"]S"
2050 bool_Bool curline,
2051 hlf_T *attrp // return: attributes of bad word or NULL
2052 // (only when "dir" is FORWARD)
2053)
2054{
2055 linenr_T lnum;
2056 pos_T found_pos;
2057 int found_len = 0;
2058 char_u *line;
2059 char_u *p;
2060 char_u *endp;
2061 hlf_T attr;
2062 int len;
2063 int has_syntax = syntax_present(wp);
2064 int col;
2065 bool_Bool can_spell;
2066 char_u *buf = NULL((void*)0);
2067 int buflen = 0;
2068 int skip = 0;
2069 int capcol = -1;
2070 bool_Bool found_one = false0;
2071 bool_Bool wrapped = false0;
2072
2073 if (no_spell_checking(wp))
2074 return 0;
2075
2076 // Start looking for bad word at the start of the line, because we can't
2077 // start halfway a word, we don't know where it starts or ends.
2078 //
2079 // When searching backwards, we continue in the line to find the last
2080 // bad word (in the cursor line: before the cursor).
2081 //
2082 // We concatenate the start of the next line, so that wrapped words work
2083 // (e.g. "et<line-break>cetera"). Doesn't work when searching backwards
2084 // though...
2085 lnum = wp->w_cursor.lnum;
2086 clearpos(&found_pos){(&found_pos)->lnum = 0; (&found_pos)->col = 0;
(&found_pos)->coladd = 0; };
2087
2088 while (!got_int) {
2089 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0);
2090
2091 len = (int)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line));
2092 if (buflen < len + MAXWLEN250 + 2) {
2093 free(buf);
2094 buflen = len + MAXWLEN250 + 2;
2095 buf = xmalloc(buflen);
2096 }
2097
