2098 // In first line check first word for Capital.
2099 if (lnum == 1)
2100 capcol = 0;
2101
2102 // For checking first word with a capital skip white space.
2103 if (capcol == 0)
2104 capcol = (int)(skipwhite(line) - line);
2105 else if (curline && wp == curwin) {
2106 // For spellbadword(): check if first word needs a capital.
2107 col = (int)(skipwhite(line) - line);
2108 if (check_need_cap(lnum, col))
2109 capcol = col;
2110
2111 // Need to get the line again, may have looked at the previous
2112 // one.
2113 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0);
2114 }
2115
2116 // Copy the line into "buf" and append the start of the next line if
2117 // possible.
2118 STRCPY(buf, line)strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(line));
2119 if (lnum < wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count)
2120 spell_cat_line(buf + STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf)),
2121 ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum + 1, FALSE0), MAXWLEN250);
2122
2123 p = buf + skip;
2124 endp = buf + len;
2125 while (p < endp) {
2126 // When searching backward don't search after the cursor. Unless
2127 // we wrapped around the end of the buffer.
2128 if (dir == BACKWARD(-1)
2129 && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum
2130 && !wrapped
2131 && (colnr_T)(p - buf) >= wp->w_cursor.col)
2132 break;
2133
2134 // start of word
2135 attr = HLF_COUNT;
2136 len = spell_check(wp, p, &attr, &capcol, false0);
2137
2138 if (attr != HLF_COUNT) {
2139 // We found a bad word. Check the attribute.
2140 if (allwords || attr == HLF_SPB) {
2141 // When searching forward only accept a bad word after
2142 // the cursor.
2143 if (dir == BACKWARD(-1)
2144 || lnum != wp->w_cursor.lnum
2145 || (lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum
2146 && (wrapped
2147 || (colnr_T)(curline ? p - buf + len
2148 : p - buf)
2149 > wp->w_cursor.col))) {
2150 if (has_syntax) {
2151 col = (int)(p - buf);
2152 (void)syn_get_id(wp, lnum, (colnr_T)col,
2153 FALSE0, &can_spell, FALSE0);
2154 if (!can_spell)
2155 attr = HLF_COUNT;
2156 } else
2157 can_spell = true1;
2158
2159 if (can_spell) {
2160 found_one = true1;
2161 found_pos.lnum = lnum;
2162 found_pos.col = (int)(p - buf);
2163 found_pos.coladd = 0;
2164 if (dir == FORWARD1) {
2165 // No need to search further.
2166 wp->w_cursor = found_pos;
2167 free(buf);
2168 if (attrp != NULL((void*)0))
2169 *attrp = attr;
2170 return len;
2171 } else if (curline)
2172 // Insert mode completion: put cursor after
2173 // the bad word.
2174 found_pos.col += len;
2175 found_len = len;
2176 }
2177 } else
2178 found_one = true1;
2179 }
2180 }
2181
2182 // advance to character after the word
2183 p += len;
2184 capcol -= len;
2185 }
2186
2187 if (dir == BACKWARD(-1) && found_pos.lnum != 0) {
2188 // Use the last match in the line (before the cursor).
2189 wp->w_cursor = found_pos;
2190 free(buf);
2191 return found_len;
2192 }
2193
2194 if (curline)
2195 break; // only check cursor line
2196
2197 // Advance to next line.
2198 if (dir == BACKWARD(-1)) {
2199 // If we are back at the starting line and searched it again there
2200 // is no match, give up.
2201 if (lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum && wrapped)
2202 break;
2203
2204 if (lnum > 1)
2205 --lnum;
2206 else if (!p_ws)
2207 break; // at first line and 'nowrapscan'
2208 else {
2209 // Wrap around to the end of the buffer. May search the
2210 // starting line again and accept the last match.
2211 lnum = wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count;
2212 wrapped = true1;
2213 if (!shortmess(SHM_SEARCH's'))
2214 give_warning((char_u *)_(top_bot_msg)gettext((char *)(top_bot_msg)), true1);
2215 }
2216 capcol = -1;
2217 } else {
2218 if (lnum < wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count)
2219 ++lnum;
2220 else if (!p_ws)
2221 break; // at first line and 'nowrapscan'
2222 else {
2223 // Wrap around to the start of the buffer. May search the
2224 // starting line again and accept the first match.
2225 lnum = 1;
2226 wrapped = true1;
2227 if (!shortmess(SHM_SEARCH's'))
2228 give_warning((char_u *)_(bot_top_msg)gettext((char *)(bot_top_msg)), true1);
2229 }
2230
2231 // If we are back at the starting line and there is no match then
2232 // give up.
2233 if (lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum && (!found_one || wrapped))
2234 break;
2235
2236 // Skip the characters at the start of the next line that were
2237 // included in a match crossing line boundaries.
2238 if (attr == HLF_COUNT)
2239 skip = (int)(p - endp);
2240 else
2241 skip = 0;
2242
2243 // Capcol skips over the inserted space.
2244 --capcol;
2245
2246 // But after empty line check first word in next line
2247 if (*skipwhite(line) == NUL'\000')
2248 capcol = 0;
2249 }
2250
2251 line_breakcheck();
2252 }
2253
2254 free(buf);
2255 return 0;
2256}
2257
2258// For spell checking: concatenate the start of the following line "line" into
2259// "buf", blanking-out special characters. Copy less then "maxlen" bytes.
2260// Keep the blanks at the start of the next line, this is used in win_line()
2261// to skip those bytes if the word was OK.
2262void spell_cat_line(char_u *buf, char_u *line, int maxlen)
2263{
2264 char_u *p;
2265 int n;
2266
2267 p = skipwhite(line);
2268 while (vim_strchr((char_u *)"*#/\"\t", *p) != NULL((void*)0))
2269 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
2270
2271 if (*p != NUL'\000') {
2272 // Only worth concatenating if there is something else than spaces to
2273 // concatenate.
2274 n = (int)(p - line) + 1;
2275 if (n < maxlen - 1) {
2276 memset(buf, ' ', n);
2277 STRLCPY(buf + n, p, maxlen - n)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf + n), (char *)(p), (size_t)(maxlen - n)
);
2278 }
2279 }
2280}
2281
2282// Load word list(s) for "lang" from Vim spell file(s).
2283// "lang" must be the language without the region: e.g., "en".
2284static void spell_load_lang(char_u *lang)
2285{
2286 char_u fname_enc[85];
2287 int r;
2288 spelload_T sl;
2289 int round;
2290
2291 // Copy the language name to pass it to spell_load_cb() as a cookie.
2292 // It's truncated when an error is detected.
2293 STRCPY(sl.sl_lang, lang)strcpy((char *)(sl.sl_lang), (char *)(lang));
2294 sl.sl_slang = NULL((void*)0);
2295 sl.sl_nobreak = false0;
2296
2297 // We may retry when no spell file is found for the language, an
2298 // autocommand may load it then.
2299 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round) {
2300 // Find the first spell file for "lang" in 'runtimepath' and load it.
2301 vim_snprintf((char *)fname_enc, sizeof(fname_enc) - 5,
2302 "spell/%s.%s.spl",
2303 lang, spell_enc());
2304 r = do_in_runtimepath(fname_enc, FALSE0, spell_load_cb, &sl);
2305
2306 if (r == FAIL0 && *sl.sl_lang != NUL'\000') {
2307 // Try loading the ASCII version.
2308 vim_snprintf((char *)fname_enc, sizeof(fname_enc) - 5,
2309 "spell/%s.ascii.spl",
2310 lang);
2311 r = do_in_runtimepath(fname_enc, FALSE0, spell_load_cb, &sl);
2312
2313 if (r == FAIL0 && *sl.sl_lang != NUL'\000' && round == 1
2314 && apply_autocmds(EVENT_SPELLFILEMISSING, lang,
2315 curbuf->b_fname, FALSE0, curbuf))
2316 continue;
2317 break;
2318 }
2319 break;
2320 }
2321
2322 if (r == FAIL0) {
2323 smsg((char_u *)
2324 _("Warning: Cannot find word list \"%s.%s.spl\" or \"%s.ascii.spl\"")gettext((char *)("Warning: Cannot find word list \"%s.%s.spl\" or \"%s.ascii.spl\""
)),
2325 lang, spell_enc(), lang);
2326 } else if (sl.sl_slang != NULL((void*)0)) {
2327 // At least one file was loaded, now load ALL the additions.
2328 STRCPY(fname_enc + STRLEN(fname_enc) - 3, "add.spl")strcpy((char *)(fname_enc + strlen((char *)(fname_enc)) - 3),
(char *)("add.spl"));
2329 do_in_runtimepath(fname_enc, TRUE1, spell_load_cb, &sl);
2330 }
2331}
2332
2333// Return the encoding used for spell checking: Use 'encoding', except that we
2334// use "latin1" for "latin9". And limit to 60 characters (just in case).
2335static char_u *spell_enc(void)
2336{
2337
2338 if (STRLEN(p_enc)strlen((char *)(p_enc)) < 60 && STRCMP(p_enc, "iso-8859-15")strcmp((char *)(p_enc), (char *)("iso-8859-15")) != 0)
2339 return p_enc;
2340 return (char_u *)"latin1";
2341}
2342
2343// Get the name of the .spl file for the internal wordlist into
2344// "fname[MAXPATHL]".
2345static void int_wordlist_spl(char_u *fname)
2346{
2347 vim_snprintf((char *)fname, MAXPATHL4096, SPL_FNAME_TMPL"%s.%s.spl",
2348 int_wordlist, spell_enc());
2349}
2350
2351// Allocate a new slang_T for language "lang". "lang" can be NULL.
2352// Caller must fill "sl_next".
2353static slang_T *slang_alloc(char_u *lang)
2354{
2355 slang_T *lp = xcalloc(1, sizeof(slang_T));
2356
2357 if (lang != NULL((void*)0))
2358 lp->sl_name = vim_strsave(lang);
2359 ga_init(&lp->sl_rep, sizeof(fromto_T), 10);
2360 ga_init(&lp->sl_repsal, sizeof(fromto_T), 10);
2361 lp->sl_compmax = MAXWLEN250;
2362 lp->sl_compsylmax = MAXWLEN250;
2363 hash_init(&lp->sl_wordcount);
2364
2365 return lp;
2366}
2367
2368// Free the contents of an slang_T and the structure itself.
2369static void slang_free(slang_T *lp)
2370{
2371 free(lp->sl_name);
2372 free(lp->sl_fname);
2373 slang_clear(lp);
2374 free(lp);
2375}
2376
2377// Clear an slang_T so that the file can be reloaded.
2378static void slang_clear(slang_T *lp)
2379{
2380 garray_T *gap;
2381 fromto_T *ftp;
2382 salitem_T *smp;
2383 int round;
2384
2385 free(lp->sl_fbyts);
2386 lp->sl_fbyts = NULL((void*)0);
2387 free(lp->sl_kbyts);
2388 lp->sl_kbyts = NULL((void*)0);
2389 free(lp->sl_pbyts);
2390 lp->sl_pbyts = NULL((void*)0);
2391
2392 free(lp->sl_fidxs);
2393 lp->sl_fidxs = NULL((void*)0);
2394 free(lp->sl_kidxs);
2395 lp->sl_kidxs = NULL((void*)0);
2396 free(lp->sl_pidxs);
2397 lp->sl_pidxs = NULL((void*)0);
2398
2399 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round) {
2400 gap = round == 1 ? &lp->sl_rep : &lp->sl_repsal;
2401 while (!GA_EMPTY(gap)((gap)->ga_len <= 0)) {
2402 ftp = &((fromto_T *)gap->ga_data)[--gap->ga_len];
2403 free(ftp->ft_from);
2404 free(ftp->ft_to);
2405 }
2406 ga_clear(gap);
2407 }
2408
2409 gap = &lp->sl_sal;
2410 if (lp->sl_sofo) {
2411 // "ga_len" is set to 1 without adding an item for latin1
2412 if (gap->ga_data != NULL((void*)0))
2413 // SOFOFROM and SOFOTO items: free lists of wide characters.
2414 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
2415 free(((int **)gap->ga_data)[i]);
2416 }
2417 } else
2418 // SAL items: free salitem_T items
2419 while (!GA_EMPTY(gap)((gap)->ga_len <= 0)) {
2420 smp = &((salitem_T *)gap->ga_data)[--gap->ga_len];
2421 free(smp->sm_lead);
2422 // Don't free sm_oneof and sm_rules, they point into sm_lead.
2423 free(smp->sm_to);
2424 free(smp->sm_lead_w);
2425 free(smp->sm_oneof_w);
2426 free(smp->sm_to_w);
2427 }
2428 ga_clear(gap);
2429
2430 for (int i = 0; i < lp->sl_prefixcnt; ++i) {
2431 vim_regfree(lp->sl_prefprog[i]);
2432 }
2433 lp->sl_prefixcnt = 0;
2434 free(lp->sl_prefprog);
2435 lp->sl_prefprog = NULL((void*)0);
2436
2437 free(lp->sl_info);
2438 lp->sl_info = NULL((void*)0);
2439
2440 free(lp->sl_midword);
2441 lp->sl_midword = NULL((void*)0);
2442
2443 vim_regfree(lp->sl_compprog);
2444 free(lp->sl_comprules);
2445 free(lp->sl_compstartflags);
2446 free(lp->sl_compallflags);
2447 lp->sl_compprog = NULL((void*)0);
2448 lp->sl_comprules = NULL((void*)0);
2449 lp->sl_compstartflags = NULL((void*)0);
2450 lp->sl_compallflags = NULL((void*)0);
2451
2452 free(lp->sl_syllable);
2453 lp->sl_syllable = NULL((void*)0);
2454 ga_clear(&lp->sl_syl_items);
2455
2456 ga_clear_strings(&lp->sl_comppat);
2457
2458 hash_clear_all(&lp->sl_wordcount, WC_KEY_OFF(unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word - (char_u *)&dumwc));
2459 hash_init(&lp->sl_wordcount);
2460
2461 hash_clear_all(&lp->sl_map_hash, 0);
2462
2463 // Clear info from .sug file.
2464 slang_clear_sug(lp);
2465
2466 lp->sl_compmax = MAXWLEN250;
2467 lp->sl_compminlen = 0;
2468 lp->sl_compsylmax = MAXWLEN250;
2469 lp->sl_regions[0] = NUL'\000';
2470}
2471
2472// Clear the info from the .sug file in "lp".
2473static void slang_clear_sug(slang_T *lp)
2474{
2475 free(lp->sl_sbyts);
2476 lp->sl_sbyts = NULL((void*)0);
2477 free(lp->sl_sidxs);
2478 lp->sl_sidxs = NULL((void*)0);
2479 close_spellbuf(lp->sl_sugbuf);
2480 lp->sl_sugbuf = NULL((void*)0);
2481 lp->sl_sugloaded = false0;
2482 lp->sl_sugtime = 0;
2483}
2484
2485// Load one spell file and store the info into a slang_T.
2486// Invoked through do_in_runtimepath().
2487static void spell_load_cb(char_u *fname, void *cookie)
2488{
2489 spelload_T *slp = (spelload_T *)cookie;
2490 slang_T *slang;
2491
2492 slang = spell_load_file(fname, slp->sl_lang, NULL((void*)0), false0);
2493 if (slang != NULL((void*)0)) {
2494 // When a previously loaded file has NOBREAK also use it for the
2495 // ".add" files.
2496 if (slp->sl_nobreak && slang->sl_add)
2497 slang->sl_nobreak = true1;
2498 else if (slang->sl_nobreak)
2499 slp->sl_nobreak = true1;
2500
2501 slp->sl_slang = slang;
2502 }
2503}
2504
2505// Load one spell file and store the info into a slang_T.
2506//
2507// This is invoked in three ways:
2508// - From spell_load_cb() to load a spell file for the first time. "lang" is
2509// the language name, "old_lp" is NULL. Will allocate an slang_T.
2510// - To reload a spell file that was changed. "lang" is NULL and "old_lp"
2511// points to the existing slang_T.
2512// - Just after writing a .spl file; it's read back to produce the .sug file.
2513// "old_lp" is NULL and "lang" is NULL. Will allocate an slang_T.
2514//
2515// Returns the slang_T the spell file was loaded into. NULL for error.
2516static slang_T *
2517spell_load_file (
2518 char_u *fname,
2519 char_u *lang,
2520 slang_T *old_lp,
2521 bool_Bool silent // no error if file doesn't exist
2522)
2523{
2524 FILE *fd;
2525 char_u buf[VIMSPELLMAGICL8];
2526 char_u *p;
2527 int i;
2528 int n;
2529 int len;
2530 char_u *save_sourcing_name = sourcing_name;
2531 linenr_T save_sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum;
2532 slang_T *lp = NULL((void*)0);
2533 int c = 0;
2534 int res;
2535
2536 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r"));
2537 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
2538 if (!silent)
2539 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
2540 else if (p_verbose > 2) {
2541 verbose_enter();
2542 smsg((char_u *)e_notopen, fname);
2543 verbose_leave();
2544 }
2545 goto endFAIL;
2546 }
2547 if (p_verbose > 2) {
2548 verbose_enter();
2549 smsg((char_u *)_("Reading spell file \"%s\"")gettext((char *)("Reading spell file \"%s\"")), fname);
2550 verbose_leave();
2551 }
2552
2553 if (old_lp == NULL((void*)0)) {
2554 lp = slang_alloc(lang);
2555
2556 // Remember the file name, used to reload the file when it's updated.
2557 lp->sl_fname = vim_strsave(fname);
2558
2559 // Check for .add.spl.
2560 lp->sl_add = strstr((char *)path_tail(fname), SPL_FNAME_ADD".add.") != NULL((void*)0);
2561 } else
2562 lp = old_lp;
2563
2564 // Set sourcing_name, so that error messages mention the file name.
2565 sourcing_name = fname;
2566 sourcing_lnum = 0;
2567
2568 // <HEADER>: <fileID>
2569 for (i = 0; i < VIMSPELLMAGICL8; ++i)
2570 buf[i] = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <fileID>
2571 if (STRNCMP(buf, VIMSPELLMAGIC, VIMSPELLMAGICL)strncmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("VIMspell"), (size_t)(8)) != 0) {
2572 EMSG(_("E757: This does not look like a spell file"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E757: This does not look like a spell file"
))));
2573 goto endFAIL;
2574 }
2575 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <versionnr>
2576 if (c < VIMSPELLVERSION50) {
2577 EMSG(_("E771: Old spell file, needs to be updated"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E771: Old spell file, needs to be updated"
))));
2578 goto endFAIL;
2579 } else if (c > VIMSPELLVERSION50) {
2580 EMSG(_("E772: Spell file is for newer version of Vim"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E772: Spell file is for newer version of Vim"
))));
2581 goto endFAIL;
2582 }
2583
2584
2585 // <SECTIONS>: <section> ... <sectionend>
2586 // <section>: <sectionID> <sectionflags> <sectionlen> (section contents)
2587 for (;; ) {
2588 n = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <sectionID> or <sectionend>
2589 if (n == SN_END255)
2590 break;
2591 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <sectionflags>
2592 len = get4c(fd); // <sectionlen>
2593 if (len < 0)
2594 goto truncerr;
2595
2596 res = 0;
2597 switch (n) {
2598 case SN_INFO15:
2599 lp->sl_info = READ_STRING(fd, len)(char_u *)read_string((fd), (size_t)(len)); // <infotext>
2600 if (lp->sl_info == NULL((void*)0))
2601 goto endFAIL;
2602 break;
2603
2604 case SN_REGION0:
2605 res = read_region_section(fd, lp, len);
2606 break;
2607
2608 case SN_CHARFLAGS1:
2609 res = read_charflags_section(fd);
2610 break;
2611
2612 case SN_MIDWORD2:
2613 lp->sl_midword = READ_STRING(fd, len)(char_u *)read_string((fd), (size_t)(len)); // <midword>
2614 if (lp->sl_midword == NULL((void*)0))
2615 goto endFAIL;
2616 break;
2617
2618 case SN_PREFCOND3:
2619 res = read_prefcond_section(fd, lp);
2620 break;
2621
2622 case SN_REP4:
2623 res = read_rep_section(fd, &lp->sl_rep, lp->sl_rep_first);
2624 break;
2625
2626 case SN_REPSAL12:
2627 res = read_rep_section(fd, &lp->sl_repsal, lp->sl_repsal_first);
2628 break;
2629
2630 case SN_SAL5:
2631 res = read_sal_section(fd, lp);
2632 break;
2633
2634 case SN_SOFO6:
2635 res = read_sofo_section(fd, lp);
2636 break;
2637
2638 case SN_MAP7:
2639 p = READ_STRING(fd, len)(char_u *)read_string((fd), (size_t)(len)); // <mapstr>
2640 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
2641 goto endFAIL;
2642 set_map_str(lp, p);
2643 free(p);
2644 break;
2645
2646 case SN_WORDS13:
2647 res = read_words_section(fd, lp, len);
2648 break;
2649
2650 case SN_SUGFILE11:
2651 lp->sl_sugtime = get8ctime(fd); // <timestamp>
2652 break;
2653
2654 case SN_NOSPLITSUGS14:
2655 lp->sl_nosplitsugs = true1; // <timestamp>
2656 break;
2657
2658 case SN_COMPOUND8:
2659 res = read_compound(fd, lp, len);
2660 break;
2661
2662 case SN_NOBREAK10:
2663 lp->sl_nobreak = true1;
2664 break;
2665
2666 case SN_SYLLABLE9:
2667 lp->sl_syllable = READ_STRING(fd, len)(char_u *)read_string((fd), (size_t)(len)); // <syllable>
2668 if (lp->sl_syllable == NULL((void*)0))
2669 goto endFAIL;
2670 if (init_syl_tab(lp) == FAIL0)
2671 goto endFAIL;
2672 break;
2673
2674 default:
2675 // Unsupported section. When it's required give an error
2676 // message. When it's not required skip the contents.
2677 if (c & SNF_REQUIRED1) {
2678 EMSG(_("E770: Unsupported section in spell file"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E770: Unsupported section in spell file"
))));
2679 goto endFAIL;
2680 }
2681 while (--len >= 0)
2682 if (getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd) < 0)
2683 goto truncerr;
2684 break;
2685 }
2686someerror:
2687 if (res == SP_FORMERROR-2) {
2688 EMSG(_(e_format))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_format))));
2689 goto endFAIL;
2690 }
2691 if (res == SP_TRUNCERROR-1) {
2692truncerr:
2693 EMSG(_(e_spell_trunc))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_spell_trunc))));
2694 goto endFAIL;
2695 }
2696 if (res == SP_OTHERERROR-3)
2697 goto endFAIL;
2698 }
2699
2700 // <LWORDTREE>
2701 res = spell_read_tree(fd, &lp->sl_fbyts, &lp->sl_fidxs, false0, 0);
2702 if (res != 0)
2703 goto someerror;
2704
2705 // <KWORDTREE>
2706 res = spell_read_tree(fd, &lp->sl_kbyts, &lp->sl_kidxs, false0, 0);
2707 if (res != 0)
2708 goto someerror;
2709
2710 // <PREFIXTREE>
2711 res = spell_read_tree(fd, &lp->sl_pbyts, &lp->sl_pidxs, true1,
2712 lp->sl_prefixcnt);
2713 if (res != 0)
2714 goto someerror;
2715
2716 // For a new file link it in the list of spell files.
2717 if (old_lp == NULL((void*)0) && lang != NULL((void*)0)) {
2718 lp->sl_next = first_lang;
2719 first_lang = lp;
2720 }
2721
2722 goto endOK;
2723
2724endFAIL:
2725 if (lang != NULL((void*)0))
2726 // truncating the name signals the error to spell_load_lang()
2727 *lang = NUL'\000';
2728 if (lp != NULL((void*)0) && old_lp == NULL((void*)0))
2729 slang_free(lp);
2730 lp = NULL((void*)0);
2731
2732endOK:
2733 if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
2734 fclose(fd);
2735 sourcing_name = save_sourcing_name;
2736 sourcing_lnum = save_sourcing_lnum;
2737
2738 return lp;
2739}
2740
2741// Read a length field from "fd" in "cnt_bytes" bytes.
2742// Allocate memory, read the string into it and add a NUL at the end.
2743// Returns NULL when the count is zero.
2744// Sets "*cntp" to SP_*ERROR when there is an error, length of the result
2745// otherwise.
2746static char_u *read_cnt_string(FILE *fd, int cnt_bytes, int *cntp)
2747{
2748 int cnt = 0;
2749 int i;
2750 char_u *str;
2751
2752 // read the length bytes, MSB first
2753 for (i = 0; i < cnt_bytes; ++i)
2754 cnt = (cnt << 8) + getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd);
2755 if (cnt < 0) {
2756 *cntp = SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
2757 return NULL((void*)0);
2758 }
2759 *cntp = cnt;
2760 if (cnt == 0)
2761 return NULL((void*)0); // nothing to read, return NULL
2762
2763 str = READ_STRING(fd, cnt)(char_u *)read_string((fd), (size_t)(cnt));
2764 if (str == NULL((void*)0))
2765 *cntp = SP_OTHERERROR-3;
2766 return str;
2767}
2768
2769// Read SN_REGION: <regionname> ...
2770// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
2771static int read_region_section(FILE *fd, slang_T *lp, int len)
2772{
2773 int i;
2774
2775 if (len > 16)
2776 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
2777 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
2778 lp->sl_regions[i] = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <regionname>
2779 lp->sl_regions[len] = NUL'\000';
2780 return 0;
2781}
2782
2783// Read SN_CHARFLAGS section: <charflagslen> <charflags>
2784// <folcharslen> <folchars>
2785// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
2786static int read_charflags_section(FILE *fd)
2787{
2788 char_u *flags;
2789 char_u *fol;
2790 int flagslen, follen;
2791
2792 // <charflagslen> <charflags>
2793 flags = read_cnt_string(fd, 1, &flagslen);
2794 if (flagslen < 0)
2795 return flagslen;
2796
2797 // <folcharslen> <folchars>
2798 fol = read_cnt_string(fd, 2, &follen);
2799 if (follen < 0) {
2800 free(flags);
2801 return follen;
2802 }
2803
2804 // Set the word-char flags and fill SPELL_ISUPPER() table.
2805 if (flags != NULL((void*)0) && fol != NULL((void*)0))
2806 set_spell_charflags(flags, flagslen, fol);
2807
2808 free(flags);
2809 free(fol);
2810
2811 // When <charflagslen> is zero then <fcharlen> must also be zero.
2812 if ((flags == NULL((void*)0)) != (fol == NULL((void*)0)))
2813 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
2814 return 0;
2815}
2816
2817// Read SN_PREFCOND section.
2818// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
2819static int read_prefcond_section(FILE *fd, slang_T *lp)
2820{
2821 int cnt;
2822 int i;
2823 int n;
2824 char_u *p;
2825 char_u buf[MAXWLEN250 + 1];
2826
2827 // <prefcondcnt> <prefcond> ...
2828 cnt = get2c(fd); // <prefcondcnt>
2829 if (cnt <= 0)
2830 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
2831
2832 lp->sl_prefprog = xcalloc(cnt, sizeof(regprog_T *));
2833 lp->sl_prefixcnt = cnt;
2834
2835 for (i = 0; i < cnt; ++i) {
2836 // <prefcond> : <condlen> <condstr>
2837 n = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <condlen>
2838 if (n < 0 || n >= MAXWLEN250)
2839 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
2840
2841 // When <condlen> is zero we have an empty condition. Otherwise
2842 // compile the regexp program used to check for the condition.
2843 if (n > 0) {
2844 buf[0] = '^'; // always match at one position only
2845 p = buf + 1;
2846 while (n-- > 0)
2847 *p++ = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <condstr>
2848 *p = NUL'\000';
2849 lp->sl_prefprog[i] = vim_regcomp(buf, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
2850 }
2851 }
2852 return 0;
2853}
2854
2855// Read REP or REPSAL items section from "fd": <repcount> <rep> ...
2856// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
2857static int read_rep_section(FILE *fd, garray_T *gap, short *first)
2858{
2859 int cnt;
2860 fromto_T *ftp;
2861
2862 cnt = get2c(fd); // <repcount>
2863 if (cnt < 0)
2864 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
2865
2866 ga_grow(gap, cnt);
2867
2868 // <rep> : <repfromlen> <repfrom> <reptolen> <repto>
2869 for (; gap->ga_len < cnt; ++gap->ga_len) {
2870 int c;
2871 ftp = &((fromto_T *)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len];
2872 ftp->ft_from = read_cnt_string(fd, 1, &c);
2873 if (c < 0)
2874 return c;
2875 if (c == 0)
2876 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
2877 ftp->ft_to = read_cnt_string(fd, 1, &c);
2878 if (c <= 0) {
2879 free(ftp->ft_from);
2880 if (c < 0)
2881 return c;
2882 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
2883 }
2884 }
2885
2886 // Fill the first-index table.
2887 for (int i = 0; i < 256; ++i) {
2888 first[i] = -1;
2889 }
2890 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
2891 ftp = &((fromto_T *)gap->ga_data)[i];
2892 if (first[*ftp->ft_from] == -1)
2893 first[*ftp->ft_from] = i;
2894 }
2895 return 0;
2896}
2897
2898// Read SN_SAL section: <salflags> <salcount> <sal> ...
2899// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
2900static int read_sal_section(FILE *fd, slang_T *slang)
2901{
2902 int i;
2903 int cnt;
2904 garray_T *gap;
2905 salitem_T *smp;
2906 int ccnt;
2907 char_u *p;
2908 int c = NUL'\000';
2909
2910 slang->sl_sofo = false0;
2911
2912 i = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <salflags>
2913 if (i & SAL_F0LLOWUP1)
2914 slang->sl_followup = true1;
2915 if (i & SAL_COLLAPSE2)
2916 slang->sl_collapse = true1;
2917 if (i & SAL_REM_ACCENTS4)
2918 slang->sl_rem_accents = true1;
2919
2920 cnt = get2c(fd); // <salcount>
2921 if (cnt < 0)
2922 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
2923
2924 gap = &slang->sl_sal;
2925 ga_init(gap, sizeof(salitem_T), 10);
2926 ga_grow(gap, cnt + 1);
2927
2928 // <sal> : <salfromlen> <salfrom> <saltolen> <salto>
2929 for (; gap->ga_len < cnt; ++gap->ga_len) {
2930 smp = &((salitem_T *)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len];
2931 ccnt = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <salfromlen>
2932 if (ccnt < 0)
2933 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
2934 p = xmalloc(ccnt + 2);
2935 smp->sm_lead = p;
2936
2937 // Read up to the first special char into sm_lead.
2938 for (i = 0; i < ccnt; ++i) {
2939 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <salfrom>
2940 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"0123456789(-<^$", c) != NULL((void*)0))
2941 break;
2942 *p++ = c;
2943 }
2944 smp->sm_leadlen = (int)(p - smp->sm_lead);
2945 *p++ = NUL'\000';
2946
2947 // Put (abc) chars in sm_oneof, if any.
2948 if (c == '(') {
2949 smp->sm_oneof = p;
2950 for (++i; i < ccnt; ++i) {
2951 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <salfrom>
2952 if (c == ')')
2953 break;
2954 *p++ = c;
2955 }
2956 *p++ = NUL'\000';
2957 if (++i < ccnt)
2958 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd);
2959 } else
2960 smp->sm_oneof = NULL((void*)0);
2961
2962 // Any following chars go in sm_rules.
2963 smp->sm_rules = p;
2964 if (i < ccnt)
2965 // store the char we got while checking for end of sm_lead
2966 *p++ = c;
2967 for (++i; i < ccnt; ++i)
2968 *p++ = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <salfrom>
2969 *p++ = NUL'\000';
2970
2971 // <saltolen> <salto>
2972 smp->sm_to = read_cnt_string(fd, 1, &ccnt);
2973 if (ccnt < 0) {
2974 free(smp->sm_lead);
2975 return ccnt;
2976 }
2977
2978 if (has_mbyte) {
2979 // convert the multi-byte strings to wide char strings
2980 smp->sm_lead_w = mb_str2wide(smp->sm_lead);
2981 smp->sm_leadlen = mb_charlen(smp->sm_lead);
2982 if (smp->sm_oneof == NULL((void*)0))
2983 smp->sm_oneof_w = NULL((void*)0);
2984 else
2985 smp->sm_oneof_w = mb_str2wide(smp->sm_oneof);
2986 if (smp->sm_to == NULL((void*)0))
2987 smp->sm_to_w = NULL((void*)0);
2988 else
2989 smp->sm_to_w = mb_str2wide(smp->sm_to);
2990 }
2991 }
2992
2993 if (!GA_EMPTY(gap)((gap)->ga_len <= 0)) {
2994 // Add one extra entry to mark the end with an empty sm_lead. Avoids
2995 // that we need to check the index every time.
2996 smp = &((salitem_T *)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len];
2997 p = xmalloc(1);
2998 p[0] = NUL'\000';
2999 smp->sm_lead = p;
3000 smp->sm_leadlen = 0;
3001 smp->sm_oneof = NULL((void*)0);
3002 smp->sm_rules = p;
3003 smp->sm_to = NULL((void*)0);
3004 if (has_mbyte) {
3005 smp->sm_lead_w = mb_str2wide(smp->sm_lead);
3006 smp->sm_leadlen = 0;
3007 smp->sm_oneof_w = NULL((void*)0);
3008 smp->sm_to_w = NULL((void*)0);
3009 }
3010 ++gap->ga_len;
3011 }
3012
3013 // Fill the first-index table.
3014 set_sal_first(slang);
3015
3016 return 0;
3017}
3018
3019// Read SN_WORDS: <word> ...
3020// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
3021static int read_words_section(FILE *fd, slang_T *lp, int len)
3022{
3023 int done = 0;
3024 int i;
3025 int c;
3026 char_u word[MAXWLEN250];
3027
3028 while (done < len) {
3029 // Read one word at a time.
3030 for (i = 0;; ++i) {
3031 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd);
3032 if (c == EOF(-1))
3033 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
3034 word[i] = c;
3035 if (word[i] == NUL'\000')
3036 break;
3037 if (i == MAXWLEN250 - 1)
3038 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3039 }
3040
3041 // Init the count to 10.
3042 count_common_word(lp, word, -1, 10);
3043 done += i + 1;
3044 }
3045 return 0;
3046}
3047
3048// Add a word to the hashtable of common words.
3049// If it's already there then the counter is increased.
3050static void
3051count_common_word (
3052 slang_T *lp,
3053 char_u *word,
3054 int len, // word length, -1 for upto NUL
3055 int count // 1 to count once, 10 to init
3056)
3057{
3058 hash_T hash;
3059 hashitem_T *hi;
3060 wordcount_T *wc;
3061 char_u buf[MAXWLEN250];
3062 char_u *p;
3063
3064 if (len == -1)
3065 p = word;
3066 else {
3067 STRLCPY(buf, word, len + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(word), (size_t)(len + 1));
3068 p = buf;
3069 }
3070
3071 hash = hash_hash(p);
3072 hi = hash_lookup(&lp->sl_wordcount, p, hash);
3073 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3074 wc = xmalloc(sizeof(wordcount_T) + STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)));
3075 STRCPY(wc->wc_word, p)strcpy((char *)(wc->wc_word), (char *)(p));
3076 wc->wc_count = count;
3077 hash_add_item(&lp->sl_wordcount, hi, wc->wc_word, hash);
3078 } else {
3079 wc = HI2WC(hi)((wordcount_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word -
(char_u *)&dumwc)));
3080 if ((wc->wc_count += count) < (unsigned)count) // check for overflow
3081 wc->wc_count = MAXWORDCOUNT0xffff;
3082 }
3083}
3084
3085// Adjust the score of common words.
3086static int
3087score_wordcount_adj (
3088 slang_T *slang,
3089 int score,
3090 char_u *word,
3091 bool_Bool split // word was split, less bonus
3092)
3093{
3094 hashitem_T *hi;
3095 wordcount_T *wc;
3096 int bonus;
3097 int newscore;
3098
3099 hi = hash_find(&slang->sl_wordcount, word);
3100 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3101 wc = HI2WC(hi)((wordcount_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word -
(char_u *)&dumwc)));
3102 if (wc->wc_count < SCORE_THRES210)
3103 bonus = SCORE_COMMON130;
3104 else if (wc->wc_count < SCORE_THRES3100)
3105 bonus = SCORE_COMMON240;
3106 else
3107 bonus = SCORE_COMMON350;
3108 if (split)
3109 newscore = score - bonus / 2;
3110 else
3111 newscore = score - bonus;
3112 if (newscore < 0)
3113 return 0;
3114 return newscore;
3115 }
3116 return score;
3117}
3118
3119// SN_SOFO: <sofofromlen> <sofofrom> <sofotolen> <sofoto>
3120// Return SP_*ERROR flags.
3121static int read_sofo_section(FILE *fd, slang_T *slang)
3122{
3123 int cnt;
3124 char_u *from, *to;
3125 int res;
3126
3127 slang->sl_sofo = true1;
3128
3129 // <sofofromlen> <sofofrom>
3130 from = read_cnt_string(fd, 2, &cnt);
3131 if (cnt < 0)
3132 return cnt;
3133
3134 // <sofotolen> <sofoto>
3135 to = read_cnt_string(fd, 2, &cnt);
3136 if (cnt < 0) {
3137 free(from);
3138 return cnt;
3139 }
3140
3141 // Store the info in slang->sl_sal and/or slang->sl_sal_first.
3142 if (from != NULL((void*)0) && to != NULL((void*)0))
3143 res = set_sofo(slang, from, to);
3144 else if (from != NULL((void*)0) || to != NULL((void*)0))
3145 res = SP_FORMERROR-2; // only one of two strings is an error
3146 else
3147 res = 0;
3148
3149 free(from);
3150 free(to);
3151 return res;
3152}
3153
3154// Read the compound section from the .spl file:
3155// <compmax> <compminlen> <compsylmax> <compoptions> <compflags>
3156// Returns SP_*ERROR flags.
3157static int read_compound(FILE *fd, slang_T *slang, int len)
3158{
3159 int todo = len;
3160 int c;
3161 int atstart;
3162 char_u *pat;
3163 char_u *pp;
3164 char_u *cp;
3165 char_u *ap;
3166 char_u *crp;
3167 int cnt;
3168 garray_T *gap;
3169
3170 if (todo < 2)
3171 return SP_FORMERROR-2; // need at least two bytes
3172
3173 --todo;
3174 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <compmax>
3175 if (c < 2)
3176 c = MAXWLEN250;
3177 slang->sl_compmax = c;
3178
3179 --todo;
3180 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <compminlen>
3181 if (c < 1)
3182 c = 0;
3183 slang->sl_compminlen = c;
3184
3185 --todo;
3186 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <compsylmax>
3187 if (c < 1)
3188 c = MAXWLEN250;
3189 slang->sl_compsylmax = c;
3190
3191 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <compoptions>
3192 if (c != 0)
3193 ungetc(c, fd); // be backwards compatible with Vim 7.0b
3194 else {
3195 --todo;
3196 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // only use the lower byte for now
3197 --todo;
3198 slang->sl_compoptions = c;
3199
3200 gap = &slang->sl_comppat;
3201 c = get2c(fd); // <comppatcount>
3202 todo -= 2;
3203 ga_init(gap, sizeof(char_u *), c);
3204 ga_grow(gap, c);
3205 while (--c >= 0) {
3206 ((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[gap->ga_len++] =
3207 read_cnt_string(fd, 1, &cnt);
3208 // <comppatlen> <comppattext>
3209 if (cnt < 0)
3210 return cnt;
3211 todo -= cnt + 1;
3212 }
3213 }
3214 if (todo < 0)
3215 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3216
3217 // Turn the COMPOUNDRULE items into a regexp pattern:
3218 // "a[bc]/a*b+" -> "^\(a[bc]\|a*b\+\)$".
3219 // Inserting backslashes may double the length, "^\(\)$<Nul>" is 7 bytes.
3220 // Conversion to utf-8 may double the size.
3221 c = todo * 2 + 7;
3222 if (enc_utf8)
3223 c += todo * 2;
3224 pat = xmalloc(c);
3225
3226 // We also need a list of all flags that can appear at the start and one
3227 // for all flags.
3228 cp = xmalloc(todo + 1);
3229 slang->sl_compstartflags = cp;
3230 *cp = NUL'\000';
3231
3232 ap = xmalloc(todo + 1);
3233 slang->sl_compallflags = ap;
3234 *ap = NUL'\000';
3235
3236 // And a list of all patterns in their original form, for checking whether
3237 // compounding may work in match_compoundrule(). This is freed when we
3238 // encounter a wildcard, the check doesn't work then.
3239 crp = xmalloc(todo + 1);
3240 slang->sl_comprules = crp;
3241
3242 pp = pat;
3243 *pp++ = '^';
3244 *pp++ = '\\';
3245 *pp++ = '(';
3246
3247 atstart = 1;
3248 while (todo-- > 0) {
3249 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <compflags>
3250 if (c == EOF(-1)) {
3251 free(pat);
3252 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
3253 }
3254
3255 // Add all flags to "sl_compallflags".
3256 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"?*+[]/", c) == NULL((void*)0)
3257 && !byte_in_str(slang->sl_compallflags, c)) {
3258 *ap++ = c;
3259 *ap = NUL'\000';
3260 }
3261
3262 if (atstart != 0) {
3263 // At start of item: copy flags to "sl_compstartflags". For a
3264 // [abc] item set "atstart" to 2 and copy up to the ']'.
3265 if (c == '[')
3266 atstart = 2;
3267 else if (c == ']')
3268 atstart = 0;
3269 else {
3270 if (!byte_in_str(slang->sl_compstartflags, c)) {
3271 *cp++ = c;
3272 *cp = NUL'\000';
3273 }
3274 if (atstart == 1)
3275 atstart = 0;
3276 }
3277 }
3278
3279 // Copy flag to "sl_comprules", unless we run into a wildcard.
3280 if (crp != NULL((void*)0)) {
3281 if (c == '?' || c == '+' || c == '*') {
3282 free(slang->sl_comprules);
3283 slang->sl_comprules = NULL((void*)0);
3284 crp = NULL((void*)0);
3285 } else
3286 *crp++ = c;
3287 }
3288
3289 if (c == '/') { // slash separates two items
3290 *pp++ = '\\';
3291 *pp++ = '|';
3292 atstart = 1;
3293 } else { // normal char, "[abc]" and '*' are copied as-is
3294 if (c == '?' || c == '+' || c == '~')
3295 *pp++ = '\\'; // "a?" becomes "a\?", "a+" becomes "a\+"
3296 if (enc_utf8)
3297 pp += mb_char2bytes(c, pp);
3298 else
3299 *pp++ = c;
3300 }
3301 }
3302
3303 *pp++ = '\\';
3304 *pp++ = ')';
3305 *pp++ = '$';
3306 *pp = NUL'\000';
3307
3308 if (crp != NULL((void*)0))
3309 *crp = NUL'\000';
3310
3311 slang->sl_compprog = vim_regcomp(pat, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2 + RE_STRICT4);
3312 free(pat);
3313 if (slang->sl_compprog == NULL((void*)0))
3314 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3315
3316 return 0;
3317}
3318
3319// Returns true if byte "n" appears in "str".
3320// Like strchr() but independent of locale.
3321static bool_Bool byte_in_str(char_u *str, int n)
3322{
3323 char_u *p;
3324
3325 for (p = str; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p)
3326 if (*p == n)
3327 return true1;
3328 return false0;
3329}
3330
3331// Truncate "slang->sl_syllable" at the first slash and put the following items
3332// in "slang->sl_syl_items".
3333static int init_syl_tab(slang_T *slang)
3334{
3335 char_u *p;
3336 char_u *s;
3337 int l;
3338
3339 ga_init(&slang->sl_syl_items, sizeof(syl_item_T), 4);
3340 p = vim_strchr(slang->sl_syllable, '/');
3341 while (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
3342 *p++ = NUL'\000';
3343 if (*p == NUL'\000') // trailing slash
3344 break;
3345 s = p;
3346 p = vim_strchr(p, '/');
3347 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
3348 l = (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
3349 else
3350 l = (int)(p - s);
3351 if (l >= SY_MAXLEN30)
3352 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3353
3354 syl_item_T *syl = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(syl_item_T, &slang->sl_syl_items)ga_append_via_ptr(&slang->sl_syl_items, sizeof(syl_item_T
));
3355 STRLCPY(syl->sy_chars, s, l + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(syl->sy_chars), (char *)(s), (size_t)(l +
1));
3356 syl->sy_len = l;
3357 }
3358 return OK1;
3359}
3360
3361// Count the number of syllables in "word".
3362// When "word" contains spaces the syllables after the last space are counted.
3363// Returns zero if syllables are not defines.
3364static int count_syllables(slang_T *slang, char_u *word)
3365{
3366 int cnt = 0;
3367 bool_Bool skip = false0;
3368 char_u *p;
3369 int len;
3370 syl_item_T *syl;
3371 int c;
3372
3373 if (slang->sl_syllable == NULL((void*)0))
3374 return 0;
3375
3376 for (p = word; *p != NUL'\000'; p += len) {
3377 // When running into a space reset counter.
3378 if (*p == ' ') {
3379 len = 1;
3380 cnt = 0;
3381 continue;
3382 }
3383
3384 // Find longest match of syllable items.
3385 len = 0;
3386 for (int i = 0; i < slang->sl_syl_items.ga_len; ++i) {
3387 syl = ((syl_item_T *)slang->sl_syl_items.ga_data) + i;
3388 if (syl->sy_len > len
3389 && STRNCMP(p, syl->sy_chars, syl->sy_len)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)(syl->sy_chars), (size_t)(syl
->sy_len)) == 0)
3390 len = syl->sy_len;
3391 }
3392 if (len != 0) { // found a match, count syllable
3393 ++cnt;
3394 skip = false0;
3395 } else {
3396 // No recognized syllable item, at least a syllable char then?
3397 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
3398 len = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
3399 if (vim_strchr(slang->sl_syllable, c) == NULL((void*)0))
3400 skip = false0; // No, search for next syllable
3401 else if (!skip) {
3402 ++cnt; // Yes, count it
3403 skip = true1; // don't count following syllable chars
3404 }
3405 }
3406 }
3407 return cnt;
3408}
3409
3410// Set the SOFOFROM and SOFOTO items in language "lp".
3411// Returns SP_*ERROR flags when there is something wrong.
3412static int set_sofo(slang_T *lp, char_u *from, char_u *to)
3413{
3414 int i;
3415
3416 garray_T *gap;
3417 char_u *s;
3418 char_u *p;
3419 int c;
3420 int *inp;
3421
3422 if (has_mbyte) {
3423 // Use "sl_sal" as an array with 256 pointers to a list of wide
3424 // characters. The index is the low byte of the character.
3425 // The list contains from-to pairs with a terminating NUL.
3426 // sl_sal_first[] is used for latin1 "from" characters.
3427 gap = &lp->sl_sal;
3428 ga_init(gap, sizeof(int *), 1);
3429 ga_grow(gap, 256);
3430 memset(gap->ga_data, 0, sizeof(int *) * 256);
3431 gap->ga_len = 256;
3432
3433 // First count the number of items for each list. Temporarily use
3434 // sl_sal_first[] for this.
3435 for (p = from, s = to; *p != NUL'\000' && *s != NUL'\000'; ) {
3436 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
3437 mb_cptr_adv(s)s += enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(s) : has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s)
: 1;
3438 if (c >= 256)
3439 ++lp->sl_sal_first[c & 0xff];
3440 }
3441 if (*p != NUL'\000' || *s != NUL'\000') // lengths differ
3442 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3443
3444 // Allocate the lists.
3445 for (i = 0; i < 256; ++i)
3446 if (lp->sl_sal_first[i] > 0) {
3447 p = xmalloc(sizeof(int) * (lp->sl_sal_first[i] * 2 + 1));
3448 ((int **)gap->ga_data)[i] = (int *)p;
3449 *(int *)p = 0;
3450 }
3451
3452 // Put the characters up to 255 in sl_sal_first[] the rest in a sl_sal
3453 // list.
3454 memset(lp->sl_sal_first, 0, sizeof(salfirst_T) * 256);
3455 for (p = from, s = to; *p != NUL'\000' && *s != NUL'\000'; ) {
3456 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
3457 i = mb_cptr2char_adv(&s);
3458 if (c >= 256) {
3459 // Append the from-to chars at the end of the list with
3460 // the low byte.
3461 inp = ((int **)gap->ga_data)[c & 0xff];
3462 while (*inp != 0)
3463 ++inp;
3464 *inp++ = c; // from char
3465 *inp++ = i; // to char
3466 *inp++ = NUL'\000'; // NUL at the end
3467 } else
3468 // mapping byte to char is done in sl_sal_first[]
3469 lp->sl_sal_first[c] = i;
3470 }
3471 } else {
3472 // mapping bytes to bytes is done in sl_sal_first[]
3473 if (STRLEN(from)strlen((char *)(from)) != STRLEN(to)strlen((char *)(to)))
3474 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3475
3476 for (i = 0; to[i] != NUL'\000'; ++i)
3477 lp->sl_sal_first[from[i]] = to[i];
3478 lp->sl_sal.ga_len = 1; // indicates we have soundfolding
3479 }
3480
3481 return 0;
3482}
3483
3484// Fill the first-index table for "lp".
3485static void set_sal_first(slang_T *lp)
3486{
3487 salfirst_T *sfirst;
3488 salitem_T *smp;
3489 int c;
3490 garray_T *gap = &lp->sl_sal;
3491
3492 sfirst = lp->sl_sal_first;
3493 for (int i = 0; i < 256; ++i) {
3494 sfirst[i] = -1;
3495 }
3496 smp = (salitem_T *)gap->ga_data;
3497 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
3498 if (has_mbyte)
3499 // Use the lowest byte of the first character. For latin1 it's
3500 // the character, for other encodings it should differ for most
3501 // characters.
3502 c = *smp[i].sm_lead_w & 0xff;
3503 else
3504 c = *smp[i].sm_lead;
3505 if (sfirst[c] == -1) {
3506 sfirst[c] = i;
3507 if (has_mbyte) {
3508 int n;
3509
3510 // Make sure all entries with this byte are following each
3511 // other. Move the ones that are in the wrong position. Do
3512 // keep the same ordering!
3513 while (i + 1 < gap->ga_len
3514 && (*smp[i + 1].sm_lead_w & 0xff) == c)
3515 // Skip over entry with same index byte.
3516 ++i;
3517
3518 for (n = 1; i + n < gap->ga_len; ++n)
3519 if ((*smp[i + n].sm_lead_w & 0xff) == c) {
3520 salitem_T tsal;
3521
3522 // Move entry with same index byte after the entries
3523 // we already found.
3524 ++i;
3525 --n;
3526 tsal = smp[i + n];
3527 memmove(smp + i + 1, smp + i,
3528 sizeof(salitem_T) * n);
3529 smp[i] = tsal;
3530 }
3531 }
3532 }
3533 }
3534}
3535
3536// Turn a multi-byte string into a wide character string.
3537// Return it in allocated memory.
3538static int *mb_str2wide(char_u *s)
3539{
3540 int i = 0;
3541
3542 int *res = xmalloc((mb_charlen(s) + 1) * sizeof(int));
3543 for (char_u *p = s; *p != NUL'\000'; )
3544 res[i++] = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
3545 res[i] = NUL'\000';
3546
3547 return res;
3548}
3549
3550// Reads a tree from the .spl or .sug file.
3551// Allocates the memory and stores pointers in "bytsp" and "idxsp".
3552// This is skipped when the tree has zero length.
3553// Returns zero when OK, SP_ value for an error.
3554static int
3555spell_read_tree (
3556 FILE *fd,
3557 char_u **bytsp,
3558 idx_T **idxsp,
3559 bool_Bool prefixtree, // true for the prefix tree
3560 int prefixcnt // when "prefixtree" is true: prefix count
3561)
3562{
3563 int idx;
3564 char_u *bp;
3565 idx_T *ip;
3566
3567 // The tree size was computed when writing the file, so that we can
3568 // allocate it as one long block. <nodecount>
3569 int len = get4c(fd);
3570 if (len < 0)
3571 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
3572 if (len > 0) {
3573 // Allocate the byte array.
3574 bp = xmalloc(len);
3575 *bytsp = bp;
3576
3577 // Allocate the index array.
3578 ip = xcalloc(len, sizeof(*ip));
3579 *idxsp = ip;
3580
3581 // Recursively read the tree and store it in the array.
3582 idx = read_tree_node(fd, bp, ip, len, 0, prefixtree, prefixcnt);
3583 if (idx < 0)
3584 return idx;
3585 }
3586 return 0;
3587}
3588
3589// Read one row of siblings from the spell file and store it in the byte array
3590// "byts" and index array "idxs". Recursively read the children.
3591//
3592// NOTE: The code here must match put_node()!
3593//
3594// Returns the index (>= 0) following the siblings.
3595// Returns SP_TRUNCERROR if the file is shorter than expected.
3596// Returns SP_FORMERROR if there is a format error.
3597static idx_T
3598read_tree_node (
3599 FILE *fd,
3600 char_u *byts,
3601 idx_T *idxs,
3602 int maxidx, // size of arrays
3603 idx_T startidx, // current index in "byts" and "idxs"
3604 bool_Bool prefixtree, // true for reading PREFIXTREE
3605 int maxprefcondnr // maximum for <prefcondnr>
3606)
3607{
3608 int len;
3609 int i;
3610 int n;
3611 idx_T idx = startidx;
3612 int c;
3613 int c2;
3614#define SHARED_MASK0x8000000 0x8000000
3615
3616 len = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <siblingcount>
3617 if (len <= 0)
3618 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
3619
3620 if (startidx + len >= maxidx)
3621 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3622 byts[idx++] = len;
3623
3624 // Read the byte values, flag/region bytes and shared indexes.
3625 for (i = 1; i <= len; ++i) {
3626 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <byte>
3627 if (c < 0)
3628 return SP_TRUNCERROR-1;
3629 if (c <= BY_SPECIAL3) {
3630 if (c == BY_NOFLAGS0 && !prefixtree) {
3631 // No flags, all regions.
3632 idxs[idx] = 0;
3633 c = 0;
3634 } else if (c != BY_INDEX1) {
3635 if (prefixtree) {
3636 // Read the optional pflags byte, the prefix ID and the
3637 // condition nr. In idxs[] store the prefix ID in the low
3638 // byte, the condition index shifted up 8 bits, the flags
3639 // shifted up 24 bits.
3640 if (c == BY_FLAGS2)
3641 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd) << 24; // <pflags>
3642 else
3643 c = 0;
3644
3645 c |= getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <affixID>
3646
3647 n = get2c(fd); // <prefcondnr>
3648 if (n >= maxprefcondnr)
3649 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3650 c |= (n << 8);
3651 } else { // c must be BY_FLAGS or BY_FLAGS2
3652 // Read flags and optional region and prefix ID. In
3653 // idxs[] the flags go in the low two bytes, region above
3654 // that and prefix ID above the region.
3655 c2 = c;
3656 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <flags>
3657 if (c2 == BY_FLAGS23)
3658 c = (getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd) << 8) + c; // <flags2>
3659 if (c & WF_REGION0x01)
3660 c = (getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd) << 16) + c; // <region>
3661 if (c & WF_AFX0x20)
3662 c = (getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd) << 24) + c; // <affixID>
3663 }
3664
3665 idxs[idx] = c;
3666 c = 0;
3667 } else { // c == BY_INDEX
3668 // <nodeidx>
3669 n = get3c(fd);
3670 if (n < 0 || n >= maxidx)
3671 return SP_FORMERROR-2;
3672 idxs[idx] = n + SHARED_MASK0x8000000;
3673 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <xbyte>
3674 }
3675 }
3676 byts[idx++] = c;
3677 }
3678
3679 // Recursively read the children for non-shared siblings.
3680 // Skip the end-of-word ones (zero byte value) and the shared ones (and
3681 // remove SHARED_MASK)
3682 for (i = 1; i <= len; ++i)
3683 if (byts[startidx + i] != 0) {
3684 if (idxs[startidx + i] & SHARED_MASK0x8000000)
3685 idxs[startidx + i] &= ~SHARED_MASK0x8000000;
3686 else {
3687 idxs[startidx + i] = idx;
3688 idx = read_tree_node(fd, byts, idxs, maxidx, idx,
3689 prefixtree, maxprefcondnr);
3690 if (idx < 0)
3691 break;
3692 }
3693 }
3694
3695 return idx;
3696}
3697
3698// Parse 'spelllang' and set w_s->b_langp accordingly.
3699// Returns NULL if it's OK, an error message otherwise.
3700char_u *did_set_spelllang(win_T *wp)
3701{
3702 garray_T ga;
3703 char_u *splp;
3704 char_u *region;
3705 char_u region_cp[3];
3706 bool_Bool filename;
3707 int region_mask;
3708 slang_T *slang;
3709 int c;
3710 char_u lang[MAXWLEN250 + 1];
3711 char_u spf_name[MAXPATHL4096];
3712 int len;
3713 char_u *p;
3714 int round;
3715 char_u *spf;
3716 char_u *use_region = NULL((void*)0);
3717 bool_Bool dont_use_region = false0;
3718 bool_Bool nobreak = false0;
3719 langp_T *lp, *lp2;
3720 static bool_Bool recursive = false0;
3721 char_u *ret_msg = NULL((void*)0);
3722 char_u *spl_copy;
3723
3724 // We don't want to do this recursively. May happen when a language is
3725 // not available and the SpellFileMissing autocommand opens a new buffer
3726 // in which 'spell' is set.
3727 if (recursive)
3728 return NULL((void*)0);
3729 recursive = true1;
3730
3731 ga_init(&ga, sizeof(langp_T), 2);
3732 clear_midword(wp);
3733
3734 // Make a copy of 'spelllang', the SpellFileMissing autocommands may change
3735 // it under our fingers.
3736 spl_copy = vim_strsave(wp->w_s->b_p_spl);
3737
3738 wp->w_s->b_cjk = 0;
3739
3740 // Loop over comma separated language names.
3741 for (splp = spl_copy; *splp != NUL'\000'; ) {
3742 // Get one language name.
3743 copy_option_part(&splp, lang, MAXWLEN250, ",");
3744 region = NULL((void*)0);
3745 len = (int)STRLEN(lang)strlen((char *)(lang));
3746
3747 if (STRCMP(lang, "cjk")strcmp((char *)(lang), (char *)("cjk")) == 0) {
3748 wp->w_s->b_cjk = 1;
3749 continue;
3750 }
3751
3752 // If the name ends in ".spl" use it as the name of the spell file.
3753 // If there is a region name let "region" point to it and remove it
3754 // from the name.
3755 if (len > 4 && fnamecmp(lang + len - 4, ".spl")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(lang + len - 4), (char_u *)(".spl")) == 0) {
3756 filename = true1;
3757
3758 // Locate a region and remove it from the file name.
3759 p = vim_strchr(path_tail(lang), '_');
3760 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && ASCII_ISALPHA(p[1])(((unsigned)(p[1]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[1]) - 'a' <
26)) && ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'a' <
26))
3761 && !ASCII_ISALPHA(p[3])(((unsigned)(p[3]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[3]) - 'a' <
26))) {
3762 STRLCPY(region_cp, p + 1, 3)xstrlcpy((char *)(region_cp), (char *)(p + 1), (size_t)(3));
3763 memmove(p, p + 3, len - (p - lang) - 2);
3764 region = region_cp;
3765 } else
3766 dont_use_region = true1;
3767
3768 // Check if we loaded this language before.
3769 for (slang = first_lang; slang != NULL((void*)0); slang = slang->sl_next)
3770 if (path_full_compare(lang, slang->sl_fname, FALSE0) == kEqualFiles)
3771 break;
3772 } else {
3773 filename = false0;
3774 if (len > 3 && lang[len - 3] == '_') {
3775 region = lang + len - 2;
3776 lang[len - 3] = NUL'\000';
3777 } else
3778 dont_use_region = true1;
3779
3780 // Check if we loaded this language before.
3781 for (slang = first_lang; slang != NULL((void*)0); slang = slang->sl_next)
3782 if (STRICMP(lang, slang->sl_name)strcasecmp((char *)(lang), (char *)(slang->sl_name)) == 0)
3783 break;
3784 }
3785
3786 if (region != NULL((void*)0)) {
3787 // If the region differs from what was used before then don't
3788 // use it for 'spellfile'.
3789 if (use_region != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(region, use_region)strcmp((char *)(region), (char *)(use_region)) != 0)
3790 dont_use_region = true1;
3791 use_region = region;
3792 }
3793
3794 // If not found try loading the language now.
3795 if (slang == NULL((void*)0)) {
3796 if (filename)
3797 (void)spell_load_file(lang, lang, NULL((void*)0), false0);
3798 else {
3799 spell_load_lang(lang);
3800 // SpellFileMissing autocommands may do anything, including
3801 // destroying the buffer we are using...
3802 if (!buf_valid(wp->w_buffer)) {
3803 ret_msg =
3804 (char_u *)"E797: SpellFileMissing autocommand deleted buffer";
3805 goto theend;
3806 }
3807 }
3808 }
3809
3810 // Loop over the languages, there can be several files for "lang".
3811 for (slang = first_lang; slang != NULL((void*)0); slang = slang->sl_next)
3812 if (filename ? path_full_compare(lang, slang->sl_fname, FALSE0) == kEqualFiles
3813 : STRICMP(lang, slang->sl_name)strcasecmp((char *)(lang), (char *)(slang->sl_name)) == 0) {
3814 region_mask = REGION_ALL0xff;
3815 if (!filename && region != NULL((void*)0)) {
3816 // find region in sl_regions
3817 c = find_region(slang->sl_regions, region);
3818 if (c == REGION_ALL0xff) {
3819 if (slang->sl_add) {
3820 if (*slang->sl_regions != NUL'\000')
3821 // This addition file is for other regions.
3822 region_mask = 0;
3823 } else
3824 // This is probably an error. Give a warning and
3825 // accept the words anyway.
3826 smsg((char_u *)
3827 _("Warning: region %s not supported")gettext((char *)("Warning: region %s not supported")),
3828 region);
3829 } else
3830 region_mask = 1 << c;
3831 }
3832
3833 if (region_mask != 0) {
3834 langp_T *p = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(langp_T, &ga)ga_append_via_ptr(&ga, sizeof(langp_T));
3835 p->lp_slang = slang;
3836 p->lp_region = region_mask;
3837
3838 use_midword(slang, wp);
3839 if (slang->sl_nobreak)
3840 nobreak = true1;
3841 }
3842 }
3843 }
3844
3845 // round 0: load int_wordlist, if possible.
3846 // round 1: load first name in 'spellfile'.
3847 // round 2: load second name in 'spellfile.
3848 // etc.
3849 spf = curwin->w_s->b_p_spf;
3850 for (round = 0; round == 0 || *spf != NUL'\000'; ++round) {
3851 if (round == 0) {
3852 // Internal wordlist, if there is one.
3853 if (int_wordlist == NULL((void*)0))
3854 continue;
3855 int_wordlist_spl(spf_name);
3856 } else {
3857 // One entry in 'spellfile'.
3858 copy_option_part(&spf, spf_name, MAXPATHL4096 - 5, ",");
3859 STRCAT(spf_name, ".spl")strcat((char *)(spf_name), (char *)(".spl"));
3860
3861 // If it was already found above then skip it.
3862 for (c = 0; c < ga.ga_len; ++c) {
3863 p = LANGP_ENTRY(ga, c)(((langp_T *)(ga).ga_data) + (c))->lp_slang->sl_fname;
3864 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && path_full_compare(spf_name, p, FALSE0) == kEqualFiles)
3865 break;
3866 }
3867 if (c < ga.ga_len)
3868 continue;
3869 }
3870
3871 // Check if it was loaded already.
3872 for (slang = first_lang; slang != NULL((void*)0); slang = slang->sl_next)
3873 if (path_full_compare(spf_name, slang->sl_fname, FALSE0) == kEqualFiles)
3874 break;
3875 if (slang == NULL((void*)0)) {
3876 // Not loaded, try loading it now. The language name includes the
3877 // region name, the region is ignored otherwise. for int_wordlist
3878 // use an arbitrary name.
3879 if (round == 0)
3880 STRCPY(lang, "internal wordlist")strcpy((char *)(lang), (char *)("internal wordlist"));
3881 else {
3882 STRLCPY(lang, path_tail(spf_name), MAXWLEN + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(lang), (char *)(path_tail(spf_name)), (size_t
)(250 + 1));
3883 p = vim_strchr(lang, '.');
3884 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
3885 *p = NUL'\000'; // truncate at ".encoding.add"
3886 }
3887 slang = spell_load_file(spf_name, lang, NULL((void*)0), true1);
3888
3889 // If one of the languages has NOBREAK we assume the addition
3890 // files also have this.
3891 if (slang != NULL((void*)0) && nobreak)
3892 slang->sl_nobreak = true1;
3893 }
3894 if (slang != NULL((void*)0)) {
3895 region_mask = REGION_ALL0xff;
3896 if (use_region != NULL((void*)0) && !dont_use_region) {
3897 // find region in sl_regions
3898 c = find_region(slang->sl_regions, use_region);
3899 if (c != REGION_ALL0xff)
3900 region_mask = 1 << c;
3901 else if (*slang->sl_regions != NUL'\000')
3902 // This spell file is for other regions.
3903 region_mask = 0;
3904 }
3905
3906 if (region_mask != 0) {
3907 langp_T *p = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(langp_T, &ga)ga_append_via_ptr(&ga, sizeof(langp_T));
3908 p->lp_slang = slang;
3909 p->lp_sallang = NULL((void*)0);
3910 p->lp_replang = NULL((void*)0);
3911 p->lp_region = region_mask;
3912
3913 use_midword(slang, wp);
3914 }
3915 }
3916 }
3917
3918 // Everything is fine, store the new b_langp value.
3919 ga_clear(&wp->w_s->b_langp);
3920 wp->w_s->b_langp = ga;
3921
3922 // For each language figure out what language to use for sound folding and
3923 // REP items. If the language doesn't support it itself use another one
3924 // with the same name. E.g. for "en-math" use "en".
3925 for (int i = 0; i < ga.ga_len; ++i) {
3926 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(ga, i)(((langp_T *)(ga).ga_data) + (i));
3927
3928 // sound folding
3929 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)((&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0))
3930 // language does sound folding itself
3931 lp->lp_sallang = lp->lp_slang;
3932 else
3933 // find first similar language that does sound folding
3934 for (int j = 0; j < ga.ga_len; ++j) {
3935 lp2 = LANGP_ENTRY(ga, j)(((langp_T *)(ga).ga_data) + (j));
3936 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp2->lp_slang->sl_sal)((&lp2->lp_slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0)
3937 && STRNCMP(lp->lp_slang->sl_name,strncmp((char *)(lp->lp_slang->sl_name), (char *)(lp2->
lp_slang->sl_name), (size_t)(2))
3938 lp2->lp_slang->sl_name, 2)strncmp((char *)(lp->lp_slang->sl_name), (char *)(lp2->
lp_slang->sl_name), (size_t)(2)) == 0) {
3939 lp->lp_sallang = lp2->lp_slang;
3940 break;
3941 }
3942 }
3943
3944 // REP items
3945 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp->lp_slang->sl_rep)((&lp->lp_slang->sl_rep)->ga_len <= 0))
3946 // language has REP items itself
3947 lp->lp_replang = lp->lp_slang;
3948 else
3949 // find first similar language that has REP items
3950 for (int j = 0; j < ga.ga_len; ++j) {
3951 lp2 = LANGP_ENTRY(ga, j)(((langp_T *)(ga).ga_data) + (j));
3952 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp2->lp_slang->sl_rep)((&lp2->lp_slang->sl_rep)->ga_len <= 0)
3953 && STRNCMP(lp->lp_slang->sl_name,strncmp((char *)(lp->lp_slang->sl_name), (char *)(lp2->
lp_slang->sl_name), (size_t)(2))
3954 lp2->lp_slang->sl_name, 2)strncmp((char *)(lp->lp_slang->sl_name), (char *)(lp2->
lp_slang->sl_name), (size_t)(2)) == 0) {
3955 lp->lp_replang = lp2->lp_slang;
3956 break;
3957 }
3958 }
3959 }
3960
3961theend:
3962 free(spl_copy);
3963 recursive = false0;
3964 redraw_win_later(wp, NOT_VALID40);
3965 return ret_msg;
3966}
3967
3968// Clear the midword characters for buffer "buf".
3969static void clear_midword(win_T *wp)
3970{
3971 memset(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw, 0, 256);
3972 free(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb);
3973 wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb = NULL((void*)0);
3974}
3975
3976// Use the "sl_midword" field of language "lp" for buffer "buf".
3977// They add up to any currently used midword characters.
3978static void use_midword(slang_T *lp, win_T *wp)
3979{
3980 char_u *p;
3981
3982 if (lp->sl_midword == NULL((void*)0)) // there aren't any
3983 return;
3984
3985 for (p = lp->sl_midword; *p != NUL'\000'; )
3986 if (has_mbyte) {
3987 int c, l, n;
3988 char_u *bp;
3989
3990 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
3991 l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
3992 if (c < 256 && l <= 2)
3993 wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw[c] = true1;
3994 else if (wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb == NULL((void*)0))
3995 // First multi-byte char in "b_spell_ismw_mb".
3996 wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb = vim_strnsave(p, l);
3997 else {
3998 // Append multi-byte chars to "b_spell_ismw_mb".
3999 n = (int)STRLEN(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb)strlen((char *)(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb));
4000 bp = vim_strnsave(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb, n + l);
4001 free(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb);
4002 wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb = bp;
4003 STRLCPY(bp + n, p, l + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(bp + n), (char *)(p), (size_t)(l + 1));
4004 }
4005 p += l;
4006 } else
4007 wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw[*p++] = true1;
4008}
4009
4010// Find the region "region[2]" in "rp" (points to "sl_regions").
4011// Each region is simply stored as the two characters of it's name.
4012// Returns the index if found (first is 0), REGION_ALL if not found.
4013static int find_region(char_u *rp, char_u *region)
4014{
4015 int i;
4016
4017 for (i = 0;; i += 2) {
4018 if (rp[i] == NUL'\000')
4019 return REGION_ALL0xff;
4020 if (rp[i] == region[0] && rp[i + 1] == region[1])
4021 break;
4022 }
4023 return i / 2;
4024}
4025
4026// Return case type of word:
4027// w word 0
4028// Word WF_ONECAP
4029// W WORD WF_ALLCAP
4030// WoRd wOrd WF_KEEPCAP
4031static int
4032captype (
4033 char_u *word,
4034 char_u *end // When NULL use up to NUL byte.
4035)
4036{
4037 char_u *p;
4038 int c;
4039 int firstcap;
4040 bool_Bool allcap;
4041 bool_Bool past_second = false0; // past second word char
4042
4043 // find first letter
4044 for (p = word; !spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin); mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
4045 if (end == NULL((void*)0) ? *p == NUL'\000' : p >= end)
4046 return 0; // only non-word characters, illegal word
4047 if (has_mbyte)
4048 c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
4049 else
4050 c = *p++;
4051 firstcap = allcap = SPELL_ISUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c));
4052
4053 // Need to check all letters to find a word with mixed upper/lower.
4054 // But a word with an upper char only at start is a ONECAP.
4055 for (; end == NULL((void*)0) ? *p != NUL'\000' : p < end; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
4056 if (spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin)) {
4057 c = PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p));
4058 if (!SPELL_ISUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c))) {
4059 // UUl -> KEEPCAP
4060 if (past_second && allcap)
4061 return WF_KEEPCAP0x80;
4062 allcap = false0;
4063 } else if (!allcap)
4064 // UlU -> KEEPCAP
4065 return WF_KEEPCAP0x80;
4066 past_second = true1;
4067 }
4068
4069 if (allcap)
4070 return WF_ALLCAP0x04;
4071 if (firstcap)
4072 return WF_ONECAP0x02;
4073 return 0;
4074}
4075
4076// Like captype() but for a KEEPCAP word add ONECAP if the word starts with a
4077// capital. So that make_case_word() can turn WOrd into Word.
4078// Add ALLCAP for "WOrD".
4079static int badword_captype(char_u *word, char_u *end)
4080{
4081 int flags = captype(word, end);
4082 int c;
4083 int l, u;
4084 bool_Bool first;
4085 char_u *p;
4086
4087 if (flags & WF_KEEPCAP0x80) {
4088 // Count the number of UPPER and lower case letters.
4089 l = u = 0;
4090 first = false0;
4091 for (p = word; p < end; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
4092 c = PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p));
4093 if (SPELL_ISUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c))) {
4094 ++u;
4095 if (p == word)
4096 first = true1;
4097 } else
4098 ++l;
4099 }
4100
4101 // If there are more UPPER than lower case letters suggest an
4102 // ALLCAP word. Otherwise, if the first letter is UPPER then
4103 // suggest ONECAP. Exception: "ALl" most likely should be "All",
4104 // require three upper case letters.
4105 if (u > l && u > 2)
4106 flags |= WF_ALLCAP0x04;
4107 else if (first)
4108 flags |= WF_ONECAP0x02;
4109
4110 if (u >= 2 && l >= 2) // maCARONI maCAroni
4111 flags |= WF_MIXCAP0x20;
4112 }
4113 return flags;
4114}
4115
4116// Delete the internal wordlist and its .spl file.
4117void spell_delete_wordlist(void)
4118{
4119 char_u fname[MAXPATHL4096];
4120
4121 if (int_wordlist != NULL((void*)0)) {
4122 os_remove((char *)int_wordlist);
4123 int_wordlist_spl(fname);
4124 os_remove((char *)fname);
4125 free(int_wordlist);
4126 int_wordlist = NULL((void*)0);
4127 }
4128}
4129
4130// Free all languages.
4131void spell_free_all(void)
4132{
4133 slang_T *slang;
4134
4135 // Go through all buffers and handle 'spelllang'. <VN>
4136 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
4137 ga_clear(&buf->b_s.b_langp);
4138 }
4139
4140 while (first_lang != NULL((void*)0)) {
4141 slang = first_lang;
4142 first_lang = slang->sl_next;
4143 slang_free(slang);
4144 }
4145
4146 spell_delete_wordlist();
4147
4148 free(repl_to);
4149 repl_to = NULL((void*)0);
4150 free(repl_from);
4151 repl_from = NULL((void*)0);
4152}
4153
4154// Clear all spelling tables and reload them.
4155// Used after 'encoding' is set and when ":mkspell" was used.
4156void spell_reload(void)
4157{
4158 // Initialize the table for spell_iswordp().
4159 init_spell_chartab();
4160
4161 // Unload all allocated memory.
4162 spell_free_all();
4163
4164 // Go through all buffers and handle 'spelllang'.
4165 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, curtab)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
4166 // Only load the wordlists when 'spelllang' is set and there is a
4167 // window for this buffer in which 'spell' is set.
4168 if (*wp->w_s->b_p_spl != NUL'\000') {
4169 if (wp->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell) {
4170 (void)did_set_spelllang(wp);
4171 break;
4172 }
4173 }
4174 }
4175}
4176
4177// Reload the spell file "fname" if it's loaded.
4178static void
4179spell_reload_one (
4180 char_u *fname,
4181 bool_Bool added_word // invoked through "zg"
4182)
4183{
4184 slang_T *slang;
4185 bool_Bool didit = false0;
4186
4187 for (slang = first_lang; slang != NULL((void*)0); slang = slang->sl_next) {
4188 if (path_full_compare(fname, slang->sl_fname, FALSE0) == kEqualFiles) {
4189 slang_clear(slang);
4190 if (spell_load_file(fname, NULL((void*)0), slang, false0) == NULL((void*)0))
4191 // reloading failed, clear the language
4192 slang_clear(slang);
4193 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
4194 didit = true1;
4195 }
4196 }
4197
4198 // When "zg" was used and the file wasn't loaded yet, should redo
4199 // 'spelllang' to load it now.
4200 if (added_word && !didit)
4201 did_set_spelllang(curwin);
4202}
4203
4204
4205// Functions for ":mkspell".
4206
4207
4208// In the postponed prefixes tree wn_flags is used to store the WFP_ flags,
4209// but it must be negative to indicate the prefix tree to tree_add_word().
4210// Use a negative number with the lower 8 bits zero.
4211#define PFX_FLAGS-256 -256
4212
4213// flags for "condit" argument of store_aff_word()
4214#define CONDIT_COMB1 1 // affix must combine
4215#define CONDIT_CFIX2 2 // affix must have CIRCUMFIX flag
4216#define CONDIT_SUF4 4 // add a suffix for matching flags
4217#define CONDIT_AFF8 8 // word already has an affix
4218
4219// Tunable parameters for when the tree is compressed. See 'mkspellmem'.
4220static long compress_start = 30000; // memory / SBLOCKSIZE
4221static long compress_inc = 100; // memory / SBLOCKSIZE
4222static long compress_added = 500000; // word count
4223
4224#ifdef SPELL_PRINTTREE
4225// For debugging the tree code: print the current tree in a (more or less)
4226// readable format, so that we can see what happens when adding a word and/or
4227// compressing the tree.
4228// Based on code from Olaf Seibert.
4229#define PRINTLINESIZE 1000
4230#define PRINTWIDTH 6
4231
4232#define PRINTSOME(l, depth, fmt, a1, a2) vim_snprintf(l + depth * PRINTWIDTH, \
4233 PRINTLINESIZE - PRINTWIDTH * depth, fmt, a1, a2)
4234
4235static char line1[PRINTLINESIZE];
4236static char line2[PRINTLINESIZE];
4237static char line3[PRINTLINESIZE];
4238
4239static void spell_clear_flags(wordnode_T *node)
4240{
4241 wordnode_T *np;
4242
4243 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling) {
4244 np->wn_u1.index = FALSE0;
4245 spell_clear_flags(np->wn_child);
4246 }
4247}
4248
4249static void spell_print_node(wordnode_T *node, int depth)
4250{
4251 if (node->wn_u1.index) {
4252 // Done this node before, print the reference.
4253 PRINTSOME(line1, depth, "(%d)", node->wn_nr, 0);
4254 PRINTSOME(line2, depth, " ", 0, 0);
4255 PRINTSOME(line3, depth, " ", 0, 0);
4256 msg(line1);
4257 msg(line2);
4258 msg(line3);
4259 } else {
4260 node->wn_u1.index = TRUE1;
4261
4262 if (node->wn_byte != NUL'\000') {
4263 if (node->wn_child != NULL((void*)0))
4264 PRINTSOME(line1, depth, " %c -> ", node->wn_byte, 0);
4265 else
4266 // Cannot happen?
4267 PRINTSOME(line1, depth, " %c ???", node->wn_byte, 0);
4268 } else
4269 PRINTSOME(line1, depth, " $ ", 0, 0);
4270
4271 PRINTSOME(line2, depth, "%d/%d ", node->wn_nr, node->wn_refs);
4272
4273 if (node->wn_sibling != NULL((void*)0))
4274 PRINTSOME(line3, depth, " | ", 0, 0);
4275 else
4276 PRINTSOME(line3, depth, " ", 0, 0);
4277
4278 if (node->wn_byte == NUL'\000') {
4279 msg(line1);
4280 msg(line2);
4281 msg(line3);
4282 }
4283
4284 // do the children
4285 if (node->wn_byte != NUL'\000' && node->wn_child != NULL((void*)0))
4286 spell_print_node(node->wn_child, depth + 1);
4287
4288 // do the siblings
4289 if (node->wn_sibling != NULL((void*)0)) {
4290 // get rid of all parent details except |
4291 STRCPY(line1, line3)strcpy((char *)(line1), (char *)(line3));
4292 STRCPY(line2, line3)strcpy((char *)(line2), (char *)(line3));
4293 spell_print_node(node->wn_sibling, depth);
4294 }
4295 }
4296}
4297
4298static void spell_print_tree(wordnode_T *root)
4299{
4300 if (root != NULL((void*)0)) {
4301 // Clear the "wn_u1.index" fields, used to remember what has been
4302 // done.
4303 spell_clear_flags(root);
4304
4305 // Recursively print the tree.
4306 spell_print_node(root, 0);
4307 }
4308}
4309
4310#endif // SPELL_PRINTTREE
4311
4312// Reads the affix file "fname".
4313// Returns an afffile_T, NULL for complete failure.
4314static afffile_T *spell_read_aff(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *fname)
4315{
4316 FILE *fd;
4317 afffile_T *aff;
4318 char_u rline[MAXLINELEN500];
4319 char_u *line;
4320 char_u *pc = NULL((void*)0);
4321#define MAXITEMCNT30 30
4322 char_u *(items[MAXITEMCNT30]);
4323 int itemcnt;
4324 char_u *p;
4325 int lnum = 0;
4326 affheader_T *cur_aff = NULL((void*)0);
4327 bool_Bool did_postpone_prefix = false0;
4328 int aff_todo = 0;
4329 hashtab_T *tp;
4330 char_u *low = NULL((void*)0);
4331 char_u *fol = NULL((void*)0);
4332 char_u *upp = NULL((void*)0);
4333 int do_rep;
4334 int do_repsal;
4335 int do_sal;
4336 int do_mapline;
4337 bool_Bool found_map = false0;
4338 hashitem_T *hi;
4339 int l;
4340 int compminlen = 0; // COMPOUNDMIN value
4341 int compsylmax = 0; // COMPOUNDSYLMAX value
4342 int compoptions = 0; // COMP_ flags
4343 int compmax = 0; // COMPOUNDWORDMAX value
4344 char_u *compflags = NULL((void*)0); // COMPOUNDFLAG and COMPOUNDRULE
4345 // concatenated
4346 char_u *midword = NULL((void*)0); // MIDWORD value
4347 char_u *syllable = NULL((void*)0); // SYLLABLE value
4348 char_u *sofofrom = NULL((void*)0); // SOFOFROM value
4349 char_u *sofoto = NULL((void*)0); // SOFOTO value
4350
4351 // Open the file.
4352 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r"));
4353 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
4354 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
4355 return NULL((void*)0);
4356 }
4357
4358 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Reading affix file %s ...")gettext((char *)("Reading affix file %s ...")), fname);
4359 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
4360
4361 // Only do REP lines when not done in another .aff file already.
4362 do_rep = GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_rep)((&spin->si_rep)->ga_len <= 0);
4363
4364 // Only do REPSAL lines when not done in another .aff file already.
4365 do_repsal = GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_repsal)((&spin->si_repsal)->ga_len <= 0);
4366
4367 // Only do SAL lines when not done in another .aff file already.
4368 do_sal = GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_sal)((&spin->si_sal)->ga_len <= 0);
4369
4370 // Only do MAP lines when not done in another .aff file already.
4371 do_mapline = GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_map)((&spin->si_map)->ga_len <= 0);
4372
4373 // Allocate and init the afffile_T structure.
4374 aff = (afffile_T *)getroom(spin, sizeof(afffile_T), true1);
4375 if (aff == NULL((void*)0)) {
4376 fclose(fd);
4377 return NULL((void*)0);
4378 }
4379 hash_init(&aff->af_pref);
4380 hash_init(&aff->af_suff);
4381 hash_init(&aff->af_comp);
4382
4383 // Read all the lines in the file one by one.
4384 while (!vim_fgets(rline, MAXLINELEN500, fd) && !got_int) {
4385 line_breakcheck();
4386 ++lnum;
4387
4388 // Skip comment lines.
4389 if (*rline == '#')
4390 continue;
4391
4392 // Convert from "SET" to 'encoding' when needed.
4393 free(pc);
4394 if (spin->si_conv.vc_type != CONV_NONE0) {
4395 pc = string_convert(&spin->si_conv, rline, NULL((void*)0));
4396 if (pc == NULL((void*)0)) {
4397 smsg((char_u *)_("Conversion failure for word in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Conversion failure for word in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4398 fname, lnum, rline);
4399 continue;
4400 }
4401 line = pc;
4402 } else {
4403 pc = NULL((void*)0);
4404 line = rline;
4405 }
4406
4407 // Split the line up in white separated items. Put a NUL after each
4408 // item.
4409 itemcnt = 0;
4410 for (p = line;; ) {
4411 while (*p != NUL'\000' && *p <= ' ') // skip white space and CR/NL
4412 ++p;
4413 if (*p == NUL'\000')
4414 break;
4415 if (itemcnt == MAXITEMCNT30) // too many items
4416 break;
4417 items[itemcnt++] = p;
4418 // A few items have arbitrary text argument, don't split them.
4419 if (itemcnt == 2 && spell_info_item(items[0]))
4420 while (*p >= ' ' || *p == TAB'\011') // skip until CR/NL
4421 ++p;
4422 else
4423 while (*p > ' ') // skip until white space or CR/NL
4424 ++p;
4425 if (*p == NUL'\000')
4426 break;
4427 *p++ = NUL'\000';
4428 }
4429
4430 // Handle non-empty lines.
4431 if (itemcnt > 0) {
4432 if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "SET", 2) && aff->af_enc == NULL((void*)0)) {
4433 // Setup for conversion from "ENC" to 'encoding'.
4434 aff->af_enc = enc_canonize(items[1]);
4435 if (!spin->si_ascii
4436 && convert_setup(&spin->si_conv, aff->af_enc,
4437 p_enc) == FAIL0)
4438 smsg((char_u *)_("Conversion in %s not supported: from %s to %s")gettext((char *)("Conversion in %s not supported: from %s to %s"
)),
4439 fname, aff->af_enc, p_enc);
4440 spin->si_conv.vc_fail = true1;
4441 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "FLAG", 2)
4442 && aff->af_flagtype == AFT_CHAR0) {
4443 if (STRCMP(items[1], "long")strcmp((char *)(items[1]), (char *)("long")) == 0)
4444 aff->af_flagtype = AFT_LONG1;
4445 else if (STRCMP(items[1], "num")strcmp((char *)(items[1]), (char *)("num")) == 0)
4446 aff->af_flagtype = AFT_NUM3;
4447 else if (STRCMP(items[1], "caplong")strcmp((char *)(items[1]), (char *)("caplong")) == 0)
4448 aff->af_flagtype = AFT_CAPLONG2;
4449 else
4450 smsg((char_u *)_("Invalid value for FLAG in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Invalid value for FLAG in %s line %d: %s")),
4451 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4452 if (aff->af_rare != 0
4453 || aff->af_keepcase != 0
4454 || aff->af_bad != 0
4455 || aff->af_needaffix != 0
4456 || aff->af_circumfix != 0
4457 || aff->af_needcomp != 0
4458 || aff->af_comproot != 0
4459 || aff->af_nosuggest != 0
4460 || compflags != NULL((void*)0)
4461 || aff->af_suff.ht_used > 0
4462 || aff->af_pref.ht_used > 0)
4463 smsg((char_u *)_("FLAG after using flags in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("FLAG after using flags in %s line %d: %s")),
4464 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4465 } else if (spell_info_item(items[0])) {
4466 p = (char_u *)getroom(spin,
4467 (spin->si_info == NULL((void*)0) ? 0 : STRLEN(spin->si_info)strlen((char *)(spin->si_info)))
4468 + STRLEN(items[0])strlen((char *)(items[0]))
4469 + STRLEN(items[1])strlen((char *)(items[1])) + 3, false0);
4470 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
4471 if (spin->si_info != NULL((void*)0)) {
4472 STRCPY(p, spin->si_info)strcpy((char *)(p), (char *)(spin->si_info));
4473 STRCAT(p, "\n")strcat((char *)(p), (char *)("\n"));
4474 }
4475 STRCAT(p, items[0])strcat((char *)(p), (char *)(items[0]));
4476 STRCAT(p, " ")strcat((char *)(p), (char *)(" "));
4477 STRCAT(p, items[1])strcat((char *)(p), (char *)(items[1]));
4478 spin->si_info = p;
4479 }
4480 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "MIDWORD", 2)
4481 && midword == NULL((void*)0)) {
4482 midword = getroom_save(spin, items[1]);
4483 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "TRY", 2)) {
4484 // ignored, we look in the tree for what chars may appear
4485 }
4486 // TODO: remove "RAR" later
4487 else if ((is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "RAR", 2)
4488 || is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "RARE", 2))
4489 && aff->af_rare == 0) {
4490 aff->af_rare = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4491 fname, lnum);
4492 }
4493 // TODO: remove "KEP" later
4494 else if ((is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "KEP", 2)
4495 || is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "KEEPCASE", 2))
4496 && aff->af_keepcase == 0) {
4497 aff->af_keepcase = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4498 fname, lnum);
4499 } else if ((is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "BAD", 2)
4500 || is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "FORBIDDENWORD", 2))
4501 && aff->af_bad == 0) {
4502 aff->af_bad = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4503 fname, lnum);
4504 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "NEEDAFFIX", 2)
4505 && aff->af_needaffix == 0) {
4506 aff->af_needaffix = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4507 fname, lnum);
4508 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CIRCUMFIX", 2)
4509 && aff->af_circumfix == 0) {
4510 aff->af_circumfix = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4511 fname, lnum);
4512 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "NOSUGGEST", 2)
4513 && aff->af_nosuggest == 0) {
4514 aff->af_nosuggest = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4515 fname, lnum);
4516 } else if ((is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "NEEDCOMPOUND", 2)
4517 || is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "ONLYINCOMPOUND", 2))
4518 && aff->af_needcomp == 0) {
4519 aff->af_needcomp = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4520 fname, lnum);
4521 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDROOT", 2)
4522 && aff->af_comproot == 0) {
4523 aff->af_comproot = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4524 fname, lnum);
4525 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG", 2)
4526 && aff->af_compforbid == 0) {
4527 aff->af_compforbid = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4528 fname, lnum);
4529 if (aff->af_pref.ht_used > 0)
4530 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("Defining COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG after PFX item may give wrong results in %s line %d"
))
4531 "Defining COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG after PFX item may give wrong results in %s line %d")gettext((char *)("Defining COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG after PFX item may give wrong results in %s line %d"
)),
4532 fname, lnum);
4533 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG", 2)
4534 && aff->af_comppermit == 0) {
4535 aff->af_comppermit = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4536 fname, lnum);
4537 if (aff->af_pref.ht_used > 0)
4538 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("Defining COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG after PFX item may give wrong results in %s line %d"
))
4539 "Defining COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG after PFX item may give wrong results in %s line %d")gettext((char *)("Defining COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG after PFX item may give wrong results in %s line %d"
)),
4540 fname, lnum);
4541 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDFLAG", 2)
4542 && compflags == NULL((void*)0)) {
4543 // Turn flag "c" into COMPOUNDRULE compatible string "c+",
4544 // "Na" into "Na+", "1234" into "1234+".
4545 p = getroom(spin, STRLEN(items[1])strlen((char *)(items[1])) + 2, false0);
4546 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
4547 STRCPY(p, items[1])strcpy((char *)(p), (char *)(items[1]));
4548 STRCAT(p, "+")strcat((char *)(p), (char *)("+"));
4549 compflags = p;
4550 }
4551 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDRULES", 2)) {
4552 // We don't use the count, but do check that it's a number and
4553 // not COMPOUNDRULE mistyped.
4554 if (atoi((char *)items[1]) == 0)
4555 smsg((char_u *)_("Wrong COMPOUNDRULES value in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Wrong COMPOUNDRULES value in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4556 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4557 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDRULE", 2)) {
4558 // Don't use the first rule if it is a number.
4559 if (compflags != NULL((void*)0) || *skipdigits(items[1]) != NUL'\000') {
4560 // Concatenate this string to previously defined ones,
4561 // using a slash to separate them.
4562 l = (int)STRLEN(items[1])strlen((char *)(items[1])) + 1;
4563 if (compflags != NULL((void*)0))
4564 l += (int)STRLEN(compflags)strlen((char *)(compflags)) + 1;
4565 p = getroom(spin, l, false0);
4566 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
4567 if (compflags != NULL((void*)0)) {
4568 STRCPY(p, compflags)strcpy((char *)(p), (char *)(compflags));
4569 STRCAT(p, "/")strcat((char *)(p), (char *)("/"));
4570 }
4571 STRCAT(p, items[1])strcat((char *)(p), (char *)(items[1]));
4572 compflags = p;
4573 }
4574 }
4575 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDWORDMAX", 2)
4576 && compmax == 0) {
4577 compmax = atoi((char *)items[1]);
4578 if (compmax == 0)
4579 smsg((char_u *)_("Wrong COMPOUNDWORDMAX value in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Wrong COMPOUNDWORDMAX value in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4580 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4581 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDMIN", 2)
4582 && compminlen == 0) {
4583 compminlen = atoi((char *)items[1]);
4584 if (compminlen == 0)
4585 smsg((char_u *)_("Wrong COMPOUNDMIN value in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Wrong COMPOUNDMIN value in %s line %d: %s")
),
4586 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4587 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "COMPOUNDSYLMAX", 2)
4588 && compsylmax == 0) {
4589 compsylmax = atoi((char *)items[1]);
4590 if (compsylmax == 0)
4591 smsg((char_u *)_("Wrong COMPOUNDSYLMAX value in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Wrong COMPOUNDSYLMAX value in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4592 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4593 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CHECKCOMPOUNDDUP", 1)) {
4594 compoptions |= COMP_CHECKDUP1;
4595 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CHECKCOMPOUNDREP", 1)) {
4596 compoptions |= COMP_CHECKREP2;
4597 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CHECKCOMPOUNDCASE", 1)) {
4598 compoptions |= COMP_CHECKCASE4;
4599 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CHECKCOMPOUNDTRIPLE", 1)) {
4600 compoptions |= COMP_CHECKTRIPLE8;
4601 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN", 2)) {
