4602 if (atoi((char *)items[1]) == 0)
4603 smsg((char_u *)_("Wrong CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN value in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Wrong CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN value in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4604 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4605 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN", 3)) {
4606 garray_T *gap = &spin->si_comppat;
4607 int i;
4608
4609 // Only add the couple if it isn't already there.
4610 for (i = 0; i < gap->ga_len - 1; i += 2)
4611 if (STRCMP(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[i], items[1])strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[i]), (char *)(
items[1])) == 0
4612 && STRCMP(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[i + 1],strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[i + 1]), (char
*)(items[2]))
4613 items[2])strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[i + 1]), (char
*)(items[2])) == 0)
4614 break;
4615 if (i >= gap->ga_len) {
4616 ga_grow(gap, 2);
4617 ((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[gap->ga_len++]
4618 = getroom_save(spin, items[1]);
4619 ((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[gap->ga_len++]
4620 = getroom_save(spin, items[2]);
4621 }
4622 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "SYLLABLE", 2)
4623 && syllable == NULL((void*)0)) {
4624 syllable = getroom_save(spin, items[1]);
4625 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "NOBREAK", 1)) {
4626 spin->si_nobreak = true1;
4627 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "NOSPLITSUGS", 1)) {
4628 spin->si_nosplitsugs = true1;
4629 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "NOSUGFILE", 1)) {
4630 spin->si_nosugfile = true1;
4631 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "PFXPOSTPONE", 1)) {
4632 aff->af_pfxpostpone = true1;
4633 } else if ((STRCMP(items[0], "PFX")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("PFX")) == 0
4634 || STRCMP(items[0], "SFX")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("SFX")) == 0)
4635 && aff_todo == 0
4636 && itemcnt >= 4) {
4637 int lasti = 4;
4638 char_u key[AH_KEY_LEN17];
4639
4640 if (*items[0] == 'P')
4641 tp = &aff->af_pref;
4642 else
4643 tp = &aff->af_suff;
4644
4645 // Myspell allows the same affix name to be used multiple
4646 // times. The affix files that do this have an undocumented
4647 // "S" flag on all but the last block, thus we check for that
4648 // and store it in ah_follows.
4649 STRLCPY(key, items[1], AH_KEY_LEN)xstrlcpy((char *)(key), (char *)(items[1]), (size_t)(17));
4650 hi = hash_find(tp, key);
4651 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
4652 cur_aff = HI2AH(hi)((affheader_T *)(hi)->hi_key);
4653 if (cur_aff->ah_combine != (*items[2] == 'Y'))
4654 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("Different combining flag in continued affix block in %s line %d: %s"
))
4655 "Different combining flag in continued affix block in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Different combining flag in continued affix block in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4656 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4657 if (!cur_aff->ah_follows)
4658 smsg((char_u *)_("Duplicate affix in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Duplicate affix in %s line %d: %s")),
4659 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4660 } else {
4661 // New affix letter.
4662 cur_aff = (affheader_T *)getroom(spin,
4663 sizeof(affheader_T), true1);
4664 if (cur_aff == NULL((void*)0))
4665 break;
4666 cur_aff->ah_flag = affitem2flag(aff->af_flagtype, items[1],
4667 fname, lnum);
4668 if (cur_aff->ah_flag == 0 || STRLEN(items[1])strlen((char *)(items[1])) >= AH_KEY_LEN17)
4669 break;
4670 if (cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_bad
4671 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_rare
4672 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_keepcase
4673 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_needaffix
4674 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_circumfix
4675 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_nosuggest
4676 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_needcomp
4677 || cur_aff->ah_flag == aff->af_comproot)
4678 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("Affix also used for BAD/RARE/KEEPCASE/NEEDAFFIX/NEEDCOMPOUND/NOSUGGEST in %s line %d: %s"
))
4679 "Affix also used for BAD/RARE/KEEPCASE/NEEDAFFIX/NEEDCOMPOUND/NOSUGGEST in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Affix also used for BAD/RARE/KEEPCASE/NEEDAFFIX/NEEDCOMPOUND/NOSUGGEST in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4680 fname, lnum, items[1]);
4681 STRCPY(cur_aff->ah_key, items[1])strcpy((char *)(cur_aff->ah_key), (char *)(items[1]));
4682 hash_add(tp, cur_aff->ah_key);
4683
4684 cur_aff->ah_combine = (*items[2] == 'Y');
4685 }
4686
4687 // Check for the "S" flag, which apparently means that another
4688 // block with the same affix name is following.
4689 if (itemcnt > lasti && STRCMP(items[lasti], "S")strcmp((char *)(items[lasti]), (char *)("S")) == 0) {
4690 ++lasti;
4691 cur_aff->ah_follows = true1;
4692 } else
4693 cur_aff->ah_follows = false0;
4694
4695 // Myspell allows extra text after the item, but that might
4696 // mean mistakes go unnoticed. Require a comment-starter.
4697 if (itemcnt > lasti && *items[lasti] != '#')
4698 smsg((char_u *)_(e_afftrailing)gettext((char *)(e_afftrailing)), fname, lnum, items[lasti]);
4699
4700 if (STRCMP(items[2], "Y")strcmp((char *)(items[2]), (char *)("Y")) != 0 && STRCMP(items[2], "N")strcmp((char *)(items[2]), (char *)("N")) != 0)
4701 smsg((char_u *)_("Expected Y or N in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Expected Y or N in %s line %d: %s")),
4702 fname, lnum, items[2]);
4703
4704 if (*items[0] == 'P' && aff->af_pfxpostpone) {
4705 if (cur_aff->ah_newID == 0) {
4706 // Use a new number in the .spl file later, to be able
4707 // to handle multiple .aff files.
4708 check_renumber(spin);
4709 cur_aff->ah_newID = ++spin->si_newprefID;
4710
4711 // We only really use ah_newID if the prefix is
4712 // postponed. We know that only after handling all
4713 // the items.
4714 did_postpone_prefix = false0;
4715 } else
4716 // Did use the ID in a previous block.
4717 did_postpone_prefix = true1;
4718 }
4719
4720 aff_todo = atoi((char *)items[3]);
4721 } else if ((STRCMP(items[0], "PFX")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("PFX")) == 0
4722 || STRCMP(items[0], "SFX")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("SFX")) == 0)
4723 && aff_todo > 0
4724 && STRCMP(cur_aff->ah_key, items[1])strcmp((char *)(cur_aff->ah_key), (char *)(items[1])) == 0
4725 && itemcnt >= 5) {
4726 affentry_T *aff_entry;
4727 bool_Bool upper = false0;
4728 int lasti = 5;
4729
4730 // Myspell allows extra text after the item, but that might
4731 // mean mistakes go unnoticed. Require a comment-starter.
4732 // Hunspell uses a "-" item.
4733 if (itemcnt > lasti && *items[lasti] != '#'
4734 && (STRCMP(items[lasti], "-")strcmp((char *)(items[lasti]), (char *)("-")) != 0
4735 || itemcnt != lasti + 1))
4736 smsg((char_u *)_(e_afftrailing)gettext((char *)(e_afftrailing)), fname, lnum, items[lasti]);
4737
4738 // New item for an affix letter.
4739 --aff_todo;
4740 aff_entry = (affentry_T *)getroom(spin,
4741 sizeof(affentry_T), true1);
4742 if (aff_entry == NULL((void*)0))
4743 break;
4744
4745 if (STRCMP(items[2], "0")strcmp((char *)(items[2]), (char *)("0")) != 0)
4746 aff_entry->ae_chop = getroom_save(spin, items[2]);
4747 if (STRCMP(items[3], "0")strcmp((char *)(items[3]), (char *)("0")) != 0) {
4748 aff_entry->ae_add = getroom_save(spin, items[3]);
4749
4750 // Recognize flags on the affix: abcd/XYZ
4751 aff_entry->ae_flags = vim_strchr(aff_entry->ae_add, '/');
4752 if (aff_entry->ae_flags != NULL((void*)0)) {
4753 *aff_entry->ae_flags++ = NUL'\000';
4754 aff_process_flags(aff, aff_entry);
4755 }
4756 }
4757
4758 // Don't use an affix entry with non-ASCII characters when
4759 // "spin->si_ascii" is true.
4760 if (!spin->si_ascii || !(has_non_ascii(aff_entry->ae_chop)
4761 || has_non_ascii(aff_entry->ae_add))) {
4762 aff_entry->ae_next = cur_aff->ah_first;
4763 cur_aff->ah_first = aff_entry;
4764
4765 if (STRCMP(items[4], ".")strcmp((char *)(items[4]), (char *)(".")) != 0) {
4766 char_u buf[MAXLINELEN500];
4767
4768 aff_entry->ae_cond = getroom_save(spin, items[4]);
4769 if (*items[0] == 'P')
4770 sprintf((char *)buf, "^%s", items[4]);
4771 else
4772 sprintf((char *)buf, "%s$", items[4]);
4773 aff_entry->ae_prog = vim_regcomp(buf,
4774 RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2 + RE_STRICT4);
4775 if (aff_entry->ae_prog == NULL((void*)0))
4776 smsg((char_u *)_("Broken condition in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Broken condition in %s line %d: %s")),
4777 fname, lnum, items[4]);
4778 }
4779
4780 // For postponed prefixes we need an entry in si_prefcond
4781 // for the condition. Use an existing one if possible.
4782 // Can't be done for an affix with flags, ignoring
4783 // COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG and COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG.
4784 if (*items[0] == 'P' && aff->af_pfxpostpone
4785 && aff_entry->ae_flags == NULL((void*)0)) {
4786 // When the chop string is one lower-case letter and
4787 // the add string ends in the upper-case letter we set
4788 // the "upper" flag, clear "ae_chop" and remove the
4789 // letters from "ae_add". The condition must either
4790 // be empty or start with the same letter.
4791 if (aff_entry->ae_chop != NULL((void*)0)
4792 && aff_entry->ae_add != NULL((void*)0)
4793 && aff_entry->ae_chop[(*mb_ptr2len)(
4794 aff_entry->ae_chop)] == NUL'\000'
4795 ) {
4796 int c, c_up;
4797
4798 c = PTR2CHAR(aff_entry->ae_chop)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(aff_entry->ae_chop) : (int)*(aff_entry
->ae_chop));
4799 c_up = SPELL_TOUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_toupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_upper[c] : (int)towupper(c));
4800 if (c_up != c
4801 && (aff_entry->ae_cond == NULL((void*)0)
4802 || PTR2CHAR(aff_entry->ae_cond)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(aff_entry->ae_cond) : (int)*(aff_entry
->ae_cond)) == c)) {
4803 p = aff_entry->ae_add
4804 + STRLEN(aff_entry->ae_add)strlen((char *)(aff_entry->ae_add));
4805 mb_ptr_back(aff_entry->ae_add, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(aff_entry->ae_add, p - 1)
+ 1) : 1;
4806 if (PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p)) == c_up) {
4807 upper = true1;
4808 aff_entry->ae_chop = NULL((void*)0);
4809 *p = NUL'\000';
4810
4811 // The condition is matched with the
4812 // actual word, thus must check for the
4813 // upper-case letter.
4814 if (aff_entry->ae_cond != NULL((void*)0)) {
4815 char_u buf[MAXLINELEN500];
4816 if (has_mbyte) {
4817 onecap_copy(items[4], buf, true1);
4818 aff_entry->ae_cond = getroom_save(
4819 spin, buf);
4820 } else
4821 *aff_entry->ae_cond = c_up;
4822 if (aff_entry->ae_cond != NULL((void*)0)) {
4823 sprintf((char *)buf, "^%s",
4824 aff_entry->ae_cond);
4825 vim_regfree(aff_entry->ae_prog);
4826 aff_entry->ae_prog = vim_regcomp(
4827 buf, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
4828 }
4829 }
4830 }
4831 }
4832 }
4833
4834 if (aff_entry->ae_chop == NULL((void*)0)
4835 && aff_entry->ae_flags == NULL((void*)0)) {
4836 int idx;
4837 char_u **pp;
4838 int n;
4839
4840 // Find a previously used condition.
4841 for (idx = spin->si_prefcond.ga_len - 1; idx >= 0;
4842 --idx) {
4843 p = ((char_u **)spin->si_prefcond.ga_data)[idx];
4844 if (str_equal(p, aff_entry->ae_cond))
4845 break;
4846 }
4847 if (idx < 0) {
4848 // Not found, add a new condition.
4849 idx = spin->si_prefcond.ga_len;
4850 pp = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(char_u *, &spin->si_prefcond)ga_append_via_ptr(&spin->si_prefcond, sizeof(char_u *)
);
4851 *pp = (aff_entry->ae_cond == NULL((void*)0)) ?
4852 NULL((void*)0) : getroom_save(spin, aff_entry->ae_cond);
4853 }
4854
4855 // Add the prefix to the prefix tree.
4856 if (aff_entry->ae_add == NULL((void*)0))
4857 p = (char_u *)"";
4858 else
4859 p = aff_entry->ae_add;
4860
4861 // PFX_FLAGS is a negative number, so that
4862 // tree_add_word() knows this is the prefix tree.
4863 n = PFX_FLAGS-256;
4864 if (!cur_aff->ah_combine)
4865 n |= WFP_NC0x02;
4866 if (upper)
4867 n |= WFP_UP0x04;
4868 if (aff_entry->ae_comppermit)
4869 n |= WFP_COMPPERMIT0x08;
4870 if (aff_entry->ae_compforbid)
4871 n |= WFP_COMPFORBID0x10;
4872 tree_add_word(spin, p, spin->si_prefroot, n,
4873 idx, cur_aff->ah_newID);
4874 did_postpone_prefix = true1;
4875 }
4876
4877 // Didn't actually use ah_newID, backup si_newprefID.
4878 if (aff_todo == 0 && !did_postpone_prefix) {
4879 --spin->si_newprefID;
4880 cur_aff->ah_newID = 0;
4881 }
4882 }
4883 }
4884 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "FOL", 2) && fol == NULL((void*)0)) {
4885 fol = vim_strsave(items[1]);
4886 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "LOW", 2) && low == NULL((void*)0)) {
4887 low = vim_strsave(items[1]);
4888 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "UPP", 2) && upp == NULL((void*)0)) {
4889 upp = vim_strsave(items[1]);
4890 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "REP", 2)
4891 || is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "REPSAL", 2)) {
4892 /* Ignore REP/REPSAL count */;
4893 if (!isdigit(*items[1])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*items[1]))] & (unsigned short
int) _ISdigit))
4894 smsg((char_u *)_("Expected REP(SAL) count in %s line %d")gettext((char *)("Expected REP(SAL) count in %s line %d")),
4895 fname, lnum);
4896 } else if ((STRCMP(items[0], "REP")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("REP")) == 0
4897 || STRCMP(items[0], "REPSAL")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("REPSAL")) == 0)
4898 && itemcnt >= 3) {
4899 // REP/REPSAL item
4900 // Myspell ignores extra arguments, we require it starts with
4901 // # to detect mistakes.
4902 if (itemcnt > 3 && items[3][0] != '#')
4903 smsg((char_u *)_(e_afftrailing)gettext((char *)(e_afftrailing)), fname, lnum, items[3]);
4904 if (items[0][3] == 'S' ? do_repsal : do_rep) {
4905 // Replace underscore with space (can't include a space
4906 // directly).
4907 for (p = items[1]; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
4908 if (*p == '_')
4909 *p = ' ';
4910 for (p = items[2]; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
4911 if (*p == '_')
4912 *p = ' ';
4913 add_fromto(spin, items[0][3] == 'S'
4914 ? &spin->si_repsal
4915 : &spin->si_rep, items[1], items[2]);
4916 }
4917 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "MAP", 2)) {
4918 // MAP item or count
4919 if (!found_map) {
4920 // First line contains the count.
4921 found_map = true1;
4922 if (!isdigit(*items[1])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*items[1]))] & (unsigned short
int) _ISdigit))
4923 smsg((char_u *)_("Expected MAP count in %s line %d")gettext((char *)("Expected MAP count in %s line %d")),
4924 fname, lnum);
4925 } else if (do_mapline) {
4926 int c;
4927
4928 // Check that every character appears only once.
4929 for (p = items[1]; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
4930 c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
4931 if ((!GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_map)((&spin->si_map)->ga_len <= 0)
4932 && vim_strchr(spin->si_map.ga_data, c)
4933 != NULL((void*)0))
4934 || vim_strchr(p, c) != NULL((void*)0))
4935 smsg((char_u *)_("Duplicate character in MAP in %s line %d")gettext((char *)("Duplicate character in MAP in %s line %d")),
4936 fname, lnum);
4937 }
4938
4939 // We simply concatenate all the MAP strings, separated by
4940 // slashes.
4941 ga_concat(&spin->si_map, items[1]);
4942 ga_append(&spin->si_map, '/');
4943 }
4944 }
4945 // Accept "SAL from to" and "SAL from to #comment".
4946 else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "SAL", 3)) {
4947 if (do_sal) {
4948 // SAL item (sounds-a-like)
4949 // Either one of the known keys or a from-to pair.
4950 if (STRCMP(items[1], "followup")strcmp((char *)(items[1]), (char *)("followup")) == 0)
4951 spin->si_followup = sal_to_bool(items[2]);
4952 else if (STRCMP(items[1], "collapse_result")strcmp((char *)(items[1]), (char *)("collapse_result")) == 0)
4953 spin->si_collapse = sal_to_bool(items[2]);
4954 else if (STRCMP(items[1], "remove_accents")strcmp((char *)(items[1]), (char *)("remove_accents")) == 0)
4955 spin->si_rem_accents = sal_to_bool(items[2]);
4956 else
4957 // when "to" is "_" it means empty
4958 add_fromto(spin, &spin->si_sal, items[1],
4959 STRCMP(items[2], "_")strcmp((char *)(items[2]), (char *)("_")) == 0 ? (char_u *)""
4960 : items[2]);
4961 }
4962 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "SOFOFROM", 2)
4963 && sofofrom == NULL((void*)0)) {
4964 sofofrom = getroom_save(spin, items[1]);
4965 } else if (is_aff_rule(items, itemcnt, "SOFOTO", 2)
4966 && sofoto == NULL((void*)0)) {
4967 sofoto = getroom_save(spin, items[1]);
4968 } else if (STRCMP(items[0], "COMMON")strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)("COMMON")) == 0) {
4969 int i;
4970
4971 for (i = 1; i < itemcnt; ++i) {
4972 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hash_find(&spin->si_commonwords,((hash_find(&spin->si_commonwords, items[i]))->hi_key
== ((void*)0) || (hash_find(&spin->si_commonwords, items
[i]))->hi_key == &hash_removed)
4973 items[i]))((hash_find(&spin->si_commonwords, items[i]))->hi_key
== ((void*)0) || (hash_find(&spin->si_commonwords, items
[i]))->hi_key == &hash_removed)) {
4974 p = vim_strsave(items[i]);
4975 hash_add(&spin->si_commonwords, p);
4976 }
4977 }
4978 } else
4979 smsg((char_u *)_("Unrecognized or duplicate item in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Unrecognized or duplicate item in %s line %d: %s"
)),
4980 fname, lnum, items[0]);
4981 }
4982 }
4983
4984 if (fol != NULL((void*)0) || low != NULL((void*)0) || upp != NULL((void*)0)) {
4985 if (spin->si_clear_chartab) {
4986 // Clear the char type tables, don't want to use any of the
4987 // currently used spell properties.
4988 init_spell_chartab();
4989 spin->si_clear_chartab = false0;
4990 }
4991
4992 // Don't write a word table for an ASCII file, so that we don't check
4993 // for conflicts with a word table that matches 'encoding'.
4994 // Don't write one for utf-8 either, we use utf_*() and
4995 // mb_get_class(), the list of chars in the file will be incomplete.
4996 if (!spin->si_ascii
4997 && !enc_utf8
4998 ) {
4999 if (fol == NULL((void*)0) || low == NULL((void*)0) || upp == NULL((void*)0))
5000 smsg((char_u *)_("Missing FOL/LOW/UPP line in %s")gettext((char *)("Missing FOL/LOW/UPP line in %s")), fname);
5001 else
5002 (void)set_spell_chartab(fol, low, upp);
5003 }
5004
5005 free(fol);
5006 free(low);
5007 free(upp);
5008 }
5009
5010 // Use compound specifications of the .aff file for the spell info.
5011 if (compmax != 0) {
5012 aff_check_number(spin->si_compmax, compmax, "COMPOUNDWORDMAX");
5013 spin->si_compmax = compmax;
5014 }
5015
5016 if (compminlen != 0) {
5017 aff_check_number(spin->si_compminlen, compminlen, "COMPOUNDMIN");
5018 spin->si_compminlen = compminlen;
5019 }
5020
5021 if (compsylmax != 0) {
5022 if (syllable == NULL((void*)0))
5023 smsg((char_u *)_("COMPOUNDSYLMAX used without SYLLABLE")gettext((char *)("COMPOUNDSYLMAX used without SYLLABLE")));
5024 aff_check_number(spin->si_compsylmax, compsylmax, "COMPOUNDSYLMAX");
5025 spin->si_compsylmax = compsylmax;
5026 }
5027
5028 if (compoptions != 0) {
5029 aff_check_number(spin->si_compoptions, compoptions, "COMPOUND options");
5030 spin->si_compoptions |= compoptions;
5031 }
5032
5033 if (compflags != NULL((void*)0))
5034 process_compflags(spin, aff, compflags);
5035
5036 // Check that we didn't use too many renumbered flags.
5037 if (spin->si_newcompID < spin->si_newprefID) {
5038 if (spin->si_newcompID == 127 || spin->si_newcompID == 255)
5039 MSG(_("Too many postponed prefixes"))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Too many postponed prefixes"
))));
5040 else if (spin->si_newprefID == 0 || spin->si_newprefID == 127)
5041 MSG(_("Too many compound flags"))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Too many compound flags"))));
5042 else
5043 MSG(_("Too many postponed prefixes and/or compound flags"))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Too many postponed prefixes and/or compound flags"
))));
5044 }
5045
5046 if (syllable != NULL((void*)0)) {
5047 aff_check_string(spin->si_syllable, syllable, "SYLLABLE");
5048 spin->si_syllable = syllable;
5049 }
5050
5051 if (sofofrom != NULL((void*)0) || sofoto != NULL((void*)0)) {
5052 if (sofofrom == NULL((void*)0) || sofoto == NULL((void*)0))
5053 smsg((char_u *)_("Missing SOFO%s line in %s")gettext((char *)("Missing SOFO%s line in %s")),
5054 sofofrom == NULL((void*)0) ? "FROM" : "TO", fname);
5055 else if (!GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_sal)((&spin->si_sal)->ga_len <= 0))
5056 smsg((char_u *)_("Both SAL and SOFO lines in %s")gettext((char *)("Both SAL and SOFO lines in %s")), fname);
5057 else {
5058 aff_check_string(spin->si_sofofr, sofofrom, "SOFOFROM");
5059 aff_check_string(spin->si_sofoto, sofoto, "SOFOTO");
5060 spin->si_sofofr = sofofrom;
5061 spin->si_sofoto = sofoto;
5062 }
5063 }
5064
5065 if (midword != NULL((void*)0)) {
5066 aff_check_string(spin->si_midword, midword, "MIDWORD");
5067 spin->si_midword = midword;
5068 }
5069
5070 free(pc);
5071 fclose(fd);
5072 return aff;
5073}
5074
5075// Returns true when items[0] equals "rulename", there are "mincount" items or
5076// a comment is following after item "mincount".
5077static bool_Bool is_aff_rule(char_u **items, int itemcnt, char *rulename, int mincount)
5078{
5079 return STRCMP(items[0], rulename)strcmp((char *)(items[0]), (char *)(rulename)) == 0
5080 && (itemcnt == mincount
5081 || (itemcnt > mincount && items[mincount][0] == '#'));
5082}
5083
5084// For affix "entry" move COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG and COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG from
5085// ae_flags to ae_comppermit and ae_compforbid.
5086static void aff_process_flags(afffile_T *affile, affentry_T *entry)
5087{
5088 char_u *p;
5089 char_u *prevp;
5090 unsigned flag;
5091
5092 if (entry->ae_flags != NULL((void*)0)
5093 && (affile->af_compforbid != 0 || affile->af_comppermit != 0)) {
5094 for (p = entry->ae_flags; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
5095 prevp = p;
5096 flag = get_affitem(affile->af_flagtype, &p);
5097 if (flag == affile->af_comppermit || flag == affile->af_compforbid) {
5098 STRMOVE(prevp, p)memmove((prevp), (p), strlen((char *)(p)) + 1);
5099 p = prevp;
5100 if (flag == affile->af_comppermit)
5101 entry->ae_comppermit = true1;
5102 else
5103 entry->ae_compforbid = true1;
5104 }
5105 if (affile->af_flagtype == AFT_NUM3 && *p == ',')
5106 ++p;
5107 }
5108 if (*entry->ae_flags == NUL'\000')
5109 entry->ae_flags = NULL((void*)0); // nothing left
5110 }
5111}
5112
5113// Returns true if "s" is the name of an info item in the affix file.
5114static bool_Bool spell_info_item(char_u *s)
5115{
5116 return STRCMP(s, "NAME")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("NAME")) == 0
5117 || STRCMP(s, "HOME")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("HOME")) == 0
5118 || STRCMP(s, "VERSION")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("VERSION")) == 0
5119 || STRCMP(s, "AUTHOR")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("AUTHOR")) == 0
5120 || STRCMP(s, "EMAIL")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("EMAIL")) == 0
5121 || STRCMP(s, "COPYRIGHT")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("COPYRIGHT")) == 0;
5122}
5123
5124// Turn an affix flag name into a number, according to the FLAG type.
5125// returns zero for failure.
5126static unsigned affitem2flag(int flagtype, char_u *item, char_u *fname, int lnum)
5127{
5128 unsigned res;
5129 char_u *p = item;
5130
5131 res = get_affitem(flagtype, &p);
5132 if (res == 0) {
5133 if (flagtype == AFT_NUM3)
5134 smsg((char_u *)_("Flag is not a number in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Flag is not a number in %s line %d: %s")),
5135 fname, lnum, item);
5136 else
5137 smsg((char_u *)_("Illegal flag in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Illegal flag in %s line %d: %s")),
5138 fname, lnum, item);
5139 }
5140 if (*p != NUL'\000') {
5141 smsg((char_u *)_(e_affname)gettext((char *)(e_affname)), fname, lnum, item);
5142 return 0;
5143 }
5144
5145 return res;
5146}
5147
5148// Get one affix name from "*pp" and advance the pointer.
5149// Returns zero for an error, still advances the pointer then.
5150static unsigned get_affitem(int flagtype, char_u **pp)
5151{
5152 int res;
5153
5154 if (flagtype == AFT_NUM3) {
5155 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(**pp)((unsigned)(**pp) - '0' < 10)) {
5156 ++*pp; // always advance, avoid getting stuck
5157 return 0;
5158 }
5159 res = getdigits(pp);
5160 } else {
5161 res = mb_ptr2char_adv(pp);
5162 if (flagtype == AFT_LONG1 || (flagtype == AFT_CAPLONG2
5163 && res >= 'A' && res <= 'Z')) {
5164 if (**pp == NUL'\000')
5165 return 0;
5166 res = mb_ptr2char_adv(pp) + (res << 16);
5167 }
5168 }
5169 return res;
5170}
5171
5172// Process the "compflags" string used in an affix file and append it to
5173// spin->si_compflags.
5174// The processing involves changing the affix names to ID numbers, so that
5175// they fit in one byte.
5176static void process_compflags(spellinfo_T *spin, afffile_T *aff, char_u *compflags)
5177{
5178 char_u *p;
5179 char_u *prevp;
5180 unsigned flag;
5181 compitem_T *ci;
5182 int id;
5183 int len;
5184 char_u *tp;
5185 char_u key[AH_KEY_LEN17];
5186 hashitem_T *hi;
5187
5188 // Make room for the old and the new compflags, concatenated with a / in
5189 // between. Processing it makes it shorter, but we don't know by how
5190 // much, thus allocate the maximum.
5191 len = (int)STRLEN(compflags)strlen((char *)(compflags)) + 1;
5192 if (spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0))
5193 len += (int)STRLEN(spin->si_compflags)strlen((char *)(spin->si_compflags)) + 1;
5194 p = getroom(spin, len, false0);
5195 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
5196 return;
5197 if (spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0)) {
5198 STRCPY(p, spin->si_compflags)strcpy((char *)(p), (char *)(spin->si_compflags));
5199 STRCAT(p, "/")strcat((char *)(p), (char *)("/"));
5200 }
5201 spin->si_compflags = p;
5202 tp = p + STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
5203
5204 for (p = compflags; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
5205 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"/?*+[]", *p) != NULL((void*)0))
5206 // Copy non-flag characters directly.
5207 *tp++ = *p++;
5208 else {
5209 // First get the flag number, also checks validity.
5210 prevp = p;
5211 flag = get_affitem(aff->af_flagtype, &p);
5212 if (flag != 0) {
5213 // Find the flag in the hashtable. If it was used before, use
5214 // the existing ID. Otherwise add a new entry.
5215 STRLCPY(key, prevp, p - prevp + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(key), (char *)(prevp), (size_t)(p - prevp +
1));
5216 hi = hash_find(&aff->af_comp, key);
5217 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
5218 id = HI2CI(hi)((compitem_T *)(hi)->hi_key)->ci_newID;
5219 else {
5220 ci = (compitem_T *)getroom(spin, sizeof(compitem_T), true1);
5221 if (ci == NULL((void*)0))
5222 break;
5223 STRCPY(ci->ci_key, key)strcpy((char *)(ci->ci_key), (char *)(key));
5224 ci->ci_flag = flag;
5225 // Avoid using a flag ID that has a special meaning in a
5226 // regexp (also inside []).
5227 do {
5228 check_renumber(spin);
5229 id = spin->si_newcompID--;
5230 } while (vim_strchr((char_u *)"/?*+[]\\-^", id) != NULL((void*)0));
5231 ci->ci_newID = id;
5232 hash_add(&aff->af_comp, ci->ci_key);
5233 }
5234 *tp++ = id;
5235 }
5236 if (aff->af_flagtype == AFT_NUM3 && *p == ',')
5237 ++p;
5238 }
5239 }
5240
5241 *tp = NUL'\000';
5242}
5243
5244// Check that the new IDs for postponed affixes and compounding don't overrun
5245// each other. We have almost 255 available, but start at 0-127 to avoid
5246// using two bytes for utf-8. When the 0-127 range is used up go to 128-255.
5247// When that is used up an error message is given.
5248static void check_renumber(spellinfo_T *spin)
5249{
5250 if (spin->si_newprefID == spin->si_newcompID && spin->si_newcompID < 128) {
5251 spin->si_newprefID = 127;
5252 spin->si_newcompID = 255;
5253 }
5254}
5255
5256// Returns true if flag "flag" appears in affix list "afflist".
5257static bool_Bool flag_in_afflist(int flagtype, char_u *afflist, unsigned flag)
5258{
5259 char_u *p;
5260 unsigned n;
5261
5262 switch (flagtype) {
5263 case AFT_CHAR0:
5264 return vim_strchr(afflist, flag) != NULL((void*)0);
5265
5266 case AFT_CAPLONG2:
5267 case AFT_LONG1:
5268 for (p = afflist; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
5269 n = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
5270 if ((flagtype == AFT_LONG1 || (n >= 'A' && n <= 'Z'))
5271 && *p != NUL'\000')
5272 n = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p) + (n << 16);
5273 if (n == flag)
5274 return true1;
5275 }
5276 break;
5277
5278 case AFT_NUM3:
5279 for (p = afflist; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
5280 n = getdigits(&p);
5281 if (n == flag)
5282 return true1;
5283 if (*p != NUL'\000') // skip over comma
5284 ++p;
5285 }
5286 break;
5287 }
5288 return false0;
5289}
5290
5291// Give a warning when "spinval" and "affval" numbers are set and not the same.
5292static void aff_check_number(int spinval, int affval, char *name)
5293{
5294 if (spinval != 0 && spinval != affval)
5295 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("%s value differs from what is used in another .aff file"
))
5296 "%s value differs from what is used in another .aff file")gettext((char *)("%s value differs from what is used in another .aff file"
)), name);
5297}
5298
5299// Give a warning when "spinval" and "affval" strings are set and not the same.
5300static void aff_check_string(char_u *spinval, char_u *affval, char *name)
5301{
5302 if (spinval != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(spinval, affval)strcmp((char *)(spinval), (char *)(affval)) != 0)
5303 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("%s value differs from what is used in another .aff file"
))
5304 "%s value differs from what is used in another .aff file")gettext((char *)("%s value differs from what is used in another .aff file"
)), name);
5305}
5306
5307// Returns true if strings "s1" and "s2" are equal. Also consider both being
5308// NULL as equal.
5309static bool_Bool str_equal(char_u *s1, char_u *s2)
5310{
5311 if (s1 == NULL((void*)0) || s2 == NULL((void*)0))
5312 return s1 == s2;
5313 return STRCMP(s1, s2)strcmp((char *)(s1), (char *)(s2)) == 0;
5314}
5315
5316// Add a from-to item to "gap". Used for REP and SAL items.
5317// They are stored case-folded.
5318static void add_fromto(spellinfo_T *spin, garray_T *gap, char_u *from, char_u *to)
5319{
5320 char_u word[MAXWLEN250];
5321
5322 fromto_T *ftp = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(fromto_T, gap)ga_append_via_ptr(gap, sizeof(fromto_T));
5323 (void)spell_casefold(from, (int)STRLEN(from)strlen((char *)(from)), word, MAXWLEN250);
5324 ftp->ft_from = getroom_save(spin, word);
5325 (void)spell_casefold(to, (int)STRLEN(to)strlen((char *)(to)), word, MAXWLEN250);
5326 ftp->ft_to = getroom_save(spin, word);
5327}
5328
5329// Converts a boolean argument in a SAL line to true or false;
5330static bool_Bool sal_to_bool(char_u *s)
5331{
5332 return STRCMP(s, "1")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("1")) == 0 || STRCMP(s, "true")strcmp((char *)(s), (char *)("true")) == 0;
5333}
5334
5335// Free the structure filled by spell_read_aff().
5336static void spell_free_aff(afffile_T *aff)
5337{
5338 hashtab_T *ht;
5339 hashitem_T *hi;
5340 int todo;
5341 affheader_T *ah;
5342 affentry_T *ae;
5343
5344 free(aff->af_enc);
5345
5346 // All this trouble to free the "ae_prog" items...
5347 for (ht = &aff->af_pref;; ht = &aff->af_suff) {
5348 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
5349 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
5350 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5351 --todo;
5352 ah = HI2AH(hi)((affheader_T *)(hi)->hi_key);
5353 for (ae = ah->ah_first; ae != NULL((void*)0); ae = ae->ae_next)
5354 vim_regfree(ae->ae_prog);
5355 }
5356 }
5357 if (ht == &aff->af_suff)
5358 break;
5359 }
5360
5361 hash_clear(&aff->af_pref);
5362 hash_clear(&aff->af_suff);
5363 hash_clear(&aff->af_comp);
5364}
5365
5366// Read dictionary file "fname".
5367// Returns OK or FAIL;
5368static int spell_read_dic(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *fname, afffile_T *affile)
5369{
5370 hashtab_T ht;
5371 char_u line[MAXLINELEN500];
5372 char_u *p;
5373 char_u *afflist;
5374 char_u store_afflist[MAXWLEN250];
5375 int pfxlen;
5376 bool_Bool need_affix;
5377 char_u *dw;
5378 char_u *pc;
5379 char_u *w;
5380 int l;
5381 hash_T hash;
5382 hashitem_T *hi;
5383 FILE *fd;
5384 int lnum = 1;
5385 int non_ascii = 0;
5386 int retval = OK1;
5387 char_u message[MAXLINELEN500 + MAXWLEN250];
5388 int flags;
5389 int duplicate = 0;
5390
5391 // Open the file.
5392 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r"));
5393 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
5394 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
5395 return FAIL0;
5396 }
5397
5398 // The hashtable is only used to detect duplicated words.
5399 hash_init(&ht);
5400
5401 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
5402 _("Reading dictionary file %s ...")gettext((char *)("Reading dictionary file %s ...")), fname);
5403 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
5404
5405 // start with a message for the first line
5406 spin->si_msg_count = 999999;
5407
5408 // Read and ignore the first line: word count.
5409 (void)vim_fgets(line, MAXLINELEN500, fd);
5410 if (!vim_isdigit(*skipwhite(line)))
5411 EMSG2(_("E760: No word count in %s"), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E760: No word count in %s"
))), (char_u *)(fname));
5412
5413 // Read all the lines in the file one by one.
5414 // The words are converted to 'encoding' here, before being added to
5415 // the hashtable.
5416 while (!vim_fgets(line, MAXLINELEN500, fd) && !got_int) {
5417 line_breakcheck();
5418 ++lnum;
5419 if (line[0] == '#' || line[0] == '/')
5420 continue; // comment line
5421
5422 // Remove CR, LF and white space from the end. White space halfway
5423 // the word is kept to allow e.g., "et al.".
5424 l = (int)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line));
5425 while (l > 0 && line[l - 1] <= ' ')
5426 --l;
5427 if (l == 0)
5428 continue; // empty line
5429 line[l] = NUL'\000';
5430
5431 // Convert from "SET" to 'encoding' when needed.
5432 if (spin->si_conv.vc_type != CONV_NONE0) {
5433 pc = string_convert(&spin->si_conv, line, NULL((void*)0));
5434 if (pc == NULL((void*)0)) {
5435 smsg((char_u *)_("Conversion failure for word in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Conversion failure for word in %s line %d: %s"
)),
5436 fname, lnum, line);
5437 continue;
5438 }
5439 w = pc;
5440 } else {
5441 pc = NULL((void*)0);
5442 w = line;
5443 }
5444
5445 // Truncate the word at the "/", set "afflist" to what follows.
5446 // Replace "\/" by "/" and "\\" by "\".
5447 afflist = NULL((void*)0);
5448 for (p = w; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
5449 if (*p == '\\' && (p[1] == '\\' || p[1] == '/'))
5450 STRMOVE(p, p + 1)memmove((p), (p + 1), strlen((char *)(p + 1)) + 1);
5451 else if (*p == '/') {
5452 *p = NUL'\000';
5453 afflist = p + 1;
5454 break;
5455 }
5456 }
5457
5458 // Skip non-ASCII words when "spin->si_ascii" is true.
5459 if (spin->si_ascii && has_non_ascii(w)) {
5460 ++non_ascii;
5461 free(pc);
5462 continue;
5463 }
5464
5465 // This takes time, print a message every 10000 words.
5466 if (spin->si_verbose && spin->si_msg_count > 10000) {
5467 spin->si_msg_count = 0;
5468 vim_snprintf((char *)message, sizeof(message),
5469 _("line %6d, word %6d - %s")gettext((char *)("line %6d, word %6d - %s")),
5470 lnum, spin->si_foldwcount + spin->si_keepwcount, w);
5471 msg_start();
5472 msg_puts_long_attr(message, 0);
5473 msg_clr_eos();
5474 msg_didout = FALSE0;
5475 msg_col = 0;
5476 out_flush();
5477 }
5478
5479 // Store the word in the hashtable to be able to find duplicates.
5480 dw = (char_u *)getroom_save(spin, w);
5481 if (dw == NULL((void*)0)) {
5482 retval = FAIL0;
5483 free(pc);
5484 break;
5485 }
5486
5487 hash = hash_hash(dw);
5488 hi = hash_lookup(&ht, dw, hash);
5489 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5490 if (p_verbose > 0)
5491 smsg((char_u *)_("Duplicate word in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Duplicate word in %s line %d: %s")),
5492 fname, lnum, dw);
5493 else if (duplicate == 0)
5494 smsg((char_u *)_("First duplicate word in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("First duplicate word in %s line %d: %s")),
5495 fname, lnum, dw);
5496 ++duplicate;
5497 } else
5498 hash_add_item(&ht, hi, dw, hash);
5499
5500 flags = 0;
5501 store_afflist[0] = NUL'\000';
5502 pfxlen = 0;
5503 need_affix = false0;
5504 if (afflist != NULL((void*)0)) {
5505 // Extract flags from the affix list.
5506 flags |= get_affix_flags(affile, afflist);
5507
5508 if (affile->af_needaffix != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5509 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_needaffix))
5510 need_affix = true1;
5511
5512 if (affile->af_pfxpostpone)
5513 // Need to store the list of prefix IDs with the word.
5514 pfxlen = get_pfxlist(affile, afflist, store_afflist);
5515
5516 if (spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0))
5517 // Need to store the list of compound flags with the word.
5518 // Concatenate them to the list of prefix IDs.
5519 get_compflags(affile, afflist, store_afflist + pfxlen);
5520 }
5521
5522 // Add the word to the word tree(s).
5523 if (store_word(spin, dw, flags, spin->si_region,
5524 store_afflist, need_affix) == FAIL0)
5525 retval = FAIL0;
5526
5527 if (afflist != NULL((void*)0)) {
5528 // Find all matching suffixes and add the resulting words.
5529 // Additionally do matching prefixes that combine.
5530 if (store_aff_word(spin, dw, afflist, affile,
5531 &affile->af_suff, &affile->af_pref,
5532 CONDIT_SUF4, flags, store_afflist, pfxlen) == FAIL0)
5533 retval = FAIL0;
5534
5535 // Find all matching prefixes and add the resulting words.
5536 if (store_aff_word(spin, dw, afflist, affile,
5537 &affile->af_pref, NULL((void*)0),
5538 CONDIT_SUF4, flags, store_afflist, pfxlen) == FAIL0)
5539 retval = FAIL0;
5540 }
5541
5542 free(pc);
5543 }
5544
5545 if (duplicate > 0)
5546 smsg((char_u *)_("%d duplicate word(s) in %s")gettext((char *)("%d duplicate word(s) in %s")), duplicate, fname);
5547 if (spin->si_ascii && non_ascii > 0)
5548 smsg((char_u *)_("Ignored %d word(s) with non-ASCII characters in %s")gettext((char *)("Ignored %d word(s) with non-ASCII characters in %s"
)),
5549 non_ascii, fname);
5550 hash_clear(&ht);
5551
5552 fclose(fd);
5553 return retval;
5554}
5555
5556// Check for affix flags in "afflist" that are turned into word flags.
5557// Return WF_ flags.
5558static int get_affix_flags(afffile_T *affile, char_u *afflist)
5559{
5560 int flags = 0;
5561
5562 if (affile->af_keepcase != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5563 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_keepcase))
5564 flags |= WF_KEEPCAP0x80 | WF_FIXCAP0x40;
5565 if (affile->af_rare != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5566 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_rare))
5567 flags |= WF_RARE0x08;
5568 if (affile->af_bad != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5569 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_bad))
5570 flags |= WF_BANNED0x10;
5571 if (affile->af_needcomp != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5572 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_needcomp))
5573 flags |= WF_NEEDCOMP0x0200;
5574 if (affile->af_comproot != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5575 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_comproot))
5576 flags |= WF_COMPROOT0x0800;
5577 if (affile->af_nosuggest != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5578 affile->af_flagtype, afflist, affile->af_nosuggest))
5579 flags |= WF_NOSUGGEST0x0400;
5580 return flags;
5581}
5582
5583// Get the list of prefix IDs from the affix list "afflist".
5584// Used for PFXPOSTPONE.
5585// Put the resulting flags in "store_afflist[MAXWLEN]" with a terminating NUL
5586// and return the number of affixes.
5587static int get_pfxlist(afffile_T *affile, char_u *afflist, char_u *store_afflist)
5588{
5589 char_u *p;
5590 char_u *prevp;
5591 int cnt = 0;
5592 int id;
5593 char_u key[AH_KEY_LEN17];
5594 hashitem_T *hi;
5595
5596 for (p = afflist; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
5597 prevp = p;
5598 if (get_affitem(affile->af_flagtype, &p) != 0) {
5599 // A flag is a postponed prefix flag if it appears in "af_pref"
5600 // and it's ID is not zero.
5601 STRLCPY(key, prevp, p - prevp + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(key), (char *)(prevp), (size_t)(p - prevp +
1));
5602 hi = hash_find(&affile->af_pref, key);
5603 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5604 id = HI2AH(hi)((affheader_T *)(hi)->hi_key)->ah_newID;
5605 if (id != 0)
5606 store_afflist[cnt++] = id;
5607 }
5608 }
5609 if (affile->af_flagtype == AFT_NUM3 && *p == ',')
5610 ++p;
5611 }
5612
5613 store_afflist[cnt] = NUL'\000';
5614 return cnt;
5615}
5616
5617// Get the list of compound IDs from the affix list "afflist" that are used
5618// for compound words.
5619// Puts the flags in "store_afflist[]".
5620static void get_compflags(afffile_T *affile, char_u *afflist, char_u *store_afflist)
5621{
5622 char_u *p;
5623 char_u *prevp;
5624 int cnt = 0;
5625 char_u key[AH_KEY_LEN17];
5626 hashitem_T *hi;
5627
5628 for (p = afflist; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
5629 prevp = p;
5630 if (get_affitem(affile->af_flagtype, &p) != 0) {
5631 // A flag is a compound flag if it appears in "af_comp".
5632 STRLCPY(key, prevp, p - prevp + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(key), (char *)(prevp), (size_t)(p - prevp +
1));
5633 hi = hash_find(&affile->af_comp, key);
5634 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
5635 store_afflist[cnt++] = HI2CI(hi)((compitem_T *)(hi)->hi_key)->ci_newID;
5636 }
5637 if (affile->af_flagtype == AFT_NUM3 && *p == ',')
5638 ++p;
5639 }
5640
5641 store_afflist[cnt] = NUL'\000';
5642}
5643
5644// Apply affixes to a word and store the resulting words.
5645// "ht" is the hashtable with affentry_T that need to be applied, either
5646// prefixes or suffixes.
5647// "xht", when not NULL, is the prefix hashtable, to be used additionally on
5648// the resulting words for combining affixes.
5649//
5650// Returns FAIL when out of memory.
5651static int
5652store_aff_word (
5653 spellinfo_T *spin, // spell info
5654 char_u *word, // basic word start
5655 char_u *afflist, // list of names of supported affixes
5656 afffile_T *affile,
5657 hashtab_T *ht,
5658 hashtab_T *xht,
5659 int condit, // CONDIT_SUF et al.
5660 int flags, // flags for the word
5661 char_u *pfxlist, // list of prefix IDs
5662 int pfxlen // nr of flags in "pfxlist" for prefixes, rest
5663 // is compound flags
5664)
5665{
5666 int todo;
5667 hashitem_T *hi;
5668 affheader_T *ah;
5669 affentry_T *ae;
5670 regmatch_T regmatch;
5671 char_u newword[MAXWLEN250];
5672 int retval = OK1;
5673 int i, j;
5674 char_u *p;
5675 int use_flags;
5676 char_u *use_pfxlist;
5677 int use_pfxlen;
5678 bool_Bool need_affix;
5679 char_u store_afflist[MAXWLEN250];
5680 char_u pfx_pfxlist[MAXWLEN250];
5681 size_t wordlen = STRLEN(word)strlen((char *)(word));
5682 int use_condit;
5683
5684 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
5685 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0 && retval == OK1; ++hi) {
5686 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5687 --todo;
5688 ah = HI2AH(hi)((affheader_T *)(hi)->hi_key);
5689
5690 // Check that the affix combines, if required, and that the word
5691 // supports this affix.
5692 if (((condit & CONDIT_COMB1) == 0 || ah->ah_combine)
5693 && flag_in_afflist(affile->af_flagtype, afflist,
5694 ah->ah_flag)) {
5695 // Loop over all affix entries with this name.
5696 for (ae = ah->ah_first; ae != NULL((void*)0); ae = ae->ae_next) {
5697 // Check the condition. It's not logical to match case
5698 // here, but it is required for compatibility with
5699 // Myspell.
5700 // Another requirement from Myspell is that the chop
5701 // string is shorter than the word itself.
5702 // For prefixes, when "PFXPOSTPONE" was used, only do
5703 // prefixes with a chop string and/or flags.
5704 // When a previously added affix had CIRCUMFIX this one
5705 // must have it too, if it had not then this one must not
5706 // have one either.
5707 regmatch.regprog = ae->ae_prog;
5708 regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE0;
5709 if ((xht != NULL((void*)0) || !affile->af_pfxpostpone
5710 || ae->ae_chop != NULL((void*)0)
5711 || ae->ae_flags != NULL((void*)0))
5712 && (ae->ae_chop == NULL((void*)0)
5713 || STRLEN(ae->ae_chop)strlen((char *)(ae->ae_chop)) < wordlen)
5714 && (ae->ae_prog == NULL((void*)0)
5715 || vim_regexec(&regmatch, word, (colnr_T)0))
5716 && (((condit & CONDIT_CFIX2) == 0)
5717 == ((condit & CONDIT_AFF8) == 0
5718 || ae->ae_flags == NULL((void*)0)
5719 || !flag_in_afflist(affile->af_flagtype,
5720 ae->ae_flags, affile->af_circumfix)))) {
5721 // Match. Remove the chop and add the affix.
5722 if (xht == NULL((void*)0)) {
5723 // prefix: chop/add at the start of the word
5724 if (ae->ae_add == NULL((void*)0))
5725 *newword = NUL'\000';
5726 else
5727 STRLCPY(newword, ae->ae_add, MAXWLEN)xstrlcpy((char *)(newword), (char *)(ae->ae_add), (size_t)
(250));
5728 p = word;
5729 if (ae->ae_chop != NULL((void*)0)) {
5730 // Skip chop string.
5731 if (has_mbyte) {
5732 i = mb_charlen(ae->ae_chop);
5733 for (; i > 0; --i)
5734 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
5735 } else
5736 p += STRLEN(ae->ae_chop)strlen((char *)(ae->ae_chop));
5737 }
5738 STRCAT(newword, p)strcat((char *)(newword), (char *)(p));
5739 } else {
5740 // suffix: chop/add at the end of the word
5741 STRLCPY(newword, word, MAXWLEN)xstrlcpy((char *)(newword), (char *)(word), (size_t)(250));
5742 if (ae->ae_chop != NULL((void*)0)) {
5743 // Remove chop string.
5744 p = newword + STRLEN(newword)strlen((char *)(newword));
5745 i = (int)MB_CHARLEN(ae->ae_chop)(has_mbyte ? mb_charlen(ae->ae_chop) : (int)strlen((char *
)(ae->ae_chop)));
5746 for (; i > 0; --i)
5747 mb_ptr_back(newword, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(newword, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
5748 *p = NUL'\000';
5749 }
5750 if (ae->ae_add != NULL((void*)0))
5751 STRCAT(newword, ae->ae_add)strcat((char *)(newword), (char *)(ae->ae_add));
5752 }
5753
5754 use_flags = flags;
5755 use_pfxlist = pfxlist;
5756 use_pfxlen = pfxlen;
5757 need_affix = false0;
5758 use_condit = condit | CONDIT_COMB1 | CONDIT_AFF8;
5759 if (ae->ae_flags != NULL((void*)0)) {
5760 // Extract flags from the affix list.
5761 use_flags |= get_affix_flags(affile, ae->ae_flags);
5762
5763 if (affile->af_needaffix != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5764 affile->af_flagtype, ae->ae_flags,
5765 affile->af_needaffix))
5766 need_affix = true1;
5767
5768 // When there is a CIRCUMFIX flag the other affix
5769 // must also have it and we don't add the word
5770 // with one affix.
5771 if (affile->af_circumfix != 0 && flag_in_afflist(
5772 affile->af_flagtype, ae->ae_flags,
5773 affile->af_circumfix)) {
5774 use_condit |= CONDIT_CFIX2;
5775 if ((condit & CONDIT_CFIX2) == 0)
5776 need_affix = true1;
5777 }
5778
5779 if (affile->af_pfxpostpone
5780 || spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0)) {
5781 if (affile->af_pfxpostpone)
5782 // Get prefix IDS from the affix list.
5783 use_pfxlen = get_pfxlist(affile,
5784 ae->ae_flags, store_afflist);
5785 else
5786 use_pfxlen = 0;
5787 use_pfxlist = store_afflist;
5788
5789 // Combine the prefix IDs. Avoid adding the
5790 // same ID twice.
5791 for (i = 0; i < pfxlen; ++i) {
5792 for (j = 0; j < use_pfxlen; ++j)
5793 if (pfxlist[i] == use_pfxlist[j])
5794 break;
5795 if (j == use_pfxlen)
5796 use_pfxlist[use_pfxlen++] = pfxlist[i];
5797 }
5798
5799 if (spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0))
5800 // Get compound IDS from the affix list.
5801 get_compflags(affile, ae->ae_flags,
5802 use_pfxlist + use_pfxlen);
5803
5804 // Combine the list of compound flags.
5805 // Concatenate them to the prefix IDs list.
5806 // Avoid adding the same ID twice.
5807 for (i = pfxlen; pfxlist[i] != NUL'\000'; ++i) {
5808 for (j = use_pfxlen;
5809 use_pfxlist[j] != NUL'\000'; ++j)
5810 if (pfxlist[i] == use_pfxlist[j])
5811 break;
5812 if (use_pfxlist[j] == NUL'\000') {
5813 use_pfxlist[j++] = pfxlist[i];
5814 use_pfxlist[j] = NUL'\000';
5815 }
5816 }
5817 }
5818 }
5819
5820 // Obey a "COMPOUNDFORBIDFLAG" of the affix: don't
5821 // use the compound flags.
5822 if (use_pfxlist != NULL((void*)0) && ae->ae_compforbid) {
5823 STRLCPY(pfx_pfxlist, use_pfxlist, use_pfxlen + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(pfx_pfxlist), (char *)(use_pfxlist), (size_t
)(use_pfxlen + 1));
5824 use_pfxlist = pfx_pfxlist;
5825 }
5826
5827 // When there are postponed prefixes...
5828 if (spin->si_prefroot != NULL((void*)0)
5829 && spin->si_prefroot->wn_sibling != NULL((void*)0)) {
5830 // ... add a flag to indicate an affix was used.
5831 use_flags |= WF_HAS_AFF0x0100;
5832
5833 // ... don't use a prefix list if combining
5834 // affixes is not allowed. But do use the
5835 // compound flags after them.
5836 if (!ah->ah_combine && use_pfxlist != NULL((void*)0))
5837 use_pfxlist += use_pfxlen;
5838 }
5839
5840 // When compounding is supported and there is no
5841 // "COMPOUNDPERMITFLAG" then forbid compounding on the
5842 // side where the affix is applied.
5843 if (spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0) && !ae->ae_comppermit) {
5844 if (xht != NULL((void*)0))
5845 use_flags |= WF_NOCOMPAFT0x2000;
5846 else
5847 use_flags |= WF_NOCOMPBEF0x1000;
5848 }
5849
5850 // Store the modified word.
5851 if (store_word(spin, newword, use_flags,
5852 spin->si_region, use_pfxlist,
5853 need_affix) == FAIL0)
5854 retval = FAIL0;
5855
5856 // When added a prefix or a first suffix and the affix
5857 // has flags may add a(nother) suffix. RECURSIVE!
5858 if ((condit & CONDIT_SUF4) && ae->ae_flags != NULL((void*)0))
5859 if (store_aff_word(spin, newword, ae->ae_flags,
5860 affile, &affile->af_suff, xht,
5861 use_condit & (xht == NULL((void*)0)
5862 ? ~0 : ~CONDIT_SUF4),
5863 use_flags, use_pfxlist, pfxlen) == FAIL0)
5864 retval = FAIL0;
5865
5866 // When added a suffix and combining is allowed also
5867 // try adding a prefix additionally. Both for the
5868 // word flags and for the affix flags. RECURSIVE!
5869 if (xht != NULL((void*)0) && ah->ah_combine) {
5870 if (store_aff_word(spin, newword,
5871 afflist, affile,
5872 xht, NULL((void*)0), use_condit,
5873 use_flags, use_pfxlist,
5874 pfxlen) == FAIL0
5875 || (ae->ae_flags != NULL((void*)0)
5876 && store_aff_word(spin, newword,
5877 ae->ae_flags, affile,
5878 xht, NULL((void*)0), use_condit,
5879 use_flags, use_pfxlist,
5880 pfxlen) == FAIL0))
5881 retval = FAIL0;
5882 }
5883 }
5884 }
5885 }
5886 }
5887 }
5888
5889 return retval;
5890}
5891
5892// Read a file with a list of words.
5893static int spell_read_wordfile(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *fname)
5894{
5895 FILE *fd;
5896 long lnum = 0;
5897 char_u rline[MAXLINELEN500];
5898 char_u *line;
5899 char_u *pc = NULL((void*)0);
5900 char_u *p;
5901 int l;
5902 int retval = OK1;
5903 bool_Bool did_word = false0;
5904 int non_ascii = 0;
5905 int flags;
5906 int regionmask;
5907
5908 // Open the file.
5909 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r"));
5910 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
5911 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
5912 return FAIL0;
5913 }
5914
5915 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Reading word file %s ...")gettext((char *)("Reading word file %s ...")), fname);
5916 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
5917
5918 // Read all the lines in the file one by one.
5919 while (!vim_fgets(rline, MAXLINELEN500, fd) && !got_int) {
5920 line_breakcheck();
5921 ++lnum;
5922
5923 // Skip comment lines.
5924 if (*rline == '#')
5925 continue;
5926
5927 // Remove CR, LF and white space from the end.
5928 l = (int)STRLEN(rline)strlen((char *)(rline));
5929 while (l > 0 && rline[l - 1] <= ' ')
5930 --l;
5931 if (l == 0)
5932 continue; // empty or blank line
5933 rline[l] = NUL'\000';
5934
5935 // Convert from "/encoding={encoding}" to 'encoding' when needed.
5936 free(pc);
5937 if (spin->si_conv.vc_type != CONV_NONE0) {
5938 pc = string_convert(&spin->si_conv, rline, NULL((void*)0));
5939 if (pc == NULL((void*)0)) {
5940 smsg((char_u *)_("Conversion failure for word in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Conversion failure for word in %s line %d: %s"
)),
5941 fname, lnum, rline);
5942 continue;
5943 }
5944 line = pc;
5945 } else {
5946 pc = NULL((void*)0);
5947 line = rline;
5948 }
5949
5950 if (*line == '/') {
5951 ++line;
5952 if (STRNCMP(line, "encoding=", 9)strncmp((char *)(line), (char *)("encoding="), (size_t)(9)) == 0) {
5953 if (spin->si_conv.vc_type != CONV_NONE0)
5954 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("Duplicate /encoding= line ignored in %s line %d: %s"
))
5955 "Duplicate /encoding= line ignored in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Duplicate /encoding= line ignored in %s line %d: %s"
)),
5956 fname, lnum, line - 1);
5957 else if (did_word)
5958 smsg((char_u *)_(gettext((char *)("/encoding= line after word ignored in %s line %d: %s"
))
5959 "/encoding= line after word ignored in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("/encoding= line after word ignored in %s line %d: %s"
)),
5960 fname, lnum, line - 1);
5961 else {
5962 char_u *enc;
5963
5964 // Setup for conversion to 'encoding'.
5965 line += 9;
5966 enc = enc_canonize(line);
5967 if (!spin->si_ascii
5968 && convert_setup(&spin->si_conv, enc,
5969 p_enc) == FAIL0)
5970 smsg((char_u *)_("Conversion in %s not supported: from %s to %s")gettext((char *)("Conversion in %s not supported: from %s to %s"
)),
5971 fname, line, p_enc);
5972 free(enc);
5973 spin->si_conv.vc_fail = true1;
5974 }
5975 continue;
5976 }
5977
5978 if (STRNCMP(line, "regions=", 8)strncmp((char *)(line), (char *)("regions="), (size_t)(8)) == 0) {
5979 if (spin->si_region_count > 1)
5980 smsg((char_u *)_("Duplicate /regions= line ignored in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Duplicate /regions= line ignored in %s line %d: %s"
)),
5981 fname, lnum, line);
5982 else {
5983 line += 8;
5984 if (STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) > 16)
5985 smsg((char_u *)_("Too many regions in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Too many regions in %s line %d: %s")),
5986 fname, lnum, line);
5987 else {
5988 spin->si_region_count = (int)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) / 2;
5989 STRCPY(spin->si_region_name, line)strcpy((char *)(spin->si_region_name), (char *)(line));
5990
5991 // Adjust the mask for a word valid in all regions.
5992 spin->si_region = (1 << spin->si_region_count) - 1;
5993 }
5994 }
5995 continue;
5996 }
5997
5998 smsg((char_u *)_("/ line ignored in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("/ line ignored in %s line %d: %s")),
5999 fname, lnum, line - 1);
6000 continue;
6001 }
6002
6003 flags = 0;
6004 regionmask = spin->si_region;
6005
6006 // Check for flags and region after a slash.
6007 p = vim_strchr(line, '/');
6008 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
6009 *p++ = NUL'\000';
6010 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
6011 if (*p == '=') // keep-case word
6012 flags |= WF_KEEPCAP0x80 | WF_FIXCAP0x40;
6013 else if (*p == '!') // Bad, bad, wicked word.
6014 flags |= WF_BANNED0x10;
6015 else if (*p == '?') // Rare word.
6016 flags |= WF_RARE0x08;
6017 else if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10)) { // region number(s)
6018 if ((flags & WF_REGION0x01) == 0) // first one
6019 regionmask = 0;
6020 flags |= WF_REGION0x01;
6021
6022 l = *p - '0';
6023 if (l > spin->si_region_count) {
6024 smsg((char_u *)_("Invalid region nr in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Invalid region nr in %s line %d: %s")),
6025 fname, lnum, p);
6026 break;
6027 }
6028 regionmask |= 1 << (l - 1);
6029 } else {
6030 smsg((char_u *)_("Unrecognized flags in %s line %d: %s")gettext((char *)("Unrecognized flags in %s line %d: %s")),
6031 fname, lnum, p);
6032 break;
6033 }
6034 ++p;
6035 }
6036 }
6037
6038 // Skip non-ASCII words when "spin->si_ascii" is true.
6039 if (spin->si_ascii && has_non_ascii(line)) {
6040 ++non_ascii;
6041 continue;
6042 }
6043
6044 // Normal word: store it.
6045 if (store_word(spin, line, flags, regionmask, NULL((void*)0), false0) == FAIL0) {
6046 retval = FAIL0;
6047 break;
6048 }
6049 did_word = true1;
6050 }
6051
6052 free(pc);
6053 fclose(fd);
6054
6055 if (spin->si_ascii && non_ascii > 0) {
6056 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
6057 _("Ignored %d words with non-ASCII characters")gettext((char *)("Ignored %d words with non-ASCII characters"
)), non_ascii);
6058 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
6059 }
6060
6061 return retval;
6062}
6063
6064/// Get part of an sblock_T, "len" bytes long.
6065/// This avoids calling free() for every little struct we use (and keeping
6066/// track of them).
6067/// The memory is cleared to all zeros.
6068///
6069/// @param len Length needed.
6070/// @param align Align for pointer.
6071/// @return NULL when out of memory.
6072static void *getroom(spellinfo_T *spin, size_t len, bool_Bool align)
6073{
6074 char_u *p;
6075 sblock_T *bl = spin->si_blocks;
6076
6077 if (align && bl != NULL((void*)0))
6078 // Round size up for alignment. On some systems structures need to be
6079 // aligned to the size of a pointer (e.g., SPARC).
6080 bl->sb_used = (bl->sb_used + sizeof(char *) - 1)
6081 & ~(sizeof(char *) - 1);
6082
6083 if (bl == NULL((void*)0) || bl->sb_used + len > SBLOCKSIZE16000) {
2
←
Assuming 'bl' is equal to null
→
6084 if (len >= SBLOCKSIZE16000)
3
←
Assuming 'len' is >= 16000
→
4
←
Taking true branch
→
6085 bl = NULL((void*)0);
5
←
Null pointer value stored to 'bl'
→
6086 else
6087 // Allocate a block of memory. It is not freed until much later.
6088 bl = xcalloc(1, (sizeof(sblock_T) + SBLOCKSIZE16000));
6089 bl->sb_next = spin->si_blocks;
6
←
Access to field 'sb_next' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from variable 'bl')
6090 spin->si_blocks = bl;
6091 bl->sb_used = 0;
6092 ++spin->si_blocks_cnt;
6093 }
6094
6095 p = bl->sb_data + bl->sb_used;
6096 bl->sb_used += (int)len;
6097
6098 return p;
6099}
6100
6101// Make a copy of a string into memory allocated with getroom().
6102// Returns NULL when out of memory.
6103static char_u *getroom_save(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *s)
6104{
6105 char_u *sc;
6106
6107 sc = (char_u *)getroom(spin, STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)) + 1, false0);
1
Calling 'getroom'
→
6108 if (sc != NULL((void*)0))
6109 STRCPY(sc, s)strcpy((char *)(sc), (char *)(s));
6110 return sc;
6111}
6112
6113
6114// Free the list of allocated sblock_T.
6115static void free_blocks(sblock_T *bl)
6116{
6117 sblock_T *next;
6118
6119 while (bl != NULL((void*)0)) {
6120 next = bl->sb_next;
6121 free(bl);
6122 bl = next;
6123 }
6124}
6125
6126// Allocate the root of a word tree.
6127// Returns NULL when out of memory.
6128static wordnode_T *wordtree_alloc(spellinfo_T *spin)
6129{
6130 return (wordnode_T *)getroom(spin, sizeof(wordnode_T), true1);
6131}
6132
6133// Store a word in the tree(s).
6134// Always store it in the case-folded tree. For a keep-case word this is
6135// useful when the word can also be used with all caps (no WF_FIXCAP flag) and
6136// used to find suggestions.
6137// For a keep-case word also store it in the keep-case tree.
6138// When "pfxlist" is not NULL store the word for each postponed prefix ID and
6139// compound flag.
6140static int
6141store_word (
6142 spellinfo_T *spin,
6143 char_u *word,
6144 int flags, // extra flags, WF_BANNED
6145 int region, // supported region(s)
6146 char_u *pfxlist, // list of prefix IDs or NULL
6147 bool_Bool need_affix // only store word with affix ID
6148)
6149{
6150 int len = (int)STRLEN(word)strlen((char *)(word));
6151 int ct = captype(word, word + len);
6152 char_u foldword[MAXWLEN250];
6153 int res = OK1;
6154 char_u *p;
6155
6156 (void)spell_casefold(word, len, foldword, MAXWLEN250);
6157 for (p = pfxlist; res == OK1; ++p) {
6158 if (!need_affix || (p != NULL((void*)0) && *p != NUL'\000'))
6159 res = tree_add_word(spin, foldword, spin->si_foldroot, ct | flags,
6160 region, p == NULL((void*)0) ? 0 : *p);
6161 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || *p == NUL'\000')
6162 break;
6163 }
6164 ++spin->si_foldwcount;
6165
6166 if (res == OK1 && (ct == WF_KEEPCAP0x80 || (flags & WF_KEEPCAP0x80))) {
6167 for (p = pfxlist; res == OK1; ++p) {
6168 if (!need_affix || (p != NULL((void*)0) && *p != NUL'\000'))
6169 res = tree_add_word(spin, word, spin->si_keeproot, flags,
6170 region, p == NULL((void*)0) ? 0 : *p);
6171 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || *p == NUL'\000')
6172 break;
6173 }
6174 ++spin->si_keepwcount;
6175 }
6176 return res;
6177}
6178
6179// Add word "word" to a word tree at "root".
6180// When "flags" < 0 we are adding to the prefix tree where "flags" is used for
6181// "rare" and "region" is the condition nr.
6182// Returns FAIL when out of memory.
6183static int tree_add_word(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *word, wordnode_T *root, int flags, int region, int affixID)
6184{
6185 wordnode_T *node = root;
6186 wordnode_T *np;
6187 wordnode_T *copyp, **copyprev;
6188 wordnode_T **prev = NULL((void*)0);
6189 int i;
6190
6191 // Add each byte of the word to the tree, including the NUL at the end.
6192 for (i = 0;; ++i) {
6193 // When there is more than one reference to this node we need to make
6194 // a copy, so that we can modify it. Copy the whole list of siblings
6195 // (we don't optimize for a partly shared list of siblings).
6196 if (node != NULL((void*)0) && node->wn_refs > 1) {
6197 --node->wn_refs;
6198 copyprev = prev;
6199 for (copyp = node; copyp != NULL((void*)0); copyp = copyp->wn_sibling) {
6200 // Allocate a new node and copy the info.
6201 np = get_wordnode(spin);
6202 if (np == NULL((void*)0))
6203 return FAIL0;
6204 np->wn_child = copyp->wn_child;
6205 if (np->wn_child != NULL((void*)0))
6206 ++np->wn_child->wn_refs; // child gets extra ref
6207 np->wn_byte = copyp->wn_byte;
6208 if (np->wn_byte == NUL'\000') {
6209 np->wn_flags = copyp->wn_flags;
6210 np->wn_region = copyp->wn_region;
6211 np->wn_affixID = copyp->wn_affixID;
6212 }
6213
6214 // Link the new node in the list, there will be one ref.
6215 np->wn_refs = 1;
6216 if (copyprev != NULL((void*)0))
6217 *copyprev = np;
6218 copyprev = &np->wn_sibling;
6219
6220 // Let "node" point to the head of the copied list.
6221 if (copyp == node)
6222 node = np;
6223 }
6224 }
6225
6226 // Look for the sibling that has the same character. They are sorted
6227 // on byte value, thus stop searching when a sibling is found with a
6228 // higher byte value. For zero bytes (end of word) the sorting is
6229 // done on flags and then on affixID.
6230 while (node != NULL((void*)0)
6231 && (node->wn_byte < word[i]
6232 || (node->wn_byte == NUL'\000'
6233 && (flags < 0
6234 ? node->wn_affixID < (unsigned)affixID
6235 : (node->wn_flags < (unsigned)(flags & WN_MASK0xffff)
6236 || (node->wn_flags == (flags & WN_MASK0xffff)
6237 && (spin->si_sugtree
6238 ? (node->wn_region & 0xffff) < region
6239 : node->wn_affixID
6240 < (unsigned)affixID))))))) {
6241 prev = &node->wn_sibling;
6242 node = *prev;
6243 }
6244 if (node == NULL((void*)0)
6245 || node->wn_byte != word[i]
6246 || (word[i] == NUL'\000'
6247 && (flags < 0
6248 || spin->si_sugtree
6249 || node->wn_flags != (flags & WN_MASK0xffff)
6250 || node->wn_affixID != affixID))) {
6251 // Allocate a new node.
6252 np = get_wordnode(spin);
6253 if (np == NULL((void*)0))
6254 return FAIL0;
6255 np->wn_byte = word[i];
6256
6257 // If "node" is NULL this is a new child or the end of the sibling
6258 // list: ref count is one. Otherwise use ref count of sibling and
6259 // make ref count of sibling one (matters when inserting in front
6260 // of the list of siblings).
6261 if (node == NULL((void*)0))
6262 np->wn_refs = 1;
6263 else {
6264 np->wn_refs = node->wn_refs;
6265 node->wn_refs = 1;
6266 }
6267 if (prev != NULL((void*)0))
6268 *prev = np;
6269 np->wn_sibling = node;
6270 node = np;
6271 }
6272
6273 if (word[i] == NUL'\000') {
6274 node->wn_flags = flags;
6275 node->wn_region |= region;
6276 node->wn_affixID = affixID;
6277 break;
6278 }
6279 prev = &node->wn_child;
6280 node = *prev;
6281 }
6282#ifdef SPELL_PRINTTREE
6283 smsg("Added \"%s\"", word);
6284 spell_print_tree(root->wn_sibling);
6285#endif
6286
6287 // count nr of words added since last message
6288 ++spin->si_msg_count;
6289
6290 if (spin->si_compress_cnt > 1) {
6291 if (--spin->si_compress_cnt == 1)
6292 // Did enough words to lower the block count limit.
6293 spin->si_blocks_cnt += compress_inc;
6294 }
6295
6296 // When we have allocated lots of memory we need to compress the word tree
6297 // to free up some room. But compression is slow, and we might actually
6298 // need that room, thus only compress in the following situations:
6299 // 1. When not compressed before (si_compress_cnt == 0): when using
6300 // "compress_start" blocks.
6301 // 2. When compressed before and used "compress_inc" blocks before
6302 // adding "compress_added" words (si_compress_cnt > 1).
6303 // 3. When compressed before, added "compress_added" words
6304 // (si_compress_cnt == 1) and the number of free nodes drops below the
6305 // maximum word length.
6306#ifndef SPELL_PRINTTREE
6307 if (spin->si_compress_cnt == 1
6308 ? spin->si_free_count < MAXWLEN250
6309 : spin->si_blocks_cnt >= compress_start)
6310#endif
6311 {
6312 // Decrement the block counter. The effect is that we compress again
6313 // when the freed up room has been used and another "compress_inc"
6314 // blocks have been allocated. Unless "compress_added" words have
6315 // been added, then the limit is put back again.
6316 spin->si_blocks_cnt -= compress_inc;
6317 spin->si_compress_cnt = compress_added;
6318
6319 if (spin->si_verbose) {
6320 msg_start();
6321 msg_puts((char_u *)_(msg_compressing)gettext((char *)(msg_compressing)));
6322 msg_clr_eos();
6323 msg_didout = FALSE0;
6324 msg_col = 0;
6325 out_flush();
6326 }
6327
6328 // Compress both trees. Either they both have many nodes, which makes
6329 // compression useful, or one of them is small, which means
6330 // compression goes fast. But when filling the soundfold word tree
6331 // there is no keep-case tree.
6332 wordtree_compress(spin, spin->si_foldroot);
6333 if (affixID >= 0)
6334 wordtree_compress(spin, spin->si_keeproot);
6335 }
6336
6337 return OK1;
6338}
6339
6340// Check the 'mkspellmem' option. Return FAIL if it's wrong.
6341// Sets "sps_flags".
6342int spell_check_msm(void)
6343{
6344 char_u *p = p_msm;
6345 long start = 0;
6346 long incr = 0;
6347 long added = 0;
6348
6349 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10))
6350 return FAIL0;
6351 // block count = (value * 1024) / SBLOCKSIZE (but avoid overflow)
6352 start = (getdigits(&p) * 10) / (SBLOCKSIZE16000 / 102);
6353 if (*p != ',')
6354 return FAIL0;
6355 ++p;
6356 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10))
6357 return FAIL0;
6358 incr = (getdigits(&p) * 102) / (SBLOCKSIZE16000 / 10);
6359 if (*p != ',')
6360 return FAIL0;
6361 ++p;
6362 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10))
6363 return FAIL0;
6364 added = getdigits(&p) * 1024;
6365 if (*p != NUL'\000')
6366 return FAIL0;
6367
6368 if (start == 0 || incr == 0 || added == 0 || incr > start)
6369 return FAIL0;
6370
6371 compress_start = start;
6372 compress_inc = incr;
6373 compress_added = added;
6374 return OK1;
6375}
6376
6377// Get a wordnode_T, either from the list of previously freed nodes or
6378// allocate a new one.
6379// Returns NULL when out of memory.
6380static wordnode_T *get_wordnode(spellinfo_T *spin)
6381{
6382 wordnode_T *n;
6383
6384 if (spin->si_first_free == NULL((void*)0))
6385 n = (wordnode_T *)getroom(spin, sizeof(wordnode_T), true1);
6386 else {
6387 n = spin->si_first_free;
6388 spin->si_first_free = n->wn_child;
6389 memset(n, 0, sizeof(wordnode_T));
6390 --spin->si_free_count;
6391 }
6392#ifdef SPELL_PRINTTREE
6393 if (n != NULL((void*)0))
6394 n->wn_nr = ++spin->si_wordnode_nr;
6395#endif
6396 return n;
6397}
6398
6399// Decrement the reference count on a node (which is the head of a list of
6400// siblings). If the reference count becomes zero free the node and its
6401// siblings.
6402// Returns the number of nodes actually freed.
6403static int deref_wordnode(spellinfo_T *spin, wordnode_T *node)
6404{
6405 wordnode_T *np;
6406 int cnt = 0;
6407
6408 if (--node->wn_refs == 0) {
6409 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling) {
6410 if (np->wn_child != NULL((void*)0))
6411 cnt += deref_wordnode(spin, np->wn_child);
6412 free_wordnode(spin, np);
6413 ++cnt;
6414 }
6415 ++cnt; // length field
6416 }
6417 return cnt;
6418}
6419
6420// Free a wordnode_T for re-use later.
6421// Only the "wn_child" field becomes invalid.
6422static void free_wordnode(spellinfo_T *spin, wordnode_T *n)
6423{
6424 n->wn_child = spin->si_first_free;
6425 spin->si_first_free = n;
6426 ++spin->si_free_count;
6427}
6428
6429// Compress a tree: find tails that are identical and can be shared.
6430static void wordtree_compress(spellinfo_T *spin, wordnode_T *root)
6431{
6432 hashtab_T ht;
6433 int n;
6434 int tot = 0;
6435 int perc;
6436
6437 // Skip the root itself, it's not actually used. The first sibling is the
6438 // start of the tree.
6439 if (root->wn_sibling != NULL((void*)0)) {
6440 hash_init(&ht);
6441 n = node_compress(spin, root->wn_sibling, &ht, &tot);
6442
6443#ifndef SPELL_PRINTTREE
6444 if (spin->si_verbose || p_verbose > 2)
6445#endif
6446 {
6447 if (tot > 1000000)
6448 perc = (tot - n) / (tot / 100);
6449 else if (tot == 0)
6450 perc = 0;
6451 else
6452 perc = (tot - n) * 100 / tot;
6453 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
6454 _("Compressed %d of %d nodes; %d (%d%%) remaining")gettext((char *)("Compressed %d of %d nodes; %d (%d%%) remaining"
)),
6455 n, tot, tot - n, perc);
6456 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
6457 }
6458#ifdef SPELL_PRINTTREE
6459 spell_print_tree(root->wn_sibling);
6460#endif
6461 hash_clear(&ht);
6462 }
6463}
6464
6465// Compress a node, its siblings and its children, depth first.
6466// Returns the number of compressed nodes.
6467static int
6468node_compress (
6469 spellinfo_T *spin,
6470 wordnode_T *node,
6471 hashtab_T *ht,
6472 int *tot // total count of nodes before compressing,
6473 // incremented while going through the tree
6474)
6475{
6476 wordnode_T *np;
6477 wordnode_T *tp;
6478 wordnode_T *child;
6479 hash_T hash;
6480 hashitem_T *hi;
6481 int len = 0;
6482 unsigned nr, n;
6483 int compressed = 0;
6484
6485 // Go through the list of siblings. Compress each child and then try
6486 // finding an identical child to replace it.
6487 // Note that with "child" we mean not just the node that is pointed to,
6488 // but the whole list of siblings of which the child node is the first.
6489 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; np = np->wn_sibling) {
6490 ++len;
6491 if ((child = np->wn_child) != NULL((void*)0)) {
6492 // Compress the child first. This fills hashkey.
6493 compressed += node_compress(spin, child, ht, tot);
6494
6495 // Try to find an identical child.
6496 hash = hash_hash(child->wn_u1.hashkey);
6497 hi = hash_lookup(ht, child->wn_u1.hashkey, hash);
6498 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
6499 // There are children we encountered before with a hash value
6500 // identical to the current child. Now check if there is one
6501 // that is really identical.
6502 for (tp = HI2WN(hi)(wordnode_T *)((hi)->hi_key); tp != NULL((void*)0); tp = tp->wn_u2.next)
6503 if (node_equal(child, tp)) {
6504 // Found one! Now use that child in place of the
6505 // current one. This means the current child and all
6506 // its siblings is unlinked from the tree.
6507 ++tp->wn_refs;
6508 compressed += deref_wordnode(spin, child);
6509 np->wn_child = tp;
6510 break;
6511 }
6512 if (tp == NULL((void*)0)) {
6513 // No other child with this hash value equals the child of
6514 // the node, add it to the linked list after the first
6515 // item.
6516 tp = HI2WN(hi)(wordnode_T *)((hi)->hi_key);
6517 child->wn_u2.next = tp->wn_u2.next;
6518 tp->wn_u2.next = child;
6519 }
6520 } else
6521 // No other child has this hash value, add it to the
6522 // hashtable.
6523 hash_add_item(ht, hi, child->wn_u1.hashkey, hash);
6524 }
6525 }
6526 *tot += len + 1; // add one for the node that stores the length
6527
6528 // Make a hash key for the node and its siblings, so that we can quickly
6529 // find a lookalike node. This must be done after compressing the sibling
6530 // list, otherwise the hash key would become invalid by the compression.
6531 node->wn_u1.hashkey[0] = len;
6532 nr = 0;
6533 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling) {
6534 if (np->wn_byte == NUL'\000')
6535 // end node: use wn_flags, wn_region and wn_affixID
6536 n = np->wn_flags + (np->wn_region << 8) + (np->wn_affixID << 16);
6537 else
6538 // byte node: use the byte value and the child pointer
6539 n = (unsigned)(np->wn_byte + ((long_u)np->wn_child << 8));
6540 nr = nr * 101 + n;
6541 }
6542
6543 // Avoid NUL bytes, it terminates the hash key.
6544 n = nr & 0xff;
6545 node->wn_u1.hashkey[1] = n == 0 ? 1 : n;
6546 n = (nr >> 8) & 0xff;
6547 node->wn_u1.hashkey[2] = n == 0 ? 1 : n;
6548 n = (nr >> 16) & 0xff;
6549 node->wn_u1.hashkey[3] = n == 0 ? 1 : n;
6550 n = (nr >> 24) & 0xff;
6551 node->wn_u1.hashkey[4] = n == 0 ? 1 : n;
6552 node->wn_u1.hashkey[5] = NUL'\000';
6553
6554 // Check for CTRL-C pressed now and then.
6555 fast_breakcheck();
6556
6557 return compressed;
6558}
6559
6560// Returns true when two nodes have identical siblings and children.
6561static bool_Bool node_equal(wordnode_T *n1, wordnode_T *n2)
6562{
6563 wordnode_T *p1;
6564 wordnode_T *p2;
6565
6566 for (p1 = n1, p2 = n2; p1 != NULL((void*)0) && p2 != NULL((void*)0);
6567 p1 = p1->wn_sibling, p2 = p2->wn_sibling)
6568 if (p1->wn_byte != p2->wn_byte
6569 || (p1->wn_byte == NUL'\000'
6570 ? (p1->wn_flags != p2->wn_flags
6571 || p1->wn_region != p2->wn_region
6572 || p1->wn_affixID != p2->wn_affixID)
6573 : (p1->wn_child != p2->wn_child)))
6574 break;
6575
6576 return p1 == NULL((void*)0) && p2 == NULL((void*)0);
6577}
6578
6579
6580// Function given to qsort() to sort the REP items on "from" string.
6581static int rep_compare(const void *s1, const void *s2)
6582{
6583 fromto_T *p1 = (fromto_T *)s1;
6584 fromto_T *p2 = (fromto_T *)s2;
6585
6586 return STRCMP(p1->ft_from, p2->ft_from)strcmp((char *)(p1->ft_from), (char *)(p2->ft_from));
6587}
6588
6589// Write the Vim .spl file "fname".
6590// Return FAIL or OK;
6591static int write_vim_spell(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *fname)
6592{
6593 FILE *fd;
6594 int regionmask;
6595 int round;
6596 wordnode_T *tree;
6597 int nodecount;
6598 int i;
6599 int l;
6600 garray_T *gap;
6601 fromto_T *ftp;
6602 char_u *p;
6603 int rr;
6604 int retval = OK1;
6605 size_t fwv = 1; // collect return value of fwrite() to avoid
6606 // warnings from picky compiler
6607
6608 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "w")fopen(((char *)fname), ("w"));
6609 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
6610 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
6611 return FAIL0;
6612 }
6613
6614 // <HEADER>: <fileID> <versionnr>
6615 // <fileID>
6616 fwv &= fwrite(VIMSPELLMAGIC"VIMspell", VIMSPELLMAGICL8, (size_t)1, fd);
6617 if (fwv != (size_t)1)
6618 // Catch first write error, don't try writing more.
6619 goto theend;
6620
6621 putc(VIMSPELLVERSION, fd)_IO_putc (50, fd); // <versionnr>
6622
6623 // <SECTIONS>: <section> ... <sectionend>
6624
6625 // SN_INFO: <infotext>
6626 if (spin->si_info != NULL((void*)0)) {
6627 putc(SN_INFO, fd)_IO_putc (15, fd); // <sectionID>
6628 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6629
6630 i = (int)STRLEN(spin->si_info)strlen((char *)(spin->si_info));
6631 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)i, 4); // <sectionlen>
6632 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_info, (size_t)i, (size_t)1, fd); // <infotext>
6633 }
6634
6635 // SN_REGION: <regionname> ...
6636 // Write the region names only if there is more than one.
6637 if (spin->si_region_count > 1) {
6638 putc(SN_REGION, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionID>
6639 putc(SNF_REQUIRED, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <sectionflags>
6640 l = spin->si_region_count * 2;
6641 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 4); // <sectionlen>
6642 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_region_name, (size_t)l, (size_t)1, fd);
6643 // <regionname> ...
6644 regionmask = (1 << spin->si_region_count) - 1;
6645 } else
6646 regionmask = 0;
6647
6648 // SN_CHARFLAGS: <charflagslen> <charflags> <folcharslen> <folchars>
6649 //
6650 // The table with character flags and the table for case folding.
6651 // This makes sure the same characters are recognized as word characters
6652 // when generating an when using a spell file.
6653 // Skip this for ASCII, the table may conflict with the one used for
6654 // 'encoding'.
6655 // Also skip this for an .add.spl file, the main spell file must contain
6656 // the table (avoids that it conflicts). File is shorter too.
6657 if (!spin->si_ascii && !spin->si_add) {
6658 char_u folchars[128 * 8];
6659 int flags;
6660
6661 putc(SN_CHARFLAGS, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <sectionID>
6662 putc(SNF_REQUIRED, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <sectionflags>
6663
6664 // Form the <folchars> string first, we need to know its length.
6665 l = 0;
6666 for (i = 128; i < 256; ++i) {
6667 if (has_mbyte)
6668 l += mb_char2bytes(spelltab.st_fold[i], folchars + l);
6669 else
6670 folchars[l++] = spelltab.st_fold[i];
6671 }
6672 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)(1 + 128 + 2 + l), 4); // <sectionlen>
6673
6674 fputc(128, fd); // <charflagslen>
6675 for (i = 128; i < 256; ++i) {
6676 flags = 0;
6677 if (spelltab.st_isw[i])
6678 flags |= CF_WORD0x01;
6679 if (spelltab.st_isu[i])
6680 flags |= CF_UPPER0x02;
6681 fputc(flags, fd); // <charflags>
6682 }
6683
6684 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 2); // <folcharslen>
6685 fwv &= fwrite(folchars, (size_t)l, (size_t)1, fd); // <folchars>
6686 }
6687
6688 // SN_MIDWORD: <midword>
6689 if (spin->si_midword != NULL((void*)0)) {
6690 putc(SN_MIDWORD, fd)_IO_putc (2, fd); // <sectionID>
6691 putc(SNF_REQUIRED, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <sectionflags>
6692
6693 i = (int)STRLEN(spin->si_midword)strlen((char *)(spin->si_midword));
6694 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)i, 4); // <sectionlen>
6695 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_midword, (size_t)i, (size_t)1, fd);
6696 // <midword>
6697 }
6698
6699 // SN_PREFCOND: <prefcondcnt> <prefcond> ...
6700 if (!GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_prefcond)((&spin->si_prefcond)->ga_len <= 0)) {
6701 putc(SN_PREFCOND, fd)_IO_putc (3, fd); // <sectionID>
6702 putc(SNF_REQUIRED, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <sectionflags>
6703
6704 l = write_spell_prefcond(NULL((void*)0), &spin->si_prefcond);
6705 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 4); // <sectionlen>
6706
6707 write_spell_prefcond(fd, &spin->si_prefcond);
6708 }
6709
6710 // SN_REP: <repcount> <rep> ...
6711 // SN_SAL: <salflags> <salcount> <sal> ...
6712 // SN_REPSAL: <repcount> <rep> ...
6713
6714 // round 1: SN_REP section
6715 // round 2: SN_SAL section (unless SN_SOFO is used)
6716 // round 3: SN_REPSAL section
6717 for (round = 1; round <= 3; ++round) {
6718 if (round == 1)
6719 gap = &spin->si_rep;
6720 else if (round == 2) {
6721 // Don't write SN_SAL when using a SN_SOFO section
6722 if (spin->si_sofofr != NULL((void*)0) && spin->si_sofoto != NULL((void*)0))
6723 continue;
6724 gap = &spin->si_sal;
6725 } else
6726 gap = &spin->si_repsal;
6727
6728 // Don't write the section if there are no items.
6729 if (GA_EMPTY(gap)((gap)->ga_len <= 0))
6730 continue;
6731
6732 // Sort the REP/REPSAL items.
6733 if (round != 2)
6734 qsort(gap->ga_data, (size_t)gap->ga_len,
6735 sizeof(fromto_T), rep_compare);
6736
6737 i = round == 1 ? SN_REP4 : (round == 2 ? SN_SAL5 : SN_REPSAL12);
6738 putc(i, fd)_IO_putc (i, fd); // <sectionID>
6739
6740 // This is for making suggestions, section is not required.
6741 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6742
6743 // Compute the length of what follows.
6744 l = 2; // count <repcount> or <salcount>
6745 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
6746 ftp = &((fromto_T *)gap->ga_data)[i];
6747 l += 1 + (int)STRLEN(ftp->ft_from)strlen((char *)(ftp->ft_from)); // count <*fromlen> and <*from>
6748 l += 1 + (int)STRLEN(ftp->ft_to)strlen((char *)(ftp->ft_to)); // count <*tolen> and <*to>
6749 }
6750 if (round == 2)
6751 ++l; // count <salflags>
6752 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 4); // <sectionlen>
6753
6754 if (round == 2) {
6755 i = 0;
6756 if (spin->si_followup)
6757 i |= SAL_F0LLOWUP1;
6758 if (spin->si_collapse)
6759 i |= SAL_COLLAPSE2;
6760 if (spin->si_rem_accents)
6761 i |= SAL_REM_ACCENTS4;
6762 putc(i, fd)_IO_putc (i, fd); // <salflags>
6763 }
6764
6765 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)gap->ga_len, 2); // <repcount> or <salcount>
6766 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
6767 // <rep> : <repfromlen> <repfrom> <reptolen> <repto>
6768 // <sal> : <salfromlen> <salfrom> <saltolen> <salto>
6769 ftp = &((fromto_T *)gap->ga_data)[i];
6770 for (rr = 1; rr <= 2; ++rr) {
6771 p = rr == 1 ? ftp->ft_from : ftp->ft_to;
6772 l = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
6773 putc(l, fd)_IO_putc (l, fd);
6774 if (l > 0)
6775 fwv &= fwrite(p, l, (size_t)1, fd);
6776 }
6777 }
6778
6779 }
6780
6781 // SN_SOFO: <sofofromlen> <sofofrom> <sofotolen> <sofoto>
6782 // This is for making suggestions, section is not required.
6783 if (spin->si_sofofr != NULL((void*)0) && spin->si_sofoto != NULL((void*)0)) {
6784 putc(SN_SOFO, fd)_IO_putc (6, fd); // <sectionID>
6785 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6786
6787 l = (int)STRLEN(spin->si_sofofr)strlen((char *)(spin->si_sofofr));
6788 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)(l + STRLEN(spin->si_sofoto)strlen((char *)(spin->si_sofoto)) + 4), 4);
6789 // <sectionlen>
6790
6791 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 2); // <sofofromlen>
