6792 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_sofofr, l, (size_t)1, fd); // <sofofrom>
6793
6794 l = (int)STRLEN(spin->si_sofoto)strlen((char *)(spin->si_sofoto));
6795 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 2); // <sofotolen>
6796 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_sofoto, l, (size_t)1, fd); // <sofoto>
6797 }
6798
6799 // SN_WORDS: <word> ...
6800 // This is for making suggestions, section is not required.
6801 if (spin->si_commonwords.ht_used > 0) {
6802 putc(SN_WORDS, fd)_IO_putc (13, fd); // <sectionID>
6803 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6804
6805 // round 1: count the bytes
6806 // round 2: write the bytes
6807 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round) {
6808 int todo;
6809 int len = 0;
6810 hashitem_T *hi;
6811
6812 todo = (int)spin->si_commonwords.ht_used;
6813 for (hi = spin->si_commonwords.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi)
6814 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
6815 l = (int)STRLEN(hi->hi_key)strlen((char *)(hi->hi_key)) + 1;
6816 len += l;
6817 if (round == 2) // <word>
6818 fwv &= fwrite(hi->hi_key, (size_t)l, (size_t)1, fd);
6819 --todo;
6820 }
6821 if (round == 1)
6822 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)len, 4); // <sectionlen>
6823 }
6824 }
6825
6826 // SN_MAP: <mapstr>
6827 // This is for making suggestions, section is not required.
6828 if (!GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_map)((&spin->si_map)->ga_len <= 0)) {
6829 putc(SN_MAP, fd)_IO_putc (7, fd); // <sectionID>
6830 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6831 l = spin->si_map.ga_len;
6832 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 4); // <sectionlen>
6833 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_map.ga_data, (size_t)l, (size_t)1, fd);
6834 // <mapstr>
6835 }
6836
6837 // SN_SUGFILE: <timestamp>
6838 // This is used to notify that a .sug file may be available and at the
6839 // same time allows for checking that a .sug file that is found matches
6840 // with this .spl file. That's because the word numbers must be exactly
6841 // right.
6842 if (!spin->si_nosugfile
6843 && (!GA_EMPTY(&spin->si_sal)((&spin->si_sal)->ga_len <= 0)
6844 || (spin->si_sofofr != NULL((void*)0) && spin->si_sofoto != NULL((void*)0)))) {
6845 putc(SN_SUGFILE, fd)_IO_putc (11, fd); // <sectionID>
6846 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6847 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)8, 4); // <sectionlen>
6848
6849 // Set si_sugtime and write it to the file.
6850 spin->si_sugtime = time(NULL((void*)0));
6851 put_time(fd, spin->si_sugtime); // <timestamp>
6852 }
6853
6854 // SN_NOSPLITSUGS: nothing
6855 // This is used to notify that no suggestions with word splits are to be
6856 // made.
6857 if (spin->si_nosplitsugs) {
6858 putc(SN_NOSPLITSUGS, fd)_IO_putc (14, fd); // <sectionID>
6859 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6860 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)0, 4); // <sectionlen>
6861 }
6862
6863 // SN_COMPOUND: compound info.
6864 // We don't mark it required, when not supported all compound words will
6865 // be bad words.
6866 if (spin->si_compflags != NULL((void*)0)) {
6867 putc(SN_COMPOUND, fd)_IO_putc (8, fd); // <sectionID>
6868 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6869
6870 l = (int)STRLEN(spin->si_compflags)strlen((char *)(spin->si_compflags));
6871 for (int i = 0; i < spin->si_comppat.ga_len; ++i) {
6872 l += (int)STRLEN(((char_u **)(spin->si_comppat.ga_data))[i])strlen((char *)(((char_u **)(spin->si_comppat.ga_data))[i]
)) + 1;
6873 }
6874 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)(l + 7), 4); // <sectionlen>
6875
6876 putc(spin->si_compmax, fd)_IO_putc (spin->si_compmax, fd); // <compmax>
6877 putc(spin->si_compminlen, fd)_IO_putc (spin->si_compminlen, fd); // <compminlen>
6878 putc(spin->si_compsylmax, fd)_IO_putc (spin->si_compsylmax, fd); // <compsylmax>
6879 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // for Vim 7.0b compatibility
6880 putc(spin->si_compoptions, fd)_IO_putc (spin->si_compoptions, fd); // <compoptions>
6881 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)spin->si_comppat.ga_len, 2);
6882 // <comppatcount>
6883 for (int i = 0; i < spin->si_comppat.ga_len; ++i) {
6884 p = ((char_u **)(spin->si_comppat.ga_data))[i];
6885 putc((int)STRLEN(p), fd)_IO_putc ((int)strlen((char *)(p)), fd); // <comppatlen>
6886 fwv &= fwrite(p, (size_t)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)), (size_t)1, fd);
6887 // <comppattext>
6888 }
6889 // <compflags>
6890 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_compflags, (size_t)STRLEN(spin->si_compflags)strlen((char *)(spin->si_compflags)),
6891 (size_t)1, fd);
6892 }
6893
6894 // SN_NOBREAK: NOBREAK flag
6895 if (spin->si_nobreak) {
6896 putc(SN_NOBREAK, fd)_IO_putc (10, fd); // <sectionID>
6897 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6898
6899 // It's empty, the presence of the section flags the feature.
6900 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)0, 4); // <sectionlen>
6901 }
6902
6903 // SN_SYLLABLE: syllable info.
6904 // We don't mark it required, when not supported syllables will not be
6905 // counted.
6906 if (spin->si_syllable != NULL((void*)0)) {
6907 putc(SN_SYLLABLE, fd)_IO_putc (9, fd); // <sectionID>
6908 putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <sectionflags>
6909
6910 l = (int)STRLEN(spin->si_syllable)strlen((char *)(spin->si_syllable));
6911 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)l, 4); // <sectionlen>
6912 fwv &= fwrite(spin->si_syllable, (size_t)l, (size_t)1, fd);
6913 // <syllable>
6914 }
6915
6916 // end of <SECTIONS>
6917 putc(SN_END, fd)_IO_putc (255, fd); // <sectionend>
6918
6919
6920 // <LWORDTREE> <KWORDTREE> <PREFIXTREE>
6921 spin->si_memtot = 0;
6922 for (round = 1; round <= 3; ++round) {
6923 if (round == 1)
6924 tree = spin->si_foldroot->wn_sibling;
6925 else if (round == 2)
6926 tree = spin->si_keeproot->wn_sibling;
6927 else
6928 tree = spin->si_prefroot->wn_sibling;
6929
6930 // Clear the index and wnode fields in the tree.
6931 clear_node(tree);
6932
6933 // Count the number of nodes. Needed to be able to allocate the
6934 // memory when reading the nodes. Also fills in index for shared
6935 // nodes.
6936 nodecount = put_node(NULL((void*)0), tree, 0, regionmask, round == 3);
6937
6938 // number of nodes in 4 bytes
6939 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)nodecount, 4); // <nodecount>
6940 spin->si_memtot += nodecount + nodecount * sizeof(int);
6941
6942 // Write the nodes.
6943 (void)put_node(fd, tree, 0, regionmask, round == 3);
6944 }
6945
6946 // Write another byte to check for errors (file system full).
6947 if (putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd) == EOF(-1))
6948 retval = FAIL0;
6949theend:
6950 if (fclose(fd) == EOF(-1))
6951 retval = FAIL0;
6952
6953 if (fwv != (size_t)1)
6954 retval = FAIL0;
6955 if (retval == FAIL0)
6956 EMSG(_(e_write))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_write))));
6957
6958 return retval;
6959}
6960
6961// Clear the index and wnode fields of "node", it siblings and its
6962// children. This is needed because they are a union with other items to save
6963// space.
6964static void clear_node(wordnode_T *node)
6965{
6966 wordnode_T *np;
6967
6968 if (node != NULL((void*)0))
6969 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling) {
6970 np->wn_u1.index = 0;
6971 np->wn_u2.wnode = NULL((void*)0);
6972
6973 if (np->wn_byte != NUL'\000')
6974 clear_node(np->wn_child);
6975 }
6976}
6977
6978
6979// Dump a word tree at node "node".
6980//
6981// This first writes the list of possible bytes (siblings). Then for each
6982// byte recursively write the children.
6983//
6984// NOTE: The code here must match the code in read_tree_node(), since
6985// assumptions are made about the indexes (so that we don't have to write them
6986// in the file).
6987//
6988// Returns the number of nodes used.
6989static int
6990put_node (
6991 FILE *fd, // NULL when only counting
6992 wordnode_T *node,
6993 int idx,
6994 int regionmask,
6995 bool_Bool prefixtree // true for PREFIXTREE
6996)
6997{
6998 int newindex = idx;
6999 int siblingcount = 0;
7000 wordnode_T *np;
7001 int flags;
7002
7003 // If "node" is zero the tree is empty.
7004 if (node == NULL((void*)0))
7005 return 0;
7006
7007 // Store the index where this node is written.
7008 node->wn_u1.index = idx;
7009
7010 // Count the number of siblings.
7011 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling)
7012 ++siblingcount;
7013
7014 // Write the sibling count.
7015 if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
7016 putc(siblingcount, fd)_IO_putc (siblingcount, fd); // <siblingcount>
7017
7018 // Write each sibling byte and optionally extra info.
7019 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling) {
7020 if (np->wn_byte == 0) {
7021 if (fd != NULL((void*)0)) {
7022 // For a NUL byte (end of word) write the flags etc.
7023 if (prefixtree) {
7024 // In PREFIXTREE write the required affixID and the
7025 // associated condition nr (stored in wn_region). The
7026 // byte value is misused to store the "rare" and "not
7027 // combining" flags
7028 if (np->wn_flags == (uint16_t)PFX_FLAGS-256)
7029 putc(BY_NOFLAGS, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <byte>
7030 else {
7031 putc(BY_FLAGS, fd)_IO_putc (2, fd); // <byte>
7032 putc(np->wn_flags, fd)_IO_putc (np->wn_flags, fd); // <pflags>
7033 }
7034 putc(np->wn_affixID, fd)_IO_putc (np->wn_affixID, fd); // <affixID>
7035 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)np->wn_region, 2); // <prefcondnr>
7036 } else {
7037 // For word trees we write the flag/region items.
7038 flags = np->wn_flags;
7039 if (regionmask != 0 && np->wn_region != regionmask)
7040 flags |= WF_REGION0x01;
7041 if (np->wn_affixID != 0)
7042 flags |= WF_AFX0x20;
7043 if (flags == 0) {
7044 // word without flags or region
7045 putc(BY_NOFLAGS, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd); // <byte>
7046 } else {
7047 if (np->wn_flags >= 0x100) {
7048 putc(BY_FLAGS2, fd)_IO_putc (3, fd); // <byte>
7049 putc(flags, fd)_IO_putc (flags, fd); // <flags>
7050 putc((unsigned)flags >> 8, fd)_IO_putc ((unsigned)flags >> 8, fd); // <flags2>
7051 } else {
7052 putc(BY_FLAGS, fd)_IO_putc (2, fd); // <byte>
7053 putc(flags, fd)_IO_putc (flags, fd); // <flags>
7054 }
7055 if (flags & WF_REGION0x01)
7056 putc(np->wn_region, fd)_IO_putc (np->wn_region, fd); // <region>
7057 if (flags & WF_AFX0x20)
7058 putc(np->wn_affixID, fd)_IO_putc (np->wn_affixID, fd); // <affixID>
7059 }
7060 }
7061 }
7062 } else {
7063 if (np->wn_child->wn_u1.index != 0
7064 && np->wn_child->wn_u2.wnode != node) {
7065 // The child is written elsewhere, write the reference.
7066 if (fd != NULL((void*)0)) {
7067 putc(BY_INDEX, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <byte>
7068 // <nodeidx>
7069 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)np->wn_child->wn_u1.index, 3);
7070 }
7071 } else if (np->wn_child->wn_u2.wnode == NULL((void*)0))
7072 // We will write the child below and give it an index.
7073 np->wn_child->wn_u2.wnode = node;
7074
7075 if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
7076 if (putc(np->wn_byte, fd)_IO_putc (np->wn_byte, fd) == EOF(-1)) { // <byte> or <xbyte>
7077 EMSG(_(e_write))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_write))));
7078 return 0;
7079 }
7080 }
7081 }
7082
7083 // Space used in the array when reading: one for each sibling and one for
7084 // the count.
7085 newindex += siblingcount + 1;
7086
7087 // Recursively dump the children of each sibling.
7088 for (np = node; np != NULL((void*)0); np = np->wn_sibling)
7089 if (np->wn_byte != 0 && np->wn_child->wn_u2.wnode == node)
7090 newindex = put_node(fd, np->wn_child, newindex, regionmask,
7091 prefixtree);
7092
7093 return newindex;
7094}
7095
7096
7097// ":mkspell [-ascii] outfile infile ..."
7098// ":mkspell [-ascii] addfile"
7099void ex_mkspell(exarg_T *eap)
7100{
7101 int fcount;
7102 char_u **fnames;
7103 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
7104 bool_Bool ascii = false0;
7105
7106 if (STRNCMP(arg, "-ascii", 6)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("-ascii"), (size_t)(6)) == 0) {
7107 ascii = true1;
7108 arg = skipwhite(arg + 6);
7109 }
7110
7111 // Expand all the remaining arguments (e.g., $VIMRUNTIME).
7112 if (get_arglist_exp(arg, &fcount, &fnames, false0) == OK1) {
7113 mkspell(fcount, fnames, ascii, eap->forceit, false0);
7114 FreeWild(fcount, fnames);
7115 }
7116}
7117
7118// Create the .sug file.
7119// Uses the soundfold info in "spin".
7120// Writes the file with the name "wfname", with ".spl" changed to ".sug".
7121static void spell_make_sugfile(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *wfname)
7122{
7123 char_u *fname = NULL((void*)0);
7124 int len;
7125 slang_T *slang;
7126 bool_Bool free_slang = false0;
7127
7128 // Read back the .spl file that was written. This fills the required
7129 // info for soundfolding. This also uses less memory than the
7130 // pointer-linked version of the trie. And it avoids having two versions
7131 // of the code for the soundfolding stuff.
7132 // It might have been done already by spell_reload_one().
7133 for (slang = first_lang; slang != NULL((void*)0); slang = slang->sl_next)
7134 if (path_full_compare(wfname, slang->sl_fname, FALSE0) == kEqualFiles)
7135 break;
7136 if (slang == NULL((void*)0)) {
7137 spell_message(spin, (char_u *)_("Reading back spell file...")gettext((char *)("Reading back spell file...")));
7138 slang = spell_load_file(wfname, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), false0);
7139 if (slang == NULL((void*)0))
7140 return;
7141 free_slang = true1;
7142 }
7143
7144 // Clear the info in "spin" that is used.
7145 spin->si_blocks = NULL((void*)0);
7146 spin->si_blocks_cnt = 0;
7147 spin->si_compress_cnt = 0; // will stay at 0 all the time
7148 spin->si_free_count = 0;
7149 spin->si_first_free = NULL((void*)0);
7150 spin->si_foldwcount = 0;
7151
7152 // Go through the trie of good words, soundfold each word and add it to
7153 // the soundfold trie.
7154 spell_message(spin, (char_u *)_("Performing soundfolding...")gettext((char *)("Performing soundfolding...")));
7155 if (sug_filltree(spin, slang) == FAIL0)
7156 goto theend;
7157
7158 // Create the table which links each soundfold word with a list of the
7159 // good words it may come from. Creates buffer "spin->si_spellbuf".
7160 // This also removes the wordnr from the NUL byte entries to make
7161 // compression possible.
7162 if (sug_maketable(spin) == FAIL0)
7163 goto theend;
7164
7165 smsg((char_u *)_("Number of words after soundfolding: %" PRId64)gettext((char *)("Number of words after soundfolding: %" "l" "d"
)),
7166 (int64_t)spin->si_spellbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count);
7167
7168 // Compress the soundfold trie.
7169 spell_message(spin, (char_u *)_(msg_compressing)gettext((char *)(msg_compressing)));
7170 wordtree_compress(spin, spin->si_foldroot);
7171
7172 // Write the .sug file.
7173 // Make the file name by changing ".spl" to ".sug".
7174 fname = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
7175 STRLCPY(fname, wfname, MAXPATHL)xstrlcpy((char *)(fname), (char *)(wfname), (size_t)(4096));
7176 len = (int)STRLEN(fname)strlen((char *)(fname));
7177 fname[len - 2] = 'u';
7178 fname[len - 1] = 'g';
7179 sug_write(spin, fname);
7180
7181theend:
7182 free(fname);
7183 if (free_slang)
7184 slang_free(slang);
7185 free_blocks(spin->si_blocks);
7186 close_spellbuf(spin->si_spellbuf);
7187}
7188
7189// Build the soundfold trie for language "slang".
7190static int sug_filltree(spellinfo_T *spin, slang_T *slang)
7191{
7192 char_u *byts;
7193 idx_T *idxs;
7194 int depth;
7195 idx_T arridx[MAXWLEN250];
7196 int curi[MAXWLEN250];
7197 char_u tword[MAXWLEN250];
7198 char_u tsalword[MAXWLEN250];
7199 int c;
7200 idx_T n;
7201 unsigned words_done = 0;
7202 int wordcount[MAXWLEN250];
7203
7204 // We use si_foldroot for the soundfolded trie.
7205 spin->si_foldroot = wordtree_alloc(spin);
7206 if (spin->si_foldroot == NULL((void*)0))
7207 return FAIL0;
7208
7209 // Let tree_add_word() know we're adding to the soundfolded tree
7210 spin->si_sugtree = true1;
7211
7212 // Go through the whole case-folded tree, soundfold each word and put it
7213 // in the trie.
7214 byts = slang->sl_fbyts;
7215 idxs = slang->sl_fidxs;
7216
7217 arridx[0] = 0;
7218 curi[0] = 1;
7219 wordcount[0] = 0;
7220
7221 depth = 0;
7222 while (depth >= 0 && !got_int) {
7223 if (curi[depth] > byts[arridx[depth]]) {
7224 // Done all bytes at this node, go up one level.
7225 idxs[arridx[depth]] = wordcount[depth];
7226 if (depth > 0)
7227 wordcount[depth - 1] += wordcount[depth];
7228
7229 --depth;
7230 line_breakcheck();
7231 } else {
7232
7233 // Do one more byte at this node.
7234 n = arridx[depth] + curi[depth];
7235 ++curi[depth];
7236
7237 c = byts[n];
7238 if (c == 0) {
7239 // Sound-fold the word.
7240 tword[depth] = NUL'\000';
7241 spell_soundfold(slang, tword, true1, tsalword);
7242
7243 // We use the "flags" field for the MSB of the wordnr,
7244 // "region" for the LSB of the wordnr.
7245 if (tree_add_word(spin, tsalword, spin->si_foldroot,
7246 words_done >> 16, words_done & 0xffff,
7247 0) == FAIL0)
7248 return FAIL0;
7249
7250 ++words_done;
7251 ++wordcount[depth];
7252
7253 // Reset the block count each time to avoid compression
7254 // kicking in.
7255 spin->si_blocks_cnt = 0;
7256
7257 // Skip over any other NUL bytes (same word with different
7258 // flags).
7259 while (byts[n + 1] == 0) {
7260 ++n;
7261 ++curi[depth];
7262 }
7263 } else {
7264 // Normal char, go one level deeper.
7265 tword[depth++] = c;
7266 arridx[depth] = idxs[n];
7267 curi[depth] = 1;
7268 wordcount[depth] = 0;
7269 }
7270 }
7271 }
7272
7273 smsg((char_u *)_("Total number of words: %d")gettext((char *)("Total number of words: %d")), words_done);
7274
7275 return OK1;
7276}
7277
7278// Make the table that links each word in the soundfold trie to the words it
7279// can be produced from.
7280// This is not unlike lines in a file, thus use a memfile to be able to access
7281// the table efficiently.
7282// Returns FAIL when out of memory.
7283static int sug_maketable(spellinfo_T *spin)
7284{
7285 garray_T ga;
7286 int res = OK1;
7287
7288 // Allocate a buffer, open a memline for it and create the swap file
7289 // (uses a temp file, not a .swp file).
7290 spin->si_spellbuf = open_spellbuf();
7291
7292 // Use a buffer to store the line info, avoids allocating many small
7293 // pieces of memory.
7294 ga_init(&ga, 1, 100);
7295
7296 // recursively go through the tree
7297 if (sug_filltable(spin, spin->si_foldroot->wn_sibling, 0, &ga) == -1)
7298 res = FAIL0;
7299
7300 ga_clear(&ga);
7301 return res;
7302}
7303
7304// Fill the table for one node and its children.
7305// Returns the wordnr at the start of the node.
7306// Returns -1 when out of memory.
7307static int
7308sug_filltable (
7309 spellinfo_T *spin,
7310 wordnode_T *node,
7311 int startwordnr,
7312 garray_T *gap // place to store line of numbers
7313)
7314{
7315 wordnode_T *p, *np;
7316 int wordnr = startwordnr;
7317 int nr;
7318 int prev_nr;
7319
7320 for (p = node; p != NULL((void*)0); p = p->wn_sibling) {
7321 if (p->wn_byte == NUL'\000') {
7322 gap->ga_len = 0;
7323 prev_nr = 0;
7324 for (np = p; np != NULL((void*)0) && np->wn_byte == NUL'\000'; np = np->wn_sibling) {
7325 ga_grow(gap, 10);
7326
7327 nr = (np->wn_flags << 16) + (np->wn_region & 0xffff);
7328 // Compute the offset from the previous nr and store the
7329 // offset in a way that it takes a minimum number of bytes.
7330 // It's a bit like utf-8, but without the need to mark
7331 // following bytes.
7332 nr -= prev_nr;
7333 prev_nr += nr;
7334 gap->ga_len += offset2bytes(nr,
7335 (char_u *)gap->ga_data + gap->ga_len);
7336 }
7337
7338 // add the NUL byte
7339 ((char_u *)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len++] = NUL'\000';
7340
7341 if (ml_append_buf(spin->si_spellbuf, (linenr_T)wordnr,
7342 gap->ga_data, gap->ga_len, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
7343 return -1;
7344 ++wordnr;
7345
7346 // Remove extra NUL entries, we no longer need them. We don't
7347 // bother freeing the nodes, the won't be reused anyway.
7348 while (p->wn_sibling != NULL((void*)0) && p->wn_sibling->wn_byte == NUL'\000')
7349 p->wn_sibling = p->wn_sibling->wn_sibling;
7350
7351 // Clear the flags on the remaining NUL node, so that compression
7352 // works a lot better.
7353 p->wn_flags = 0;
7354 p->wn_region = 0;
7355 } else {
7356 wordnr = sug_filltable(spin, p->wn_child, wordnr, gap);
7357 if (wordnr == -1)
7358 return -1;
7359 }
7360 }
7361 return wordnr;
7362}
7363
7364// Convert an offset into a minimal number of bytes.
7365// Similar to utf_char2byters, but use 8 bits in followup bytes and avoid NUL
7366// bytes.
7367static int offset2bytes(int nr, char_u *buf)
7368{
7369 int rem;
7370 int b1, b2, b3, b4;
7371
7372 // Split the number in parts of base 255. We need to avoid NUL bytes.
7373 b1 = nr % 255 + 1;
7374 rem = nr / 255;
7375 b2 = rem % 255 + 1;
7376 rem = rem / 255;
7377 b3 = rem % 255 + 1;
7378 b4 = rem / 255 + 1;
7379
7380 if (b4 > 1 || b3 > 0x1f) { // 4 bytes
7381 buf[0] = 0xe0 + b4;
7382 buf[1] = b3;
7383 buf[2] = b2;
7384 buf[3] = b1;
7385 return 4;
7386 }
7387 if (b3 > 1 || b2 > 0x3f ) { // 3 bytes
7388 buf[0] = 0xc0 + b3;
7389 buf[1] = b2;
7390 buf[2] = b1;
7391 return 3;
7392 }
7393 if (b2 > 1 || b1 > 0x7f ) { // 2 bytes
7394 buf[0] = 0x80 + b2;
7395 buf[1] = b1;
7396 return 2;
7397 }
7398 // 1 byte
7399 buf[0] = b1;
7400 return 1;
7401}
7402
7403// Opposite of offset2bytes().
7404// "pp" points to the bytes and is advanced over it.
7405// Returns the offset.
7406static int bytes2offset(char_u **pp)
7407{
7408 char_u *p = *pp;
7409 int nr;
7410 int c;
7411
7412 c = *p++;
7413 if ((c & 0x80) == 0x00) { // 1 byte
7414 nr = c - 1;
7415 } else if ((c & 0xc0) == 0x80) { // 2 bytes
7416 nr = (c & 0x3f) - 1;
7417 nr = nr * 255 + (*p++ - 1);
7418 } else if ((c & 0xe0) == 0xc0) { // 3 bytes
7419 nr = (c & 0x1f) - 1;
7420 nr = nr * 255 + (*p++ - 1);
7421 nr = nr * 255 + (*p++ - 1);
7422 } else { // 4 bytes
7423 nr = (c & 0x0f) - 1;
7424 nr = nr * 255 + (*p++ - 1);
7425 nr = nr * 255 + (*p++ - 1);
7426 nr = nr * 255 + (*p++ - 1);
7427 }
7428
7429 *pp = p;
7430 return nr;
7431}
7432
7433// Write the .sug file in "fname".
7434static void sug_write(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *fname)
7435{
7436 FILE *fd;
7437 wordnode_T *tree;
7438 int nodecount;
7439 int wcount;
7440 char_u *line;
7441 linenr_T lnum;
7442 int len;
7443
7444 // Create the file. Note that an existing file is silently overwritten!
7445 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "w")fopen(((char *)fname), ("w"));
7446 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
7447 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
7448 return;
7449 }
7450
7451 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
7452 _("Writing suggestion file %s ...")gettext((char *)("Writing suggestion file %s ...")), fname);
7453 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
7454
7455 // <SUGHEADER>: <fileID> <versionnr> <timestamp>
7456 if (fwrite(VIMSUGMAGIC"VIMsug", VIMSUGMAGICL6, (size_t)1, fd) != 1) { // <fileID>
7457 EMSG(_(e_write))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_write))));
7458 goto theend;
7459 }
7460 putc(VIMSUGVERSION, fd)_IO_putc (1, fd); // <versionnr>
7461
7462 // Write si_sugtime to the file.
7463 put_time(fd, spin->si_sugtime); // <timestamp>
7464
7465 // <SUGWORDTREE>
7466 spin->si_memtot = 0;
7467 tree = spin->si_foldroot->wn_sibling;
7468
7469 // Clear the index and wnode fields in the tree.
7470 clear_node(tree);
7471
7472 // Count the number of nodes. Needed to be able to allocate the
7473 // memory when reading the nodes. Also fills in index for shared
7474 // nodes.
7475 nodecount = put_node(NULL((void*)0), tree, 0, 0, false0);
7476
7477 // number of nodes in 4 bytes
7478 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)nodecount, 4); // <nodecount>
7479 spin->si_memtot += nodecount + nodecount * sizeof(int);
7480
7481 // Write the nodes.
7482 (void)put_node(fd, tree, 0, 0, false0);
7483
7484 // <SUGTABLE>: <sugwcount> <sugline> ...
7485 wcount = spin->si_spellbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
7486 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)wcount, 4); // <sugwcount>
7487
7488 for (lnum = 1; lnum <= (linenr_T)wcount; ++lnum) {
7489 // <sugline>: <sugnr> ... NUL
7490 line = ml_get_buf(spin->si_spellbuf, lnum, FALSE0);
7491 len = (int)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) + 1;
7492 if (fwrite(line, (size_t)len, (size_t)1, fd) == 0) {
7493 EMSG(_(e_write))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_write))));
7494 goto theend;
7495 }
7496 spin->si_memtot += len;
7497 }
7498
7499 // Write another byte to check for errors.
7500 if (putc(0, fd)_IO_putc (0, fd) == EOF(-1))
7501 EMSG(_(e_write))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_write))));
7502
7503 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
7504 _("Estimated runtime memory use: %d bytes")gettext((char *)("Estimated runtime memory use: %d bytes")), spin->si_memtot);
7505 spell_message(spin, IObuff);
7506
7507theend:
7508 // close the file
7509 fclose(fd);
7510}
7511
7512// Open a spell buffer. This is a nameless buffer that is not in the buffer
7513// list and only contains text lines. Can use a swapfile to reduce memory
7514// use.
7515// Most other fields are invalid! Esp. watch out for string options being
7516// NULL and there is no undo info.
7517static buf_T *open_spellbuf(void)
7518{
7519 buf_T *buf = xcalloc(1, sizeof(buf_T));
7520
7521 buf->b_spell = true1;
7522 buf->b_p_swf = true1; // may create a swap file
7523 ml_open(buf);
7524 ml_open_file(buf); // create swap file now
7525
7526 return buf;
7527}
7528
7529// Close the buffer used for spell info.
7530static void close_spellbuf(buf_T *buf)
7531{
7532 if (buf != NULL((void*)0)) {
7533 ml_close(buf, TRUE1);
7534 free(buf);
7535 }
7536}
7537
7538
7539// Create a Vim spell file from one or more word lists.
7540// "fnames[0]" is the output file name.
7541// "fnames[fcount - 1]" is the last input file name.
7542// Exception: when "fnames[0]" ends in ".add" it's used as the input file name
7543// and ".spl" is appended to make the output file name.
7544static void
7545mkspell (
7546 int fcount,
7547 char_u **fnames,
7548 bool_Bool ascii, // -ascii argument given
7549 bool_Bool over_write, // overwrite existing output file
7550 bool_Bool added_word // invoked through "zg"
7551)
7552{
7553 char_u *fname = NULL((void*)0);
7554 char_u *wfname;
7555 char_u **innames;
7556 int incount;
7557 afffile_T *(afile[8]);
7558 int i;
7559 int len;
7560 bool_Bool error = false0;
7561 spellinfo_T spin;
7562
7563 memset(&spin, 0, sizeof(spin));
7564 spin.si_verbose = !added_word;
7565 spin.si_ascii = ascii;
7566 spin.si_followup = true1;
7567 spin.si_rem_accents = true1;
7568 ga_init(&spin.si_rep, (int)sizeof(fromto_T), 20);
7569 ga_init(&spin.si_repsal, (int)sizeof(fromto_T), 20);
7570 ga_init(&spin.si_sal, (int)sizeof(fromto_T), 20);
7571 ga_init(&spin.si_map, (int)sizeof(char_u), 100);
7572 ga_init(&spin.si_comppat, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 20);
7573 ga_init(&spin.si_prefcond, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 50);
7574 hash_init(&spin.si_commonwords);
7575 spin.si_newcompID = 127; // start compound ID at first maximum
7576
7577 // default: fnames[0] is output file, following are input files
7578 innames = &fnames[1];
7579 incount = fcount - 1;
7580
7581 wfname = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
7582
7583 if (fcount >= 1) {
7584 len = (int)STRLEN(fnames[0])strlen((char *)(fnames[0]));
7585 if (fcount == 1 && len > 4 && STRCMP(fnames[0] + len - 4, ".add")strcmp((char *)(fnames[0] + len - 4), (char *)(".add")) == 0) {
7586 // For ":mkspell path/en.latin1.add" output file is
7587 // "path/en.latin1.add.spl".
7588 innames = &fnames[0];
7589 incount = 1;
7590 vim_snprintf((char *)wfname, MAXPATHL4096, "%s.spl", fnames[0]);
7591 } else if (fcount == 1) {
7592 // For ":mkspell path/vim" output file is "path/vim.latin1.spl".
7593 innames = &fnames[0];
7594 incount = 1;
7595 vim_snprintf((char *)wfname, MAXPATHL4096, SPL_FNAME_TMPL"%s.%s.spl",
7596 fnames[0], spin.si_ascii ? (char_u *)"ascii" : spell_enc());
7597 } else if (len > 4 && STRCMP(fnames[0] + len - 4, ".spl")strcmp((char *)(fnames[0] + len - 4), (char *)(".spl")) == 0) {
7598 // Name ends in ".spl", use as the file name.
7599 STRLCPY(wfname, fnames[0], MAXPATHL)xstrlcpy((char *)(wfname), (char *)(fnames[0]), (size_t)(4096
));
7600 } else
7601 // Name should be language, make the file name from it.
7602 vim_snprintf((char *)wfname, MAXPATHL4096, SPL_FNAME_TMPL"%s.%s.spl",
7603 fnames[0], spin.si_ascii ? (char_u *)"ascii" : spell_enc());
7604
7605 // Check for .ascii.spl.
7606 if (strstr((char *)path_tail(wfname), SPL_FNAME_ASCII".ascii.") != NULL((void*)0))
7607 spin.si_ascii = true1;
7608
7609 // Check for .add.spl.
7610 if (strstr((char *)path_tail(wfname), SPL_FNAME_ADD".add.") != NULL((void*)0))
7611 spin.si_add = true1;
7612 }
7613
7614 if (incount <= 0)
7615 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg)))); // need at least output and input names
7616 else if (vim_strchr(path_tail(wfname), '_') != NULL((void*)0))
7617 EMSG(_("E751: Output file name must not have region name"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E751: Output file name must not have region name"
))));
7618 else if (incount > 8)
7619 EMSG(_("E754: Only up to 8 regions supported"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E754: Only up to 8 regions supported"
))));
7620 else {
7621 // Check for overwriting before doing things that may take a lot of
7622 // time.
7623 if (!over_write && os_file_exists(wfname)) {
7624 EMSG(_(e_exists))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_exists))));
7625 goto theend;
7626 }
7627 if (os_isdir(wfname)) {
7628 EMSG2(_(e_isadir2), wfname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_isadir2))), (char_u *)(wfname
));
7629 goto theend;
7630 }
7631
7632 fname = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
7633
7634 // Init the aff and dic pointers.
7635 // Get the region names if there are more than 2 arguments.
7636 for (i = 0; i < incount; ++i) {
7637 afile[i] = NULL((void*)0);
7638
7639 if (incount > 1) {
7640 len = (int)STRLEN(innames[i])strlen((char *)(innames[i]));
7641 if (STRLEN(path_tail(innames[i]))strlen((char *)(path_tail(innames[i]))) < 5
7642 || innames[i][len - 3] != '_') {
7643 EMSG2(_("E755: Invalid region in %s"), innames[i])emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E755: Invalid region in %s"
))), (char_u *)(innames[i]));
7644 goto theend;
7645 }
7646 spin.si_region_name[i * 2] = TOLOWER_ASC(innames[i][len - 2])(((innames[i][len - 2]) < 'A' || (innames[i][len - 2]) >
'Z') ? (innames[i][len - 2]) : (innames[i][len - 2]) + ('a' -
'A'));
7647 spin.si_region_name[i * 2 + 1] =
7648 TOLOWER_ASC(innames[i][len - 1])(((innames[i][len - 1]) < 'A' || (innames[i][len - 1]) >
'Z') ? (innames[i][len - 1]) : (innames[i][len - 1]) + ('a' -
'A'));
7649 }
7650 }
7651 spin.si_region_count = incount;
7652
7653 spin.si_foldroot = wordtree_alloc(&spin);
7654 spin.si_keeproot = wordtree_alloc(&spin);
7655 spin.si_prefroot = wordtree_alloc(&spin);
7656 if (spin.si_foldroot == NULL((void*)0)
7657 || spin.si_keeproot == NULL((void*)0)
7658 || spin.si_prefroot == NULL((void*)0)) {
7659 free_blocks(spin.si_blocks);
7660 goto theend;
7661 }
7662
7663 // When not producing a .add.spl file clear the character table when
7664 // we encounter one in the .aff file. This means we dump the current
7665 // one in the .spl file if the .aff file doesn't define one. That's
7666 // better than guessing the contents, the table will match a
7667 // previously loaded spell file.
7668 if (!spin.si_add)
7669 spin.si_clear_chartab = true1;
7670
7671 // Read all the .aff and .dic files.
7672 // Text is converted to 'encoding'.
7673 // Words are stored in the case-folded and keep-case trees.
7674 for (i = 0; i < incount && !error; ++i) {
7675 spin.si_conv.vc_type = CONV_NONE0;
7676 spin.si_region = 1 << i;
7677
7678 vim_snprintf((char *)fname, MAXPATHL4096, "%s.aff", innames[i]);
7679 if (os_file_exists(fname)) {
7680 // Read the .aff file. Will init "spin->si_conv" based on the
7681 // "SET" line.
7682 afile[i] = spell_read_aff(&spin, fname);
7683 if (afile[i] == NULL((void*)0))
7684 error = true1;
7685 else {
7686 // Read the .dic file and store the words in the trees.
7687 vim_snprintf((char *)fname, MAXPATHL4096, "%s.dic",
7688 innames[i]);
7689 if (spell_read_dic(&spin, fname, afile[i]) == FAIL0)
7690 error = true1;
7691 }
7692 } else {
7693 // No .aff file, try reading the file as a word list. Store
7694 // the words in the trees.
7695 if (spell_read_wordfile(&spin, innames[i]) == FAIL0)
7696 error = true1;
7697 }
7698
7699 // Free any conversion stuff.
7700 convert_setup(&spin.si_conv, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7701 }
7702
7703 if (spin.si_compflags != NULL((void*)0) && spin.si_nobreak)
7704 MSG(_("Warning: both compounding and NOBREAK specified"))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Warning: both compounding and NOBREAK specified"
))));
7705
7706 if (!error && !got_int) {
7707 // Combine tails in the tree.
7708 spell_message(&spin, (char_u *)_(msg_compressing)gettext((char *)(msg_compressing)));
7709 wordtree_compress(&spin, spin.si_foldroot);
7710 wordtree_compress(&spin, spin.si_keeproot);
7711 wordtree_compress(&spin, spin.si_prefroot);
7712 }
7713
7714 if (!error && !got_int) {
7715 // Write the info in the spell file.
7716 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
7717 _("Writing spell file %s ...")gettext((char *)("Writing spell file %s ...")), wfname);
7718 spell_message(&spin, IObuff);
7719
7720 error = write_vim_spell(&spin, wfname) == FAIL0;
7721
7722 spell_message(&spin, (char_u *)_("Done!")gettext((char *)("Done!")));
7723 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
7724 _("Estimated runtime memory use: %d bytes")gettext((char *)("Estimated runtime memory use: %d bytes")), spin.si_memtot);
7725 spell_message(&spin, IObuff);
7726
7727 // If the file is loaded need to reload it.
7728 if (!error)
7729 spell_reload_one(wfname, added_word);
7730 }
7731
7732 // Free the allocated memory.
7733 ga_clear(&spin.si_rep);
7734 ga_clear(&spin.si_repsal);
7735 ga_clear(&spin.si_sal);
7736 ga_clear(&spin.si_map);
7737 ga_clear(&spin.si_comppat);
7738 ga_clear(&spin.si_prefcond);
7739 hash_clear_all(&spin.si_commonwords, 0);
7740
7741 // Free the .aff file structures.
7742 for (i = 0; i < incount; ++i)
7743 if (afile[i] != NULL((void*)0))
7744 spell_free_aff(afile[i]);
7745
7746 // Free all the bits and pieces at once.
7747 free_blocks(spin.si_blocks);
7748
7749 // If there is soundfolding info and no NOSUGFILE item create the
7750 // .sug file with the soundfolded word trie.
7751 if (spin.si_sugtime != 0 && !error && !got_int)
7752 spell_make_sugfile(&spin, wfname);
7753
7754 }
7755
7756theend:
7757 free(fname);
7758 free(wfname);
7759}
7760
7761// Display a message for spell file processing when 'verbose' is set or using
7762// ":mkspell". "str" can be IObuff.
7763static void spell_message(spellinfo_T *spin, char_u *str)
7764{
7765 if (spin->si_verbose || p_verbose > 2) {
7766 if (!spin->si_verbose)
7767 verbose_enter();
7768 MSG(str)msg((char_u *)(str));
7769 out_flush();
7770 if (!spin->si_verbose)
7771 verbose_leave();
7772 }
7773}
7774
7775// ":[count]spellgood {word}"
7776// ":[count]spellwrong {word}"
7777// ":[count]spellundo {word}"
7778void ex_spell(exarg_T *eap)
7779{
7780 spell_add_word(eap->arg, (int)STRLEN(eap->arg)strlen((char *)(eap->arg)), eap->cmdidx == CMD_spellwrong,
7781 eap->forceit ? 0 : (int)eap->line2,
7782 eap->cmdidx == CMD_spellundo);
7783}
7784
7785// Add "word[len]" to 'spellfile' as a good or bad word.
7786void
7787spell_add_word (
7788 char_u *word,
7789 int len,
7790 int bad,
7791 int idx, // "zG" and "zW": zero, otherwise index in
7792 // 'spellfile'
7793 bool_Bool undo // true for "zug", "zuG", "zuw" and "zuW"
7794)
7795{
7796 FILE *fd = NULL((void*)0);
7797 buf_T *buf = NULL((void*)0);
7798 bool_Bool new_spf = false0;
7799 char_u *fname;
7800 char_u *fnamebuf = NULL((void*)0);
7801 char_u line[MAXWLEN250 * 2];
7802 long fpos, fpos_next = 0;
7803 int i;
7804 char_u *spf;
7805
7806 if (idx == 0) { // use internal wordlist
7807 if (int_wordlist == NULL((void*)0)) {
7808 int_wordlist = vim_tempname();
7809 if (int_wordlist == NULL((void*)0))
7810 return;
7811 }
7812 fname = int_wordlist;
7813 } else {
7814 // If 'spellfile' isn't set figure out a good default value.
7815 if (*curwin->w_s->b_p_spf == NUL'\000') {
7816 init_spellfile();
7817 new_spf = true1;
7818 }
7819
7820 if (*curwin->w_s->b_p_spf == NUL'\000') {
7821 EMSG2(_(e_notset), "spellfile")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notset))), (char_u *)("spellfile"
));
7822 return;
7823 }
7824 fnamebuf = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
7825
7826 for (spf = curwin->w_s->b_p_spf, i = 1; *spf != NUL'\000'; ++i) {
7827 copy_option_part(&spf, fnamebuf, MAXPATHL4096, ",");
7828 if (i == idx)
7829 break;
7830 if (*spf == NUL'\000') {
7831 EMSGN(_("E765: 'spellfile' does not have %" PRId64 " entries"), idx)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E765: 'spellfile' does not have %"
"l" "d" " entries"))), (int64_t)(idx));
7832 free(fnamebuf);
7833 return;
7834 }
7835 }
7836
7837 // Check that the user isn't editing the .add file somewhere.
7838 buf = buflist_findname_exp(fnamebuf);
7839 if (buf != NULL((void*)0) && buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0))
7840 buf = NULL((void*)0);
7841 if (buf != NULL((void*)0) && bufIsChanged(buf)) {
7842 EMSG(_(e_bufloaded))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_bufloaded))));
7843 free(fnamebuf);
7844 return;
7845 }
7846
7847 fname = fnamebuf;
7848 }
7849
7850 if (bad || undo) {
7851 // When the word appears as good word we need to remove that one,
7852 // since its flags sort before the one with WF_BANNED.
7853 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r"));
7854 if (fd != NULL((void*)0)) {
7855 while (!vim_fgets(line, MAXWLEN250 * 2, fd)) {
7856 fpos = fpos_next;
7857 fpos_next = ftell(fd);
7858 if (STRNCMP(word, line, len)strncmp((char *)(word), (char *)(line), (size_t)(len)) == 0
7859 && (line[len] == '/' || line[len] < ' ')) {
7860 // Found duplicate word. Remove it by writing a '#' at
7861 // the start of the line. Mixing reading and writing
7862 // doesn't work for all systems, close the file first.
7863 fclose(fd);
7864 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r+")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r+"));
7865 if (fd == NULL((void*)0))
7866 break;
7867 if (fseek(fd, fpos, SEEK_SET0) == 0) {
7868 fputc('#', fd);
7869 if (undo) {
7870 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), fname, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, TRUE1);
7871 smsg((char_u *)_("Word '%.*s' removed from %s")gettext((char *)("Word '%.*s' removed from %s")),
7872 len, word, NameBuff);
7873 }
7874 }
7875 fseek(fd, fpos_next, SEEK_SET0);
7876 }
7877 }
7878 if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
7879 fclose(fd);
7880 }
7881 }
7882
7883 if (!undo) {
7884 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "a")fopen(((char *)fname), ("a"));
7885 if (fd == NULL((void*)0) && new_spf) {
7886 char_u *p;
7887
7888 // We just initialized the 'spellfile' option and can't open the
7889 // file. We may need to create the "spell" directory first. We
7890 // already checked the runtime directory is writable in
7891 // init_spellfile().
7892 if (!dir_of_file_exists(fname) && (p = path_tail_with_sep(fname)) != fname) {
7893 int c = *p;
7894
7895 // The directory doesn't exist. Try creating it and opening
7896 // the file again.
7897 *p = NUL'\000';
7898 os_mkdir((char *)fname, 0755);
7899 *p = c;
7900 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "a")fopen(((char *)fname), ("a"));
7901 }
7902 }
7903
7904 if (fd == NULL((void*)0))
7905 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
7906 else {
7907 if (bad)
7908 fprintf(fd, "%.*s/!\n", len, word);
7909 else
7910 fprintf(fd, "%.*s\n", len, word);
7911 fclose(fd);
7912
7913 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), fname, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, TRUE1);
7914 smsg((char_u *)_("Word '%.*s' added to %s")gettext((char *)("Word '%.*s' added to %s")), len, word, NameBuff);
7915 }
7916 }
7917
7918 if (fd != NULL((void*)0)) {
7919 // Update the .add.spl file.
7920 mkspell(1, &fname, false0, true1, true1);
7921
7922 // If the .add file is edited somewhere, reload it.
7923 if (buf != NULL((void*)0))
7924 buf_reload(buf, buf->b_orig_mode);
7925
7926 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
7927 }
7928 free(fnamebuf);
7929}
7930
7931// Initialize 'spellfile' for the current buffer.
7932static void init_spellfile(void)
7933{
7934 char_u *buf;
7935 int l;
7936 char_u *fname;
7937 char_u *rtp;
7938 char_u *lend;
7939 bool_Bool aspath = false0;
7940 char_u *lstart = curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl;
7941
7942 if (*curwin->w_s->b_p_spl != NUL'\000' && !GA_EMPTY(&curwin->w_s->b_langp)((&curwin->w_s->b_langp)->ga_len <= 0)) {
7943 buf = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
7944
7945 // Find the end of the language name. Exclude the region. If there
7946 // is a path separator remember the start of the tail.
7947 for (lend = curwin->w_s->b_p_spl; *lend != NUL'\000'
7948 && vim_strchr((char_u *)",._", *lend) == NULL((void*)0); ++lend)
7949 if (vim_ispathsep(*lend)) {
7950 aspath = true1;
7951 lstart = lend + 1;
7952 }
7953
7954 // Loop over all entries in 'runtimepath'. Use the first one where we
7955 // are allowed to write.
7956 rtp = p_rtp;
7957 while (*rtp != NUL'\000') {
7958 if (aspath)
7959 // Use directory of an entry with path, e.g., for
7960 // "/dir/lg.utf-8.spl" use "/dir".
7961 STRLCPY(buf, curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl,xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl), (size_t
)(lstart - curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl))
7962 lstart - curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl), (size_t
)(lstart - curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl));
7963 else
7964 // Copy the path from 'runtimepath' to buf[].
7965 copy_option_part(&rtp, buf, MAXPATHL4096, ",");
7966 if (os_file_is_writable((char *)buf) == 2) {
7967 // Use the first language name from 'spelllang' and the
7968 // encoding used in the first loaded .spl file.
7969 if (aspath)
7970 STRLCPY(buf, curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl,xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl), (size_t
)(lend - curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl + 1))
7971 lend - curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl), (size_t
)(lend - curbuf->b_s.b_p_spl + 1));
7972 else {
7973 // Create the "spell" directory if it doesn't exist yet.
7974 l = (int)STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf));
7975 vim_snprintf((char *)buf + l, MAXPATHL4096 - l, "/spell");
7976 if (os_file_is_writable((char *)buf) != 2) {
7977 os_mkdir((char *)buf, 0755);
7978 }
7979
7980 l = (int)STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf));
7981 vim_snprintf((char *)buf + l, MAXPATHL4096 - l,
7982 "/%.*s", (int)(lend - lstart), lstart);
7983 }
7984 l = (int)STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf));
7985 fname = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, 0)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (0))
7986 ->lp_slang->sl_fname;
7987 vim_snprintf((char *)buf + l, MAXPATHL4096 - l, ".%s.add",
7988 fname != NULL((void*)0)
7989 && strstr((char *)path_tail(fname), ".ascii.") != NULL((void*)0)
7990 ? (char_u *)"ascii" : spell_enc());
7991 set_option_value((char_u *)"spellfile", 0L, buf, OPT_LOCAL4);
7992 break;
7993 }
7994 aspath = false0;
7995 }
7996
7997 free(buf);
7998 }
7999}
8000
8001// Init the chartab used for spelling for ASCII.
8002static void clear_spell_chartab(spelltab_T *sp)
8003{
8004 int i;
8005
8006 // Init everything to false.
8007 memset(sp->st_isw, false0, sizeof(sp->st_isw));
8008 memset(sp->st_isu, false0, sizeof(sp->st_isu));
8009
8010 for (i = 0; i < 256; ++i) {
8011 sp->st_fold[i] = i;
8012 sp->st_upper[i] = i;
8013 }
8014
8015 // We include digits. A word shouldn't start with a digit, but handling
8016 // that is done separately.
8017 for (i = '0'; i <= '9'; ++i)
8018 sp->st_isw[i] = true1;
8019 for (i = 'A'; i <= 'Z'; ++i) {
8020 sp->st_isw[i] = true1;
8021 sp->st_isu[i] = true1;
8022 sp->st_fold[i] = i + 0x20;
8023 }
8024 for (i = 'a'; i <= 'z'; ++i) {
8025 sp->st_isw[i] = true1;
8026 sp->st_upper[i] = i - 0x20;
8027 }
8028}
8029
8030// Init the chartab used for spelling. Only depends on 'encoding'.
8031// Called once while starting up and when 'encoding' changes.
8032// The default is to use isalpha(), but the spell file should define the word
8033// characters to make it possible that 'encoding' differs from the current
8034// locale. For utf-8 we don't use isalpha() but our own functions.
8035void init_spell_chartab(void)
8036{
8037 int i;
8038
8039 did_set_spelltab = false0;
8040 clear_spell_chartab(&spelltab);
8041 if (enc_dbcs) {
8042 // DBCS: assume double-wide characters are word characters.
8043 for (i = 128; i <= 255; ++i)
8044 if (MB_BYTE2LEN(i)mb_bytelen_tab[i] == 2)
8045 spelltab.st_isw[i] = true1;
8046 } else if (enc_utf8) {
8047 for (i = 128; i < 256; ++i) {
8048 int f = utf_fold(i);
8049 int u = utf_toupper(i);
8050
8051 spelltab.st_isu[i] = utf_isupper(i);
8052 spelltab.st_isw[i] = spelltab.st_isu[i] || utf_islower(i);
8053 // The folded/upper-cased value is different between latin1 and
8054 // utf8 for 0xb5, causing E763 for no good reason. Use the latin1
8055 // value for utf-8 to avoid this.
8056 spelltab.st_fold[i] = (f < 256) ? f : i;
8057 spelltab.st_upper[i] = (u < 256) ? u : i;
8058 }
8059 } else {
8060 // Rough guess: use locale-dependent library functions.
8061 for (i = 128; i < 256; ++i) {
8062 if (vim_isupper(i)) {
8063 spelltab.st_isw[i] = true1;
8064 spelltab.st_isu[i] = true1;
8065 spelltab.st_fold[i] = vim_tolower(i);
8066 } else if (vim_islower(i)) {
8067 spelltab.st_isw[i] = true1;
8068 spelltab.st_upper[i] = vim_toupper(i);
8069 }
8070 }
8071 }
8072}
8073
8074// Set the spell character tables from strings in the affix file.
8075static int set_spell_chartab(char_u *fol, char_u *low, char_u *upp)
8076{
8077 // We build the new tables here first, so that we can compare with the
8078 // previous one.
8079 spelltab_T new_st;
8080 char_u *pf = fol, *pl = low, *pu = upp;
8081 int f, l, u;
8082
8083 clear_spell_chartab(&new_st);
8084
8085 while (*pf != NUL'\000') {
8086 if (*pl == NUL'\000' || *pu == NUL'\000') {
8087 EMSG(_(e_affform))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_affform))));
8088 return FAIL0;
8089 }
8090 f = mb_ptr2char_adv(&pf);
8091 l = mb_ptr2char_adv(&pl);
8092 u = mb_ptr2char_adv(&pu);
8093 // Every character that appears is a word character.
8094 if (f < 256)
8095 new_st.st_isw[f] = true1;
8096 if (l < 256)
8097 new_st.st_isw[l] = true1;
8098 if (u < 256)
8099 new_st.st_isw[u] = true1;
8100
8101 // if "LOW" and "FOL" are not the same the "LOW" char needs
8102 // case-folding
8103 if (l < 256 && l != f) {
8104 if (f >= 256) {
8105 EMSG(_(e_affrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_affrange))));
8106 return FAIL0;
8107 }
8108 new_st.st_fold[l] = f;
8109 }
8110
8111 // if "UPP" and "FOL" are not the same the "UPP" char needs
8112 // case-folding, it's upper case and the "UPP" is the upper case of
8113 // "FOL" .
8114 if (u < 256 && u != f) {
8115 if (f >= 256) {
8116 EMSG(_(e_affrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_affrange))));
8117 return FAIL0;
8118 }
8119 new_st.st_fold[u] = f;
8120 new_st.st_isu[u] = true1;
8121 new_st.st_upper[f] = u;
8122 }
8123 }
8124
8125 if (*pl != NUL'\000' || *pu != NUL'\000') {
8126 EMSG(_(e_affform))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_affform))));
8127 return FAIL0;
8128 }
8129
8130 return set_spell_finish(&new_st);
8131}
8132
8133// Set the spell character tables from strings in the .spl file.
8134static void
8135set_spell_charflags (
8136 char_u *flags,
8137 int cnt, // length of "flags"
8138 char_u *fol
8139)
8140{
8141 // We build the new tables here first, so that we can compare with the
8142 // previous one.
8143 spelltab_T new_st;
8144 int i;
8145 char_u *p = fol;
8146 int c;
8147
8148 clear_spell_chartab(&new_st);
8149
8150 for (i = 0; i < 128; ++i) {
8151 if (i < cnt) {
8152 new_st.st_isw[i + 128] = (flags[i] & CF_WORD0x01) != 0;
8153 new_st.st_isu[i + 128] = (flags[i] & CF_UPPER0x02) != 0;
8154 }
8155
8156 if (*p != NUL'\000') {
8157 c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
8158 new_st.st_fold[i + 128] = c;
8159 if (i + 128 != c && new_st.st_isu[i + 128] && c < 256)
8160 new_st.st_upper[c] = i + 128;
8161 }
8162 }
8163
8164 (void)set_spell_finish(&new_st);
8165}
8166
8167static int set_spell_finish(spelltab_T *new_st)
8168{
8169 int i;
8170
8171 if (did_set_spelltab) {
8172 // check that it's the same table
8173 for (i = 0; i < 256; ++i) {
8174 if (spelltab.st_isw[i] != new_st->st_isw[i]
8175 || spelltab.st_isu[i] != new_st->st_isu[i]
8176 || spelltab.st_fold[i] != new_st->st_fold[i]
8177 || spelltab.st_upper[i] != new_st->st_upper[i]) {
8178 EMSG(_("E763: Word characters differ between spell files"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E763: Word characters differ between spell files"
))));
8179 return FAIL0;
8180 }
8181 }
8182 } else {
8183 // copy the new spelltab into the one being used
8184 spelltab = *new_st;
8185 did_set_spelltab = true1;
8186 }
8187
8188 return OK1;
8189}
8190
8191/// Returns true if "p" points to a word character.
8192/// As a special case we see "midword" characters as word character when it is
8193/// followed by a word character. This finds they'there but not 'they there'.
8194/// Thus this only works properly when past the first character of the word.
8195///
8196/// @param wp Buffer used.
8197static bool_Bool spell_iswordp(char_u *p, win_T *wp)
8198{
8199 char_u *s;
8200 int l;
8201 int c;
8202
8203 if (has_mbyte) {
8204 l = MB_BYTE2LEN(*p)mb_bytelen_tab[*p];
8205 s = p;
8206 if (l == 1) {
8207 // be quick for ASCII
8208 if (wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw[*p])
8209 s = p + 1; // skip a mid-word character
8210 } else {
8211 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
8212 if (c < 256 ? wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw[c]
8213 : (wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb != NULL((void*)0)
8214 && vim_strchr(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb, c) != NULL((void*)0)))
8215 s = p + l;
8216 }
8217
8218 c = mb_ptr2char(s);
8219 if (c > 255)
8220 return spell_mb_isword_class(mb_get_class(s), wp);
8221 return spelltab.st_isw[c];
8222 }
8223
8224 return spelltab.st_isw[wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw[*p] ? p[1] : p[0]];
8225}
8226
8227// Returns true if "p" points to a word character.
8228// Unlike spell_iswordp() this doesn't check for "midword" characters.
8229static bool_Bool spell_iswordp_nmw(char_u *p, win_T *wp)
8230{
8231 int c;
8232
8233 if (has_mbyte) {
8234 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
8235 if (c > 255)
8236 return spell_mb_isword_class(mb_get_class(p), wp);
8237 return spelltab.st_isw[c];
8238 }
8239 return spelltab.st_isw[*p];
8240}
8241
8242// Returns true if word class indicates a word character.
8243// Only for characters above 255.
8244// Unicode subscript and superscript are not considered word characters.
8245// See also dbcs_class() and utf_class() in mbyte.c.
8246static bool_Bool spell_mb_isword_class(int cl, win_T *wp)
8247{
8248 if (wp->w_s->b_cjk)
8249 // East Asian characters are not considered word characters.
8250 return cl == 2 || cl == 0x2800;
8251 return cl >= 2 && cl != 0x2070 && cl != 0x2080;
8252}
8253
8254// Returns true if "p" points to a word character.
8255// Wide version of spell_iswordp().
8256static bool_Bool spell_iswordp_w(int *p, win_T *wp)
8257{
8258 int *s;
8259
8260 if (*p < 256 ? wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw[*p]
8261 : (wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb != NULL((void*)0)
8262 && vim_strchr(wp->w_s->b_spell_ismw_mb, *p) != NULL((void*)0)))
8263 s = p + 1;
8264 else
8265 s = p;
8266
8267 if (*s > 255) {
8268 if (enc_utf8)
8269 return spell_mb_isword_class(utf_class(*s), wp);
8270 if (enc_dbcs)
8271 return spell_mb_isword_class(
8272 dbcs_class((unsigned)*s >> 8, *s & 0xff), wp);
8273 return false0;
8274 }
8275 return spelltab.st_isw[*s];
8276}
8277
8278// Write the table with prefix conditions to the .spl file.
8279// When "fd" is NULL only count the length of what is written.
8280static int write_spell_prefcond(FILE *fd, garray_T *gap)
8281{
8282 char_u *p;
8283 int len;
8284 int totlen;
8285 size_t x = 1; // collect return value of fwrite()
8286
8287 if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
8288 put_bytes(fd, (long_u)gap->ga_len, 2); // <prefcondcnt>
8289
8290 totlen = 2 + gap->ga_len; // length of <prefcondcnt> and <condlen> bytes
8291
8292 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
8293 // <prefcond> : <condlen> <condstr>
8294 p = ((char_u **)gap->ga_data)[i];
8295 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
8296 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
8297 if (fd != NULL((void*)0)) {
8298 fputc(len, fd);
8299 x &= fwrite(p, (size_t)len, (size_t)1, fd);
8300 }
8301 totlen += len;
8302 } else if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
8303 fputc(0, fd);
8304 }
8305
8306 return totlen;
8307}
8308
8309// Case-fold "str[len]" into "buf[buflen]". The result is NUL terminated.
8310// Uses the character definitions from the .spl file.
8311// When using a multi-byte 'encoding' the length may change!
8312// Returns FAIL when something wrong.
8313static int spell_casefold(char_u *str, int len, char_u *buf, int buflen)
8314{
8315 int i;
8316
8317 if (len >= buflen) {
8318 buf[0] = NUL'\000';
8319 return FAIL0; // result will not fit
8320 }
8321
8322 if (has_mbyte) {
8323 int outi = 0;
8324 char_u *p;
8325 int c;
8326
8327 // Fold one character at a time.
8328 for (p = str; p < str + len; ) {
8329 if (outi + MB_MAXBYTES21 > buflen) {
8330 buf[outi] = NUL'\000';
8331 return FAIL0;
8332 }
8333 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
8334 outi += mb_char2bytes(SPELL_TOFOLD(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_fold(c) : (c) < 256
? (int)spelltab.st_fold[c] : (int)towlower(c)), buf + outi);
8335 }
8336 buf[outi] = NUL'\000';
8337 } else {
8338 // Be quick for non-multibyte encodings.
8339 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
8340 buf[i] = spelltab.st_fold[str[i]];
8341 buf[i] = NUL'\000';
8342 }
8343
8344 return OK1;
8345}
8346
8347// values for sps_flags
8348#define SPS_BEST1 1
8349#define SPS_FAST2 2
8350#define SPS_DOUBLE4 4
8351
8352static int sps_flags = SPS_BEST1; // flags from 'spellsuggest'
8353static int sps_limit = 9999; // max nr of suggestions given
8354
8355// Check the 'spellsuggest' option. Return FAIL if it's wrong.
8356// Sets "sps_flags" and "sps_limit".
8357int spell_check_sps(void)
8358{
8359 char_u *p;
8360 char_u *s;
8361 char_u buf[MAXPATHL4096];
8362 int f;
8363
8364 sps_flags = 0;
8365 sps_limit = 9999;
8366
8367 for (p = p_sps; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
8368 copy_option_part(&p, buf, MAXPATHL4096, ",");
8369
8370 f = 0;
8371 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*buf)((unsigned)(*buf) - '0' < 10)) {
8372 s = buf;
8373 sps_limit = getdigits(&s);
8374 if (*s != NUL'\000' && !VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10))
8375 f = -1;
8376 } else if (STRCMP(buf, "best")strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("best")) == 0)
8377 f = SPS_BEST1;
8378 else if (STRCMP(buf, "fast")strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("fast")) == 0)
8379 f = SPS_FAST2;
8380 else if (STRCMP(buf, "double")strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("double")) == 0)
8381 f = SPS_DOUBLE4;
8382 else if (STRNCMP(buf, "expr:", 5)strncmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("expr:"), (size_t)(5)) != 0
8383 && STRNCMP(buf, "file:", 5)strncmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("file:"), (size_t)(5)) != 0)
8384 f = -1;
8385
8386 if (f == -1 || (sps_flags != 0 && f != 0)) {
8387 sps_flags = SPS_BEST1;
8388 sps_limit = 9999;
8389 return FAIL0;
8390 }
8391 if (f != 0)
8392 sps_flags = f;
8393 }
8394
8395 if (sps_flags == 0)
8396 sps_flags = SPS_BEST1;
8397
8398 return OK1;
8399}
8400
8401// "z=": Find badly spelled word under or after the cursor.
8402// Give suggestions for the properly spelled word.
8403// In Visual mode use the highlighted word as the bad word.
8404// When "count" is non-zero use that suggestion.
8405void spell_suggest(int count)
8406{
8407 char_u *line;
8408 pos_T prev_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
8409 char_u wcopy[MAXWLEN250 + 2];
8410 char_u *p;
8411 int c;
8412 suginfo_T sug;
8413 suggest_T *stp;
8414 int mouse_used;
8415 int need_cap;
8416 int limit;
8417 int selected = count;
8418 int badlen = 0;
8419 int msg_scroll_save = msg_scroll;
8420
8421 if (no_spell_checking(curwin))
8422 return;
8423
8424 if (VIsual_active) {
8425 // Use the Visually selected text as the bad word. But reject
8426 // a multi-line selection.
8427 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != VIsual.lnum) {
8428 vim_beep();
8429 return;
8430 }
8431 badlen = (int)curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)VIsual.col;
8432 if (badlen < 0)
8433 badlen = -badlen;
8434 else
8435 curwin->w_cursor.col = VIsual.col;
8436 ++badlen;
8437 end_visual_mode();
8438 } else
8439 // Find the start of the badly spelled word.
8440 if (spell_move_to(curwin, FORWARD1, true1, true1, NULL((void*)0)) == 0
8441 || curwin->w_cursor.col > prev_cursor.col) {
8442 // No bad word or it starts after the cursor: use the word under the
8443 // cursor.
8444 curwin->w_cursor = prev_cursor;
8445 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
8446 p = line + curwin->w_cursor.col;
8447 // Backup to before start of word.
8448 while (p > line && spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin))
8449 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
8450 // Forward to start of word.
8451 while (*p != NUL'\000' && !spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin))
8452 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
8453
8454 if (!spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin)) { // No word found.
8455 beep_flush();
8456 return;
8457 }
8458 curwin->w_cursor.col = (colnr_T)(p - line);
8459 }
8460
8461 // Get the word and its length.
8462
8463 // Figure out if the word should be capitalised.
8464 need_cap = check_need_cap(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.col);
8465
8466 // Make a copy of current line since autocommands may free the line.
8467 line = vim_strsave(get_cursor_line_ptr());
8468
8469 // Get the list of suggestions. Limit to 'lines' - 2 or the number in
8470 // 'spellsuggest', whatever is smaller.
8471 if (sps_limit > (int)Rows - 2)
8472 limit = (int)Rows - 2;
8473 else
8474 limit = sps_limit;
8475 spell_find_suggest(line + curwin->w_cursor.col, badlen, &sug, limit,
8476 true1, need_cap, true1);
8477
8478 if (GA_EMPTY(&sug.su_ga)((&sug.su_ga)->ga_len <= 0))
8479 MSG(_("Sorry, no suggestions"))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Sorry, no suggestions"))));
8480 else if (count > 0) {
8481 if (count > sug.su_ga.ga_len)
8482 smsg((char_u *)_("Sorry, only %" PRId64 " suggestions")gettext((char *)("Sorry, only %" "l" "d" " suggestions")),
8483 (int64_t)sug.su_ga.ga_len);
8484 } else {
8485 free(repl_from);
8486 repl_from = NULL((void*)0);
8487 free(repl_to);
8488 repl_to = NULL((void*)0);
8489
8490 // When 'rightleft' is set the list is drawn right-left.
8491 cmdmsg_rl = curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl;
8492 if (cmdmsg_rl)
8493 msg_col = Columns - 1;
8494
8495 // List the suggestions.
8496 msg_start();
8497 msg_row = Rows - 1; // for when 'cmdheight' > 1
8498 lines_left = Rows; // avoid more prompt
8499 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Change \"%.*s\" to:")gettext((char *)("Change \"%.*s\" to:")),
8500 sug.su_badlen, sug.su_badptr);
8501 if (cmdmsg_rl && STRNCMP(IObuff, "Change", 6)strncmp((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("Change"), (size_t)(6)) == 0) {
8502 // And now the rabbit from the high hat: Avoid showing the
8503 // untranslated message rightleft.
8504 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), ":ot \"%.*s\" egnahC",
8505 sug.su_badlen, sug.su_badptr);
8506 }
8507 msg_puts(IObuff);
8508 msg_clr_eos();
8509 msg_putchar('\n');
8510
8511 msg_scroll = TRUE1;
8512 for (int i = 0; i < sug.su_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
8513 stp = &SUG(sug.su_ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(sug.su_ga).ga_data)[i]);
8514
8515 // The suggested word may replace only part of the bad word, add
8516 // the not replaced part.
8517 STRLCPY(wcopy, stp->st_word, MAXWLEN + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(wcopy), (char *)(stp->st_word), (size_t)
(250 + 1));
8518 if (sug.su_badlen > stp->st_orglen)
8519 STRLCPY(wcopy + stp->st_wordlen,xstrlcpy((char *)(wcopy + stp->st_wordlen), (char *)(sug.su_badptr
+ stp->st_orglen), (size_t)(sug.su_badlen - stp->st_orglen
+ 1))
8520 sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen,xstrlcpy((char *)(wcopy + stp->st_wordlen), (char *)(sug.su_badptr
+ stp->st_orglen), (size_t)(sug.su_badlen - stp->st_orglen
+ 1))
8521 sug.su_badlen - stp->st_orglen + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(wcopy + stp->st_wordlen), (char *)(sug.su_badptr
+ stp->st_orglen), (size_t)(sug.su_badlen - stp->st_orglen
+ 1));
8522 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), "%2d", i + 1);
8523 if (cmdmsg_rl)
8524 rl_mirror(IObuff);
8525 msg_puts(IObuff);
8526
8527 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), " \"%s\"", wcopy);
8528 msg_puts(IObuff);
8529
8530 // The word may replace more than "su_badlen".
8531 if (sug.su_badlen < stp->st_orglen) {
8532 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _(" < \"%.*s\"")gettext((char *)(" < \"%.*s\"")),
8533 stp->st_orglen, sug.su_badptr);
8534 msg_puts(IObuff);
8535 }
8536
8537 if (p_verbose > 0) {
8538 // Add the score.
8539 if (sps_flags & (SPS_DOUBLE4 | SPS_BEST1))
8540 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), " (%s%d - %d)",
8541 stp->st_salscore ? "s " : "",
8542 stp->st_score, stp->st_altscore);
8543 else
8544 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), " (%d)",
8545 stp->st_score);
8546 if (cmdmsg_rl)
8547 // Mirror the numbers, but keep the leading space.
8548 rl_mirror(IObuff + 1);
8549 msg_advance(30);
8550 msg_puts(IObuff);
8551 }
8552 msg_putchar('\n');
8553 }
8554
8555 cmdmsg_rl = FALSE0;
8556 msg_col = 0;
8557 // Ask for choice.
8558 selected = prompt_for_number(&mouse_used);
8559 if (mouse_used)
8560 selected -= lines_left;
8561 lines_left = Rows; // avoid more prompt
8562 // don't delay for 'smd' in normal_cmd()
8563 msg_scroll = msg_scroll_save;
8564 }
8565
8566 if (selected > 0 && selected <= sug.su_ga.ga_len && u_save_cursor() == OK1) {
8567 // Save the from and to text for :spellrepall.
8568 stp = &SUG(sug.su_ga, selected - 1)(((suggest_T *)(sug.su_ga).ga_data)[selected - 1]);
8569 if (sug.su_badlen > stp->st_orglen) {
8570 // Replacing less than "su_badlen", append the remainder to
8571 // repl_to.
8572 repl_from = vim_strnsave(sug.su_badptr, sug.su_badlen);
8573 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), "%s%.*s", stp->st_word,
8574 sug.su_badlen - stp->st_orglen,
8575 sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen);
8576 repl_to = vim_strsave(IObuff);
8577 } else {
8578 // Replacing su_badlen or more, use the whole word.
8579 repl_from = vim_strnsave(sug.su_badptr, stp->st_orglen);
8580 repl_to = vim_strsave(stp->st_word);
8581 }
8582
8583 // Replace the word.
8584 p = xmalloc(STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) - stp->st_orglen + stp->st_wordlen + 1);
8585 c = (int)(sug.su_badptr - line);
8586 memmove(p, line, c);
8587 STRCPY(p + c, stp->st_word)strcpy((char *)(p + c), (char *)(stp->st_word));
8588 STRCAT(p, sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen)strcat((char *)(p), (char *)(sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen
));
8589 ml_replace(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, p, FALSE0);
8590 curwin->w_cursor.col = c;
8591
8592 // For redo we use a change-word command.
8593 ResetRedobuff();
8594 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)"ciw");
8595 AppendToRedobuffLit(p + c,
8596 stp->st_wordlen + sug.su_badlen - stp->st_orglen);
8597 AppendCharToRedobuff(ESC'\033');
8598
8599 // After this "p" may be invalid.
8600 changed_bytes(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, c);
8601 } else
8602 curwin->w_cursor = prev_cursor;
8603
8604 spell_find_cleanup(&sug);
8605}
8606
8607// Check if the word at line "lnum" column "col" is required to start with a
8608// capital. This uses 'spellcapcheck' of the current buffer.
8609static bool_Bool check_need_cap(linenr_T lnum, colnr_T col)
8610{
8611 bool_Bool need_cap = false0;
8612 char_u *line;
8613 char_u *line_copy = NULL((void*)0);
8614 char_u *p;
8615 colnr_T endcol;
8616 regmatch_T regmatch;
8617
8618 if (curwin->w_s->b_cap_prog == NULL((void*)0))
8619 return false0;
8620
8621 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
8622 endcol = 0;
8623 if ((int)(skipwhite(line) - line) >= (int)col) {
8624 // At start of line, check if previous line is empty or sentence
8625 // ends there.
8626 if (lnum == 1)
8627 need_cap = true1;
8628 else {
8629 line = ml_get(lnum - 1);
8630 if (*skipwhite(line) == NUL'\000')
8631 need_cap = true1;
8632 else {
8633 // Append a space in place of the line break.
8634 line_copy = concat_str(line, (char_u *)" ");
8635 line = line_copy;
8636 endcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line));
8637 }
8638 }
8639 } else
8640 endcol = col;
8641
8642 if (endcol > 0) {
8643 // Check if sentence ends before the bad word.
8644 regmatch.regprog = curwin->w_s->b_cap_prog;
8645 regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE0;
8646 p = line + endcol;
8647 for (;; ) {
8648 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
8649 if (p == line || spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin))
8650 break;
8651 if (vim_regexec(&regmatch, p, 0)
8652 && regmatch.endp[0] == line + endcol) {
8653 need_cap = true1;
8654 break;
8655 }
8656 }
8657 }
8658
8659 free(line_copy);
8660
8661 return need_cap;
8662}
8663
8664
8665// ":spellrepall"
8666void ex_spellrepall(exarg_T *eap)
8667{
8668 pos_T pos = curwin->w_cursor;
8669 char_u *frompat;
8670 int addlen;
8671 char_u *line;
8672 char_u *p;
8673 bool_Bool save_ws = p_ws;
8674 linenr_T prev_lnum = 0;
8675
8676 if (repl_from == NULL((void*)0) || repl_to == NULL((void*)0)) {
8677 EMSG(_("E752: No previous spell replacement"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E752: No previous spell replacement"
))));
8678 return;
8679 }
8680 addlen = (int)(STRLEN(repl_to)strlen((char *)(repl_to)) - STRLEN(repl_from)strlen((char *)(repl_from)));
8681
8682 frompat = xmalloc(STRLEN(repl_from)strlen((char *)(repl_from)) + 7);
8683 sprintf((char *)frompat, "\\V\\<%s\\>", repl_from);
8684 p_ws = false0;
8685
8686 sub_nsubs = 0;
8687 sub_nlines = 0;
8688 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = 0;
8689 while (!got_int) {
8690 if (do_search(NULL((void*)0), '/', frompat, 1L, SEARCH_KEEP0x400, NULL((void*)0)) == 0
8691 || u_save_cursor() == FAIL0)
8692 break;
8693
8694 // Only replace when the right word isn't there yet. This happens
8695 // when changing "etc" to "etc.".
8696 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
8697 if (addlen <= 0 || STRNCMP(line + curwin->w_cursor.col,strncmp((char *)(line + curwin->w_cursor.col), (char *)(repl_to
), (size_t)(strlen((char *)(repl_to))))
8698 repl_to, STRLEN(repl_to))strncmp((char *)(line + curwin->w_cursor.col), (char *)(repl_to
), (size_t)(strlen((char *)(repl_to)))) != 0) {
8699 p = xmalloc(STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) + addlen + 1);
8700 memmove(p, line, curwin->w_cursor.col);
8701 STRCPY(p + curwin->w_cursor.col, repl_to)strcpy((char *)(p + curwin->w_cursor.col), (char *)(repl_to
));
8702 STRCAT(p, line + curwin->w_cursor.col + STRLEN(repl_from))strcat((char *)(p), (char *)(line + curwin->w_cursor.col +
strlen((char *)(repl_from))));
8703 ml_replace(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, p, FALSE0);
8704 changed_bytes(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.col);
8705
8706 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != prev_lnum) {
8707 ++sub_nlines;
8708 prev_lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
8709 }
8710 ++sub_nsubs;
8711 }
8712 curwin->w_cursor.col += (colnr_T)STRLEN(repl_to)strlen((char *)(repl_to));
8713 }
8714
8715 p_ws = save_ws;
8716 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
8717 free(frompat);
8718
8719 if (sub_nsubs == 0)
8720 EMSG2(_("E753: Not found: %s"), repl_from)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E753: Not found: %s"))), (
char_u *)(repl_from));
8721 else
8722 do_sub_msg(false0);
8723}
8724
8725// Find spell suggestions for "word". Return them in the growarray "*gap" as
8726// a list of allocated strings.
8727void
8728spell_suggest_list (
8729 garray_T *gap,
8730 char_u *word,
8731 int maxcount, // maximum nr of suggestions
8732 bool_Bool need_cap, // 'spellcapcheck' matched
8733 bool_Bool interactive
8734)
8735{
8736 suginfo_T sug;
8737 suggest_T *stp;
8738 char_u *wcopy;
8739
8740 spell_find_suggest(word, 0, &sug, maxcount, false0, need_cap, interactive);
8741
8742 // Make room in "gap".
8743 ga_init(gap, sizeof(char_u *), sug.su_ga.ga_len + 1);
8744 ga_grow(gap, sug.su_ga.ga_len);
8745 for (int i = 0; i < sug.su_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
8746 stp = &SUG(sug.su_ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(sug.su_ga).ga_data)[i]);
8747
8748 // The suggested word may replace only part of "word", add the not
8749 // replaced part.
8750 wcopy = xmalloc(stp->st_wordlen
8751 + STRLEN(sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen)strlen((char *)(sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen)) + 1);
8752 STRCPY(wcopy, stp->st_word)strcpy((char *)(wcopy), (char *)(stp->st_word));
8753 STRCPY(wcopy + stp->st_wordlen, sug.su_badptr + stp->st_orglen)strcpy((char *)(wcopy + stp->st_wordlen), (char *)(sug.su_badptr
+ stp->st_orglen));
8754 ((char_u **)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len++] = wcopy;
8755 }
8756
8757 spell_find_cleanup(&sug);
8758}
8759
8760// Find spell suggestions for the word at the start of "badptr".
8761// Return the suggestions in "su->su_ga".
8762// The maximum number of suggestions is "maxcount".
8763// Note: does use info for the current window.
8764// This is based on the mechanisms of Aspell, but completely reimplemented.
8765static void
8766spell_find_suggest (
8767 char_u *badptr,
8768 int badlen, // length of bad word or 0 if unknown
8769 suginfo_T *su,
8770 int maxcount,
8771 bool_Bool banbadword, // don't include badword in suggestions
8772 bool_Bool need_cap, // word should start with capital
8773 bool_Bool interactive
8774)
8775{
8776 hlf_T attr = HLF_COUNT;
8777 char_u buf[MAXPATHL4096];
8778 char_u *p;
8779 bool_Bool do_combine = false0;
8780 char_u *sps_copy;
8781 static bool_Bool expr_busy = false0;
8782 int c;
8783 langp_T *lp;
8784
8785 // Set the info in "*su".
8786 memset(su, 0, sizeof(suginfo_T));
8787 ga_init(&su->su_ga, (int)sizeof(suggest_T), 10);
8788 ga_init(&su->su_sga, (int)sizeof(suggest_T), 10);
8789 if (*badptr == NUL'\000')
8790 return;
8791 hash_init(&su->su_banned);
8792
8793 su->su_badptr = badptr;
8794 if (badlen != 0)
8795 su->su_badlen = badlen;
8796 else
8797 su->su_badlen = spell_check(curwin, su->su_badptr, &attr, NULL((void*)0), false0);
8798 su->su_maxcount = maxcount;
8799 su->su_maxscore = SCORE_MAXINIT350;
8800
8801 if (su->su_badlen >= MAXWLEN250)
8802 su->su_badlen = MAXWLEN250 - 1; // just in case
8803 STRLCPY(su->su_badword, su->su_badptr, su->su_badlen + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(su->su_badword), (char *)(su->su_badptr
), (size_t)(su->su_badlen + 1));
8804 (void)spell_casefold(su->su_badptr, su->su_badlen,
8805 su->su_fbadword, MAXWLEN250);
8806 // get caps flags for bad word
8807 su->su_badflags = badword_captype(su->su_badptr,
8808 su->su_badptr + su->su_badlen);
8809 if (need_cap)
8810 su->su_badflags |= WF_ONECAP0x02;
8811
8812 // Find the default language for sound folding. We simply use the first
8813 // one in 'spelllang' that supports sound folding. That's good for when
8814 // using multiple files for one language, it's not that bad when mixing
8815 // languages (e.g., "pl,en").
8816 for (int i = 0; i < curbuf->b_s.b_langp.ga_len; ++i) {
8817 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curbuf->b_s.b_langp, i)(((langp_T *)(curbuf->b_s.b_langp).ga_data) + (i));
8818 if (lp->lp_sallang != NULL((void*)0)) {
8819 su->su_sallang = lp->lp_sallang;
8820 break;
8821 }
8822 }
8823
8824 // Soundfold the bad word with the default sound folding, so that we don't
8825 // have to do this many times.
8826 if (su->su_sallang != NULL((void*)0))
8827 spell_soundfold(su->su_sallang, su->su_fbadword, true1,
8828 su->su_sal_badword);
8829
8830 // If the word is not capitalised and spell_check() doesn't consider the
8831 // word to be bad then it might need to be capitalised. Add a suggestion
8832 // for that.
8833 c = PTR2CHAR(su->su_badptr)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(su->su_badptr) : (int)*(su->su_badptr
));
8834 if (!SPELL_ISUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[c] : iswupper(c)) && attr == HLF_COUNT) {
8835 make_case_word(su->su_badword, buf, WF_ONECAP0x02);
8836 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, buf, su->su_badlen, SCORE_ICASE52,
8837 0, true1, su->su_sallang, false0);
8838 }
8839
8840 // Ban the bad word itself. It may appear in another region.
8841 if (banbadword)
8842 add_banned(su, su->su_badword);
8843
8844 // Make a copy of 'spellsuggest', because the expression may change it.
8845 sps_copy = vim_strsave(p_sps);
8846
8847 // Loop over the items in 'spellsuggest'.
8848 for (p = sps_copy; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
8849 copy_option_part(&p, buf, MAXPATHL4096, ",");
8850
8851 if (STRNCMP(buf, "expr:", 5)strncmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("expr:"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
8852 // Evaluate an expression. Skip this when called recursively,
8853 // when using spellsuggest() in the expression.
8854 if (!expr_busy) {
8855 expr_busy = true1;
8856 spell_suggest_expr(su, buf + 5);
8857 expr_busy = false0;
8858 }
8859 } else if (STRNCMP(buf, "file:", 5)strncmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("file:"), (size_t)(5)) == 0)
8860 // Use list of suggestions in a file.
8861 spell_suggest_file(su, buf + 5);
8862 else {
8863 // Use internal method.
8864 spell_suggest_intern(su, interactive);
8865 if (sps_flags & SPS_DOUBLE4)
8866 do_combine = true1;
8867 }
8868 }
8869
8870 free(sps_copy);
8871
8872 if (do_combine)
8873 // Combine the two list of suggestions. This must be done last,
8874 // because sorting changes the order again.
8875 score_combine(su);
8876}
8877
8878// Find suggestions by evaluating expression "expr".
8879static void spell_suggest_expr(suginfo_T *su, char_u *expr)
8880{
8881 list_T *list;
8882 listitem_T *li;
8883 int score;
8884 char_u *p;
8885
8886 // The work is split up in a few parts to avoid having to export
8887 // suginfo_T.
8888 // First evaluate the expression and get the resulting list.
8889 list = eval_spell_expr(su->su_badword, expr);
8890 if (list != NULL((void*)0)) {
8891 // Loop over the items in the list.
8892 for (li = list->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
8893 if (li->li_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
8894 // Get the word and the score from the items.
8895 score = get_spellword(li->li_tv.vval.v_list, &p);
8896 if (score >= 0 && score <= su->su_maxscore)
8897 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, p, su->su_badlen,
8898 score, 0, true1, su->su_sallang, false0);
8899 }
8900 list_unref(list);
8901 }
8902
8903 // Remove bogus suggestions, sort and truncate at "maxcount".
8904 check_suggestions(su, &su->su_ga);
8905 (void)cleanup_suggestions(&su->su_ga, su->su_maxscore, su->su_maxcount);
8906}
8907
8908// Find suggestions in file "fname". Used for "file:" in 'spellsuggest'.
8909static void spell_suggest_file(suginfo_T *su, char_u *fname)
8910{
8911 FILE *fd;
8912 char_u line[MAXWLEN250 * 2];
8913 char_u *p;
8914 int len;
8915 char_u cword[MAXWLEN250];
8916
8917 // Open the file.
8918 fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r")fopen(((char *)fname), ("r"));
8919 if (fd == NULL((void*)0)) {
8920 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(fname
));
8921 return;
8922 }
8923
8924 // Read it line by line.
8925 while (!vim_fgets(line, MAXWLEN250 * 2, fd) && !got_int) {
8926 line_breakcheck();
8927
8928 p = vim_strchr(line, '/');
8929 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
8930 continue; // No Tab found, just skip the line.
8931 *p++ = NUL'\000';
8932 if (STRICMP(su->su_badword, line)strcasecmp((char *)(su->su_badword), (char *)(line)) == 0) {
8933 // Match! Isolate the good word, until CR or NL.
8934 for (len = 0; p[len] >= ' '; ++len)
8935 ;
8936 p[len] = NUL'\000';
8937
8938 // If the suggestion doesn't have specific case duplicate the case
8939 // of the bad word.
8940 if (captype(p, NULL((void*)0)) == 0) {
8941 make_case_word(p, cword, su->su_badflags);
8942 p = cword;
8943 }
8944
8945 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, p, su->su_badlen,
8946 SCORE_FILE30, 0, true1, su->su_sallang, false0);
8947 }
8948 }
8949
8950 fclose(fd);
8951
8952 // Remove bogus suggestions, sort and truncate at "maxcount".
8953 check_suggestions(su, &su->su_ga);
8954 (void)cleanup_suggestions(&su->su_ga, su->su_maxscore, su->su_maxcount);
8955}
8956
8957// Find suggestions for the internal method indicated by "sps_flags".
8958static void spell_suggest_intern(suginfo_T *su, bool_Bool interactive)
8959{
8960 // Load the .sug file(s) that are available and not done yet.
8961 suggest_load_files();
8962
8963 // 1. Try special cases, such as repeating a word: "the the" -> "the".
8964 //
8965 // Set a maximum score to limit the combination of operations that is
8966 // tried.
8967 suggest_try_special(su);
8968
8969 // 2. Try inserting/deleting/swapping/changing a letter, use REP entries
8970 // from the .aff file and inserting a space (split the word).
8971 suggest_try_change(su);
8972
8973 // For the resulting top-scorers compute the sound-a-like score.
8974 if (sps_flags & SPS_DOUBLE4)
8975 score_comp_sal(su);
8976
8977 // 3. Try finding sound-a-like words.
8978 if ((sps_flags & SPS_FAST2) == 0) {
8979 if (sps_flags & SPS_BEST1)
8980 // Adjust the word score for the suggestions found so far for how
8981 // they sounds like.
8982 rescore_suggestions(su);
8983
8984 // While going through the soundfold tree "su_maxscore" is the score
8985 // for the soundfold word, limits the changes that are being tried,
8986 // and "su_sfmaxscore" the rescored score, which is set by
8987 // cleanup_suggestions().
8988 // First find words with a small edit distance, because this is much
8989 // faster and often already finds the top-N suggestions. If we didn't
8990 // find many suggestions try again with a higher edit distance.
8991 // "sl_sounddone" is used to avoid doing the same word twice.
8992 suggest_try_soundalike_prep();
8993 su->su_maxscore = SCORE_SFMAX1200;
8994 su->su_sfmaxscore = SCORE_MAXINIT350 * 3;
8995 suggest_try_soundalike(su);
8996 if (su->su_ga.ga_len < SUG_CLEAN_COUNT(su)((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20)) {
8997 // We didn't find enough matches, try again, allowing more
8998 // changes to the soundfold word.
8999 su->su_maxscore = SCORE_SFMAX2300;
9000 suggest_try_soundalike(su);
9001 if (su->su_ga.ga_len < SUG_CLEAN_COUNT(su)((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20)) {
9002 // Still didn't find enough matches, try again, allowing even
9003 // more changes to the soundfold word.
9004 su->su_maxscore = SCORE_SFMAX3400;
9005 suggest_try_soundalike(su);
9006 }
9007 }
9008 su->su_maxscore = su->su_sfmaxscore;
9009 suggest_try_soundalike_finish();
9010 }
9011
9012 // When CTRL-C was hit while searching do show the results. Only clear
9013 // got_int when using a command, not for spellsuggest().
9014 ui_breakcheck();
9015 if (interactive && got_int) {
9016 (void)vgetc();
9017 got_int = FALSE0;
9018 }
9019
9020 if ((sps_flags & SPS_DOUBLE4) == 0 && su->su_ga.ga_len != 0) {
9021 if (sps_flags & SPS_BEST1)
9022 // Adjust the word score for how it sounds like.
9023 rescore_suggestions(su);
9024
9025 // Remove bogus suggestions, sort and truncate at "maxcount".
9026 check_suggestions(su, &su->su_ga);
9027 (void)cleanup_suggestions(&su->su_ga, su->su_maxscore, su->su_maxcount);
9028 }
9029}
9030
9031// Load the .sug files for languages that have one and weren't loaded yet.
9032static void suggest_load_files(void)
9033{
9034 langp_T *lp;
9035 slang_T *slang;
9036 char_u *dotp;
9037 FILE *fd;
9038 char_u buf[MAXWLEN250];
9039 int i;
9040 time_t timestamp;
9041 int wcount;
9042 int wordnr;
9043 garray_T ga;
9044 int c;
9045
9046 // Do this for all languages that support sound folding.
9047 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
9048 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
9049 slang = lp->lp_slang;
9050 if (slang->sl_sugtime != 0 && !slang->sl_sugloaded) {
9051 // Change ".spl" to ".sug" and open the file. When the file isn't
9052 // found silently skip it. Do set "sl_sugloaded" so that we
9053 // don't try again and again.
9054 slang->sl_sugloaded = true1;
9055
9056 dotp = vim_strrchr(slang->sl_fname, '.');
9057 if (dotp == NULL((void*)0) || fnamecmp(dotp, ".spl")vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(dotp), (char_u *)(".spl")) != 0)
9058 continue;
9059 STRCPY(dotp, ".sug")strcpy((char *)(dotp), (char *)(".sug"));
9060 fd = mch_fopen((char *)slang->sl_fname, "r")fopen(((char *)slang->sl_fname), ("r"));
9061 if (fd == NULL((void*)0))
9062 goto nextone;
9063
9064 // <SUGHEADER>: <fileID> <versionnr> <timestamp>
9065 for (i = 0; i < VIMSUGMAGICL6; ++i)
9066 buf[i] = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <fileID>
9067 if (STRNCMP(buf, VIMSUGMAGIC, VIMSUGMAGICL)strncmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("VIMsug"), (size_t)(6)) != 0) {
9068 EMSG2(_("E778: This does not look like a .sug file: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E778: This does not look like a .sug file: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname))
9069 slang->sl_fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E778: This does not look like a .sug file: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname));
9070 goto nextone;
9071 }
9072 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <versionnr>
9073 if (c < VIMSUGVERSION1) {
9074 EMSG2(_("E779: Old .sug file, needs to be updated: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E779: Old .sug file, needs to be updated: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname))
9075 slang->sl_fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E779: Old .sug file, needs to be updated: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname));
9076 goto nextone;
9077 } else if (c > VIMSUGVERSION1) {
