9078 EMSG2(_("E780: .sug file is for newer version of Vim: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E780: .sug file is for newer version of Vim: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname))
9079 slang->sl_fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E780: .sug file is for newer version of Vim: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname));
9080 goto nextone;
9081 }
9082
9083 // Check the timestamp, it must be exactly the same as the one in
9084 // the .spl file. Otherwise the word numbers won't match.
9085 timestamp = get8ctime(fd); // <timestamp>
9086 if (timestamp != slang->sl_sugtime) {
9087 EMSG2(_("E781: .sug file doesn't match .spl file: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E781: .sug file doesn't match .spl file: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname))
9088 slang->sl_fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E781: .sug file doesn't match .spl file: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname));
9089 goto nextone;
9090 }
9091
9092 // <SUGWORDTREE>: <wordtree>
9093 // Read the trie with the soundfolded words.
9094 if (spell_read_tree(fd, &slang->sl_sbyts, &slang->sl_sidxs,
9095 false0, 0) != 0) {
9096someerror:
9097 EMSG2(_("E782: error while reading .sug file: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E782: error while reading .sug file: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname))
9098 slang->sl_fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E782: error while reading .sug file: %s"
))), (char_u *)(slang->sl_fname));
9099 slang_clear_sug(slang);
9100 goto nextone;
9101 }
9102
9103 // <SUGTABLE>: <sugwcount> <sugline> ...
9104 //
9105 // Read the table with word numbers. We use a file buffer for
9106 // this, because it's so much like a file with lines. Makes it
9107 // possible to swap the info and save on memory use.
9108 slang->sl_sugbuf = open_spellbuf();
9109
9110 // <sugwcount>
9111 wcount = get4c(fd);
9112 if (wcount < 0)
9113 goto someerror;
9114
9115 // Read all the wordnr lists into the buffer, one NUL terminated
9116 // list per line.
9117 ga_init(&ga, 1, 100);
9118 for (wordnr = 0; wordnr < wcount; ++wordnr) {
9119 ga.ga_len = 0;
9120 for (;; ) {
9121 c = getc(fd)_IO_getc (fd); // <sugline>
9122 if (c < 0) {
9123 goto someerror;
9124 }
9125 GA_APPEND(char_u, &ga, c)do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char_u *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(
&ga)->ga_len++] = (c); } while (0);
9126 if (c == NUL'\000')
9127 break;
9128 }
9129 if (ml_append_buf(slang->sl_sugbuf, (linenr_T)wordnr,
9130 ga.ga_data, ga.ga_len, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
9131 goto someerror;
9132 }
9133 ga_clear(&ga);
9134
9135 // Need to put word counts in the word tries, so that we can find
9136 // a word by its number.
9137 tree_count_words(slang->sl_fbyts, slang->sl_fidxs);
9138 tree_count_words(slang->sl_sbyts, slang->sl_sidxs);
9139
9140nextone:
9141 if (fd != NULL((void*)0))
9142 fclose(fd);
9143 STRCPY(dotp, ".spl")strcpy((char *)(dotp), (char *)(".spl"));
9144 }
9145 }
9146}
9147
9148// Fill in the wordcount fields for a trie.
9149// Returns the total number of words.
9150static void tree_count_words(char_u *byts, idx_T *idxs)
9151{
9152 int depth;
9153 idx_T arridx[MAXWLEN250];
9154 int curi[MAXWLEN250];
9155 int c;
9156 idx_T n;
9157 int wordcount[MAXWLEN250];
9158
9159 arridx[0] = 0;
9160 curi[0] = 1;
9161 wordcount[0] = 0;
9162 depth = 0;
9163 while (depth >= 0 && !got_int) {
9164 if (curi[depth] > byts[arridx[depth]]) {
9165 // Done all bytes at this node, go up one level.
9166 idxs[arridx[depth]] = wordcount[depth];
9167 if (depth > 0)
9168 wordcount[depth - 1] += wordcount[depth];
9169
9170 --depth;
9171 fast_breakcheck();
9172 } else {
9173 // Do one more byte at this node.
9174 n = arridx[depth] + curi[depth];
9175 ++curi[depth];
9176
9177 c = byts[n];
9178 if (c == 0) {
9179 // End of word, count it.
9180 ++wordcount[depth];
9181
9182 // Skip over any other NUL bytes (same word with different
9183 // flags).
9184 while (byts[n + 1] == 0) {
9185 ++n;
9186 ++curi[depth];
9187 }
9188 } else {
9189 // Normal char, go one level deeper to count the words.
9190 ++depth;
9191 arridx[depth] = idxs[n];
9192 curi[depth] = 1;
9193 wordcount[depth] = 0;
9194 }
9195 }
9196 }
9197}
9198
9199// Free the info put in "*su" by spell_find_suggest().
9200static void spell_find_cleanup(suginfo_T *su)
9201{
9202 // Free the suggestions.
9203 for (int i = 0; i < su->su_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
9204 free(SUG(su->su_ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_ga).ga_data)[i]).st_word);
9205 }
9206 ga_clear(&su->su_ga);
9207 for (int i = 0; i < su->su_sga.ga_len; ++i) {
9208 free(SUG(su->su_sga, i)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_sga).ga_data)[i]).st_word);
9209 }
9210 ga_clear(&su->su_sga);
9211
9212 // Free the banned words.
9213 hash_clear_all(&su->su_banned, 0);
9214}
9215
9216// Make a copy of "word", with the first letter upper or lower cased, to
9217// "wcopy[MAXWLEN]". "word" must not be empty.
9218// The result is NUL terminated.
9219static void
9220onecap_copy (
9221 char_u *word,
9222 char_u *wcopy,
9223 bool_Bool upper // true: first letter made upper case
9224)
9225{
9226 char_u *p;
9227 int c;
9228 int l;
9229
9230 p = word;
9231 if (has_mbyte)
9232 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
9233 else
9234 c = *p++;
9235 if (upper)
9236 c = SPELL_TOUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_toupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_upper[c] : (int)towupper(c));
9237 else
9238 c = SPELL_TOFOLD(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_fold(c) : (c) < 256
? (int)spelltab.st_fold[c] : (int)towlower(c));
9239 if (has_mbyte)
9240 l = mb_char2bytes(c, wcopy);
9241 else {
9242 l = 1;
9243 wcopy[0] = c;
9244 }
9245 STRLCPY(wcopy + l, p, MAXWLEN - l)xstrlcpy((char *)(wcopy + l), (char *)(p), (size_t)(250 - l));
9246}
9247
9248// Make a copy of "word" with all the letters upper cased into
9249// "wcopy[MAXWLEN]". The result is NUL terminated.
9250static void allcap_copy(char_u *word, char_u *wcopy)
9251{
9252 char_u *s;
9253 char_u *d;
9254 int c;
9255
9256 d = wcopy;
9257 for (s = word; *s != NUL'\000'; ) {
9258 if (has_mbyte)
9259 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&s);
9260 else
9261 c = *s++;
9262
9263 // We only change 0xdf to SS when we are certain latin1 is used. It
9264 // would cause weird errors in other 8-bit encodings.
9265 if (enc_latin1like && c == 0xdf) {
9266 c = 'S';
9267 if (d - wcopy >= MAXWLEN250 - 1)
9268 break;
9269 *d++ = c;
9270 } else
9271 c = SPELL_TOUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_toupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_upper[c] : (int)towupper(c));
9272
9273 if (has_mbyte) {
9274 if (d - wcopy >= MAXWLEN250 - MB_MAXBYTES21)
9275 break;
9276 d += mb_char2bytes(c, d);
9277 } else {
9278 if (d - wcopy >= MAXWLEN250 - 1)
9279 break;
9280 *d++ = c;
9281 }
9282 }
9283 *d = NUL'\000';
9284}
9285
9286// Try finding suggestions by recognizing specific situations.
9287static void suggest_try_special(suginfo_T *su)
9288{
9289 char_u *p;
9290 size_t len;
9291 int c;
9292 char_u word[MAXWLEN250];
9293
9294 // Recognize a word that is repeated: "the the".
9295 p = skiptowhite(su->su_fbadword);
9296 len = p - su->su_fbadword;
9297 p = skipwhite(p);
9298 if (STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) == len && STRNCMP(su->su_fbadword, p, len)strncmp((char *)(su->su_fbadword), (char *)(p), (size_t)(len
)) == 0) {
9299 // Include badflags: if the badword is onecap or allcap
9300 // use that for the goodword too: "The the" -> "The".
9301 c = su->su_fbadword[len];
9302 su->su_fbadword[len] = NUL'\000';
9303 make_case_word(su->su_fbadword, word, su->su_badflags);
9304 su->su_fbadword[len] = c;
9305
9306 // Give a soundalike score of 0, compute the score as if deleting one
9307 // character.
9308 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, word, su->su_badlen,
9309 RESCORE(SCORE_REP, 0)((3 * 65 + 0) / 4), 0, true1, su->su_sallang, false0);
9310 }
9311}
9312
9313// Try finding suggestions by adding/removing/swapping letters.
9314static void suggest_try_change(suginfo_T *su)
9315{
9316 char_u fword[MAXWLEN250]; // copy of the bad word, case-folded
9317 int n;
9318 char_u *p;
9319 langp_T *lp;
9320
9321 // We make a copy of the case-folded bad word, so that we can modify it
9322 // to find matches (esp. REP items). Append some more text, changing
9323 // chars after the bad word may help.
9324 STRCPY(fword, su->su_fbadword)strcpy((char *)(fword), (char *)(su->su_fbadword));
9325 n = (int)STRLEN(fword)strlen((char *)(fword));
9326 p = su->su_badptr + su->su_badlen;
9327 (void)spell_casefold(p, (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)), fword + n, MAXWLEN250 - n);
9328
9329 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
9330 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
9331
9332 // If reloading a spell file fails it's still in the list but
9333 // everything has been cleared.
9334 if (lp->lp_slang->sl_fbyts == NULL((void*)0))
9335 continue;
9336
9337 // Try it for this language. Will add possible suggestions.
9338 suggest_trie_walk(su, lp, fword, false0);
9339 }
9340}
9341
9342// Check the maximum score, if we go over it we won't try this change.
9343#define TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, add)(stack[depth].ts_score + (add) < su->su_maxscore) \
9344 (stack[depth].ts_score + (add) < su->su_maxscore)
9345
9346// Try finding suggestions by adding/removing/swapping letters.
9347//
9348// This uses a state machine. At each node in the tree we try various
9349// operations. When trying if an operation works "depth" is increased and the
9350// stack[] is used to store info. This allows combinations, thus insert one
9351// character, replace one and delete another. The number of changes is
9352// limited by su->su_maxscore.
9353//
9354// After implementing this I noticed an article by Kemal Oflazer that
9355// describes something similar: "Error-tolerant Finite State Recognition with
9356// Applications to Morphological Analysis and Spelling Correction" (1996).
9357// The implementation in the article is simplified and requires a stack of
9358// unknown depth. The implementation here only needs a stack depth equal to
9359// the length of the word.
9360//
9361// This is also used for the sound-folded word, "soundfold" is true then.
9362// The mechanism is the same, but we find a match with a sound-folded word
9363// that comes from one or more original words. Each of these words may be
9364// added, this is done by add_sound_suggest().
9365// Don't use:
9366// the prefix tree or the keep-case tree
9367// "su->su_badlen"
9368// anything to do with upper and lower case
9369// anything to do with word or non-word characters ("spell_iswordp()")
9370// banned words
9371// word flags (rare, region, compounding)
9372// word splitting for now
9373// "similar_chars()"
9374// use "slang->sl_repsal" instead of "lp->lp_replang->sl_rep"
9375static void suggest_trie_walk(suginfo_T *su, langp_T *lp, char_u *fword, bool_Bool soundfold)
9376{
9377 char_u tword[MAXWLEN250]; // good word collected so far
9378 trystate_T stack[MAXWLEN250];
9379 char_u preword[MAXWLEN250 * 3]; // word found with proper case;
9380 // concatenation of prefix compound
9381 // words and split word. NUL terminated
9382 // when going deeper but not when coming
9383 // back.
9384 char_u compflags[MAXWLEN250]; // compound flags, one for each word
9385 trystate_T *sp;
9386 int newscore;
9387 int score;
9388 char_u *byts, *fbyts, *pbyts;
9389 idx_T *idxs, *fidxs, *pidxs;
9390 int depth;
9391 int c, c2, c3;
9392 int n = 0;
9393 int flags;
9394 garray_T *gap;
9395 idx_T arridx;
9396 int len;
9397 char_u *p;
9398 fromto_T *ftp;
9399 int fl = 0, tl;
9400 int repextra = 0; // extra bytes in fword[] from REP item
9401 slang_T *slang = lp->lp_slang;
9402 int fword_ends;
9403 bool_Bool goodword_ends;
9404#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
9405 // Stores the name of the change made at each level.
9406 char_u changename[MAXWLEN250][80];
9407#endif
9408 int breakcheckcount = 1000;
9409 bool_Bool compound_ok;
9410
9411 // Go through the whole case-fold tree, try changes at each node.
9412 // "tword[]" contains the word collected from nodes in the tree.
9413 // "fword[]" the word we are trying to match with (initially the bad
9414 // word).
9415 depth = 0;
9416 sp = &stack[0];
9417 memset(sp, 0, sizeof(trystate_T));
9418 sp->ts_curi = 1;
9419
9420 if (soundfold) {
9421 // Going through the soundfold tree.
9422 byts = fbyts = slang->sl_sbyts;
9423 idxs = fidxs = slang->sl_sidxs;
9424 pbyts = NULL((void*)0);
9425 pidxs = NULL((void*)0);
9426 sp->ts_prefixdepth = PFD_NOPREFIX0xff;
9427 sp->ts_state = STATE_START;
9428 } else {
9429 // When there are postponed prefixes we need to use these first. At
9430 // the end of the prefix we continue in the case-fold tree.
9431 fbyts = slang->sl_fbyts;
9432 fidxs = slang->sl_fidxs;
9433 pbyts = slang->sl_pbyts;
9434 pidxs = slang->sl_pidxs;
9435 if (pbyts != NULL((void*)0)) {
9436 byts = pbyts;
9437 idxs = pidxs;
9438 sp->ts_prefixdepth = PFD_PREFIXTREE0xfe;
9439 sp->ts_state = STATE_NOPREFIX; // try without prefix first
9440 } else {
9441 byts = fbyts;
9442 idxs = fidxs;
9443 sp->ts_prefixdepth = PFD_NOPREFIX0xff;
9444 sp->ts_state = STATE_START;
9445 }
9446 }
9447
9448 // Loop to find all suggestions. At each round we either:
9449 // - For the current state try one operation, advance "ts_curi",
9450 // increase "depth".
9451 // - When a state is done go to the next, set "ts_state".
9452 // - When all states are tried decrease "depth".
9453 while (depth >= 0 && !got_int) {
9454 sp = &stack[depth];
9455 switch (sp->ts_state) {
9456 case STATE_START:
9457 case STATE_NOPREFIX:
9458 // Start of node: Deal with NUL bytes, which means
9459 // tword[] may end here.
9460 arridx = sp->ts_arridx; // current node in the tree
9461 len = byts[arridx]; // bytes in this node
9462 arridx += sp->ts_curi; // index of current byte
9463
9464 if (sp->ts_prefixdepth == PFD_PREFIXTREE0xfe) {
9465 // Skip over the NUL bytes, we use them later.
9466 for (n = 0; n < len && byts[arridx + n] == 0; ++n)
9467 ;
9468 sp->ts_curi += n;
9469
9470 // Always past NUL bytes now.
9471 n = (int)sp->ts_state;
9472 sp->ts_state = STATE_ENDNUL;
9473 sp->ts_save_badflags = su->su_badflags;
9474
9475 // At end of a prefix or at start of prefixtree: check for
9476 // following word.
9477 if (byts[arridx] == 0 || n == (int)STATE_NOPREFIX) {
9478 // Set su->su_badflags to the caps type at this position.
9479 // Use the caps type until here for the prefix itself.
9480 if (has_mbyte)
9481 n = nofold_len(fword, sp->ts_fidx, su->su_badptr);
9482 else
9483 n = sp->ts_fidx;
9484 flags = badword_captype(su->su_badptr, su->su_badptr + n);
9485 su->su_badflags = badword_captype(su->su_badptr + n,
9486 su->su_badptr + su->su_badlen);
9487#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
9488 sprintf(changename[depth], "prefix");
9489#endif
9490 go_deeper(stack, depth, 0);
9491 ++depth;
9492 sp = &stack[depth];
9493 sp->ts_prefixdepth = depth - 1;
9494 byts = fbyts;
9495 idxs = fidxs;
9496 sp->ts_arridx = 0;
9497
9498 // Move the prefix to preword[] with the right case
9499 // and make find_keepcap_word() works.
9500 tword[sp->ts_twordlen] = NUL'\000';
9501 make_case_word(tword + sp->ts_splitoff,
9502 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen, flags);
9503 sp->ts_prewordlen = (char_u)STRLEN(preword)strlen((char *)(preword));
9504 sp->ts_splitoff = sp->ts_twordlen;
9505 }
9506 break;
9507 }
9508
9509 if (sp->ts_curi > len || byts[arridx] != 0) {
9510 // Past bytes in node and/or past NUL bytes.
9511 sp->ts_state = STATE_ENDNUL;
9512 sp->ts_save_badflags = su->su_badflags;
9513 break;
9514 }
9515
9516 // End of word in tree.
9517 ++sp->ts_curi; // eat one NUL byte
9518
9519 flags = (int)idxs[arridx];
9520
9521 // Skip words with the NOSUGGEST flag.
9522 if (flags & WF_NOSUGGEST0x0400)
9523 break;
9524
9525 fword_ends = (fword[sp->ts_fidx] == NUL'\000'
9526 || (soundfold
9527 ? vim_iswhite(fword[sp->ts_fidx])((fword[sp->ts_fidx]) == ' ' || (fword[sp->ts_fidx]) ==
'\t')
9528 : !spell_iswordp(fword + sp->ts_fidx, curwin)));
9529 tword[sp->ts_twordlen] = NUL'\000';
9530
9531 if (sp->ts_prefixdepth <= PFD_NOTSPECIAL0xfd
9532 && (sp->ts_flags & TSF_PREFIXOK1) == 0) {
9533 // There was a prefix before the word. Check that the prefix
9534 // can be used with this word.
9535 // Count the length of the NULs in the prefix. If there are
9536 // none this must be the first try without a prefix.
9537 n = stack[sp->ts_prefixdepth].ts_arridx;
9538 len = pbyts[n++];
9539 for (c = 0; c < len && pbyts[n + c] == 0; ++c)
9540 ;
9541 if (c > 0) {
9542 c = valid_word_prefix(c, n, flags,
9543 tword + sp->ts_splitoff, slang, false0);
9544 if (c == 0)
9545 break;
9546
9547 // Use the WF_RARE flag for a rare prefix.
9548 if (c & WF_RAREPFX(0x01 << 24))
9549 flags |= WF_RARE0x08;
9550
9551 // Tricky: when checking for both prefix and compounding
9552 // we run into the prefix flag first.
9553 // Remember that it's OK, so that we accept the prefix
9554 // when arriving at a compound flag.
9555 sp->ts_flags |= TSF_PREFIXOK1;
9556 }
9557 }
9558
9559 // Check NEEDCOMPOUND: can't use word without compounding. Do try
9560 // appending another compound word below.
9561 if (sp->ts_complen == sp->ts_compsplit && fword_ends
9562 && (flags & WF_NEEDCOMP0x0200))
9563 goodword_ends = false0;
9564 else
9565 goodword_ends = true1;
9566
9567 p = NULL((void*)0);
9568 compound_ok = true1;
9569 if (sp->ts_complen > sp->ts_compsplit) {
9570 if (slang->sl_nobreak) {
9571 // There was a word before this word. When there was no
9572 // change in this word (it was correct) add the first word
9573 // as a suggestion. If this word was corrected too, we
9574 // need to check if a correct word follows.
9575 if (sp->ts_fidx - sp->ts_splitfidx
9576 == sp->ts_twordlen - sp->ts_splitoff
9577 && STRNCMP(fword + sp->ts_splitfidx,strncmp((char *)(fword + sp->ts_splitfidx), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff), (size_t)(sp->ts_fidx - sp->ts_splitfidx
))
9578 tword + sp->ts_splitoff,strncmp((char *)(fword + sp->ts_splitfidx), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff), (size_t)(sp->ts_fidx - sp->ts_splitfidx
))
9579 sp->ts_fidx - sp->ts_splitfidx)strncmp((char *)(fword + sp->ts_splitfidx), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff), (size_t)(sp->ts_fidx - sp->ts_splitfidx
)) == 0) {
9580 preword[sp->ts_prewordlen] = NUL'\000';
9581 newscore = score_wordcount_adj(slang, sp->ts_score,
9582 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen,
9583 sp->ts_prewordlen > 0);
9584 // Add the suggestion if the score isn't too bad.
9585 if (newscore <= su->su_maxscore)
9586 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, preword,
9587 sp->ts_splitfidx - repextra,
9588 newscore, 0, false0,
9589 lp->lp_sallang, false0);
9590 break;
9591 }
9592 } else {
9593 // There was a compound word before this word. If this
9594 // word does not support compounding then give up
9595 // (splitting is tried for the word without compound
9596 // flag).
9597 if (((unsigned)flags >> 24) == 0
9598 || sp->ts_twordlen - sp->ts_splitoff
9599 < slang->sl_compminlen)
9600 break;
9601 // For multi-byte chars check character length against
9602 // COMPOUNDMIN.
9603 if (has_mbyte
9604 && slang->sl_compminlen > 0
9605 && mb_charlen(tword + sp->ts_splitoff)
9606 < slang->sl_compminlen)
9607 break;
9608
9609 compflags[sp->ts_complen] = ((unsigned)flags >> 24);
9610 compflags[sp->ts_complen + 1] = NUL'\000';
9611 STRLCPY(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen,xstrlcpy((char *)(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff), (size_t)(sp->ts_twordlen - sp->
ts_splitoff + 1))
9612 tword + sp->ts_splitoff,xstrlcpy((char *)(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff), (size_t)(sp->ts_twordlen - sp->
ts_splitoff + 1))
9613 sp->ts_twordlen - sp->ts_splitoff + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff), (size_t)(sp->ts_twordlen - sp->
ts_splitoff + 1));
9614
9615 // Verify CHECKCOMPOUNDPATTERN rules.
9616 if (match_checkcompoundpattern(preword, sp->ts_prewordlen,
9617 &slang->sl_comppat))
9618 compound_ok = false0;
9619
9620 if (compound_ok) {
9621 p = preword;
9622 while (*skiptowhite(p) != NUL'\000')
9623 p = skipwhite(skiptowhite(p));
9624 if (fword_ends && !can_compound(slang, p,
9625 compflags + sp->ts_compsplit))
9626 // Compound is not allowed. But it may still be
9627 // possible if we add another (short) word.
9628 compound_ok = false0;
9629 }
9630
9631 // Get pointer to last char of previous word.
9632 p = preword + sp->ts_prewordlen;
9633 mb_ptr_back(preword, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(preword, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
9634 }
9635 }
9636
9637 // Form the word with proper case in preword.
9638 // If there is a word from a previous split, append.
9639 // For the soundfold tree don't change the case, simply append.
9640 if (soundfold)
9641 STRCPY(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen, tword + sp->ts_splitoff)strcpy((char *)(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen), (char *)(tword
+ sp->ts_splitoff));
9642 else if (flags & WF_KEEPCAP0x80)
9643 // Must find the word in the keep-case tree.
9644 find_keepcap_word(slang, tword + sp->ts_splitoff,
9645 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen);
9646 else {
9647 // Include badflags: If the badword is onecap or allcap
9648 // use that for the goodword too. But if the badword is
9649 // allcap and it's only one char long use onecap.
9650 c = su->su_badflags;
9651 if ((c & WF_ALLCAP0x04)
9652 && su->su_badlen == (*mb_ptr2len)(su->su_badptr)
9653 )
9654 c = WF_ONECAP0x02;
9655 c |= flags;
9656
9657 // When appending a compound word after a word character don't
9658 // use Onecap.
9659 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin))
9660 c &= ~WF_ONECAP0x02;
9661 make_case_word(tword + sp->ts_splitoff,
9662 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen, c);
9663 }
9664
9665 if (!soundfold) {
9666 // Don't use a banned word. It may appear again as a good
9667 // word, thus remember it.
9668 if (flags & WF_BANNED0x10) {
9669 add_banned(su, preword + sp->ts_prewordlen);
9670 break;
9671 }
9672 if ((sp->ts_complen == sp->ts_compsplit
9673 && WAS_BANNED(su, preword + sp->ts_prewordlen)(!((hash_find(&su->su_banned, preword + sp->ts_prewordlen
))->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hash_find(&su->su_banned
, preword + sp->ts_prewordlen))->hi_key == &hash_removed
)))
9674 || WAS_BANNED(su, preword)(!((hash_find(&su->su_banned, preword))->hi_key == (
(void*)0) || (hash_find(&su->su_banned, preword))->
hi_key == &hash_removed))) {
9675 if (slang->sl_compprog == NULL((void*)0))
9676 break;
9677 // the word so far was banned but we may try compounding
9678 goodword_ends = false0;
9679 }
9680 }
9681
9682 newscore = 0;
9683 if (!soundfold) { // soundfold words don't have flags
9684 if ((flags & WF_REGION0x01)
9685 && (((unsigned)flags >> 16) & lp->lp_region) == 0)
9686 newscore += SCORE_REGION200;
9687 if (flags & WF_RARE0x08)
9688 newscore += SCORE_RARE180;
9689
9690 if (!spell_valid_case(su->su_badflags,
9691 captype(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen, NULL((void*)0))))
9692 newscore += SCORE_ICASE52;
9693 }
9694
9695 // TODO: how about splitting in the soundfold tree?
9696 if (fword_ends
9697 && goodword_ends
9698 && sp->ts_fidx >= sp->ts_fidxtry
9699 && compound_ok) {
9700 // The badword also ends: add suggestions.
9701#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
9702 if (soundfold && STRCMP(preword, "smwrd")strcmp((char *)(preword), (char *)("smwrd")) == 0) {
9703 int j;
9704
9705 // print the stack of changes that brought us here
9706 smsg("------ %s -------", fword);
9707 for (j = 0; j < depth; ++j)
9708 smsg("%s", changename[j]);
9709 }
9710#endif
9711 if (soundfold) {
9712 // For soundfolded words we need to find the original
9713 // words, the edit distance and then add them.
9714 add_sound_suggest(su, preword, sp->ts_score, lp);
9715 } else if (sp->ts_fidx > 0) {
9716 // Give a penalty when changing non-word char to word
9717 // char, e.g., "thes," -> "these".
9718 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
9719 mb_ptr_back(fword, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(fword, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
9720 if (!spell_iswordp(p, curwin)) {
9721 p = preword + STRLEN(preword)strlen((char *)(preword));
9722 mb_ptr_back(preword, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(preword, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
9723 if (spell_iswordp(p, curwin))
9724 newscore += SCORE_NONWORD103;
9725 }
9726
9727 // Give a bonus to words seen before.
9728 score = score_wordcount_adj(slang,
9729 sp->ts_score + newscore,
9730 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen,
9731 sp->ts_prewordlen > 0);
9732
9733 // Add the suggestion if the score isn't too bad.
9734 if (score <= su->su_maxscore) {
9735 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, preword,
9736 sp->ts_fidx - repextra,
9737 score, 0, false0, lp->lp_sallang, false0);
9738
9739 if (su->su_badflags & WF_MIXCAP0x20) {
9740 // We really don't know if the word should be
9741 // upper or lower case, add both.
9742 c = captype(preword, NULL((void*)0));
9743 if (c == 0 || c == WF_ALLCAP0x04) {
9744 make_case_word(tword + sp->ts_splitoff,
9745 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen,
9746 c == 0 ? WF_ALLCAP0x04 : 0);
9747
9748 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, preword,
9749 sp->ts_fidx - repextra,
9750 score + SCORE_ICASE52, 0, false0,
9751 lp->lp_sallang, false0);
9752 }
9753 }
9754 }
9755 }
9756 }
9757
9758 // Try word split and/or compounding.
9759 if ((sp->ts_fidx >= sp->ts_fidxtry || fword_ends)
9760 // Don't split halfway a character.
9761 && (!has_mbyte || sp->ts_tcharlen == 0)
9762 ) {
9763 bool_Bool try_compound;
9764 int try_split;
9765
9766 // If past the end of the bad word don't try a split.
9767 // Otherwise try changing the next word. E.g., find
9768 // suggestions for "the the" where the second "the" is
9769 // different. It's done like a split.
9770 // TODO: word split for soundfold words
9771 try_split = (sp->ts_fidx - repextra < su->su_badlen)
9772 && !soundfold;
9773
9774 // Get here in several situations:
9775 // 1. The word in the tree ends:
9776 // If the word allows compounding try that. Otherwise try
9777 // a split by inserting a space. For both check that a
9778 // valid words starts at fword[sp->ts_fidx].
9779 // For NOBREAK do like compounding to be able to check if
9780 // the next word is valid.
9781 // 2. The badword does end, but it was due to a change (e.g.,
9782 // a swap). No need to split, but do check that the
9783 // following word is valid.
9784 // 3. The badword and the word in the tree end. It may still
9785 // be possible to compound another (short) word.
9786 try_compound = false0;
9787 if (!soundfold
9788 && slang->sl_compprog != NULL((void*)0)
9789 && ((unsigned)flags >> 24) != 0
9790 && sp->ts_twordlen - sp->ts_splitoff
9791 >= slang->sl_compminlen
9792 && (!has_mbyte
9793 || slang->sl_compminlen == 0
9794 || mb_charlen(tword + sp->ts_splitoff)
9795 >= slang->sl_compminlen)
9796 && (slang->sl_compsylmax < MAXWLEN250
9797 || sp->ts_complen + 1 - sp->ts_compsplit
9798 < slang->sl_compmax)
9799 && (can_be_compound(sp, slang,
9800 compflags, ((unsigned)flags >> 24)))) {
9801 try_compound = true1;
9802 compflags[sp->ts_complen] = ((unsigned)flags >> 24);
9803 compflags[sp->ts_complen + 1] = NUL'\000';
9804 }
9805
9806 // For NOBREAK we never try splitting, it won't make any word
9807 // valid.
9808 if (slang->sl_nobreak)
9809 try_compound = true1;
9810
9811 // If we could add a compound word, and it's also possible to
9812 // split at this point, do the split first and set
9813 // TSF_DIDSPLIT to avoid doing it again.
9814 else if (!fword_ends
9815 && try_compound
9816 && (sp->ts_flags & TSF_DIDSPLIT2) == 0) {
9817 try_compound = false0;
9818 sp->ts_flags |= TSF_DIDSPLIT2;
9819 --sp->ts_curi; // do the same NUL again
9820 compflags[sp->ts_complen] = NUL'\000';
9821 } else
9822 sp->ts_flags &= ~TSF_DIDSPLIT2;
9823
9824 if (try_split || try_compound) {
9825 if (!try_compound && (!fword_ends || !goodword_ends)) {
9826 // If we're going to split need to check that the
9827 // words so far are valid for compounding. If there
9828 // is only one word it must not have the NEEDCOMPOUND
9829 // flag.
9830 if (sp->ts_complen == sp->ts_compsplit
9831 && (flags & WF_NEEDCOMP0x0200))
9832 break;
9833 p = preword;
9834 while (*skiptowhite(p) != NUL'\000')
9835 p = skipwhite(skiptowhite(p));
9836 if (sp->ts_complen > sp->ts_compsplit
9837 && !can_compound(slang, p,
9838 compflags + sp->ts_compsplit))
9839 break;
9840
9841 if (slang->sl_nosplitsugs)
9842 newscore += SCORE_SPLIT_NO249;
9843 else
9844 newscore += SCORE_SPLIT149;
9845
9846 // Give a bonus to words seen before.
9847 newscore = score_wordcount_adj(slang, newscore,
9848 preword + sp->ts_prewordlen, true1);
9849 }
9850
9851 if (TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, newscore)(stack[depth].ts_score + (newscore) < su->su_maxscore)) {
9852 go_deeper(stack, depth, newscore);
9853#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
9854 if (!try_compound && !fword_ends)
9855 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: split",
9856 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx);
9857 else
9858 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: compound",
9859 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx);
9860#endif
9861 // Save things to be restored at STATE_SPLITUNDO.
9862 sp->ts_save_badflags = su->su_badflags;
9863 sp->ts_state = STATE_SPLITUNDO;
9864
9865 ++depth;
9866 sp = &stack[depth];
9867
9868 // Append a space to preword when splitting.
9869 if (!try_compound && !fword_ends)
9870 STRCAT(preword, " ")strcat((char *)(preword), (char *)(" "));
9871 sp->ts_prewordlen = (char_u)STRLEN(preword)strlen((char *)(preword));
9872 sp->ts_splitoff = sp->ts_twordlen;
9873 sp->ts_splitfidx = sp->ts_fidx;
9874
9875 // If the badword has a non-word character at this
9876 // position skip it. That means replacing the
9877 // non-word character with a space. Always skip a
9878 // character when the word ends. But only when the
9879 // good word can end.
9880 if (((!try_compound && !spell_iswordp_nmw(fword
9881 + sp->ts_fidx,
9882 curwin))
9883 || fword_ends)
9884 && fword[sp->ts_fidx] != NUL'\000'
9885 && goodword_ends) {
9886 int l;
9887
9888 if (has_mbyte)
9889 l = MB_BYTE2LEN(fword[sp->ts_fidx])mb_bytelen_tab[fword[sp->ts_fidx]];
9890 else
9891 l = 1;
9892 if (fword_ends) {
9893 // Copy the skipped character to preword.
9894 memmove(preword + sp->ts_prewordlen,
9895 fword + sp->ts_fidx, l);
9896 sp->ts_prewordlen += l;
9897 preword[sp->ts_prewordlen] = NUL'\000';
9898 } else
9899 sp->ts_score -= SCORE_SPLIT149 - SCORE_SUBST93;
9900 sp->ts_fidx += l;
9901 }
9902
9903 // When compounding include compound flag in
9904 // compflags[] (already set above). When splitting we
9905 // may start compounding over again.
9906 if (try_compound)
9907 ++sp->ts_complen;
9908 else
9909 sp->ts_compsplit = sp->ts_complen;
9910 sp->ts_prefixdepth = PFD_NOPREFIX0xff;
9911
9912 // set su->su_badflags to the caps type at this
9913 // position
9914 if (has_mbyte)
9915 n = nofold_len(fword, sp->ts_fidx, su->su_badptr);
9916 else
9917 n = sp->ts_fidx;
9918 su->su_badflags = badword_captype(su->su_badptr + n,
9919 su->su_badptr + su->su_badlen);
9920
9921 // Restart at top of the tree.
9922 sp->ts_arridx = 0;
9923
9924 // If there are postponed prefixes, try these too.
9925 if (pbyts != NULL((void*)0)) {
9926 byts = pbyts;
9927 idxs = pidxs;
9928 sp->ts_prefixdepth = PFD_PREFIXTREE0xfe;
9929 sp->ts_state = STATE_NOPREFIX;
9930 }
9931 }
9932 }
9933 }
9934 break;
9935
9936 case STATE_SPLITUNDO:
9937 // Undo the changes done for word split or compound word.
9938 su->su_badflags = sp->ts_save_badflags;
9939
9940 // Continue looking for NUL bytes.
9941 sp->ts_state = STATE_START;
9942
9943 // In case we went into the prefix tree.
9944 byts = fbyts;
9945 idxs = fidxs;
9946 break;
9947
9948 case STATE_ENDNUL:
9949 // Past the NUL bytes in the node.
9950 su->su_badflags = sp->ts_save_badflags;
9951 if (fword[sp->ts_fidx] == NUL'\000'
9952 && sp->ts_tcharlen == 0
9953 ) {
9954 // The badword ends, can't use STATE_PLAIN.
9955 sp->ts_state = STATE_DEL;
9956 break;
9957 }
9958 sp->ts_state = STATE_PLAIN;
9959 // FALLTHROUGH
9960
9961 case STATE_PLAIN:
9962 // Go over all possible bytes at this node, add each to tword[]
9963 // and use child node. "ts_curi" is the index.
9964 arridx = sp->ts_arridx;
9965 if (sp->ts_curi > byts[arridx]) {
9966 // Done all bytes at this node, do next state. When still at
9967 // already changed bytes skip the other tricks.
9968 if (sp->ts_fidx >= sp->ts_fidxtry)
9969 sp->ts_state = STATE_DEL;
9970 else
9971 sp->ts_state = STATE_FINAL;
9972 } else {
9973 arridx += sp->ts_curi++;
9974 c = byts[arridx];
9975
9976 // Normal byte, go one level deeper. If it's not equal to the
9977 // byte in the bad word adjust the score. But don't even try
9978 // when the byte was already changed. And don't try when we
9979 // just deleted this byte, accepting it is always cheaper than
9980 // delete + substitute.
9981 if (c == fword[sp->ts_fidx]
9982 || (sp->ts_tcharlen > 0 && sp->ts_isdiff != DIFF_NONE0)
9983 )
9984 newscore = 0;
9985 else
9986 newscore = SCORE_SUBST93;
9987 if ((newscore == 0
9988 || (sp->ts_fidx >= sp->ts_fidxtry
9989 && ((sp->ts_flags & TSF_DIDDEL4) == 0
9990 || c != fword[sp->ts_delidx])))
9991 && TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, newscore)(stack[depth].ts_score + (newscore) < su->su_maxscore)) {
9992 go_deeper(stack, depth, newscore);
9993#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
9994 if (newscore > 0)
9995 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: subst %c to %c",
9996 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
9997 fword[sp->ts_fidx], c);
9998 else
9999 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: accept %c",
10000 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10001 fword[sp->ts_fidx]);
10002#endif
10003 ++depth;
10004 sp = &stack[depth];
10005 ++sp->ts_fidx;
10006 tword[sp->ts_twordlen++] = c;
10007 sp->ts_arridx = idxs[arridx];
10008 if (newscore == SCORE_SUBST93)
10009 sp->ts_isdiff = DIFF_YES1;
10010 if (has_mbyte) {
10011 // Multi-byte characters are a bit complicated to
10012 // handle: They differ when any of the bytes differ
10013 // and then their length may also differ.
10014 if (sp->ts_tcharlen == 0) {
10015 // First byte.
10016 sp->ts_tcharidx = 0;
10017 sp->ts_tcharlen = MB_BYTE2LEN(c)mb_bytelen_tab[c];
10018 sp->ts_fcharstart = sp->ts_fidx - 1;
10019 sp->ts_isdiff = (newscore != 0)
10020 ? DIFF_YES1 : DIFF_NONE0;
10021 } else if (sp->ts_isdiff == DIFF_INSERT2)
10022 // When inserting trail bytes don't advance in the
10023 // bad word.
10024 --sp->ts_fidx;
10025 if (++sp->ts_tcharidx == sp->ts_tcharlen) {
10026 // Last byte of character.
10027 if (sp->ts_isdiff == DIFF_YES1) {
10028 // Correct ts_fidx for the byte length of the
10029 // character (we didn't check that before).
10030 sp->ts_fidx = sp->ts_fcharstart
10031 + MB_BYTE2LEN(mb_bytelen_tab[fword[sp->ts_fcharstart]]
10032 fword[sp->ts_fcharstart])mb_bytelen_tab[fword[sp->ts_fcharstart]];
10033
10034 // For changing a composing character adjust
10035 // the score from SCORE_SUBST to
10036 // SCORE_SUBCOMP.
10037 if (enc_utf8
10038 && utf_iscomposing(
10039 mb_ptr2char(tword
10040 + sp->ts_twordlen
10041 - sp->ts_tcharlen))
10042 && utf_iscomposing(
10043 mb_ptr2char(fword
10044 + sp->ts_fcharstart)))
10045 sp->ts_score -=
10046 SCORE_SUBST93 - SCORE_SUBCOMP33;
10047
10048 // For a similar character adjust score from
10049 // SCORE_SUBST to SCORE_SIMILAR.
10050 else if (!soundfold
10051 && slang->sl_has_map
10052 && similar_chars(slang,
10053 mb_ptr2char(tword
10054 + sp->ts_twordlen
10055 - sp->ts_tcharlen),
10056 mb_ptr2char(fword
10057 + sp->ts_fcharstart)))
10058 sp->ts_score -=
10059 SCORE_SUBST93 - SCORE_SIMILAR33;
10060 } else if (sp->ts_isdiff == DIFF_INSERT2
10061 && sp->ts_twordlen > sp->ts_tcharlen) {
10062 p = tword + sp->ts_twordlen - sp->ts_tcharlen;
10063 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
10064 if (enc_utf8 && utf_iscomposing(c)) {
10065 // Inserting a composing char doesn't
10066 // count that much.
10067 sp->ts_score -= SCORE_INS96 - SCORE_INSCOMP30;
10068 } else {
10069 // If the previous character was the same,
10070 // thus doubling a character, give a bonus
10071 // to the score. Also for the soundfold
10072 // tree (might seem illogical but does
10073 // give better scores).
10074 mb_ptr_back(tword, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(tword, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
10075 if (c == mb_ptr2char(p))
10076 sp->ts_score -= SCORE_INS96
10077 - SCORE_INSDUP67;
10078 }
10079 }
10080
10081 // Starting a new char, reset the length.
10082 sp->ts_tcharlen = 0;
10083 }
10084 } else {
10085 // If we found a similar char adjust the score.
10086 // We do this after calling go_deeper() because
10087 // it's slow.
10088 if (newscore != 0
10089 && !soundfold
10090 && slang->sl_has_map
10091 && similar_chars(slang,
10092 c, fword[sp->ts_fidx - 1]))
10093 sp->ts_score -= SCORE_SUBST93 - SCORE_SIMILAR33;
10094 }
10095 }
10096 }
10097 break;
10098
10099 case STATE_DEL:
10100 // When past the first byte of a multi-byte char don't try
10101 // delete/insert/swap a character.
10102 if (has_mbyte && sp->ts_tcharlen > 0) {
10103 sp->ts_state = STATE_FINAL;
10104 break;
10105 }
10106 // Try skipping one character in the bad word (delete it).
10107 sp->ts_state = STATE_INS_PREP;
10108 sp->ts_curi = 1;
10109 if (soundfold && sp->ts_fidx == 0 && fword[sp->ts_fidx] == '*')
10110 // Deleting a vowel at the start of a word counts less, see
10111 // soundalike_score().
10112 newscore = 2 * SCORE_DEL94 / 3;
10113 else
10114 newscore = SCORE_DEL94;
10115 if (fword[sp->ts_fidx] != NUL'\000'
10116 && TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, newscore)(stack[depth].ts_score + (newscore) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10117 go_deeper(stack, depth, newscore);
10118#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10119 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: delete %c",
10120 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10121 fword[sp->ts_fidx]);
10122#endif
10123 ++depth;
10124
10125 // Remember what character we deleted, so that we can avoid
10126 // inserting it again.
10127 stack[depth].ts_flags |= TSF_DIDDEL4;
10128 stack[depth].ts_delidx = sp->ts_fidx;
10129
10130 // Advance over the character in fword[]. Give a bonus to the
10131 // score if the same character is following "nn" -> "n". It's
10132 // a bit illogical for soundfold tree but it does give better
10133 // results.
10134 if (has_mbyte) {
10135 c = mb_ptr2char(fword + sp->ts_fidx);
10136 stack[depth].ts_fidx += MB_BYTE2LEN(fword[sp->ts_fidx])mb_bytelen_tab[fword[sp->ts_fidx]];
10137 if (enc_utf8 && utf_iscomposing(c))
10138 stack[depth].ts_score -= SCORE_DEL94 - SCORE_DELCOMP28;
10139 else if (c == mb_ptr2char(fword + stack[depth].ts_fidx))
10140 stack[depth].ts_score -= SCORE_DEL94 - SCORE_DELDUP66;
10141 } else {
10142 ++stack[depth].ts_fidx;
10143 if (fword[sp->ts_fidx] == fword[sp->ts_fidx + 1])
10144 stack[depth].ts_score -= SCORE_DEL94 - SCORE_DELDUP66;
10145 }
10146 break;
10147 }
10148 // FALLTHROUGH
10149
10150 case STATE_INS_PREP:
10151 if (sp->ts_flags & TSF_DIDDEL4) {
10152 // If we just deleted a byte then inserting won't make sense,
10153 // a substitute is always cheaper.
10154 sp->ts_state = STATE_SWAP;
10155 break;
10156 }
10157
10158 // skip over NUL bytes
10159 n = sp->ts_arridx;
10160 for (;; ) {
10161 if (sp->ts_curi > byts[n]) {
10162 // Only NUL bytes at this node, go to next state.
10163 sp->ts_state = STATE_SWAP;
10164 break;
10165 }
10166 if (byts[n + sp->ts_curi] != NUL'\000') {
10167 // Found a byte to insert.
10168 sp->ts_state = STATE_INS;
10169 break;
10170 }
10171 ++sp->ts_curi;
10172 }
10173 break;
10174
10175 // FALLTHROUGH
10176
10177 case STATE_INS:
10178 // Insert one byte. Repeat this for each possible byte at this
10179 // node.
10180 n = sp->ts_arridx;
10181 if (sp->ts_curi > byts[n]) {
10182 // Done all bytes at this node, go to next state.
10183 sp->ts_state = STATE_SWAP;
10184 break;
10185 }
10186
10187 // Do one more byte at this node, but:
10188 // - Skip NUL bytes.
10189 // - Skip the byte if it's equal to the byte in the word,
10190 // accepting that byte is always better.
10191 n += sp->ts_curi++;
10192 c = byts[n];
10193 if (soundfold && sp->ts_twordlen == 0 && c == '*')
10194 // Inserting a vowel at the start of a word counts less,
10195 // see soundalike_score().
10196 newscore = 2 * SCORE_INS96 / 3;
10197 else
10198 newscore = SCORE_INS96;
10199 if (c != fword[sp->ts_fidx]
10200 && TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, newscore)(stack[depth].ts_score + (newscore) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10201 go_deeper(stack, depth, newscore);
10202#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10203 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: insert %c",
10204 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10205 c);
10206#endif
10207 ++depth;
10208 sp = &stack[depth];
10209 tword[sp->ts_twordlen++] = c;
10210 sp->ts_arridx = idxs[n];
10211 if (has_mbyte) {
10212 fl = MB_BYTE2LEN(c)mb_bytelen_tab[c];
10213 if (fl > 1) {
10214 // There are following bytes for the same character.
10215 // We must find all bytes before trying
10216 // delete/insert/swap/etc.
10217 sp->ts_tcharlen = fl;
10218 sp->ts_tcharidx = 1;
10219 sp->ts_isdiff = DIFF_INSERT2;
10220 }
10221 } else
10222 fl = 1;
10223 if (fl == 1) {
10224 // If the previous character was the same, thus doubling a
10225 // character, give a bonus to the score. Also for
10226 // soundfold words (illogical but does give a better
10227 // score).
10228 if (sp->ts_twordlen >= 2
10229 && tword[sp->ts_twordlen - 2] == c)
10230 sp->ts_score -= SCORE_INS96 - SCORE_INSDUP67;
10231 }
10232 }
10233 break;
10234
10235 case STATE_SWAP:
10236 // Swap two bytes in the bad word: "12" -> "21".
10237 // We change "fword" here, it's changed back afterwards at
10238 // STATE_UNSWAP.
10239 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10240 c = *p;
10241 if (c == NUL'\000') {
10242 // End of word, can't swap or replace.
10243 sp->ts_state = STATE_FINAL;
10244 break;
10245 }
10246
10247 // Don't swap if the first character is not a word character.
10248 // SWAP3 etc. also don't make sense then.
10249 if (!soundfold && !spell_iswordp(p, curwin)) {
10250 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10251 break;
10252 }
10253
10254 if (has_mbyte) {
10255 n = mb_cptr2len(p)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p));
10256 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
10257 if (p[n] == NUL'\000')
10258 c2 = NUL'\000';
10259 else if (!soundfold && !spell_iswordp(p + n, curwin))
10260 c2 = c; // don't swap non-word char
10261 else
10262 c2 = mb_ptr2char(p + n);
10263 } else {
10264 if (p[1] == NUL'\000')
10265 c2 = NUL'\000';
10266 else if (!soundfold && !spell_iswordp(p + 1, curwin))
10267 c2 = c; // don't swap non-word char
10268 else
10269 c2 = p[1];
10270 }
10271
10272 // When the second character is NUL we can't swap.
10273 if (c2 == NUL'\000') {
10274 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10275 break;
10276 }
10277
10278 // When characters are identical, swap won't do anything.
10279 // Also get here if the second char is not a word character.
10280 if (c == c2) {
10281 sp->ts_state = STATE_SWAP3;
10282 break;
10283 }
10284 if (c2 != NUL'\000' && TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP)(stack[depth].ts_score + (75) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10285 go_deeper(stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP75);
10286#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10287 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: swap %c and %c",
10288 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10289 c, c2);
10290#endif
10291 sp->ts_state = STATE_UNSWAP;
10292 ++depth;
10293 if (has_mbyte) {
10294 fl = mb_char2len(c2);
10295 memmove(p, p + n, fl);
10296 mb_char2bytes(c, p + fl);
10297 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + n + fl;
10298 } else {
10299 p[0] = c2;
10300 p[1] = c;
10301 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + 2;
10302 }
10303 } else
10304 // If this swap doesn't work then SWAP3 won't either.
10305 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10306 break;
10307
10308 case STATE_UNSWAP:
10309 // Undo the STATE_SWAP swap: "21" -> "12".
10310 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10311 if (has_mbyte) {
10312 n = MB_BYTE2LEN(*p)mb_bytelen_tab[*p];
10313 c = mb_ptr2char(p + n);
10314 memmove(p + MB_BYTE2LEN(p[n])mb_bytelen_tab[p[n]], p, n);
10315 mb_char2bytes(c, p);
10316 } else {
10317 c = *p;
10318 *p = p[1];
10319 p[1] = c;
10320 }
10321 // FALLTHROUGH
10322
10323 case STATE_SWAP3:
10324 // Swap two bytes, skipping one: "123" -> "321". We change
10325 // "fword" here, it's changed back afterwards at STATE_UNSWAP3.
10326 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10327 if (has_mbyte) {
10328 n = mb_cptr2len(p)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p));
10329 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
10330 fl = mb_cptr2len(p + n)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p + n) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p + n));
10331 c2 = mb_ptr2char(p + n);
10332 if (!soundfold && !spell_iswordp(p + n + fl, curwin))
10333 c3 = c; // don't swap non-word char
10334 else
10335 c3 = mb_ptr2char(p + n + fl);
10336 } else {
10337 c = *p;
10338 c2 = p[1];
10339 if (!soundfold && !spell_iswordp(p + 2, curwin))
10340 c3 = c; // don't swap non-word char
10341 else
10342 c3 = p[2];
10343 }
10344
10345 // When characters are identical: "121" then SWAP3 result is
10346 // identical, ROT3L result is same as SWAP: "211", ROT3L result is
10347 // same as SWAP on next char: "112". Thus skip all swapping.
10348 // Also skip when c3 is NUL.
10349 // Also get here when the third character is not a word character.
10350 // Second character may any char: "a.b" -> "b.a"
10351 if (c == c3 || c3 == NUL'\000') {
10352 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10353 break;
10354 }
10355 if (TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP3)(stack[depth].ts_score + (110) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10356 go_deeper(stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP3110);
10357#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10358 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: swap3 %c and %c",
10359 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10360 c, c3);
10361#endif
10362 sp->ts_state = STATE_UNSWAP3;
10363 ++depth;
10364 if (has_mbyte) {
10365 tl = mb_char2len(c3);
10366 memmove(p, p + n + fl, tl);
10367 mb_char2bytes(c2, p + tl);
10368 mb_char2bytes(c, p + fl + tl);
10369 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + n + fl + tl;
10370 } else {
10371 p[0] = p[2];
10372 p[2] = c;
10373 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + 3;
10374 }
10375 } else
10376 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10377 break;
10378
10379 case STATE_UNSWAP3:
10380 // Undo STATE_SWAP3: "321" -> "123"
10381 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10382 if (has_mbyte) {
10383 n = MB_BYTE2LEN(*p)mb_bytelen_tab[*p];
10384 c2 = mb_ptr2char(p + n);
10385 fl = MB_BYTE2LEN(p[n])mb_bytelen_tab[p[n]];
10386 c = mb_ptr2char(p + n + fl);
10387 tl = MB_BYTE2LEN(p[n + fl])mb_bytelen_tab[p[n + fl]];
10388 memmove(p + fl + tl, p, n);
10389 mb_char2bytes(c, p);
10390 mb_char2bytes(c2, p + tl);
10391 p = p + tl;
10392 } else {
10393 c = *p;
10394 *p = p[2];
10395 p[2] = c;
10396 ++p;
10397 }
10398
10399 if (!soundfold && !spell_iswordp(p, curwin)) {
10400 // Middle char is not a word char, skip the rotate. First and
10401 // third char were already checked at swap and swap3.
10402 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10403 break;
10404 }
10405
10406 // Rotate three characters left: "123" -> "231". We change
10407 // "fword" here, it's changed back afterwards at STATE_UNROT3L.
10408 if (TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP3)(stack[depth].ts_score + (110) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10409 go_deeper(stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP3110);
10410#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10411 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10412 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: rotate left %c%c%c",
10413 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10414 p[0], p[1], p[2]);
10415#endif
10416 sp->ts_state = STATE_UNROT3L;
10417 ++depth;
10418 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10419 if (has_mbyte) {
10420 n = mb_cptr2len(p)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p));
10421 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
10422 fl = mb_cptr2len(p + n)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p + n) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p + n));
10423 fl += mb_cptr2len(p + n + fl)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p + n + fl) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p + n + fl
));
10424 memmove(p, p + n, fl);
10425 mb_char2bytes(c, p + fl);
10426 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + n + fl;
10427 } else {
10428 c = *p;
10429 *p = p[1];
10430 p[1] = p[2];
10431 p[2] = c;
10432 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + 3;
10433 }
10434 } else
10435 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10436 break;
10437
10438 case STATE_UNROT3L:
10439 // Undo ROT3L: "231" -> "123"
10440 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10441 if (has_mbyte) {
10442 n = MB_BYTE2LEN(*p)mb_bytelen_tab[*p];
10443 n += MB_BYTE2LEN(p[n])mb_bytelen_tab[p[n]];
10444 c = mb_ptr2char(p + n);
10445 tl = MB_BYTE2LEN(p[n])mb_bytelen_tab[p[n]];
10446 memmove(p + tl, p, n);
10447 mb_char2bytes(c, p);
10448 } else {
10449 c = p[2];
10450 p[2] = p[1];
10451 p[1] = *p;
10452 *p = c;
10453 }
10454
10455 // Rotate three bytes right: "123" -> "312". We change "fword"
10456 // here, it's changed back afterwards at STATE_UNROT3R.
10457 if (TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP3)(stack[depth].ts_score + (110) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10458 go_deeper(stack, depth, SCORE_SWAP3110);
10459#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10460 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10461 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: rotate right %c%c%c",
10462 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10463 p[0], p[1], p[2]);
10464#endif
10465 sp->ts_state = STATE_UNROT3R;
10466 ++depth;
10467 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10468 if (has_mbyte) {
10469 n = mb_cptr2len(p)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p));
10470 n += mb_cptr2len(p + n)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p + n) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p + n));
10471 c = mb_ptr2char(p + n);
10472 tl = mb_cptr2len(p + n)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(p + n) : (*mb_ptr2len)(p + n));
10473 memmove(p + tl, p, n);
10474 mb_char2bytes(c, p);
10475 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + n + tl;
10476 } else {
10477 c = p[2];
10478 p[2] = p[1];
10479 p[1] = *p;
10480 *p = c;
10481 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + 3;
10482 }
10483 } else
10484 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_INI;
10485 break;
10486
10487 case STATE_UNROT3R:
10488 // Undo ROT3R: "312" -> "123"
10489 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10490 if (has_mbyte) {
10491 c = mb_ptr2char(p);
10492 tl = MB_BYTE2LEN(*p)mb_bytelen_tab[*p];
10493 n = MB_BYTE2LEN(p[tl])mb_bytelen_tab[p[tl]];
10494 n += MB_BYTE2LEN(p[tl + n])mb_bytelen_tab[p[tl + n]];
10495 memmove(p, p + tl, n);
10496 mb_char2bytes(c, p + n);
10497 } else {
10498 c = *p;
10499 *p = p[1];
10500 p[1] = p[2];
10501 p[2] = c;
10502 }
10503 // FALLTHROUGH
10504
10505 case STATE_REP_INI:
10506 // Check if matching with REP items from the .aff file would work.
10507 // Quickly skip if:
10508 // - there are no REP items and we are not in the soundfold trie
10509 // - the score is going to be too high anyway
10510 // - already applied a REP item or swapped here
10511 if ((lp->lp_replang == NULL((void*)0) && !soundfold)
10512 || sp->ts_score + SCORE_REP65 >= su->su_maxscore
10513 || sp->ts_fidx < sp->ts_fidxtry) {
10514 sp->ts_state = STATE_FINAL;
10515 break;
10516 }
10517
10518 // Use the first byte to quickly find the first entry that may
10519 // match. If the index is -1 there is none.
10520 if (soundfold)
10521 sp->ts_curi = slang->sl_repsal_first[fword[sp->ts_fidx]];
10522 else
10523 sp->ts_curi = lp->lp_replang->sl_rep_first[fword[sp->ts_fidx]];
10524
10525 if (sp->ts_curi < 0) {
10526 sp->ts_state = STATE_FINAL;
10527 break;
10528 }
10529
10530 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP;
10531 // FALLTHROUGH
10532
10533 case STATE_REP:
10534 // Try matching with REP items from the .aff file. For each match
10535 // replace the characters and check if the resulting word is
10536 // valid.
10537 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10538
10539 if (soundfold)
10540 gap = &slang->sl_repsal;
10541 else
10542 gap = &lp->lp_replang->sl_rep;
10543 while (sp->ts_curi < gap->ga_len) {
10544 ftp = (fromto_T *)gap->ga_data + sp->ts_curi++;
10545 if (*ftp->ft_from != *p) {
10546 // past possible matching entries
10547 sp->ts_curi = gap->ga_len;
10548 break;
10549 }
10550 if (STRNCMP(ftp->ft_from, p, STRLEN(ftp->ft_from))strncmp((char *)(ftp->ft_from), (char *)(p), (size_t)(strlen
((char *)(ftp->ft_from)))) == 0
10551 && TRY_DEEPER(su, stack, depth, SCORE_REP)(stack[depth].ts_score + (65) < su->su_maxscore)) {
10552 go_deeper(stack, depth, SCORE_REP65);
10553#ifdef DEBUG_TRIEWALK
10554 sprintf(changename[depth], "%.*s-%s: replace %s with %s",
10555 sp->ts_twordlen, tword, fword + sp->ts_fidx,
10556 ftp->ft_from, ftp->ft_to);
10557#endif
10558 // Need to undo this afterwards.
10559 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP_UNDO;
10560
10561 // Change the "from" to the "to" string.
10562 ++depth;
10563 fl = (int)STRLEN(ftp->ft_from)strlen((char *)(ftp->ft_from));
10564 tl = (int)STRLEN(ftp->ft_to)strlen((char *)(ftp->ft_to));
10565 if (fl != tl) {
10566 STRMOVE(p + tl, p + fl)memmove((p + tl), (p + fl), strlen((char *)(p + fl)) + 1);
10567 repextra += tl - fl;
10568 }
10569 memmove(p, ftp->ft_to, tl);
10570 stack[depth].ts_fidxtry = sp->ts_fidx + tl;
10571 stack[depth].ts_tcharlen = 0;
10572 break;
10573 }
10574 }
10575
10576 if (sp->ts_curi >= gap->ga_len && sp->ts_state == STATE_REP)
10577 // No (more) matches.
10578 sp->ts_state = STATE_FINAL;
10579
10580 break;
10581
10582 case STATE_REP_UNDO:
10583 // Undo a REP replacement and continue with the next one.
10584 if (soundfold)
10585 gap = &slang->sl_repsal;
10586 else
10587 gap = &lp->lp_replang->sl_rep;
10588 ftp = (fromto_T *)gap->ga_data + sp->ts_curi - 1;
10589 fl = (int)STRLEN(ftp->ft_from)strlen((char *)(ftp->ft_from));
10590 tl = (int)STRLEN(ftp->ft_to)strlen((char *)(ftp->ft_to));
10591 p = fword + sp->ts_fidx;
10592 if (fl != tl) {
10593 STRMOVE(p + fl, p + tl)memmove((p + fl), (p + tl), strlen((char *)(p + tl)) + 1);
10594 repextra -= tl - fl;
10595 }
10596 memmove(p, ftp->ft_from, fl);
10597 sp->ts_state = STATE_REP;
10598 break;
10599
10600 default:
10601 // Did all possible states at this level, go up one level.
10602 --depth;
10603
10604 if (depth >= 0 && stack[depth].ts_prefixdepth == PFD_PREFIXTREE0xfe) {
10605 // Continue in or go back to the prefix tree.
10606 byts = pbyts;
10607 idxs = pidxs;
10608 }
10609
10610 // Don't check for CTRL-C too often, it takes time.
10611 if (--breakcheckcount == 0) {
10612 ui_breakcheck();
10613 breakcheckcount = 1000;
10614 }
10615 }
10616 }
10617}
10618
10619
10620// Go one level deeper in the tree.
10621static void go_deeper(trystate_T *stack, int depth, int score_add)
10622{
10623 stack[depth + 1] = stack[depth];
10624 stack[depth + 1].ts_state = STATE_START;
10625 stack[depth + 1].ts_score = stack[depth].ts_score + score_add;
10626 stack[depth + 1].ts_curi = 1; // start just after length byte
10627 stack[depth + 1].ts_flags = 0;
10628}
10629
10630// Case-folding may change the number of bytes: Count nr of chars in
10631// fword[flen] and return the byte length of that many chars in "word".
10632static int nofold_len(char_u *fword, int flen, char_u *word)
10633{
10634 char_u *p;
10635 int i = 0;
10636
10637 for (p = fword; p < fword + flen; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
10638 ++i;
10639 for (p = word; i > 0; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
10640 --i;
10641 return (int)(p - word);
10642}
10643
10644// "fword" is a good word with case folded. Find the matching keep-case
10645// words and put it in "kword".
10646// Theoretically there could be several keep-case words that result in the
10647// same case-folded word, but we only find one...
10648static void find_keepcap_word(slang_T *slang, char_u *fword, char_u *kword)
10649{
10650 char_u uword[MAXWLEN250]; // "fword" in upper-case
10651 int depth;
10652 idx_T tryidx;
10653
10654 // The following arrays are used at each depth in the tree.
10655 idx_T arridx[MAXWLEN250];
10656 int round[MAXWLEN250];
10657 int fwordidx[MAXWLEN250];
10658 int uwordidx[MAXWLEN250];
10659 int kwordlen[MAXWLEN250];
10660
10661 int flen, ulen;
10662 int l;
10663 int len;
10664 int c;
10665 idx_T lo, hi, m;
10666 char_u *p;
10667 char_u *byts = slang->sl_kbyts; // array with bytes of the words
10668 idx_T *idxs = slang->sl_kidxs; // array with indexes
10669
10670 if (byts == NULL((void*)0)) {
10671 // array is empty: "cannot happen"
10672 *kword = NUL'\000';
10673 return;
10674 }
10675
10676 // Make an all-cap version of "fword".
10677 allcap_copy(fword, uword);
10678
10679 // Each character needs to be tried both case-folded and upper-case.
10680 // All this gets very complicated if we keep in mind that changing case
10681 // may change the byte length of a multi-byte character...
10682 depth = 0;
10683 arridx[0] = 0;
10684 round[0] = 0;
10685 fwordidx[0] = 0;
10686 uwordidx[0] = 0;
10687 kwordlen[0] = 0;
10688 while (depth >= 0) {
10689 if (fword[fwordidx[depth]] == NUL'\000') {
10690 // We are at the end of "fword". If the tree allows a word to end
10691 // here we have found a match.
10692 if (byts[arridx[depth] + 1] == 0) {
10693 kword[kwordlen[depth]] = NUL'\000';
10694 return;
10695 }
10696
10697 // kword is getting too long, continue one level up
10698 --depth;
10699 } else if (++round[depth] > 2) {
10700 // tried both fold-case and upper-case character, continue one
10701 // level up
10702 --depth;
10703 } else {
10704 // round[depth] == 1: Try using the folded-case character.
10705 // round[depth] == 2: Try using the upper-case character.
10706 if (has_mbyte) {
10707 flen = mb_cptr2len(fword + fwordidx[depth])(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(fword + fwordidx[depth]) : (*mb_ptr2len
)(fword + fwordidx[depth]));
10708 ulen = mb_cptr2len(uword + uwordidx[depth])(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(uword + uwordidx[depth]) : (*mb_ptr2len
)(uword + uwordidx[depth]));
10709 } else
10710 ulen = flen = 1;
10711 if (round[depth] == 1) {
10712 p = fword + fwordidx[depth];
10713 l = flen;
10714 } else {
10715 p = uword + uwordidx[depth];
10716 l = ulen;
10717 }
10718
10719 for (tryidx = arridx[depth]; l > 0; --l) {
10720 // Perform a binary search in the list of accepted bytes.
10721 len = byts[tryidx++];
10722 c = *p++;
10723 lo = tryidx;
10724 hi = tryidx + len - 1;
10725 while (lo < hi) {
10726 m = (lo + hi) / 2;
10727 if (byts[m] > c)
10728 hi = m - 1;
10729 else if (byts[m] < c)
10730 lo = m + 1;
10731 else {
10732 lo = hi = m;
10733 break;
10734 }
10735 }
10736
10737 // Stop if there is no matching byte.
10738 if (hi < lo || byts[lo] != c)
10739 break;
10740
10741 // Continue at the child (if there is one).
10742 tryidx = idxs[lo];
10743 }
10744
10745 if (l == 0) {
10746 // Found the matching char. Copy it to "kword" and go a
10747 // level deeper.
10748 if (round[depth] == 1) {
10749 STRNCPY(kword + kwordlen[depth], fword + fwordidx[depth],strncpy((char *)(kword + kwordlen[depth]), (char *)(fword + fwordidx
[depth]), (size_t)(flen))
10750 flen)strncpy((char *)(kword + kwordlen[depth]), (char *)(fword + fwordidx
[depth]), (size_t)(flen));
10751 kwordlen[depth + 1] = kwordlen[depth] + flen;
10752 } else {
10753 STRNCPY(kword + kwordlen[depth], uword + uwordidx[depth],strncpy((char *)(kword + kwordlen[depth]), (char *)(uword + uwordidx
[depth]), (size_t)(ulen))
10754 ulen)strncpy((char *)(kword + kwordlen[depth]), (char *)(uword + uwordidx
[depth]), (size_t)(ulen));
10755 kwordlen[depth + 1] = kwordlen[depth] + ulen;
10756 }
10757 fwordidx[depth + 1] = fwordidx[depth] + flen;
10758 uwordidx[depth + 1] = uwordidx[depth] + ulen;
10759
10760 ++depth;
10761 arridx[depth] = tryidx;
10762 round[depth] = 0;
10763 }
10764 }
10765 }
10766
10767 // Didn't find it: "cannot happen".
10768 *kword = NUL'\000';
10769}
10770
10771// Compute the sound-a-like score for suggestions in su->su_ga and add them to
10772// su->su_sga.
10773static void score_comp_sal(suginfo_T *su)
10774{
10775 langp_T *lp;
10776 char_u badsound[MAXWLEN250];
10777 int i;
10778 suggest_T *stp;
10779 suggest_T *sstp;
10780 int score;
10781
10782 ga_grow(&su->su_sga, su->su_ga.ga_len);
10783
10784 // Use the sound-folding of the first language that supports it.
10785 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
10786 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
10787 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)((&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0)) {
10788 // soundfold the bad word
10789 spell_soundfold(lp->lp_slang, su->su_fbadword, true1, badsound);
10790
10791 for (i = 0; i < su->su_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
10792 stp = &SUG(su->su_ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_ga).ga_data)[i]);
10793
10794 // Case-fold the suggested word, sound-fold it and compute the
10795 // sound-a-like score.
10796 score = stp_sal_score(stp, su, lp->lp_slang, badsound);
10797 if (score < SCORE_MAXMAX999999) {
10798 // Add the suggestion.
10799 sstp = &SUG(su->su_sga, su->su_sga.ga_len)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_sga).ga_data)[su->su_sga.ga_len]
);
10800 sstp->st_word = vim_strsave(stp->st_word);
10801 sstp->st_wordlen = stp->st_wordlen;
10802 sstp->st_score = score;
10803 sstp->st_altscore = 0;
10804 sstp->st_orglen = stp->st_orglen;
10805 ++su->su_sga.ga_len;
10806 }
10807 }
10808 break;
10809 }
10810 }
10811}
10812
10813// Combine the list of suggestions in su->su_ga and su->su_sga.
10814// They are entwined.
10815static void score_combine(suginfo_T *su)
10816{
10817 garray_T ga;
10818 garray_T *gap;
10819 langp_T *lp;
10820 suggest_T *stp;
10821 char_u *p;
10822 char_u badsound[MAXWLEN250];
10823 int round;
10824 slang_T *slang = NULL((void*)0);
10825
10826 // Add the alternate score to su_ga.
10827 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
10828 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
10829 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)((&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0)) {
10830 // soundfold the bad word
10831 slang = lp->lp_slang;
10832 spell_soundfold(slang, su->su_fbadword, true1, badsound);
10833
10834 for (int i = 0; i < su->su_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
10835 stp = &SUG(su->su_ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_ga).ga_data)[i]);
10836 stp->st_altscore = stp_sal_score(stp, su, slang, badsound);
10837 if (stp->st_altscore == SCORE_MAXMAX999999)
10838 stp->st_score = (stp->st_score * 3 + SCORE_BIG96 * 3) / 4;
10839 else
10840 stp->st_score = (stp->st_score * 3
10841 + stp->st_altscore) / 4;
10842 stp->st_salscore = false0;
10843 }
10844 break;
10845 }
10846 }
10847
10848 if (slang == NULL((void*)0)) { // Using "double" without sound folding.
10849 (void)cleanup_suggestions(&su->su_ga, su->su_maxscore,
10850 su->su_maxcount);
10851 return;
10852 }
10853
10854 // Add the alternate score to su_sga.
10855 for (int i = 0; i < su->su_sga.ga_len; ++i) {
10856 stp = &SUG(su->su_sga, i)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_sga).ga_data)[i]);
10857 stp->st_altscore = spell_edit_score(slang,
10858 su->su_badword, stp->st_word);
10859 if (stp->st_score == SCORE_MAXMAX999999)
10860 stp->st_score = (SCORE_BIG96 * 3 * 7 + stp->st_altscore) / 8;
10861 else
10862 stp->st_score = (stp->st_score * 7 + stp->st_altscore) / 8;
10863 stp->st_salscore = true1;
10864 }
10865
10866 // Remove bad suggestions, sort the suggestions and truncate at "maxcount"
10867 // for both lists.
10868 check_suggestions(su, &su->su_ga);
10869 (void)cleanup_suggestions(&su->su_ga, su->su_maxscore, su->su_maxcount);
10870 check_suggestions(su, &su->su_sga);
10871 (void)cleanup_suggestions(&su->su_sga, su->su_maxscore, su->su_maxcount);
10872
10873 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(suginfo_T), 1);
10874 ga_grow(&ga, su->su_ga.ga_len + su->su_sga.ga_len);
10875
10876 stp = &SUG(ga, 0)(((suggest_T *)(ga).ga_data)[0]);
10877 for (int i = 0; i < su->su_ga.ga_len || i < su->su_sga.ga_len; ++i) {
10878 // round 1: get a suggestion from su_ga
10879 // round 2: get a suggestion from su_sga
10880 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round) {
10881 gap = round == 1 ? &su->su_ga : &su->su_sga;
10882 if (i < gap->ga_len) {
10883 // Don't add a word if it's already there.
10884 p = SUG(*gap, i)(((suggest_T *)(*gap).ga_data)[i]).st_word;
10885 int j;
10886 for (j = 0; j < ga.ga_len; ++j)
10887 if (STRCMP(stp[j].st_word, p)strcmp((char *)(stp[j].st_word), (char *)(p)) == 0)
10888 break;
10889 if (j == ga.ga_len)
10890 stp[ga.ga_len++] = SUG(*gap, i)(((suggest_T *)(*gap).ga_data)[i]);
10891 else
10892 free(p);
10893 }
10894 }
10895 }
10896
10897 ga_clear(&su->su_ga);
10898 ga_clear(&su->su_sga);
10899
10900 // Truncate the list to the number of suggestions that will be displayed.
10901 if (ga.ga_len > su->su_maxcount) {
10902 for (int i = su->su_maxcount; i < ga.ga_len; ++i) {
10903 free(stp[i].st_word);
10904 }
10905 ga.ga_len = su->su_maxcount;
10906 }
10907
10908 su->su_ga = ga;
10909}
10910
10911// For the goodword in "stp" compute the soundalike score compared to the
10912// badword.
10913static int
10914stp_sal_score (
10915 suggest_T *stp,
10916 suginfo_T *su,
10917 slang_T *slang,
10918 char_u *badsound // sound-folded badword
10919)
10920{
10921 char_u *p;
10922 char_u *pbad;
10923 char_u *pgood;
10924 char_u badsound2[MAXWLEN250];
10925 char_u fword[MAXWLEN250];
10926 char_u goodsound[MAXWLEN250];
10927 char_u goodword[MAXWLEN250];
10928 int lendiff;
10929
10930 lendiff = (int)(su->su_badlen - stp->st_orglen);
10931 if (lendiff >= 0)
10932 pbad = badsound;
10933 else {
10934 // soundfold the bad word with more characters following
10935 (void)spell_casefold(su->su_badptr, stp->st_orglen, fword, MAXWLEN250);
10936
10937 // When joining two words the sound often changes a lot. E.g., "t he"
10938 // sounds like "t h" while "the" sounds like "@". Avoid that by
10939 // removing the space. Don't do it when the good word also contains a
10940 // space.
10941 if (vim_iswhite(su->su_badptr[su->su_badlen])((su->su_badptr[su->su_badlen]) == ' ' || (su->su_badptr
[su->su_badlen]) == '\t')
10942 && *skiptowhite(stp->st_word) == NUL'\000')
10943 for (p = fword; *(p = skiptowhite(p)) != NUL'\000'; )
10944 STRMOVE(p, p + 1)memmove((p), (p + 1), strlen((char *)(p + 1)) + 1);
10945
10946 spell_soundfold(slang, fword, true1, badsound2);
10947 pbad = badsound2;
10948 }
10949
10950 if (lendiff > 0 && stp->st_wordlen + lendiff < MAXWLEN250) {
10951 // Add part of the bad word to the good word, so that we soundfold
10952 // what replaces the bad word.
10953 STRCPY(goodword, stp->st_word)strcpy((char *)(goodword), (char *)(stp->st_word));
10954 STRLCPY(goodword + stp->st_wordlen,xstrlcpy((char *)(goodword + stp->st_wordlen), (char *)(su
->su_badptr + su->su_badlen - lendiff), (size_t)(lendiff
+ 1))
10955 su->su_badptr + su->su_badlen - lendiff, lendiff + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(goodword + stp->st_wordlen), (char *)(su
->su_badptr + su->su_badlen - lendiff), (size_t)(lendiff
+ 1));
10956 pgood = goodword;
10957 } else
10958 pgood = stp->st_word;
10959
10960 // Sound-fold the word and compute the score for the difference.
10961 spell_soundfold(slang, pgood, false0, goodsound);
10962
10963 return soundalike_score(goodsound, pbad);
10964}
10965
10966static sftword_T dumsft;
10967#define HIKEY2SFT(p)((sftword_T *)(p - (dumsft.sft_word - (char_u *)&dumsft))
) ((sftword_T *)(p - (dumsft.sft_word - (char_u *)&dumsft)))
10968#define HI2SFT(hi)((sftword_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumsft.sft_word - (char_u *
)&dumsft))) HIKEY2SFT((hi)->hi_key)((sftword_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumsft.sft_word - (char_u *
)&dumsft)))
10969
10970// Prepare for calling suggest_try_soundalike().
10971static void suggest_try_soundalike_prep(void)
10972{
10973 langp_T *lp;
10974 slang_T *slang;
10975
10976 // Do this for all languages that support sound folding and for which a
10977 // .sug file has been loaded.
10978 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
10979 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
10980 slang = lp->lp_slang;
10981 if (!GA_EMPTY(&slang->sl_sal)((&slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0) && slang->sl_sbyts != NULL((void*)0))
10982 // prepare the hashtable used by add_sound_suggest()
10983 hash_init(&slang->sl_sounddone);
10984 }
10985}
10986
10987// Find suggestions by comparing the word in a sound-a-like form.
10988// Note: This doesn't support postponed prefixes.
10989static void suggest_try_soundalike(suginfo_T *su)
10990{
10991 char_u salword[MAXWLEN250];
10992 langp_T *lp;
10993 slang_T *slang;
10994
10995 // Do this for all languages that support sound folding and for which a
10996 // .sug file has been loaded.
10997 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
10998 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
10999 slang = lp->lp_slang;
11000 if (!GA_EMPTY(&slang->sl_sal)((&slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0) && slang->sl_sbyts != NULL((void*)0)) {
11001 // soundfold the bad word
11002 spell_soundfold(slang, su->su_fbadword, true1, salword);
11003
11004 // try all kinds of inserts/deletes/swaps/etc.
11005 // TODO: also soundfold the next words, so that we can try joining
11006 // and splitting
11007 suggest_trie_walk(su, lp, salword, true1);
11008 }
11009 }
11010}
11011
11012// Finish up after calling suggest_try_soundalike().
11013static void suggest_try_soundalike_finish(void)
11014{
11015 langp_T *lp;
11016 slang_T *slang;
11017 int todo;
11018 hashitem_T *hi;
11019
11020 // Do this for all languages that support sound folding and for which a
11021 // .sug file has been loaded.
11022 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
11023 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
11024 slang = lp->lp_slang;
11025 if (!GA_EMPTY(&slang->sl_sal)((&slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0) && slang->sl_sbyts != NULL((void*)0)) {
11026 // Free the info about handled words.
11027 todo = (int)slang->sl_sounddone.ht_used;
11028 for (hi = slang->sl_sounddone.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi)
11029 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
11030 free(HI2SFT(hi)((sftword_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumsft.sft_word - (char_u *
)&dumsft))));
11031 --todo;
11032 }
11033
11034 // Clear the hashtable, it may also be used by another region.
11035 hash_clear(&slang->sl_sounddone);
11036 hash_init(&slang->sl_sounddone);
11037 }
11038 }
11039}
11040
11041// A match with a soundfolded word is found. Add the good word(s) that
11042// produce this soundfolded word.
11043static void
11044add_sound_suggest (
11045 suginfo_T *su,
11046 char_u *goodword,
11047 int score, // soundfold score
11048 langp_T *lp
11049)
11050{
11051 slang_T *slang = lp->lp_slang; // language for sound folding
11052 int sfwordnr;
11053 char_u *nrline;
11054 int orgnr;
11055 char_u theword[MAXWLEN250];
11056 int i;
11057 int wlen;
11058 char_u *byts;
11059 idx_T *idxs;
11060 int n;
11061 int wordcount;
11062 int wc;
11063 int goodscore;
11064 hash_T hash;
11065 hashitem_T *hi;
11066 sftword_T *sft;
11067 int bc, gc;
11068 int limit;
11069
11070 // It's very well possible that the same soundfold word is found several
11071 // times with different scores. Since the following is quite slow only do
11072 // the words that have a better score than before. Use a hashtable to
11073 // remember the words that have been done.
11074 hash = hash_hash(goodword);
11075 hi = hash_lookup(&slang->sl_sounddone, goodword, hash);
11076 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
11077 sft = xmalloc(sizeof(sftword_T) + STRLEN(goodword)strlen((char *)(goodword)));
11078 sft->sft_score = score;
11079 STRCPY(sft->sft_word, goodword)strcpy((char *)(sft->sft_word), (char *)(goodword));
11080 hash_add_item(&slang->sl_sounddone, hi, sft->sft_word, hash);
11081 } else {
11082 sft = HI2SFT(hi)((sftword_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumsft.sft_word - (char_u *
)&dumsft)));
11083 if (score >= sft->sft_score)
11084 return;
11085 sft->sft_score = score;
11086 }
11087
11088 // Find the word nr in the soundfold tree.
11089 sfwordnr = soundfold_find(slang, goodword);
11090 if (sfwordnr < 0) {
11091 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "add_sound_suggest()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("add_sound_suggest()"
));
11092 return;
11093 }
11094
11095 // Go over the list of good words that produce this soundfold word
11096 nrline = ml_get_buf(slang->sl_sugbuf, (linenr_T)(sfwordnr + 1), FALSE0);
11097 orgnr = 0;
11098 while (*nrline != NUL'\000') {
11099 // The wordnr was stored in a minimal nr of bytes as an offset to the
11100 // previous wordnr.
11101 orgnr += bytes2offset(&nrline);
11102
11103 byts = slang->sl_fbyts;
11104 idxs = slang->sl_fidxs;
11105
11106 // Lookup the word "orgnr" one of the two tries.
11107 n = 0;
11108 wordcount = 0;
11109 for (wlen = 0; wlen < MAXWLEN250 - 3; ++wlen) {
11110 i = 1;
11111 if (wordcount == orgnr && byts[n + 1] == NUL'\000')
11112 break; // found end of word
11113
11114 if (byts[n + 1] == NUL'\000')
11115 ++wordcount;
11116
11117 // skip over the NUL bytes
11118 for (; byts[n + i] == NUL'\000'; ++i)
11119 if (i > byts[n]) { // safety check
11120 STRCPY(theword + wlen, "BAD")strcpy((char *)(theword + wlen), (char *)("BAD"));
11121 wlen += 3;
11122 goto badword;
11123 }
11124
11125 // One of the siblings must have the word.
11126 for (; i < byts[n]; ++i) {
11127 wc = idxs[idxs[n + i]]; // nr of words under this byte
11128 if (wordcount + wc > orgnr)
11129 break;
11130 wordcount += wc;
11131 }
11132
11133 theword[wlen] = byts[n + i];
11134 n = idxs[n + i];
11135 }
11136badword:
11137 theword[wlen] = NUL'\000';
11138
11139 // Go over the possible flags and regions.
11140 for (; i <= byts[n] && byts[n + i] == NUL'\000'; ++i) {
11141 char_u cword[MAXWLEN250];
11142 char_u *p;
11143 int flags = (int)idxs[n + i];
11144
11145 // Skip words with the NOSUGGEST flag
11146 if (flags & WF_NOSUGGEST0x0400)
11147 continue;
11148
11149 if (flags & WF_KEEPCAP0x80) {
11150 // Must find the word in the keep-case tree.
11151 find_keepcap_word(slang, theword, cword);
11152 p = cword;
11153 } else {
11154 flags |= su->su_badflags;
11155 if ((flags & WF_CAPMASK(0x02 | 0x04 | 0x80 | 0x40)) != 0) {
11156 // Need to fix case according to "flags".
11157 make_case_word(theword, cword, flags);
11158 p = cword;
11159 } else
11160 p = theword;
11161 }
11162
11163 // Add the suggestion.
11164 if (sps_flags & SPS_DOUBLE4) {
11165 // Add the suggestion if the score isn't too bad.
11166 if (score <= su->su_maxscore)
11167 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_sga, p, su->su_badlen,
11168 score, 0, false0, slang, false0);
11169 } else {
11170 // Add a penalty for words in another region.
11171 if ((flags & WF_REGION0x01)
11172 && (((unsigned)flags >> 16) & lp->lp_region) == 0)
11173 goodscore = SCORE_REGION200;
11174 else
11175 goodscore = 0;
11176
11177 // Add a small penalty for changing the first letter from
11178 // lower to upper case. Helps for "tath" -> "Kath", which is
11179 // less common than "tath" -> "path". Don't do it when the
11180 // letter is the same, that has already been counted.
11181 gc = PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p));
11182 if (SPELL_ISUPPER(gc)(enc_utf8 && (gc) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(gc) : (gc) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[gc] : iswupper(gc))) {
11183 bc = PTR2CHAR(su->su_badword)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(su->su_badword) : (int)*(su->su_badword
));
11184 if (!SPELL_ISUPPER(bc)(enc_utf8 && (bc) >= 128 ? utf_isupper(bc) : (bc) <
256 ? spelltab.st_isu[bc] : iswupper(bc))
11185 && SPELL_TOFOLD(bc)(enc_utf8 && (bc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(bc) : (bc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[bc] : (int)towlower(bc)) != SPELL_TOFOLD(gc)(enc_utf8 && (gc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(gc) : (gc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[gc] : (int)towlower(gc)))
11186 goodscore += SCORE_ICASE52 / 2;
11187 }
11188
11189 // Compute the score for the good word. This only does letter
11190 // insert/delete/swap/replace. REP items are not considered,
11191 // which may make the score a bit higher.
11192 // Use a limit for the score to make it work faster. Use
11193 // MAXSCORE(), because RESCORE() will change the score.
11194 // If the limit is very high then the iterative method is
11195 // inefficient, using an array is quicker.
11196 limit = MAXSCORE(su->su_sfmaxscore - goodscore, score)((4 * su->su_sfmaxscore - goodscore - score) / 3);
11197 if (limit > SCORE_LIMITMAX350)
11198 goodscore += spell_edit_score(slang, su->su_badword, p);
11199 else
11200 goodscore += spell_edit_score_limit(slang, su->su_badword,
11201 p, limit);
11202
11203 // When going over the limit don't bother to do the rest.
11204 if (goodscore < SCORE_MAXMAX999999) {
11205 // Give a bonus to words seen before.
11206 goodscore = score_wordcount_adj(slang, goodscore, p, false0);
11207
11208 // Add the suggestion if the score isn't too bad.
11209 goodscore = RESCORE(goodscore, score)((3 * goodscore + score) / 4);
11210 if (goodscore <= su->su_sfmaxscore)
11211 add_suggestion(su, &su->su_ga, p, su->su_badlen,
11212 goodscore, score, true1, slang, true1);
11213 }
11214 }
11215 }
11216 // smsg("word %s (%d): %s (%d)", sftword, sftnr, theword, orgnr);
11217 }
11218}
11219
11220// Find word "word" in fold-case tree for "slang" and return the word number.
11221static int soundfold_find(slang_T *slang, char_u *word)
11222{
11223 idx_T arridx = 0;
11224 int len;
11225 int wlen = 0;
11226 int c;
11227 char_u *ptr = word;
11228 char_u *byts;
11229 idx_T *idxs;
11230 int wordnr = 0;
11231
11232 byts = slang->sl_sbyts;
11233 idxs = slang->sl_sidxs;
11234
11235 for (;; ) {
11236 // First byte is the number of possible bytes.
11237 len = byts[arridx++];
11238
11239 // If the first possible byte is a zero the word could end here.
11240 // If the word ends we found the word. If not skip the NUL bytes.
11241 c = ptr[wlen];
11242 if (byts[arridx] == NUL'\000') {
11243 if (c == NUL'\000')
11244 break;
11245
11246 // Skip over the zeros, there can be several.
11247 while (len > 0 && byts[arridx] == NUL'\000') {
11248 ++arridx;
11249 --len;
11250 }
11251 if (len == 0)
11252 return -1; // no children, word should have ended here
11253 ++wordnr;
11254 }
11255
11256 // If the word ends we didn't find it.
11257 if (c == NUL'\000')
11258 return -1;
11259
11260 // Perform a binary search in the list of accepted bytes.
11261 if (c == TAB'\011') // <Tab> is handled like <Space>
11262 c = ' ';
11263 while (byts[arridx] < c) {
11264 // The word count is in the first idxs[] entry of the child.
11265 wordnr += idxs[idxs[arridx]];
11266 ++arridx;
11267 if (--len == 0) // end of the bytes, didn't find it
11268 return -1;
11269 }
11270 if (byts[arridx] != c) // didn't find the byte
11271 return -1;
11272
11273 // Continue at the child (if there is one).
11274 arridx = idxs[arridx];
11275 ++wlen;
11276
11277 // One space in the good word may stand for several spaces in the
11278 // checked word.
11279 if (c == ' ')
11280 while (ptr[wlen] == ' ' || ptr[wlen] == TAB'\011')
11281 ++wlen;
11282 }
11283
11284 return wordnr;
11285}
11286
11287// Copy "fword" to "cword", fixing case according to "flags".
11288static void make_case_word(char_u *fword, char_u *cword, int flags)
11289{
11290 if (flags & WF_ALLCAP0x04)
11291 // Make it all upper-case
11292 allcap_copy(fword, cword);
11293 else if (flags & WF_ONECAP0x02)
11294 // Make the first letter upper-case
11295 onecap_copy(fword, cword, true1);
11296 else
11297 // Use goodword as-is.
11298 STRCPY(cword, fword)strcpy((char *)(cword), (char *)(fword));
11299}
11300
11301// Use map string "map" for languages "lp".
11302static void set_map_str(slang_T *lp, char_u *map)
11303{
11304 char_u *p;
11305 int headc = 0;
11306 int c;
11307 int i;
11308
11309 if (*map == NUL'\000') {
11310 lp->sl_has_map = false0;
11311 return;
11312 }
11313 lp->sl_has_map = true1;
11314
11315 // Init the array and hash tables empty.
11316 for (i = 0; i < 256; ++i)
11317 lp->sl_map_array[i] = 0;
11318 hash_init(&lp->sl_map_hash);
11319
11320 // The similar characters are stored separated with slashes:
11321 // "aaa/bbb/ccc/". Fill sl_map_array[c] with the character before c and
11322 // before the same slash. For characters above 255 sl_map_hash is used.
11323 for (p = map; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
11324 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
11325 if (c == '/')
11326 headc = 0;
11327 else {
11328 if (headc == 0)
11329 headc = c;
11330
11331 // Characters above 255 don't fit in sl_map_array[], put them in
11332 // the hash table. Each entry is the char, a NUL the headchar and
11333 // a NUL.
11334 if (c >= 256) {
11335 int cl = mb_char2len(c);
11336 int headcl = mb_char2len(headc);
11337 char_u *b;
11338 hash_T hash;
11339 hashitem_T *hi;
11340
11341 b = xmalloc(cl + headcl + 2);
11342 mb_char2bytes(c, b);
11343 b[cl] = NUL'\000';
11344 mb_char2bytes(headc, b + cl + 1);
11345 b[cl + 1 + headcl] = NUL'\000';
11346 hash = hash_hash(b);
11347 hi = hash_lookup(&lp->sl_map_hash, b, hash);
11348 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
11349 hash_add_item(&lp->sl_map_hash, hi, b, hash);
11350 else {
11351 // This should have been checked when generating the .spl
11352 // file.
