11353 EMSG(_("E783: duplicate char in MAP entry"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E783: duplicate char in MAP entry"
))));
11354 free(b);
11355 }
11356 } else
11357 lp->sl_map_array[c] = headc;
11358 }
11359 }
11360}
11361
11362// Returns true if "c1" and "c2" are similar characters according to the MAP
11363// lines in the .aff file.
11364static bool_Bool similar_chars(slang_T *slang, int c1, int c2)
11365{
11366 int m1, m2;
11367 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
11368 hashitem_T *hi;
11369
11370 if (c1 >= 256) {
11371 buf[mb_char2bytes(c1, buf)] = 0;
11372 hi = hash_find(&slang->sl_map_hash, buf);
11373 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
11374 m1 = 0;
11375 else
11376 m1 = mb_ptr2char(hi->hi_key + STRLEN(hi->hi_key)strlen((char *)(hi->hi_key)) + 1);
11377 } else
11378 m1 = slang->sl_map_array[c1];
11379 if (m1 == 0)
11380 return false0;
11381
11382
11383 if (c2 >= 256) {
11384 buf[mb_char2bytes(c2, buf)] = 0;
11385 hi = hash_find(&slang->sl_map_hash, buf);
11386 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
11387 m2 = 0;
11388 else
11389 m2 = mb_ptr2char(hi->hi_key + STRLEN(hi->hi_key)strlen((char *)(hi->hi_key)) + 1);
11390 } else
11391 m2 = slang->sl_map_array[c2];
11392
11393 return m1 == m2;
11394}
11395
11396// Adds a suggestion to the list of suggestions.
11397// For a suggestion that is already in the list the lowest score is remembered.
11398static void
11399add_suggestion (
11400 suginfo_T *su,
11401 garray_T *gap, // either su_ga or su_sga
11402 char_u *goodword,
11403 int badlenarg, // len of bad word replaced with "goodword"
11404 int score,
11405 int altscore,
11406 bool_Bool had_bonus, // value for st_had_bonus
11407 slang_T *slang, // language for sound folding
11408 bool_Bool maxsf // su_maxscore applies to soundfold score,
11409 // su_sfmaxscore to the total score.
11410)
11411{
11412 int goodlen; // len of goodword changed
11413 int badlen; // len of bad word changed
11414 suggest_T *stp;
11415 suggest_T new_sug;
11416 int i;
11417 char_u *pgood, *pbad;
11418
11419 // Minimize "badlen" for consistency. Avoids that changing "the the" to
11420 // "thee the" is added next to changing the first "the" the "thee".
11421 pgood = goodword + STRLEN(goodword)strlen((char *)(goodword));
11422 pbad = su->su_badptr + badlenarg;
11423 for (;; ) {
11424 goodlen = (int)(pgood - goodword);
11425 badlen = (int)(pbad - su->su_badptr);
11426 if (goodlen <= 0 || badlen <= 0)
11427 break;
11428 mb_ptr_back(goodword, pgood)pgood -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(goodword, pgood - 1) + 1
) : 1;
11429 mb_ptr_back(su->su_badptr, pbad)pbad -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(su->su_badptr, pbad - 1
) + 1) : 1;
11430 if (has_mbyte) {
11431 if (mb_ptr2char(pgood) != mb_ptr2char(pbad))
11432 break;
11433 } else if (*pgood != *pbad)
11434 break;
11435 }
11436
11437 if (badlen == 0 && goodlen == 0)
11438 // goodword doesn't change anything; may happen for "the the" changing
11439 // the first "the" to itself.
11440 return;
11441
11442 if (GA_EMPTY(gap)((gap)->ga_len <= 0))
11443 i = -1;
11444 else {
11445 // Check if the word is already there. Also check the length that is
11446 // being replaced "thes," -> "these" is a different suggestion from
11447 // "thes" -> "these".
11448 stp = &SUG(*gap, 0)(((suggest_T *)(*gap).ga_data)[0]);
11449 for (i = gap->ga_len; --i >= 0; ++stp) {
11450 if (stp->st_wordlen == goodlen
11451 && stp->st_orglen == badlen
11452 && STRNCMP(stp->st_word, goodword, goodlen)strncmp((char *)(stp->st_word), (char *)(goodword), (size_t
)(goodlen)) == 0) {
11453 // Found it. Remember the word with the lowest score.
11454 if (stp->st_slang == NULL((void*)0))
11455 stp->st_slang = slang;
11456
11457 new_sug.st_score = score;
11458 new_sug.st_altscore = altscore;
11459 new_sug.st_had_bonus = had_bonus;
11460
11461 if (stp->st_had_bonus != had_bonus) {
11462 // Only one of the two had the soundalike score computed.
11463 // Need to do that for the other one now, otherwise the
11464 // scores can't be compared. This happens because
11465 // suggest_try_change() doesn't compute the soundalike
11466 // word to keep it fast, while some special methods set
11467 // the soundalike score to zero.
11468 if (had_bonus)
11469 rescore_one(su, stp);
11470 else {
11471 new_sug.st_word = stp->st_word;
11472 new_sug.st_wordlen = stp->st_wordlen;
11473 new_sug.st_slang = stp->st_slang;
11474 new_sug.st_orglen = badlen;
11475 rescore_one(su, &new_sug);
11476 }
11477 }
11478
11479 if (stp->st_score > new_sug.st_score) {
11480 stp->st_score = new_sug.st_score;
11481 stp->st_altscore = new_sug.st_altscore;
11482 stp->st_had_bonus = new_sug.st_had_bonus;
11483 }
11484 break;
11485 }
11486 }
11487 }
11488
11489 if (i < 0) {
11490 // Add a suggestion.
11491 stp = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(suggest_T, gap)ga_append_via_ptr(gap, sizeof(suggest_T));
11492 stp->st_word = vim_strnsave(goodword, goodlen);
11493 stp->st_wordlen = goodlen;
11494 stp->st_score = score;
11495 stp->st_altscore = altscore;
11496 stp->st_had_bonus = had_bonus;
11497 stp->st_orglen = badlen;
11498 stp->st_slang = slang;
11499
11500 // If we have too many suggestions now, sort the list and keep
11501 // the best suggestions.
11502 if (gap->ga_len > SUG_MAX_COUNT(su)(((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20) + 50)) {
11503 if (maxsf)
11504 su->su_sfmaxscore = cleanup_suggestions(gap,
11505 su->su_sfmaxscore, SUG_CLEAN_COUNT(su)((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20));
11506 else
11507 su->su_maxscore = cleanup_suggestions(gap,
11508 su->su_maxscore, SUG_CLEAN_COUNT(su)((su)->su_maxcount < 130 ? 150 : (su)->su_maxcount +
20));
11509 }
11510 }
11511}
11512
11513// Suggestions may in fact be flagged as errors. Esp. for banned words and
11514// for split words, such as "the the". Remove these from the list here.
11515static void
11516check_suggestions (
11517 suginfo_T *su,
11518 garray_T *gap // either su_ga or su_sga
11519)
11520{
11521 suggest_T *stp;
11522 char_u longword[MAXWLEN250 + 1];
11523 int len;
11524 hlf_T attr;
11525
11526 stp = &SUG(*gap, 0)(((suggest_T *)(*gap).ga_data)[0]);
11527 for (int i = gap->ga_len - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
11528 // Need to append what follows to check for "the the".
11529 STRLCPY(longword, stp[i].st_word, MAXWLEN + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(longword), (char *)(stp[i].st_word), (size_t
)(250 + 1));
11530 len = stp[i].st_wordlen;
11531 STRLCPY(longword + len, su->su_badptr + stp[i].st_orglen,xstrlcpy((char *)(longword + len), (char *)(su->su_badptr +
stp[i].st_orglen), (size_t)(250 - len + 1))
11532 MAXWLEN - len + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(longword + len), (char *)(su->su_badptr +
stp[i].st_orglen), (size_t)(250 - len + 1));
11533 attr = HLF_COUNT;
11534 (void)spell_check(curwin, longword, &attr, NULL((void*)0), false0);
11535 if (attr != HLF_COUNT) {
11536 // Remove this entry.
11537 free(stp[i].st_word);
11538 --gap->ga_len;
11539 if (i < gap->ga_len)
11540 memmove(stp + i, stp + i + 1,
11541 sizeof(suggest_T) * (gap->ga_len - i));
11542 }
11543 }
11544}
11545
11546
11547// Add a word to be banned.
11548static void add_banned(suginfo_T *su, char_u *word)
11549{
11550 char_u *s;
11551 hash_T hash;
11552 hashitem_T *hi;
11553
11554 hash = hash_hash(word);
11555 hi = hash_lookup(&su->su_banned, word, hash);
11556 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
11557 s = vim_strsave(word);
11558 hash_add_item(&su->su_banned, hi, s, hash);
11559 }
11560}
11561
11562// Recompute the score for all suggestions if sound-folding is possible. This
11563// is slow, thus only done for the final results.
11564static void rescore_suggestions(suginfo_T *su)
11565{
11566 if (su->su_sallang != NULL((void*)0)) {
11567 for (int i = 0; i < su->su_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
11568 rescore_one(su, &SUG(su->su_ga, i)(((suggest_T *)(su->su_ga).ga_data)[i]));
11569 }
11570 }
11571}
11572
11573// Recompute the score for one suggestion if sound-folding is possible.
11574static void rescore_one(suginfo_T *su, suggest_T *stp)
11575{
11576 slang_T *slang = stp->st_slang;
11577 char_u sal_badword[MAXWLEN250];
11578 char_u *p;
11579
11580 // Only rescore suggestions that have no sal score yet and do have a
11581 // language.
11582 if (slang != NULL((void*)0) && !GA_EMPTY(&slang->sl_sal)((&slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0) && !stp->st_had_bonus) {
11583 if (slang == su->su_sallang)
11584 p = su->su_sal_badword;
11585 else {
11586 spell_soundfold(slang, su->su_fbadword, true1, sal_badword);
11587 p = sal_badword;
11588 }
11589
11590 stp->st_altscore = stp_sal_score(stp, su, slang, p);
11591 if (stp->st_altscore == SCORE_MAXMAX999999)
11592 stp->st_altscore = SCORE_BIG96 * 3;
11593 stp->st_score = RESCORE(stp->st_score, stp->st_altscore)((3 * stp->st_score + stp->st_altscore) / 4);
11594 stp->st_had_bonus = true1;
11595 }
11596}
11597
11598
11599// Function given to qsort() to sort the suggestions on st_score.
11600// First on "st_score", then "st_altscore" then alphabetically.
11601static int sug_compare(const void *s1, const void *s2)
11602{
11603 suggest_T *p1 = (suggest_T *)s1;
11604 suggest_T *p2 = (suggest_T *)s2;
11605 int n = p1->st_score - p2->st_score;
11606
11607 if (n == 0) {
11608 n = p1->st_altscore - p2->st_altscore;
11609 if (n == 0)
11610 n = STRICMP(p1->st_word, p2->st_word)strcasecmp((char *)(p1->st_word), (char *)(p2->st_word)
);
11611 }
11612 return n;
11613}
11614
11615// Cleanup the suggestions:
11616// - Sort on score.
11617// - Remove words that won't be displayed.
11618// Returns the maximum score in the list or "maxscore" unmodified.
11619static int
11620cleanup_suggestions (
11621 garray_T *gap,
11622 int maxscore,
11623 int keep // nr of suggestions to keep
11624)
11625{
11626 suggest_T *stp = &SUG(*gap, 0)(((suggest_T *)(*gap).ga_data)[0]);
11627
11628 // Sort the list.
11629 qsort(gap->ga_data, (size_t)gap->ga_len, sizeof(suggest_T), sug_compare);
11630
11631 // Truncate the list to the number of suggestions that will be displayed.
11632 if (gap->ga_len > keep) {
11633 for (int i = keep; i < gap->ga_len; ++i) {
11634 free(stp[i].st_word);
11635 }
11636 gap->ga_len = keep;
11637 return stp[keep - 1].st_score;
11638 }
11639 return maxscore;
11640}
11641
11642// Soundfold a string, for soundfold().
11643// Result is in allocated memory, NULL for an error.
11644char_u *eval_soundfold(char_u *word)
11645{
11646 langp_T *lp;
11647 char_u sound[MAXWLEN250];
11648
11649 if (curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell && *curwin->w_s->b_p_spl != NUL'\000') {
11650 // Use the sound-folding of the first language that supports it.
11651 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
11652 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
11653 if (!GA_EMPTY(&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)((&lp->lp_slang->sl_sal)->ga_len <= 0)) {
11654 // soundfold the word
11655 spell_soundfold(lp->lp_slang, word, false0, sound);
11656 return vim_strsave(sound);
11657 }
11658 }
11659 }
11660
11661 // No language with sound folding, return word as-is.
11662 return vim_strsave(word);
11663}
11664
11665// Turn "inword" into its sound-a-like equivalent in "res[MAXWLEN]".
11666//
11667// There are many ways to turn a word into a sound-a-like representation. The
11668// oldest is Soundex (1918!). A nice overview can be found in "Approximate
11669// swedish name matching - survey and test of different algorithms" by Klas
11670// Erikson.
11671//
11672// We support two methods:
11673// 1. SOFOFROM/SOFOTO do a simple character mapping.
11674// 2. SAL items define a more advanced sound-folding (and much slower).
11675static void
11676spell_soundfold (
11677 slang_T *slang,
11678 char_u *inword,
11679 bool_Bool folded, // "inword" is already case-folded
11680 char_u *res
11681)
11682{
11683 char_u fword[MAXWLEN250];
11684 char_u *word;
11685
11686 if (slang->sl_sofo)
11687 // SOFOFROM and SOFOTO used
11688 spell_soundfold_sofo(slang, inword, res);
11689 else {
11690 // SAL items used. Requires the word to be case-folded.
11691 if (folded)
11692 word = inword;
11693 else {
11694 (void)spell_casefold(inword, (int)STRLEN(inword)strlen((char *)(inword)), fword, MAXWLEN250);
11695 word = fword;
11696 }
11697
11698 if (has_mbyte)
11699 spell_soundfold_wsal(slang, word, res);
11700 else
11701 spell_soundfold_sal(slang, word, res);
11702 }
11703}
11704
11705// Perform sound folding of "inword" into "res" according to SOFOFROM and
11706// SOFOTO lines.
11707static void spell_soundfold_sofo(slang_T *slang, char_u *inword, char_u *res)
11708{
11709 char_u *s;
11710 int ri = 0;
11711 int c;
11712
11713 if (has_mbyte) {
11714 int prevc = 0;
11715 int *ip;
11716
11717 // The sl_sal_first[] table contains the translation for chars up to
11718 // 255, sl_sal the rest.
11719 for (s = inword; *s != NUL'\000'; ) {
11720 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&s);
11721 if (enc_utf8 ? utf_class(c) == 0 : vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t'))
11722 c = ' ';
11723 else if (c < 256)
11724 c = slang->sl_sal_first[c];
11725 else {
11726 ip = ((int **)slang->sl_sal.ga_data)[c & 0xff];
11727 if (ip == NULL((void*)0)) // empty list, can't match
11728 c = NUL'\000';
11729 else
11730 for (;; ) { // find "c" in the list
11731 if (*ip == 0) { // not found
11732 c = NUL'\000';
11733 break;
11734 }
11735 if (*ip == c) { // match!
11736 c = ip[1];
11737 break;
11738 }
11739 ip += 2;
11740 }
11741 }
11742
11743 if (c != NUL'\000' && c != prevc) {
11744 ri += mb_char2bytes(c, res + ri);
11745 if (ri + MB_MAXBYTES21 > MAXWLEN250)
11746 break;
11747 prevc = c;
11748 }
11749 }
11750 } else {
11751 // The sl_sal_first[] table contains the translation.
11752 for (s = inword; (c = *s) != NUL'\000'; ++s) {
11753 if (vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t'))
11754 c = ' ';
11755 else
11756 c = slang->sl_sal_first[c];
11757 if (c != NUL'\000' && (ri == 0 || res[ri - 1] != c))
11758 res[ri++] = c;
11759 }
11760 }
11761
11762 res[ri] = NUL'\000';
11763}
11764
11765static void spell_soundfold_sal(slang_T *slang, char_u *inword, char_u *res)
11766{
11767 salitem_T *smp;
11768 char_u word[MAXWLEN250];
11769 char_u *s = inword;
11770 char_u *t;
11771 char_u *pf;
11772 int i, j, z;
11773 int reslen;
11774 int n, k = 0;
11775 int z0;
11776 int k0;
11777 int n0;
11778 int c;
11779 int pri;
11780 int p0 = -333;
11781 int c0;
11782
11783 // Remove accents, if wanted. We actually remove all non-word characters.
11784 // But keep white space. We need a copy, the word may be changed here.
11785 if (slang->sl_rem_accents) {
11786 t = word;
11787 while (*s != NUL'\000') {
11788 if (vim_iswhite(*s)((*s) == ' ' || (*s) == '\t')) {
11789 *t++ = ' ';
11790 s = skipwhite(s);
11791 } else {
11792 if (spell_iswordp_nmw(s, curwin))
11793 *t++ = *s;
11794 ++s;
11795 }
11796 }
11797 *t = NUL'\000';
11798 } else
11799 STRLCPY(word, s, MAXWLEN)xstrlcpy((char *)(word), (char *)(s), (size_t)(250));
11800
11801 smp = (salitem_T *)slang->sl_sal.ga_data;
11802
11803 // This comes from Aspell phonet.cpp. Converted from C++ to C.
11804 // Changed to keep spaces.
11805 i = reslen = z = 0;
11806 while ((c = word[i]) != NUL'\000') {
11807 // Start with the first rule that has the character in the word.
11808 n = slang->sl_sal_first[c];
11809 z0 = 0;
11810
11811 if (n >= 0) {
11812 // check all rules for the same letter
11813 for (; (s = smp[n].sm_lead)[0] == c; ++n) {
11814 // Quickly skip entries that don't match the word. Most
11815 // entries are less then three chars, optimize for that.
11816 k = smp[n].sm_leadlen;
11817 if (k > 1) {
11818 if (word[i + 1] != s[1])
11819 continue;
11820 if (k > 2) {
11821 for (j = 2; j < k; ++j)
11822 if (word[i + j] != s[j])
11823 break;
11824 if (j < k)
11825 continue;
11826 }
11827 }
11828
11829 if ((pf = smp[n].sm_oneof) != NULL((void*)0)) {
11830 // Check for match with one of the chars in "sm_oneof".
11831 while (*pf != NUL'\000' && *pf != word[i + k])
11832 ++pf;
11833 if (*pf == NUL'\000')
11834 continue;
11835 ++k;
11836 }
11837 s = smp[n].sm_rules;
11838 pri = 5; // default priority
11839
11840 p0 = *s;
11841 k0 = k;
11842 while (*s == '-' && k > 1) {
11843 k--;
11844 s++;
11845 }
11846 if (*s == '<')
11847 s++;
11848 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10)) {
11849 // determine priority
11850 pri = *s - '0';
11851 s++;
11852 }
11853 if (*s == '^' && *(s + 1) == '^')
11854 s++;
11855
11856 if (*s == NUL'\000'
11857 || (*s == '^'
11858 && (i == 0 || !(word[i - 1] == ' '
11859 || spell_iswordp(word + i - 1, curwin)))
11860 && (*(s + 1) != '$'
11861 || (!spell_iswordp(word + i + k0, curwin))))
11862 || (*s == '$' && i > 0
11863 && spell_iswordp(word + i - 1, curwin)
11864 && (!spell_iswordp(word + i + k0, curwin)))) {
11865 // search for followup rules, if:
11866 // followup and k > 1 and NO '-' in searchstring
11867 c0 = word[i + k - 1];
11868 n0 = slang->sl_sal_first[c0];
11869
11870 if (slang->sl_followup && k > 1 && n0 >= 0
11871 && p0 != '-' && word[i + k] != NUL'\000') {
11872 // test follow-up rule for "word[i + k]"
11873 for (; (s = smp[n0].sm_lead)[0] == c0; ++n0) {
11874 // Quickly skip entries that don't match the word.
11875 k0 = smp[n0].sm_leadlen;
11876 if (k0 > 1) {
11877 if (word[i + k] != s[1])
11878 continue;
11879 if (k0 > 2) {
11880 pf = word + i + k + 1;
11881 for (j = 2; j < k0; ++j)
11882 if (*pf++ != s[j])
11883 break;
11884 if (j < k0)
11885 continue;
11886 }
11887 }
11888 k0 += k - 1;
11889
11890 if ((pf = smp[n0].sm_oneof) != NULL((void*)0)) {
11891 // Check for match with one of the chars in
11892 // "sm_oneof".
11893 while (*pf != NUL'\000' && *pf != word[i + k0])
11894 ++pf;
11895 if (*pf == NUL'\000')
11896 continue;
11897 ++k0;
11898 }
11899
11900 p0 = 5;
11901 s = smp[n0].sm_rules;
11902 while (*s == '-') {
11903 // "k0" gets NOT reduced because
11904 // "if (k0 == k)"
11905 s++;
11906 }
11907 if (*s == '<')
11908 s++;
11909 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10)) {
11910 p0 = *s - '0';
11911 s++;
11912 }
11913
11914 if (*s == NUL'\000'
11915 // *s == '^' cuts
11916 || (*s == '$'
11917 && !spell_iswordp(word + i + k0,
11918 curwin))) {
11919 if (k0 == k)
11920 // this is just a piece of the string
11921 continue;
11922
11923 if (p0 < pri)
11924 // priority too low
11925 continue;
11926 // rule fits; stop search
11927 break;
11928 }
11929 }
11930
11931 if (p0 >= pri && smp[n0].sm_lead[0] == c0)
11932 continue;
11933 }
11934
11935 // replace string
11936 s = smp[n].sm_to;
11937 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
11938 s = (char_u *)"";
11939 pf = smp[n].sm_rules;
11940 p0 = (vim_strchr(pf, '<') != NULL((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0;
11941 if (p0 == 1 && z == 0) {
11942 // rule with '<' is used
11943 if (reslen > 0 && *s != NUL'\000' && (res[reslen - 1] == c
11944 || res[reslen - 1] == *s))
11945 reslen--;
11946 z0 = 1;
11947 z = 1;
11948 k0 = 0;
11949 while (*s != NUL'\000' && word[i + k0] != NUL'\000') {
11950 word[i + k0] = *s;
11951 k0++;
11952 s++;
11953 }
11954 if (k > k0)
11955 STRMOVE(word + i + k0, word + i + k)memmove((word + i + k0), (word + i + k), strlen((char *)(word
+ i + k)) + 1);
11956
11957 // new "actual letter"
11958 c = word[i];
11959 } else {
11960 // no '<' rule used
11961 i += k - 1;
11962 z = 0;
11963 while (*s != NUL'\000' && s[1] != NUL'\000' && reslen < MAXWLEN250) {
11964 if (reslen == 0 || res[reslen - 1] != *s)
11965 res[reslen++] = *s;
11966 s++;
11967 }
11968 // new "actual letter"
11969 c = *s;
11970 if (strstr((char *)pf, "^^") != NULL((void*)0)) {
11971 if (c != NUL'\000')
11972 res[reslen++] = c;
11973 STRMOVE(word, word + i + 1)memmove((word), (word + i + 1), strlen((char *)(word + i + 1)
) + 1);
11974 i = 0;
11975 z0 = 1;
11976 }
11977 }
11978 break;
11979 }
11980 }
11981 } else if (vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')) {
11982 c = ' ';
11983 k = 1;
11984 }
11985
11986 if (z0 == 0) {
11987 if (k && !p0 && reslen < MAXWLEN250 && c != NUL'\000'
11988 && (!slang->sl_collapse || reslen == 0
11989 || res[reslen - 1] != c))
11990 // condense only double letters
11991 res[reslen++] = c;
11992
11993 i++;
11994 z = 0;
11995 k = 0;
11996 }
11997 }
11998
11999 res[reslen] = NUL'\000';
12000}
12001
12002// Turn "inword" into its sound-a-like equivalent in "res[MAXWLEN]".
12003// Multi-byte version of spell_soundfold().
12004static void spell_soundfold_wsal(slang_T *slang, char_u *inword, char_u *res)
12005{
12006 salitem_T *smp = (salitem_T *)slang->sl_sal.ga_data;
12007 int word[MAXWLEN250];
12008 int wres[MAXWLEN250];
12009 int l;
12010 char_u *s;
12011 int *ws;
12012 char_u *t;
12013 int *pf;
12014 int i, j, z;
12015 int reslen;
12016 int n, k = 0;
12017 int z0;
12018 int k0;
12019 int n0;
12020 int c;
12021 int pri;
12022 int p0 = -333;
12023 int c0;
12024 bool_Bool did_white = false0;
12025 int wordlen;
12026
12027
12028 // Convert the multi-byte string to a wide-character string.
12029 // Remove accents, if wanted. We actually remove all non-word characters.
12030 // But keep white space.
12031 wordlen = 0;
12032 for (s = inword; *s != NUL'\000'; ) {
12033 t = s;
12034 c = mb_cptr2char_adv(&s);
12035 if (slang->sl_rem_accents) {
12036 if (enc_utf8 ? utf_class(c) == 0 : vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')) {
12037 if (did_white)
12038 continue;
12039 c = ' ';
12040 did_white = true1;
12041 } else {
12042 did_white = false0;
12043 if (!spell_iswordp_nmw(t, curwin))
12044 continue;
12045 }
12046 }
12047 word[wordlen++] = c;
12048 }
12049 word[wordlen] = NUL'\000';
12050
12051 // This algorithm comes from Aspell phonet.cpp.
12052 // Converted from C++ to C. Added support for multi-byte chars.
12053 // Changed to keep spaces.
12054 i = reslen = z = 0;
12055 while ((c = word[i]) != NUL'\000') {
12056 // Start with the first rule that has the character in the word.
12057 n = slang->sl_sal_first[c & 0xff];
12058 z0 = 0;
12059
12060 if (n >= 0) {
12061 // Check all rules for the same index byte.
12062 // If c is 0x300 need extra check for the end of the array, as
12063 // (c & 0xff) is NUL.
12064 for (; ((ws = smp[n].sm_lead_w)[0] & 0xff) == (c & 0xff)
12065 && ws[0] != NUL'\000'; ++n) {
12066 // Quickly skip entries that don't match the word. Most
12067 // entries are less then three chars, optimize for that.
12068 if (c != ws[0])
12069 continue;
12070 k = smp[n].sm_leadlen;
12071 if (k > 1) {
12072 if (word[i + 1] != ws[1])
12073 continue;
12074 if (k > 2) {
12075 for (j = 2; j < k; ++j)
12076 if (word[i + j] != ws[j])
12077 break;
12078 if (j < k)
12079 continue;
12080 }
12081 }
12082
12083 if ((pf = smp[n].sm_oneof_w) != NULL((void*)0)) {
12084 // Check for match with one of the chars in "sm_oneof".
12085 while (*pf != NUL'\000' && *pf != word[i + k])
12086 ++pf;
12087 if (*pf == NUL'\000')
12088 continue;
12089 ++k;
12090 }
12091 s = smp[n].sm_rules;
12092 pri = 5; // default priority
12093
12094 p0 = *s;
12095 k0 = k;
12096 while (*s == '-' && k > 1) {
12097 k--;
12098 s++;
12099 }
12100 if (*s == '<')
12101 s++;
12102 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10)) {
12103 // determine priority
12104 pri = *s - '0';
12105 s++;
12106 }
12107 if (*s == '^' && *(s + 1) == '^')
12108 s++;
12109
12110 if (*s == NUL'\000'
12111 || (*s == '^'
12112 && (i == 0 || !(word[i - 1] == ' '
12113 || spell_iswordp_w(word + i - 1, curwin)))
12114 && (*(s + 1) != '$'
12115 || (!spell_iswordp_w(word + i + k0, curwin))))
12116 || (*s == '$' && i > 0
12117 && spell_iswordp_w(word + i - 1, curwin)
12118 && (!spell_iswordp_w(word + i + k0, curwin)))) {
12119 // search for followup rules, if:
12120 // followup and k > 1 and NO '-' in searchstring
12121 c0 = word[i + k - 1];
12122 n0 = slang->sl_sal_first[c0 & 0xff];
12123
12124 if (slang->sl_followup && k > 1 && n0 >= 0
12125 && p0 != '-' && word[i + k] != NUL'\000') {
12126 // Test follow-up rule for "word[i + k]"; loop over
12127 // all entries with the same index byte.
12128 for (; ((ws = smp[n0].sm_lead_w)[0] & 0xff)
12129 == (c0 & 0xff); ++n0) {
12130 // Quickly skip entries that don't match the word.
12131 if (c0 != ws[0])
12132 continue;
12133 k0 = smp[n0].sm_leadlen;
12134 if (k0 > 1) {
12135 if (word[i + k] != ws[1])
12136 continue;
12137 if (k0 > 2) {
12138 pf = word + i + k + 1;
12139 for (j = 2; j < k0; ++j)
12140 if (*pf++ != ws[j])
12141 break;
12142 if (j < k0)
12143 continue;
12144 }
12145 }
12146 k0 += k - 1;
12147
12148 if ((pf = smp[n0].sm_oneof_w) != NULL((void*)0)) {
12149 // Check for match with one of the chars in
12150 // "sm_oneof".
12151 while (*pf != NUL'\000' && *pf != word[i + k0])
12152 ++pf;
12153 if (*pf == NUL'\000')
12154 continue;
12155 ++k0;
12156 }
12157
12158 p0 = 5;
12159 s = smp[n0].sm_rules;
12160 while (*s == '-') {
12161 // "k0" gets NOT reduced because
12162 // "if (k0 == k)"
12163 s++;
12164 }
12165 if (*s == '<')
12166 s++;
12167 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10)) {
12168 p0 = *s - '0';
12169 s++;
12170 }
12171
12172 if (*s == NUL'\000'
12173 // *s == '^' cuts
12174 || (*s == '$'
12175 && !spell_iswordp_w(word + i + k0,
12176 curwin))) {
12177 if (k0 == k)
12178 // this is just a piece of the string
12179 continue;
12180
12181 if (p0 < pri)
12182 // priority too low
12183 continue;
12184 // rule fits; stop search
12185 break;
12186 }
12187 }
12188
12189 if (p0 >= pri && (smp[n0].sm_lead_w[0] & 0xff)
12190 == (c0 & 0xff))
12191 continue;
12192 }
12193
12194 // replace string
12195 ws = smp[n].sm_to_w;
12196 s = smp[n].sm_rules;
12197 p0 = (vim_strchr(s, '<') != NULL((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0;
12198 if (p0 == 1 && z == 0) {
12199 // rule with '<' is used
12200 if (reslen > 0 && ws != NULL((void*)0) && *ws != NUL'\000'
12201 && (wres[reslen - 1] == c
12202 || wres[reslen - 1] == *ws))
12203 reslen--;
12204 z0 = 1;
12205 z = 1;
12206 k0 = 0;
12207 if (ws != NULL((void*)0))
12208 while (*ws != NUL'\000' && word[i + k0] != NUL'\000') {
12209 word[i + k0] = *ws;
12210 k0++;
12211 ws++;
12212 }
12213 if (k > k0)
12214 memmove(word + i + k0, word + i + k,
12215 sizeof(int) * (wordlen - (i + k) + 1));
12216
12217 // new "actual letter"
12218 c = word[i];
12219 } else {
12220 // no '<' rule used
12221 i += k - 1;
12222 z = 0;
12223 if (ws != NULL((void*)0))
12224 while (*ws != NUL'\000' && ws[1] != NUL'\000'
12225 && reslen < MAXWLEN250) {
12226 if (reslen == 0 || wres[reslen - 1] != *ws)
12227 wres[reslen++] = *ws;
12228 ws++;
12229 }
12230 // new "actual letter"
12231 if (ws == NULL((void*)0))
12232 c = NUL'\000';
12233 else
12234 c = *ws;
12235 if (strstr((char *)s, "^^") != NULL((void*)0)) {
12236 if (c != NUL'\000')
12237 wres[reslen++] = c;
12238 memmove(word, word + i + 1,
12239 sizeof(int) * (wordlen - (i + 1) + 1));
12240 i = 0;
12241 z0 = 1;
12242 }
12243 }
12244 break;
12245 }
12246 }
12247 } else if (vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')) {
12248 c = ' ';
12249 k = 1;
12250 }
12251
12252 if (z0 == 0) {
12253 if (k && !p0 && reslen < MAXWLEN250 && c != NUL'\000'
12254 && (!slang->sl_collapse || reslen == 0
12255 || wres[reslen - 1] != c))
12256 // condense only double letters
12257 wres[reslen++] = c;
12258
12259 i++;
12260 z = 0;
12261 k = 0;
12262 }
12263 }
12264
12265 // Convert wide characters in "wres" to a multi-byte string in "res".
12266 l = 0;
12267 for (n = 0; n < reslen; ++n) {
12268 l += mb_char2bytes(wres[n], res + l);
12269 if (l + MB_MAXBYTES21 > MAXWLEN250)
12270 break;
12271 }
12272 res[l] = NUL'\000';
12273}
12274
12275// Compute a score for two sound-a-like words.
12276// This permits up to two inserts/deletes/swaps/etc. to keep things fast.
12277// Instead of a generic loop we write out the code. That keeps it fast by
12278// avoiding checks that will not be possible.
12279static int
12280soundalike_score (
12281 char_u *goodstart, // sound-folded good word
12282 char_u *badstart // sound-folded bad word
12283)
12284{
12285 char_u *goodsound = goodstart;
12286 char_u *badsound = badstart;
12287 int goodlen;
12288 int badlen;
12289 int n;
12290 char_u *pl, *ps;
12291 char_u *pl2, *ps2;
12292 int score = 0;
12293
12294 // Adding/inserting "*" at the start (word starts with vowel) shouldn't be
12295 // counted so much, vowels halfway the word aren't counted at all.
12296 if ((*badsound == '*' || *goodsound == '*') && *badsound != *goodsound) {
12297 if ((badsound[0] == NUL'\000' && goodsound[1] == NUL'\000')
12298 || (goodsound[0] == NUL'\000' && badsound[1] == NUL'\000'))
12299 // changing word with vowel to word without a sound
12300 return SCORE_DEL94;
12301 if (badsound[0] == NUL'\000' || goodsound[0] == NUL'\000')
12302 // more than two changes
12303 return SCORE_MAXMAX999999;
12304
12305 if (badsound[1] == goodsound[1]
12306 || (badsound[1] != NUL'\000'
12307 && goodsound[1] != NUL'\000'
12308 && badsound[2] == goodsound[2])) {
12309 // handle like a substitute
12310 } else {
12311 score = 2 * SCORE_DEL94 / 3;
12312 if (*badsound == '*')
12313 ++badsound;
12314 else
12315 ++goodsound;
12316 }
12317 }
12318
12319 goodlen = (int)STRLEN(goodsound)strlen((char *)(goodsound));
12320 badlen = (int)STRLEN(badsound)strlen((char *)(badsound));
12321
12322 // Return quickly if the lengths are too different to be fixed by two
12323 // changes.
12324 n = goodlen - badlen;
12325 if (n < -2 || n > 2)
12326 return SCORE_MAXMAX999999;
12327
12328 if (n > 0) {
12329 pl = goodsound; // goodsound is longest
12330 ps = badsound;
12331 } else {
12332 pl = badsound; // badsound is longest
12333 ps = goodsound;
12334 }
12335
12336 // Skip over the identical part.
12337 while (*pl == *ps && *pl != NUL'\000') {
12338 ++pl;
12339 ++ps;
12340 }
12341
12342 switch (n) {
12343 case -2:
12344 case 2:
12345 // Must delete two characters from "pl".
12346 ++pl; // first delete
12347 while (*pl == *ps) {
12348 ++pl;
12349 ++ps;
12350 }
12351 // strings must be equal after second delete
12352 if (STRCMP(pl + 1, ps)strcmp((char *)(pl + 1), (char *)(ps)) == 0)
12353 return score + SCORE_DEL94 * 2;
12354
12355 // Failed to compare.
12356 break;
12357
12358 case -1:
12359 case 1:
12360 // Minimal one delete from "pl" required.
12361
12362 // 1: delete
12363 pl2 = pl + 1;
12364 ps2 = ps;
12365 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12366 if (*pl2 == NUL'\000') // reached the end
12367 return score + SCORE_DEL94;
12368 ++pl2;
12369 ++ps2;
12370 }
12371
12372 // 2: delete then swap, then rest must be equal
12373 if (pl2[0] == ps2[1] && pl2[1] == ps2[0]
12374 && STRCMP(pl2 + 2, ps2 + 2)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 2), (char *)(ps2 + 2)) == 0)
12375 return score + SCORE_DEL94 + SCORE_SWAP75;
12376
12377 // 3: delete then substitute, then the rest must be equal
12378 if (STRCMP(pl2 + 1, ps2 + 1)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 1), (char *)(ps2 + 1)) == 0)
12379 return score + SCORE_DEL94 + SCORE_SUBST93;
12380
12381 // 4: first swap then delete
12382 if (pl[0] == ps[1] && pl[1] == ps[0]) {
12383 pl2 = pl + 2; // swap, skip two chars
12384 ps2 = ps + 2;
12385 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12386 ++pl2;
12387 ++ps2;
12388 }
12389 // delete a char and then strings must be equal
12390 if (STRCMP(pl2 + 1, ps2)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 1), (char *)(ps2)) == 0)
12391 return score + SCORE_SWAP75 + SCORE_DEL94;
12392 }
12393
12394 // 5: first substitute then delete
12395 pl2 = pl + 1; // substitute, skip one char
12396 ps2 = ps + 1;
12397 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12398 ++pl2;
12399 ++ps2;
12400 }
12401 // delete a char and then strings must be equal
12402 if (STRCMP(pl2 + 1, ps2)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 1), (char *)(ps2)) == 0)
12403 return score + SCORE_SUBST93 + SCORE_DEL94;
12404
12405 // Failed to compare.
12406 break;
12407
12408 case 0:
12409 // Lengths are equal, thus changes must result in same length: An
12410 // insert is only possible in combination with a delete.
12411 // 1: check if for identical strings
12412 if (*pl == NUL'\000')
12413 return score;
12414
12415 // 2: swap
12416 if (pl[0] == ps[1] && pl[1] == ps[0]) {
12417 pl2 = pl + 2; // swap, skip two chars
12418 ps2 = ps + 2;
12419 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12420 if (*pl2 == NUL'\000') // reached the end
12421 return score + SCORE_SWAP75;
12422 ++pl2;
12423 ++ps2;
12424 }
12425 // 3: swap and swap again
12426 if (pl2[0] == ps2[1] && pl2[1] == ps2[0]
12427 && STRCMP(pl2 + 2, ps2 + 2)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 2), (char *)(ps2 + 2)) == 0)
12428 return score + SCORE_SWAP75 + SCORE_SWAP75;
12429
12430 // 4: swap and substitute
12431 if (STRCMP(pl2 + 1, ps2 + 1)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 1), (char *)(ps2 + 1)) == 0)
12432 return score + SCORE_SWAP75 + SCORE_SUBST93;
12433 }
12434
12435 // 5: substitute
12436 pl2 = pl + 1;
12437 ps2 = ps + 1;
12438 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12439 if (*pl2 == NUL'\000') // reached the end
12440 return score + SCORE_SUBST93;
12441 ++pl2;
12442 ++ps2;
12443 }
12444
12445 // 6: substitute and swap
12446 if (pl2[0] == ps2[1] && pl2[1] == ps2[0]
12447 && STRCMP(pl2 + 2, ps2 + 2)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 2), (char *)(ps2 + 2)) == 0)
12448 return score + SCORE_SUBST93 + SCORE_SWAP75;
12449
12450 // 7: substitute and substitute
12451 if (STRCMP(pl2 + 1, ps2 + 1)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 1), (char *)(ps2 + 1)) == 0)
12452 return score + SCORE_SUBST93 + SCORE_SUBST93;
12453
12454 // 8: insert then delete
12455 pl2 = pl;
12456 ps2 = ps + 1;
12457 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12458 ++pl2;
12459 ++ps2;
12460 }
12461 if (STRCMP(pl2 + 1, ps2)strcmp((char *)(pl2 + 1), (char *)(ps2)) == 0)
12462 return score + SCORE_INS96 + SCORE_DEL94;
12463
12464 // 9: delete then insert
12465 pl2 = pl + 1;
12466 ps2 = ps;
12467 while (*pl2 == *ps2) {
12468 ++pl2;
12469 ++ps2;
12470 }
12471 if (STRCMP(pl2, ps2 + 1)strcmp((char *)(pl2), (char *)(ps2 + 1)) == 0)
12472 return score + SCORE_INS96 + SCORE_DEL94;
12473
12474 // Failed to compare.
12475 break;
12476 }
12477
12478 return SCORE_MAXMAX999999;
12479}
12480
12481// Compute the "edit distance" to turn "badword" into "goodword". The less
12482// deletes/inserts/substitutes/swaps are required the lower the score.
12483//
12484// The algorithm is described by Du and Chang, 1992.
12485// The implementation of the algorithm comes from Aspell editdist.cpp,
12486// edit_distance(). It has been converted from C++ to C and modified to
12487// support multi-byte characters.
12488static int spell_edit_score(slang_T *slang, char_u *badword, char_u *goodword)
12489{
12490 int *cnt;
12491 int badlen, goodlen; // lengths including NUL
12492 int j, i;
12493 int t;
12494 int bc, gc;
12495 int pbc, pgc;
12496 char_u *p;
12497 int wbadword[MAXWLEN250];
12498 int wgoodword[MAXWLEN250];
12499
12500 if (has_mbyte) {
12501 // Get the characters from the multi-byte strings and put them in an
12502 // int array for easy access.
12503 for (p = badword, badlen = 0; *p != NUL'\000'; )
12504 wbadword[badlen++] = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
12505 wbadword[badlen++] = 0;
12506 for (p = goodword, goodlen = 0; *p != NUL'\000'; )
12507 wgoodword[goodlen++] = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
12508 wgoodword[goodlen++] = 0;
12509 } else {
12510 badlen = (int)STRLEN(badword)strlen((char *)(badword)) + 1;
12511 goodlen = (int)STRLEN(goodword)strlen((char *)(goodword)) + 1;
12512 }
12513
12514 // We use "cnt" as an array: CNT(badword_idx, goodword_idx).
12515#define CNT(a, b)cnt[(a) + (b) * (badlen + 1)] cnt[(a) + (b) * (badlen + 1)]
12516 cnt = xmalloc(sizeof(int) * (badlen + 1) * (goodlen + 1));
12517
12518 CNT(0, 0)cnt[(0) + (0) * (badlen + 1)] = 0;
12519 for (j = 1; j <= goodlen; ++j)
12520 CNT(0, j)cnt[(0) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = CNT(0, j - 1)cnt[(0) + (j - 1) * (badlen + 1)] + SCORE_INS96;
12521
12522 for (i = 1; i <= badlen; ++i) {
12523 CNT(i, 0)cnt[(i) + (0) * (badlen + 1)] = CNT(i - 1, 0)cnt[(i - 1) + (0) * (badlen + 1)] + SCORE_DEL94;
12524 for (j = 1; j <= goodlen; ++j) {
12525 if (has_mbyte) {
12526 bc = wbadword[i - 1];
12527 gc = wgoodword[j - 1];
12528 } else {
12529 bc = badword[i - 1];
12530 gc = goodword[j - 1];
12531 }
12532 if (bc == gc)
12533 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = CNT(i - 1, j - 1)cnt[(i - 1) + (j - 1) * (badlen + 1)];
12534 else {
12535 // Use a better score when there is only a case difference.
12536 if (SPELL_TOFOLD(bc)(enc_utf8 && (bc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(bc) : (bc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[bc] : (int)towlower(bc)) == SPELL_TOFOLD(gc)(enc_utf8 && (gc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(gc) : (gc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[gc] : (int)towlower(gc)))
12537 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = SCORE_ICASE52 + CNT(i - 1, j - 1)cnt[(i - 1) + (j - 1) * (badlen + 1)];
12538 else {
12539 // For a similar character use SCORE_SIMILAR.
12540 if (slang != NULL((void*)0)
12541 && slang->sl_has_map
12542 && similar_chars(slang, gc, bc))
12543 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = SCORE_SIMILAR33 + CNT(i - 1, j - 1)cnt[(i - 1) + (j - 1) * (badlen + 1)];
12544 else
12545 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = SCORE_SUBST93 + CNT(i - 1, j - 1)cnt[(i - 1) + (j - 1) * (badlen + 1)];
12546 }
12547
12548 if (i > 1 && j > 1) {
12549 if (has_mbyte) {
12550 pbc = wbadword[i - 2];
12551 pgc = wgoodword[j - 2];
12552 } else {
12553 pbc = badword[i - 2];
12554 pgc = goodword[j - 2];
12555 }
12556 if (bc == pgc && pbc == gc) {
12557 t = SCORE_SWAP75 + CNT(i - 2, j - 2)cnt[(i - 2) + (j - 2) * (badlen + 1)];
12558 if (t < CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)])
12559 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = t;
12560 }
12561 }
12562 t = SCORE_DEL94 + CNT(i - 1, j)cnt[(i - 1) + (j) * (badlen + 1)];
12563 if (t < CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)])
12564 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = t;
12565 t = SCORE_INS96 + CNT(i, j - 1)cnt[(i) + (j - 1) * (badlen + 1)];
12566 if (t < CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)])
12567 CNT(i, j)cnt[(i) + (j) * (badlen + 1)] = t;
12568 }
12569 }
12570 }
12571
12572 i = CNT(badlen - 1, goodlen - 1)cnt[(badlen - 1) + (goodlen - 1) * (badlen + 1)];
12573 free(cnt);
12574 return i;
12575}
12576
12577// Like spell_edit_score(), but with a limit on the score to make it faster.
12578// May return SCORE_MAXMAX when the score is higher than "limit".
12579//
12580// This uses a stack for the edits still to be tried.
12581// The idea comes from Aspell leditdist.cpp. Rewritten in C and added support
12582// for multi-byte characters.
12583static int spell_edit_score_limit(slang_T *slang, char_u *badword, char_u *goodword, int limit)
12584{
12585 limitscore_T stack[10]; // allow for over 3 * 2 edits
12586 int stackidx;
12587 int bi, gi;
12588 int bi2, gi2;
12589 int bc, gc;
12590 int score;
12591 int score_off;
12592 int minscore;
12593 int round;
12594
12595 // Multi-byte characters require a bit more work, use a different function
12596 // to avoid testing "has_mbyte" quite often.
12597 if (has_mbyte)
12598 return spell_edit_score_limit_w(slang, badword, goodword, limit);
12599
12600 // The idea is to go from start to end over the words. So long as
12601 // characters are equal just continue, this always gives the lowest score.
12602 // When there is a difference try several alternatives. Each alternative
12603 // increases "score" for the edit distance. Some of the alternatives are
12604 // pushed unto a stack and tried later, some are tried right away. At the
12605 // end of the word the score for one alternative is known. The lowest
12606 // possible score is stored in "minscore".
12607 stackidx = 0;
12608 bi = 0;
12609 gi = 0;
12610 score = 0;
12611 minscore = limit + 1;
12612
12613 for (;; ) {
12614 // Skip over an equal part, score remains the same.
12615 for (;; ) {
12616 bc = badword[bi];
12617 gc = goodword[gi];
12618 if (bc != gc) // stop at a char that's different
12619 break;
12620 if (bc == NUL'\000') { // both words end
12621 if (score < minscore)
12622 minscore = score;
12623 goto pop; // do next alternative
12624 }
12625 ++bi;
12626 ++gi;
12627 }
12628
12629 if (gc == NUL'\000') { // goodword ends, delete badword chars
12630 do {
12631 if ((score += SCORE_DEL94) >= minscore)
12632 goto pop; // do next alternative
12633 } while (badword[++bi] != NUL'\000');
12634 minscore = score;
12635 } else if (bc == NUL'\000') { // badword ends, insert badword chars
12636 do {
12637 if ((score += SCORE_INS96) >= minscore)
12638 goto pop; // do next alternative
12639 } while (goodword[++gi] != NUL'\000');
12640 minscore = score;
12641 } else { // both words continue
12642 // If not close to the limit, perform a change. Only try changes
12643 // that may lead to a lower score than "minscore".
12644 // round 0: try deleting a char from badword
12645 // round 1: try inserting a char in badword
12646 for (round = 0; round <= 1; ++round) {
12647 score_off = score + (round == 0 ? SCORE_DEL94 : SCORE_INS96);
12648 if (score_off < minscore) {
12649 if (score_off + SCORE_EDIT_MIN33 >= minscore) {
12650 // Near the limit, rest of the words must match. We
12651 // can check that right now, no need to push an item
12652 // onto the stack.
12653 bi2 = bi + 1 - round;
12654 gi2 = gi + round;
12655 while (goodword[gi2] == badword[bi2]) {
12656 if (goodword[gi2] == NUL'\000') {
12657 minscore = score_off;
12658 break;
12659 }
12660 ++bi2;
12661 ++gi2;
12662 }
12663 } else {
12664 // try deleting/inserting a character later
12665 stack[stackidx].badi = bi + 1 - round;
12666 stack[stackidx].goodi = gi + round;
12667 stack[stackidx].score = score_off;
12668 ++stackidx;
12669 }
12670 }
12671 }
12672
12673 if (score + SCORE_SWAP75 < minscore) {
12674 // If swapping two characters makes a match then the
12675 // substitution is more expensive, thus there is no need to
12676 // try both.
12677 if (gc == badword[bi + 1] && bc == goodword[gi + 1]) {
12678 // Swap two characters, that is: skip them.
12679 gi += 2;
12680 bi += 2;
12681 score += SCORE_SWAP75;
12682 continue;
12683 }
12684 }
12685
12686 // Substitute one character for another which is the same
12687 // thing as deleting a character from both goodword and badword.
12688 // Use a better score when there is only a case difference.
12689 if (SPELL_TOFOLD(bc)(enc_utf8 && (bc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(bc) : (bc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[bc] : (int)towlower(bc)) == SPELL_TOFOLD(gc)(enc_utf8 && (gc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(gc) : (gc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[gc] : (int)towlower(gc)))
12690 score += SCORE_ICASE52;
12691 else {
12692 // For a similar character use SCORE_SIMILAR.
12693 if (slang != NULL((void*)0)
12694 && slang->sl_has_map
12695 && similar_chars(slang, gc, bc))
12696 score += SCORE_SIMILAR33;
12697 else
12698 score += SCORE_SUBST93;
12699 }
12700
12701 if (score < minscore) {
12702 // Do the substitution.
12703 ++gi;
12704 ++bi;
12705 continue;
12706 }
12707 }
12708pop:
12709 // Get here to try the next alternative, pop it from the stack.
12710 if (stackidx == 0) // stack is empty, finished
12711 break;
12712
12713 // pop an item from the stack
12714 --stackidx;
12715 gi = stack[stackidx].goodi;
12716 bi = stack[stackidx].badi;
12717 score = stack[stackidx].score;
12718 }
12719
12720 // When the score goes over "limit" it may actually be much higher.
12721 // Return a very large number to avoid going below the limit when giving a
12722 // bonus.
12723 if (minscore > limit)
12724 return SCORE_MAXMAX999999;
12725 return minscore;
12726}
12727
12728// Multi-byte version of spell_edit_score_limit().
12729// Keep it in sync with the above!
12730static int spell_edit_score_limit_w(slang_T *slang, char_u *badword, char_u *goodword, int limit)
12731{
12732 limitscore_T stack[10]; // allow for over 3 * 2 edits
12733 int stackidx;
12734 int bi, gi;
12735 int bi2, gi2;
12736 int bc, gc;
12737 int score;
12738 int score_off;
12739 int minscore;
12740 int round;
12741 char_u *p;
12742 int wbadword[MAXWLEN250];
12743 int wgoodword[MAXWLEN250];
12744
12745 // Get the characters from the multi-byte strings and put them in an
12746 // int array for easy access.
12747 bi = 0;
12748 for (p = badword; *p != NUL'\000'; )
12749 wbadword[bi++] = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
12750 wbadword[bi++] = 0;
12751 gi = 0;
12752 for (p = goodword; *p != NUL'\000'; )
12753 wgoodword[gi++] = mb_cptr2char_adv(&p);
12754 wgoodword[gi++] = 0;
12755
12756 // The idea is to go from start to end over the words. So long as
12757 // characters are equal just continue, this always gives the lowest score.
12758 // When there is a difference try several alternatives. Each alternative
12759 // increases "score" for the edit distance. Some of the alternatives are
12760 // pushed unto a stack and tried later, some are tried right away. At the
12761 // end of the word the score for one alternative is known. The lowest
12762 // possible score is stored in "minscore".
12763 stackidx = 0;
12764 bi = 0;
12765 gi = 0;
12766 score = 0;
12767 minscore = limit + 1;
12768
12769 for (;; ) {
12770 // Skip over an equal part, score remains the same.
12771 for (;; ) {
12772 bc = wbadword[bi];
12773 gc = wgoodword[gi];
12774
12775 if (bc != gc) // stop at a char that's different
12776 break;
12777 if (bc == NUL'\000') { // both words end
12778 if (score < minscore)
12779 minscore = score;
12780 goto pop; // do next alternative
12781 }
12782 ++bi;
12783 ++gi;
12784 }
12785
12786 if (gc == NUL'\000') { // goodword ends, delete badword chars
12787 do {
12788 if ((score += SCORE_DEL94) >= minscore)
12789 goto pop; // do next alternative
12790 } while (wbadword[++bi] != NUL'\000');
12791 minscore = score;
12792 } else if (bc == NUL'\000') { // badword ends, insert badword chars
12793 do {
12794 if ((score += SCORE_INS96) >= minscore)
12795 goto pop; // do next alternative
12796 } while (wgoodword[++gi] != NUL'\000');
12797 minscore = score;
12798 } else { // both words continue
12799 // If not close to the limit, perform a change. Only try changes
12800 // that may lead to a lower score than "minscore".
12801 // round 0: try deleting a char from badword
12802 // round 1: try inserting a char in badword
12803 for (round = 0; round <= 1; ++round) {
12804 score_off = score + (round == 0 ? SCORE_DEL94 : SCORE_INS96);
12805 if (score_off < minscore) {
12806 if (score_off + SCORE_EDIT_MIN33 >= minscore) {
12807 // Near the limit, rest of the words must match. We
12808 // can check that right now, no need to push an item
12809 // onto the stack.
12810 bi2 = bi + 1 - round;
12811 gi2 = gi + round;
12812 while (wgoodword[gi2] == wbadword[bi2]) {
12813 if (wgoodword[gi2] == NUL'\000') {
12814 minscore = score_off;
12815 break;
12816 }
12817 ++bi2;
12818 ++gi2;
12819 }
12820 } else {
12821 // try deleting a character from badword later
12822 stack[stackidx].badi = bi + 1 - round;
12823 stack[stackidx].goodi = gi + round;
12824 stack[stackidx].score = score_off;
12825 ++stackidx;
12826 }
12827 }
12828 }
12829
12830 if (score + SCORE_SWAP75 < minscore) {
12831 // If swapping two characters makes a match then the
12832 // substitution is more expensive, thus there is no need to
12833 // try both.
12834 if (gc == wbadword[bi + 1] && bc == wgoodword[gi + 1]) {
12835 // Swap two characters, that is: skip them.
12836 gi += 2;
12837 bi += 2;
12838 score += SCORE_SWAP75;
12839 continue;
12840 }
12841 }
12842
12843 // Substitute one character for another which is the same
12844 // thing as deleting a character from both goodword and badword.
12845 // Use a better score when there is only a case difference.
12846 if (SPELL_TOFOLD(bc)(enc_utf8 && (bc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(bc) : (bc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[bc] : (int)towlower(bc)) == SPELL_TOFOLD(gc)(enc_utf8 && (gc) >= 128 ? utf_fold(gc) : (gc) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_fold[gc] : (int)towlower(gc)))
12847 score += SCORE_ICASE52;
12848 else {
12849 // For a similar character use SCORE_SIMILAR.
12850 if (slang != NULL((void*)0)
12851 && slang->sl_has_map
12852 && similar_chars(slang, gc, bc))
12853 score += SCORE_SIMILAR33;
12854 else
12855 score += SCORE_SUBST93;
12856 }
12857
12858 if (score < minscore) {
12859 // Do the substitution.
12860 ++gi;
12861 ++bi;
12862 continue;
12863 }
12864 }
12865pop:
12866 // Get here to try the next alternative, pop it from the stack.
12867 if (stackidx == 0) // stack is empty, finished
12868 break;
12869
12870 // pop an item from the stack
12871 --stackidx;
12872 gi = stack[stackidx].goodi;
12873 bi = stack[stackidx].badi;
12874 score = stack[stackidx].score;
12875 }
12876
12877 // When the score goes over "limit" it may actually be much higher.
12878 // Return a very large number to avoid going below the limit when giving a
12879 // bonus.
12880 if (minscore > limit)
12881 return SCORE_MAXMAX999999;
12882 return minscore;
12883}
12884
12885// ":spellinfo"
12886void ex_spellinfo(exarg_T *eap)
12887{
12888 langp_T *lp;
12889 char_u *p;
12890
12891 if (no_spell_checking(curwin))
12892 return;
12893
12894 msg_start();
12895 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len && !got_int; ++lpi) {
12896 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
12897 msg_puts((char_u *)"file: ");
12898 msg_puts(lp->lp_slang->sl_fname);
12899 msg_putchar('\n');
12900 p = lp->lp_slang->sl_info;
12901 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
12902 msg_puts(p);
12903 msg_putchar('\n');
12904 }
12905 }
12906 msg_end();
12907}
12908
12909#define DUMPFLAG_KEEPCASE1 1 // round 2: keep-case tree
12910#define DUMPFLAG_COUNT2 2 // include word count
12911#define DUMPFLAG_ICASE4 4 // ignore case when finding matches
12912#define DUMPFLAG_ONECAP8 8 // pattern starts with capital
12913#define DUMPFLAG_ALLCAP16 16 // pattern is all capitals
12914
12915// ":spelldump"
12916void ex_spelldump(exarg_T *eap)
12917{
12918 char_u *spl;
12919 long dummy;
12920
12921 if (no_spell_checking(curwin))
12922 return;
12923 get_option_value((char_u*)"spl", &dummy, &spl, OPT_LOCAL4);
12924
12925 // Create a new empty buffer in a new window.
12926 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)"new");
12927
12928 // enable spelling locally in the new window
12929 set_option_value((char_u*)"spell", TRUE1, (char_u*)"", OPT_LOCAL4);
12930 set_option_value((char_u*)"spl", dummy, spl, OPT_LOCAL4);
12931 free(spl);
12932
12933 if (!bufempty()(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count == 1 && *ml_get((linenr_T
)1) == '\000') || !buf_valid(curbuf))
12934 return;
12935
12936 spell_dump_compl(NULL((void*)0), 0, NULL((void*)0), eap->forceit ? DUMPFLAG_COUNT2 : 0);
12937
12938 // Delete the empty line that we started with.
12939 if (curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count > 1)
12940 ml_delete(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, FALSE0);
12941
12942 redraw_later(NOT_VALID40);
12943}
12944
12945// Go through all possible words and:
12946// 1. When "pat" is NULL: dump a list of all words in the current buffer.
12947// "ic" and "dir" are not used.
12948// 2. When "pat" is not NULL: add matching words to insert mode completion.
12949void
12950spell_dump_compl (
12951 char_u *pat, // leading part of the word
12952 int ic, // ignore case
12953 int *dir, // direction for adding matches
12954 int dumpflags_arg // DUMPFLAG_*
12955)
12956{
12957 langp_T *lp;
12958 slang_T *slang;
12959 idx_T arridx[MAXWLEN250];
12960 int curi[MAXWLEN250];
12961 char_u word[MAXWLEN250];
12962 int c;
12963 char_u *byts;
12964 idx_T *idxs;
12965 linenr_T lnum = 0;
12966 int round;
12967 int depth;
12968 int n;
12969 int flags;
12970 char_u *region_names = NULL((void*)0); // region names being used
12971 bool_Bool do_region = true1; // dump region names and numbers
12972 char_u *p;
12973 int dumpflags = dumpflags_arg;
12974 int patlen;
12975
12976 // When ignoring case or when the pattern starts with capital pass this on
12977 // to dump_word().
12978 if (pat != NULL((void*)0)) {
12979 if (ic)
12980 dumpflags |= DUMPFLAG_ICASE4;
12981 else {
12982 n = captype(pat, NULL((void*)0));
12983 if (n == WF_ONECAP0x02)
12984 dumpflags |= DUMPFLAG_ONECAP8;
12985 else if (n == WF_ALLCAP0x04
12986 && (int)STRLEN(pat)strlen((char *)(pat)) > mb_ptr2len(pat)
12987 )
12988 dumpflags |= DUMPFLAG_ALLCAP16;
12989 }
12990 }
12991
12992 // Find out if we can support regions: All languages must support the same
12993 // regions or none at all.
12994 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
12995 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
12996 p = lp->lp_slang->sl_regions;
12997 if (p[0] != 0) {
12998 if (region_names == NULL((void*)0)) // first language with regions
12999 region_names = p;
13000 else if (STRCMP(region_names, p)strcmp((char *)(region_names), (char *)(p)) != 0) {
13001 do_region = false0; // region names are different
13002 break;
13003 }
13004 }
13005 }
13006
13007 if (do_region && region_names != NULL((void*)0)) {
13008 if (pat == NULL((void*)0)) {
13009 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), "/regions=%s", region_names);
13010 ml_append(lnum++, IObuff, (colnr_T)0, FALSE0);
13011 }
13012 } else
13013 do_region = false0;
13014
13015 // Loop over all files loaded for the entries in 'spelllang'.
13016 for (int lpi = 0; lpi < curwin->w_s->b_langp.ga_len; ++lpi) {
13017 lp = LANGP_ENTRY(curwin->w_s->b_langp, lpi)(((langp_T *)(curwin->w_s->b_langp).ga_data) + (lpi));
13018 slang = lp->lp_slang;
13019 if (slang->sl_fbyts == NULL((void*)0)) // reloading failed
13020 continue;
13021
13022 if (pat == NULL((void*)0)) {
13023 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), "# file: %s", slang->sl_fname);
13024 ml_append(lnum++, IObuff, (colnr_T)0, FALSE0);
13025 }
13026
13027 // When matching with a pattern and there are no prefixes only use
13028 // parts of the tree that match "pat".
13029 if (pat != NULL((void*)0) && slang->sl_pbyts == NULL((void*)0))
13030 patlen = (int)STRLEN(pat)strlen((char *)(pat));
13031 else
13032 patlen = -1;
13033
13034 // round 1: case-folded tree
13035 // round 2: keep-case tree
13036 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round) {
13037 if (round == 1) {
13038 dumpflags &= ~DUMPFLAG_KEEPCASE1;
13039 byts = slang->sl_fbyts;
13040 idxs = slang->sl_fidxs;
13041 } else {
13042 dumpflags |= DUMPFLAG_KEEPCASE1;
13043 byts = slang->sl_kbyts;
13044 idxs = slang->sl_kidxs;
13045 }
13046 if (byts == NULL((void*)0))
13047 continue; // array is empty
13048
13049 depth = 0;
13050 arridx[0] = 0;
13051 curi[0] = 1;
13052 while (depth >= 0 && !got_int
13053 && (pat == NULL((void*)0) || !compl_interrupted)) {
13054 if (curi[depth] > byts[arridx[depth]]) {
13055 // Done all bytes at this node, go up one level.
13056 --depth;
13057 line_breakcheck();
13058 ins_compl_check_keys(50);
13059 } else {
13060 // Do one more byte at this node.
13061 n = arridx[depth] + curi[depth];
13062 ++curi[depth];
13063 c = byts[n];
13064 if (c == 0) {
13065 // End of word, deal with the word.
13066 // Don't use keep-case words in the fold-case tree,
13067 // they will appear in the keep-case tree.
13068 // Only use the word when the region matches.
13069 flags = (int)idxs[n];
13070 if ((round == 2 || (flags & WF_KEEPCAP0x80) == 0)
13071 && (flags & WF_NEEDCOMP0x0200) == 0
13072 && (do_region
13073 || (flags & WF_REGION0x01) == 0
13074 || (((unsigned)flags >> 16)
13075 & lp->lp_region) != 0)) {
13076 word[depth] = NUL'\000';
13077 if (!do_region)
13078 flags &= ~WF_REGION0x01;
13079
13080 // Dump the basic word if there is no prefix or
13081 // when it's the first one.
13082 c = (unsigned)flags >> 24;
13083 if (c == 0 || curi[depth] == 2) {
13084 dump_word(slang, word, pat, dir,
13085 dumpflags, flags, lnum);
13086 if (pat == NULL((void*)0))
13087 ++lnum;
13088 }
13089
13090 // Apply the prefix, if there is one.
13091 if (c != 0)
13092 lnum = dump_prefixes(slang, word, pat, dir,
13093 dumpflags, flags, lnum);
13094 }
13095 } else {
13096 // Normal char, go one level deeper.
13097 word[depth++] = c;
13098 arridx[depth] = idxs[n];
13099 curi[depth] = 1;
13100
13101 // Check if this characters matches with the pattern.
13102 // If not skip the whole tree below it.
13103 // Always ignore case here, dump_word() will check
13104 // proper case later. This isn't exactly right when
13105 // length changes for multi-byte characters with
13106 // ignore case...
13107 if (depth <= patlen
13108 && MB_STRNICMP(word, pat, depth)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(word), (char_u *)(pat), (int)(depth)) != 0)
13109 --depth;
13110 }
13111 }
13112 }
13113 }
13114 }
13115}
13116
13117// Dumps one word: apply case modifications and append a line to the buffer.
13118// When "lnum" is zero add insert mode completion.
13119static void dump_word(slang_T *slang, char_u *word, char_u *pat, int *dir, int dumpflags, int wordflags, linenr_T lnum)
13120{
13121 bool_Bool keepcap = false0;
13122 char_u *p;
13123 char_u *tw;
13124 char_u cword[MAXWLEN250];
13125 char_u badword[MAXWLEN250 + 10];
13126 int i;
13127 int flags = wordflags;
13128
13129 if (dumpflags & DUMPFLAG_ONECAP8)
13130 flags |= WF_ONECAP0x02;
13131 if (dumpflags & DUMPFLAG_ALLCAP16)
13132 flags |= WF_ALLCAP0x04;
13133
13134 if ((dumpflags & DUMPFLAG_KEEPCASE1) == 0 && (flags & WF_CAPMASK(0x02 | 0x04 | 0x80 | 0x40)) != 0) {
13135 // Need to fix case according to "flags".
13136 make_case_word(word, cword, flags);
13137 p = cword;
13138 } else {
13139 p = word;
13140 if ((dumpflags & DUMPFLAG_KEEPCASE1)
13141 && ((captype(word, NULL((void*)0)) & WF_KEEPCAP0x80) == 0
13142 || (flags & WF_FIXCAP0x40) != 0))
13143 keepcap = true1;
13144 }
13145 tw = p;
13146
13147 if (pat == NULL((void*)0)) {
13148 // Add flags and regions after a slash.
13149 if ((flags & (WF_BANNED0x10 | WF_RARE0x08 | WF_REGION0x01)) || keepcap) {
13150 STRCPY(badword, p)strcpy((char *)(badword), (char *)(p));
13151 STRCAT(badword, "/")strcat((char *)(badword), (char *)("/"));
13152 if (keepcap)
13153 STRCAT(badword, "=")strcat((char *)(badword), (char *)("="));
13154 if (flags & WF_BANNED0x10)
13155 STRCAT(badword, "!")strcat((char *)(badword), (char *)("!"));
13156 else if (flags & WF_RARE0x08)
13157 STRCAT(badword, "?")strcat((char *)(badword), (char *)("?"));
13158 if (flags & WF_REGION0x01)
13159 for (i = 0; i < 7; ++i)
13160 if (flags & (0x10000 << i))
13161 sprintf((char *)badword + STRLEN(badword)strlen((char *)(badword)), "%d", i + 1);
13162 p = badword;
13163 }
13164
13165 if (dumpflags & DUMPFLAG_COUNT2) {
13166 hashitem_T *hi;
13167
13168 // Include the word count for ":spelldump!".
13169 hi = hash_find(&slang->sl_wordcount, tw);
13170 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
13171 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), "%s\t%d",
13172 tw, HI2WC(hi)((wordcount_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (unsigned)(dumwc.wc_word -
(char_u *)&dumwc)))->wc_count);
13173 p = IObuff;
13174 }
13175 }
13176
13177 ml_append(lnum, p, (colnr_T)0, FALSE0);
13178 } else if (((dumpflags & DUMPFLAG_ICASE4)
13179 ? MB_STRNICMP(p, pat, STRLEN(pat))mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)(pat), (int)(strlen((char
*)(pat)))) == 0
13180 : STRNCMP(p, pat, STRLEN(pat))strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)(pat), (size_t)(strlen((char *)(
pat)))) == 0)
13181 && ins_compl_add_infercase(p, (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)),
13182 p_ic, NULL((void*)0), *dir, 0) == OK1)
13183 // if dir was BACKWARD then honor it just once
13184 *dir = FORWARD1;
13185}
13186
13187// For ":spelldump": Find matching prefixes for "word". Prepend each to
13188// "word" and append a line to the buffer.
13189// When "lnum" is zero add insert mode completion.
13190// Return the updated line number.
13191static linenr_T
13192dump_prefixes (
13193 slang_T *slang,
13194 char_u *word, // case-folded word
13195 char_u *pat,
13196 int *dir,
13197 int dumpflags,
13198 int flags, // flags with prefix ID
13199 linenr_T startlnum
13200)
13201{
13202 idx_T arridx[MAXWLEN250];
13203 int curi[MAXWLEN250];
13204 char_u prefix[MAXWLEN250];
13205 char_u word_up[MAXWLEN250];
13206 bool_Bool has_word_up = false0;
13207 int c;
13208 char_u *byts;
13209 idx_T *idxs;
13210 linenr_T lnum = startlnum;
13211 int depth;
13212 int n;
13213 int len;
13214 int i;
13215
13216 // If the word starts with a lower-case letter make the word with an
13217 // upper-case letter in word_up[].
13218 c = PTR2CHAR(word)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(word) : (int)*(word));
13219 if (SPELL_TOUPPER(c)(enc_utf8 && (c) >= 128 ? utf_toupper(c) : (c) <
256 ? (int)spelltab.st_upper[c] : (int)towupper(c)) != c) {
13220 onecap_copy(word, word_up, true1);
13221 has_word_up = true1;
13222 }
13223
13224 byts = slang->sl_pbyts;
13225 idxs = slang->sl_pidxs;
13226 if (byts != NULL((void*)0)) { // array not is empty
13227 // Loop over all prefixes, building them byte-by-byte in prefix[].
13228 // When at the end of a prefix check that it supports "flags".
13229 depth = 0;
13230 arridx[0] = 0;
13231 curi[0] = 1;
13232 while (depth >= 0 && !got_int) {
13233 n = arridx[depth];
13234 len = byts[n];
13235 if (curi[depth] > len) {
13236 // Done all bytes at this node, go up one level.
13237 --depth;
13238 line_breakcheck();
13239 } else {
13240 // Do one more byte at this node.
13241 n += curi[depth];
13242 ++curi[depth];
13243 c = byts[n];
13244 if (c == 0) {
13245 // End of prefix, find out how many IDs there are.
13246 for (i = 1; i < len; ++i)
13247 if (byts[n + i] != 0)
13248 break;
13249 curi[depth] += i - 1;
13250
13251 c = valid_word_prefix(i, n, flags, word, slang, false0);
13252 if (c != 0) {
13253 STRLCPY(prefix + depth, word, MAXWLEN - depth)xstrlcpy((char *)(prefix + depth), (char *)(word), (size_t)(250
- depth));
13254 dump_word(slang, prefix, pat, dir, dumpflags,
13255 (c & WF_RAREPFX(0x01 << 24)) ? (flags | WF_RARE0x08)
13256 : flags, lnum);
13257 if (lnum != 0)
13258 ++lnum;
13259 }
13260
13261 // Check for prefix that matches the word when the
13262 // first letter is upper-case, but only if the prefix has
13263 // a condition.
13264 if (has_word_up) {
13265 c = valid_word_prefix(i, n, flags, word_up, slang,
13266 true1);
13267 if (c != 0) {
13268 STRLCPY(prefix + depth, word_up, MAXWLEN - depth)xstrlcpy((char *)(prefix + depth), (char *)(word_up), (size_t
)(250 - depth));
13269 dump_word(slang, prefix, pat, dir, dumpflags,
13270 (c & WF_RAREPFX(0x01 << 24)) ? (flags | WF_RARE0x08)
13271 : flags, lnum);
13272 if (lnum != 0)
13273 ++lnum;
13274 }
13275 }
13276 } else {
13277 // Normal char, go one level deeper.
13278 prefix[depth++] = c;
13279 arridx[depth] = idxs[n];
13280 curi[depth] = 1;
13281 }
13282 }
13283 }
13284 }
13285
13286 return lnum;
13287}
13288
13289// Move "p" to the end of word "start".
13290// Uses the spell-checking word characters.
13291char_u *spell_to_word_end(char_u *start, win_T *win)
13292{
13293 char_u *p = start;
13294
13295 while (*p != NUL'\000' && spell_iswordp(p, win))
13296 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
13297 return p;
13298}
13299
13300// For Insert mode completion CTRL-X s:
13301// Find start of the word in front of column "startcol".
13302// We don't check if it is badly spelled, with completion we can only change
13303// the word in front of the cursor.
13304// Returns the column number of the word.
13305int spell_word_start(int startcol)
13306{
13307 char_u *line;
13308 char_u *p;
13309 int col = 0;
13310
13311 if (no_spell_checking(curwin))
13312 return startcol;
13313
13314 // Find a word character before "startcol".
13315 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
13316 for (p = line + startcol; p > line; ) {
13317 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
13318 if (spell_iswordp_nmw(p, curwin))
13319 break;
13320 }
13321
13322 // Go back to start of the word.
13323 while (p > line) {
13324 col = (int)(p - line);
13325 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
13326 if (!spell_iswordp(p, curwin))
13327 break;
13328 col = 0;
13329 }
13330
13331 return col;
13332}
13333
13334// Need to check for 'spellcapcheck' now, the word is removed before
13335// expand_spelling() is called. Therefore the ugly global variable.
13336static bool_Bool spell_expand_need_cap;
13337
13338void spell_expand_check_cap(colnr_T col)
13339{
13340 spell_expand_need_cap = check_need_cap(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, col);
13341}
13342
13343// Get list of spelling suggestions.
13344// Used for Insert mode completion CTRL-X ?.
13345// Returns the number of matches. The matches are in "matchp[]", array of
13346// allocated strings.
13347int expand_spelling(linenr_T lnum, char_u *pat, char_u ***matchp)
13348{
13349 garray_T ga;
13350
13351 spell_suggest_list(&ga, pat, 100, spell_expand_need_cap, true1);
13352 *matchp = ga.ga_data;
13353 return ga.ga_len;
13354}
13355
